
###chapter 1 First Love Returns
********
She gambled her marriage to save her family. He vowed to break her pride. But when her royal flush identity surfaces, their game turns lethal—where love is the ultimate bet.
********

"Isabella Taylor, if you can't have a child, get out of the Brown Family!"

At Aiden Brown's birthday party, Isabella of the Brown Family overheard people gossiping that she couldn't have children.

Her husband Michael Brown's mother, Stella Hall, felt embarrassed.

She slapped Isabella in public and gave her an ultimatum.

Isabella covered her swollen face and received a photo as she left the Brown Villa in disgrace.

In the photo, romantic rose petals were arranged in a heart shape, and the birthday backdrop made of balloons was beautifully vibrant.

The girl standing in the center was stunningly beautiful, smiling sweetly and happily at the camera.

Clenching her fingers, Isabella was furious because Michael had refused to attend Aiden's birthday party, causing her to be scolded harshly.

Yet, he had meticulously arranged a birthday scene for his first love and was celebrating her birthday!

Gritting her teeth, Isabella turned around, got into her car, and drove off with a sharp turn.

She also wanted to have children, but in the three years of marriage, Michael had never touched her. How was she supposed to conceive? Asexual reproduction?

But the Brown Family was pressuring her and threatening her.

If she couldn't get pregnant, she feared she wouldn't be able to keep her position as Mrs. Brown in the Brown Family.

After all, Michael only had hatred for her, not love.

If she were kicked out of the Brown Family, he would be the first to raise his hands in approval.

Isabella made a turn and drove onto the main road.

The photo showed a corner of the background, and Isabella recognized it as a well-known hotel in Evergreen City.

When she arrived, the clock struck midnight.

Isabella pushed the door open, and a "bang" exploded above her head.

Fireworks lit up the sky, their dazzling colors making Isabella a bit dizzy.

She pursed her lips and pushed open the door to the banquet hall.

A wave of lively noise hit her, and the crowd was cheering. "Kiss, kiss."

No one noticed Isabella's sudden appearance.

A long table was set in the center of the banquet hall, with four people sitting around it.

Each person had a seductive girl in their arms.

And her husband, Michael, was sitting in the host's seat, holding Bianca Taylor, whose long hair flowed down her back.

Her innocent and pure face was now flushed red from the crowd's teasing, and she looked at Michael with big, watery eyes.

Michael met her gaze, his eyes tender and affectionate.

He had a faint smile on his lips, but it was clear it came from the heart.

In the three years Isabella had been married to him, he had never smiled at her.

"Who would have thought, Michael, undefeated in the casino, would lose on purpose just to kiss Bianca!"

"Yeah, Bianca. In the years you were abroad, Michael didn't have any other women around him because of you. Now that you're back, you can't let him down!"

Hearing this, Bianca's face turned even redder, and her gaze at Michael was filled with pure affection.

From the moment Isabella saw the face in the photo, she knew she wouldn't be able to keep her position as Michael's wife this time.

For no other reason than that Bianca was Michael's first love, whom he could never have!

She was also Isabella's half-sister.

Back then, the Brown Family disapproved of Bianca's status, broke them up, and forced Michael to marry Isabella.

On the wedding day, Bianca left heartbroken. If it weren't for Aiden's disapproval, Michael would have probably left the wedding to chase after her.

The sight of the two gazing at each other with deep affection hurt Isabella's heart.

Seeing their heads getting closer and closer.

Isabella cleared her throat, drawing everyone's attention.

She leaned lazily against the door, arms crossed, and said, "I was wondering which woman had such charm that he couldn't even attend Mr. Brown's birthday. Turns out it's you! Long time no see, my shameless sister Bianca! Your mom was a mistress when she had you, and now you're here to seduce Michael. What, is the mistress gene hereditary? Michael lost on purpose just to kiss you. You are a born actress!"

Bianca was still the same as three years ago, always playing the victim.

As soon as Isabella's harsh words came out, Bianca's eyes immediately reddened, as if she had suffered a great grievance. "Isabella, you misunderstood. We were just playing around. At a friends' gathering, everyone suggested playing cards, and since gambling for money seemed boring, we decided to play for other stakes."

Isabella curled her lips into a cold smile.

She understood Bianca's little schemes.

She was subtly flaunting that Michael's friends included her in their activities but excluded Isabella, implying that as Michael's wife, she was actually nothing.

But no matter what, Isabella was Michael's wife now.

No matter how much Michael loved Bianca, she still had to bear the label of a mistress.

Moreover, it was Isabella who are originally engaged to Michael.

Michael and Bianca's love was never accepted by everyone from the start!

Isabella was stunningly beautiful, with striking features, and when she sneered, her aura was overwhelming.

Bianca, with her delicate demeanor, was completely overshadowed in front of her.

"If you like playing around, come to me. I know plenty of games that will leave you wanting more!" Isabella said.

Bianca pursed her lips, hiding the disdain in her eyes. "Isabella, you might not know, but the way Michael and his friends play cards is different from what you learned in the countryside. It's very complicated; Michael taught me all night, and I still couldn't get it."

Everyone knew that Isabella was not favored by her father, Indigo Taylor. When she was young, she made a mistake that angered Indigo, and she was sent to the countryside.

She wasn't brought back until she was an adult.

"You couldn't learn because you're stupid, spending all your time thinking about how to seduce men," Isabella mercilessly exposed. "As for me, I've been playing cards since I was a child. No matter how difficult the game, it's a piece of cake to me."

She looked at Isabella with teary eyes, "Isabella, I know you've never liked me, thinking I stole Dad's love. When we were kids, you pushed me down the stairs, almost making me spend my life in a wheelchair. Now you're jealous of my past with Michael and falsely accuse me of seducing him. Then she looked at Michael with teary eyes, "Michael, if that's the case, then we shouldn't see each other anymore. I'm afraid... I'm afraid Isabella will misunderstand again."

From the moment Isabella appeared until now, Michael hadn't given her a single glance.

It wasn't until now that he looked at her coldly, "She has no right to control me. She's just an irrelevant person; who cares if she misunderstands."

Bianca's lips instinctively curled up, but she tried to restrain herself. "Michael, don't say that about Isabella..."

Michael raised his hand to pat her head, looking at Isabella with eyes as cold as ice. "Get out. This isn't a place for you!"

Isabella was so angry that she laughed, her eyes cold. "This shabby hotel is indeed unworthy of me. Michael, celebrating your first love Bianca's birthday, couldn't you have chosen a better place? Is Bianca unworthy of the top banquet hall at The Grand Majestic Hotel?"

The Grand Majestic Hotel was the most luxurious hotel in Evergreen City.

The top banquet hall there could directly host state guests.

Although Bianca knew she wasn't worthy, hearing Isabella say it so bluntly still made her feel bad.

Especially since Isabella kept emphasizing her status as Mrs. Brown, it was like a slap in Bianca's face.

Bianca was furious but couldn't say anything, feeling utterly stifled!

Michael frowned and glared at Isabella, "Shut up!"

"Fine." Isabella obediently shut up, walked over in her high heels, and disdainfully looked at the crease on his pants, which was caused by Bianca sitting on his lap.

"Throw away those pants. They're so wrinkled, even a tramp wouldn't wear them!"

With one sentence, she insulted both of them.

Everyone around gasped; Isabella's words were indeed sharp!

Isabella didn't care how ugly Michael's face looked and pulled a chair to sit next to him.

She elegantly crossed her legs, "The fireworks are done, the cards have been played, isn't it time to go home?"

"Go home?" Michael's deep eyes shot out two sharp, mocking glances. He sat up straight, towering over Isabella, exuding a sense of oppression. "Go home for what? To watch you act like a bitch in heat, trying to seduce me in every possible way?"

Isabella was infuriated.

But her personality was such that the angrier she got, the brighter her smile became.

No matter how much it hurt inside, she would never admit defeat on the surface.

"As my husband, isn't that your duty? If you can't do it, then naturally, I have to work a bit harder."

###chapter 2 Divorce

A simple sarcastic remark, and Isabella's heart ached first.

No one knew that Isabella loved Michael.

Even though she had forced him to marry her with an engagement, she had secretly rejoiced for a long time because they became husband and wife.

But after Michael married her, he completely ignored her.

William didn't even want to touch her, and he found it annoying to even look at her.

The Brown Family kept urging her to have an heir, and her grandfather Daniel Wilson also hoped she would have a child soon.

At first, she understood that William was upset about being separated from Bianca and didn't hold it against him.

It was only tonight that she realized it was all for Bianca.

How ironic!

They were already married, yet he remained physically faithful.

William had been married to someone else anyhow!

The more Isabella thought about it, the more stifled she felt, but her smile became brighter. "If you have a sexual dysfunction, I don't mind doing IVF. Or if you don't mind raising someone else's child, I can find a surrogate. You know,  the prerequisite for your inheritance is to have a child. After tonight, you have two months to think it over. Anyway, you compromised to marry me for ten percent of the shares, so compromising to have a child for the management rights shouldn't be a big deal. I'm very open-minded. As long as you complete the task, I don't care how you play or how many lovers you have..."

Before Isabella could finish her sentence, William suddenly stood up and grabbed her jaw, pushing her back.

The chair tilted back, and she hit the table behind her, barely steadying herself.

William's eyes were cold. "Isabella, how dare you treat me as a tool for having children?"

Of course Isabella dared.

When Daniel had an accident, she dared to force him to marry her with an engagement, so what else wouldn't she dare to do?

Isabella closed her eyes, enduring the discomfort, "IVF or surrogacy, or you can have the child with me yourself, your choice!"

Michael looked down at Isabella's cold, mocking face, countless emotions flashing in his eyes.

How many years had it been since someone threatened him like this?

Michael was so angry that he laughed, "You think you're worthy of having my child?"

Isabella also laughed, her beautiful eyes narrowing and shining sharply.

"Fine!" She pushed Michael away, shifting her weight forward to bring the chair back to the ground.

As soon as she was back on her feet, she opened her bag, and threw a stack of papers in Michael's face. "Then let's get a divorce. Your friends are all here, so they can be witnesses. I don't want a useless cheater who can't even have children!"

No one knew how much courage it took for Isabella to say that.

The divorce agreement had been in her bag for a long time, ever since her 99th attempt to seduce Michael had failed.

She loved Michael, but this was as far as it could go.

She had tried very hard to be with him.

Especially, he shouldn't have used Bianca to humiliate her.

With the backing of the Brown Family, Michael had always been a leader in their circle.

After Michael took over the company as an adult, he gradually turned the Brown Group into a multinational corporation, ranking among the world's top companies.

It had been a long time since anyone dared to throw something in his face.

And in front of so many people.

The atmosphere in the banquet hall instantly turned icy, with only Bianca barely containing her excitement.

She pretended to mediate, "Isabella, how can you talk about divorce with Michael in front of so many people? You're trampling on Michael's dignity! Apologize to Michael, and forget about the divorce! If you're angry about the joke earlier, I apologize. Don't let it affect your relationship with Michael; that would be my fault!"

"Who do you think you are? You think you have the right to affect my relationship with him?" Isabella looked Bianca up and down with disdain, "This is none of your business!"

Bianca, feeling wronged, closed her eyes with tears, her eyes full of malice.

She thought, 'Isabella, go ahead and be arrogant. The more arrogant you are, the more Michael will hate you.'

"Michael, if you want a divorce, sign the papers. Sexual dysfunction is one thing, but dragging out a divorce, are you even a man?" Isabella said.

Bianca, unwilling to give up, jumped in to defend Michael. "Isabella, mind your words. Michael is a man, and it's too much to insult him like that!"

Isabella retorted, her probing gaze shifting between the two of them. "A man? What, have you tried sleeping with him?"

If they had really slept together, Isabella could demand more in the divorce settlement.

After all, it would be adultery during the marriage.

Bianca's face instantly turned red, her shy gaze sweeping over Michael.

She wished she could try!

After all, Michael was the man she had dreamed of since she was a child.

But unfortunately...

Isabella sneered, "Innocent like sitting on Michael's lap and kissing? That kind of innocent?"

Bianca's face turned green.

Michael looked at Isabella with a cold smile, his eyes dark and terrifying. "You want a divorce so badly, what, do you have someone else you like?"

"None of your business. Even if I don't have someone now, I can find someone after the divorce!" Isabella's eyes lifted, forming a beautiful arc.

She still had to fulfill Daniel's wish.

Finding a man willing to be with her wasn't hard.

Although finding someone better than Michael might be difficult, finding someone comparable was definitely possible!

"Besides, by divorcing, I'm doing you a favor. What are you dissatisfied with? Unless you don't want to give Bianca a proper status and want her to remain a mistress forever?" Isabella's meaningful tone made Bianca's face change. She looked at Michael with a pale, hopeful, and anxious expression.

But Michael didn't even glance at her; he kept staring at Isabella as if trying to see through her.

After a long time, he slowly spoke, "Divorce, fine! You said you played cards since you were a kid. If you beat me, I'll sign."

Michael held up the deck of cards on the table, his narrowed eyes revealing unreadable emotions.

Isabella didn't speak, just looked at him and smiled.

Her smile was cold, with an indescribable mockery.

"Are you scared?" Michael threw the cards back on the table, his mouth curling in contempt.

Isabella coldly laughed, "Remember what you said. If you lose, don't cry!"

With that, she raised her hand and took off her trench coat.

Isabella had come straight from Aiden's birthday banquet, still wearing the red dress from the event.

It was a dress she had specially chosen for herself, with a backless design that revealed her beautiful shoulder blades and a large area of delicate skin.

The cinched waist design accentuated her slender waist, and her chest formed a beautiful curve.

His gaze fell on Isabella, his hand on the table clenched, veins bulging.

Michael's friends exchanged glances. Wow, Isabella really seemed to know her stuff!

"Blackjack, don't want you to lose too badly!" Michael said.

Her fingers were long and slender.

Fifty-four playing cards were manipulated into various tricks by her ten fingers, even the rich kids who were used to playing cards couldn't help but exclaim, "Impressive!"

###chapter 3 You Can't Let Go of Me, Have You Fallen in Love with Me?

###chapter 4 Uncle Thomas

With that, Michael not even glanced at Isabella before turning and leaving.

The loud commotion startled the people in the hallway outside.

No one dared to speak, all eyes on his furious face.

Bianca, through the automatically closing banquet hall doors, saw Isabella on the table with disheveled clothes and immediately bit her lip hard.

###chapter 5 Isabella, You're Serious about This!

At that time, Daniel was busy with the Wilson Group business. Fearing she might get bored, he hired a professional instructor for her. Coupled with her extraordinary talent, she reached a professional level in just one summer.

She even participated in a few private races with her instructor.

But she only treated it as a hobby and interest. She liked the feeling of chasing the wind, nothing more.

Later, her instructor invited her to participate in professional races, but she declined.

She didn't want Daniel to worry, nor did she want her identity to be too conspicuous.

"Really? that's great." Olivia was overjoyed. When she came, she was worried Isabella might be unhappy with her decision.

Just then, Isabella received a message.

As soon as she saw the avatar, Isabella frowned. Wasn't Bianca causing a scene and threatening to commit suicide at the hospital? What kind of scheme was she up to now?

She casually opened it, and the moment she saw the picture, a cold smile appeared on her lips.

No surprise, the picture showed Bianca being comforted by Michael.

Bianca's eyes were red from crying, and Michael was gently soothing her.

Michael looked very doting.

It wasn't hard to guess who took the photo.

After all, Bianca and Harper were a team, and Michael hadn't noticed anything amiss.

Seeing him like this, he probably wouldn't come home tonight.

Fine, he could comfort Bianca.

She would race.

Deleting the picture swiftly, Isabella put on the custom helmet Olivia handed her. Her sexy figure was fully revealed in her tight outfit, exuding a powerful aura.

Not long after, the Ivan Olivia mentioned really appeared at the racetrack.

With a beautiful spin, the car stopped in front of them.

Ivan, with long legs on the ground and wearing a black helmet, had eyes that hinted at a handsome face.

Ivan was young, well-built, good-looking, and a racer, hitting every point of Olivia's aesthetic.

No wonder she fell for Ivan at first sight.

With twenty minutes left before the race, Isabella noticed Ivan secretly observing her and Olivia.

"Which one of you is from east Valoria?" Ivan asked, puzzled.

Both Isabella and Olivia had top-notch figures, making it easy to imagine how beautiful their faces must be under the helmets.

But Isabella found the voice somewhat familiar.

However, thinking that no one around her raced, she didn't dwell on it.

Hearing Ivan's voice, Olivia nervously grabbed Isabella's hand. Isabella smiled and raised her chin at Ivan, "You'll know after the race."

Hearing Isabella's voice, Ivan was visibly stunned, then quickly took out his phone and snapped a photo of Isabella.

"Taking photos without permission, don't you have any manners?" If it weren't for Olivia, Isabella would have been angry.

"It's just a photo for memory, don't overthink it." Ethan didn't feel embarrassed at all.

His fingers quickly tapped twice, sending the photo to Michael's phone.

At the same time, Michael had just left the hospital. The doctor said there was nothing wrong with Bianca's fainting.

Just as he was about to go out and look for her, he received the photo from Ethan in the car.

Ethan: [Mr. Brown, look at this beauty I photographed. This figure, these eyes, don't they look like Isabella? I'm telling you, even the voice is similar. I was stunned when I heard it.]

Ethan: [I'm racing at Sunset Ridge Highway. Hey, you can't come. I'm determined to win today. These two beauties are just my type, and I want them both.]

Michael: [I doubt you have the skills!]

Ethan didn't care. To secretly race, he had specifically taken on a college student's identity.

He usually didn't show his face, claiming to be in class, actually fearing being seen and having his true identity revealed.

The Martinez Family, being a prestigious family, had few members. If his family knew he was doing such dangerous activities outside, they might lock him up for life.

Their wish was to see him follow the family's plan step by step, take over the business, get married, and have children.

Preferably without making any mistakes.

But he didn't want that. Living like that for a lifetime was worse than death.

On the other side.

Isabella had just slipped from his grasp two hours ago; he couldn't possibly not recognize her.

If she wanted to race, he would race with her.

Mentioning Michael's racing skills, Ethan's tone unconsciously carried pride.

As soon as he finished speaking, a custom-made black motorcycle stopped at the starting line.

The maneuver was agile and graceful.

She didn't expect to encounter such a professional opponent just by coming to have some fun. But before she could be too happy, when she saw the eyes under the helmet, she was taken aback.

Deep, cold eyes, like an abyss.

It was Michael.

She had loved him for over a decade; she couldn't be mistaken.

Why wasn't he at the hospital with Bianca at this time? What was he doing here?

Couldn't he let her have a good time?

However, the fact that Michael could race was quite surprising to her.

After all, since marrying him, she hadn't seen him have any hobbies other than work.

"Tonight's race gathers the Eastern and Southern Racing Gods of Valoria, and they're all handsome men and beautiful women. Wouldn't it be a shame if there were no rewards for this race?" The one hyping up the atmosphere was the referee.

The crowd cheered.

Most of those agreeing were guys, focusing on Isabella's sexy figure and face.

No matter how famous Isabella was, Ivan's skills in Evergreen City were well-known.

Ivan's level was clearly professional, yet he only accepted private races.

Isabella was in a good mood, especially at the thought of someone running naked.

###chapter 40 The Nominal Father Indigo

Bianca ended by asking netizens not to bully Isabella too much, saying that as Isabella's sister, she still valued their family bond and wanted to give Isabella another chance.

She pushed all the blame onto Isabella.

A bunch of netizens followed suit, feeling sorry for Bianca's magnanimity and grievances.

They demanded she apologize to Bianca.

Isabella almost felt sick reading it.

She directly posted on Facebook.

[I am Isabella. My mom only gave birth to me. I don't have any sisters. If you have a problem, come at me. I'll take it. But if you want an apology, maybe in the next life. Also, have you packed up the Taylor Family's stuff? I'm coming to collect the house tomorrow. Don't think you can leave any trash behind.]

Isabella's words were harsh and direct, immediately sparking another wave of comments online.

[Oh my God, she's so cool. I love her. I support Isabella.]

[This is a twisted. Bianca stole Isabella's boyfriend and now acts all righteous. Does she have any morals?]

[Isabella bullies Bianca because she's easygoing, huh? Watch me expose her identity online and avenge Bianca.]

The online comments kept coming, but Isabella couldn't be bothered to read them in detail.

These rumors couldn't hurt her.

###chapter 44 Michael Disappeared

The next day.

Today was the day she and Michael had agreed to go to court.

To her surprise, he hadn't protested or hired a lawyer in the past two days.

Isabella stood in front of the full-length mirror in a striking red cocktail dress, paired with a limited-edition handbag of the same color, looking radiant and bold.

This was the real Isabella.

Miss of the Wilson Family from east Valoria.

The woman who had once married into the Brown Family with high hopes had lost all her vitality over the past three years due to this marriage.

Starting today, she would be herself again.

They only knew that her marriage was a secret.

Jesse had arranged for people to protect Isabella early on.

The crowd kept providing new "evidence," as if just saying it made it a fact about Isabella.

Bianca's fans refused to admit they were making things up.

No one dared to do that.

These people were paid to do their job and wouldn't listen to reason.

Isabella waited in the hall for two hours, and people gossiped about her the entire time.

Michael never showed up.

No answer!

Isabella never expected Michael to disappear at this critical moment, making her so angry she wanted to drag him out herself.

He glanced at the reporter, seemingly calm but with an underlying menace.

Thomas's name caused a stir among the crowd.

The man frequently featured on financial news, Thomas.

He owned the most famous financial company and had a legendary legal team that had never lost a case.

It was said that any case he handled never lost.

So when he said he was the chief attorney for Isabella's divorce case, did he mean he was going to use that legendary legal team for a simple divorce?

With Thomas's status and class, who would dare to mess with him?

In just a few seconds, the reporter was drenched in cold sweat. As he was about to retract the microphone and leave in a hurry,

Thomas grabbed the microphone and confronted Michael through the camera. "Mr. Brown, if you refuse to follow the usual procedures, we will have to take legal action. No matter where you are, the legal notice will be in your inbox tonight. I'll be waiting for you in Evergreen City!"

###chapter 45 A Complete Reversal

After Thomas finished speaking, he raised an eyebrow at the reporter, "You don't need me to tell you what to do next, right?"

Thomas was a man with an undefeated team of lawyers at his disposal.

Because someone had just mentioned that Isabella had said yesterday she would kick the Taylor family out like trash today.

Isabella was going to kick Indigo and Harper's family out of the house.

About forty minutes later.

Grace had loved this location so much that she sold her jewelry to buy it.

At the time, Daniel had been completely against Grace marrying Indigo.

After Grace got pregnant out of wedlock, Daniel cut off all financial support, and for the years Grace raised her child, she had been using her money to support Indigo.

Grace had thought her efforts would be rewarded, but in reality, her endless giving only led to more demands from Indigo.

Looking back, she really felt it wasn't worth it for Grace.

Indigo might never have liked Grace; he loved the power and wealth behind her.

Grace had been ill but not completely unaware. This house had been in her name long before Harper and her mother arrived.

Indigo was so scared he called the police.

###chapter 46 Get Out of My Mom's House

###chapter 48 The Taste of Being Beaten

"Hey handsome, want to make a friend?" The girl was dressed provocatively, with a red ribbon tied in her hair, camo paint on her face, and tanned skin. She was a lively and pretty mixed-race girl.

Seeing that Michael didn't respond, she handed him a pen and extended her palm, raising an eyebrow, "Write your number here. Call me after the race."

Bold and uninhibited was the nature of this crowd.

Michael paused for a moment, then wrote down Ethan's number.

Such a good opportunity, he naturally thought of Ethan.

Especially since Ethan was still single.

"My name is Cecilia Thorne. Call me tonight." Cecilia winked at Michael, and a chorus of whistles erupted behind her.

Michael remained unfazed and took the opportunity to ask, "I heard the Queen of Racing is coming tonight. Is that true?"

Hearing that Michael was here for the Queen of Racing, the light in Cecilia's eyes dimmed, but she quickly responded enthusiastically, "Of course it's true. It's estimated that two-thirds of the men here are here for her. Didn't expect a man like you to be here for her too. But she's currently racing, so you should be able to see her soon."

"Thanks!" Michael glanced at the location and started to move.

"Such a pity, but the Queen of Racing isn't someone you can easily get a date with. If she doesn't want you, you can always find me." Cecilia called out from behind.

A few minutes later, the roar of a motorcycle engine echoed as it sped back to the starting point.

All eyes were on the scene.

"Thirteen minutes and twenty seconds, undisputed first place."

"She truly is the Queen of Racing. After three years of absence, she returns undefeated."

The audience erupted in applause.

In the center of the crowd, a tall woman in a black bodysuit dismounted from her motorcycle. Her perfect figure, long legs, and every move captivated the onlookers.

Michael approached, mesmerized by the scene.

That familiar figure, even her walking posture, was identical to Isabella's.

Was she the one who escaped at the final point on Sunset Ridge Highway last time?

Michael strode forward, blocking the woman's path, and threw down a challenge, "I'll race you. If I win, you come with me tonight!"

Not only the woman but also the surrounding spectators were stunned by Michael's bold statement.

Michael's words were audacious.

Everyone knew the Queen of Racing's prowess. Michael's attempt to date her this way seemed misguided.

"So, if I win, you belong to me?" The woman's voice was cold, unlike Isabella's.

"Of course. Do you dare to try?" Michael lowered his gaze, staring intently into her exposed eyes, as if trying to confirm something.

Isabella chuckled softly, her tone mocking, "Sure, but I won't lose to you. Consider this race a lesson in humility. I remember, you were the one who lost to me on Sunset Ridge Highway, right?"

It was really her!

Michael's gaze deepened as he looked at her.

Isabella didn't look at him, instead smiling at the black sports car not far behind him, "So, you're going to race me with that?"

Michael didn't respond, turning to a young racer and tossing him the car keys. "This is yours. Your motorcycle is mine now."

Those who came here were naturally wealthy, but Michael's limited-edition car wasn't something money could easily buy.

Its value far exceeded that of dozens of motorcycles.

The racer happily accepted.

Everyone around was envious. If they had known, they would have brought their best motorcycles.

Michael put on his helmet and exchanged a determined look with Isabella.

Both had a competitive glint in their eyes.

The signal gun was fired.

The two motorcycles shot forward like arrows, leaving only an echo behind.

"Oh my God, he's so fast. I thought he was just trying to get the Queen of Racing's attention, but he really has some skills."

The young man who had just received the luxury car was stunned by the speed of his motorcycle.

He looked incredulous, "Is that really my bike? How did he get that speed? Why am I always last?"

"Shame on you. It just means you're not good enough!" The people around him burst into laughter.

"Place your bets. Who do you think will win?"

"Do you even need to ask? I'm betting on the Queen of Racing. Didn't you hear her say that the guy already lost to her once? He's just trying to save face this time. If he had the skills, he wouldn't have lost."

"Exactly, I'm betting on the Queen of Racing too."

###chapter 59 Fulfilling the Bet

At this moment, halfway up the mountain, Michael and Isabella were intensely focused on the steep mountain road ahead.

Everpeak Mountain was much more challenging than Sunset Ridge Highway.

Moreover, the late autumn evening was approaching quickly, and visibility was starting to decrease.

Michael kept scanning ahead while also keeping an eye on Isabella's condition.

He was afraid she would disregard her own safety to win, just like last time.

Their vehicles moved like ghosts through the mountains, fast and agile.

As they pressed through the curves, sparks flew from their cars.

With only a few dozen feet left to the final turn, Michael was still closely following.

Isabella's car had reached its top speed. If she couldn't take the lead at the last turn, she would have no chance to overtake him on the remaining stretch.

But accelerating through the turn was a huge risk.

She might skid off the track and crash into the guardrail.

But if she didn't, she would face losing the race.

She had done it before; as long as she maintained her balance through the turn, she could make it.

In the last 15 feet, Isabella took an extremely low turn, pushing her speed to the maximum.

She overtook Michael at the last moment.

However, the slippery mountain ground made it impossible for her to maintain her balance, and her car skidded rapidly towards the slope.

At the critical moment, Michael used his car as a buffer, rushed over, and grabbed Isabella, rolling into the grass on the side.

Fortunately, both were wearing helmets and didn't suffer any serious injuries.

"Are you hurt?" Michael's eyes were only on her as he picked her up and checked her carefully.

"I'm fine, what about you?"

Isabella struggled to stand up. That moment was really dangerous. If Michael hadn't rushed over to grab her at the last second, she and her car might have slid down the mountain.

She could have died.

She didn't expect that in such a critical moment, he would protect a complete stranger. It seemed he wasn't as cold and heartless as she had imagined.

But why could he be kind to a stranger and not show any genuine feelings towards Isabella?

"Don't worry, I'm fine." Michael stood up, dusted off the grass and dirt, and stood in front of her with a tense expression.

Seeing that he was really okay, Isabella nodded at him, walked over to her car, quickly checked it, and sped off.

She had to win tonight.

Since Michael had made her the bet, she wouldn't miss this opportunity.

Watching Isabella's fleeting figure, Michael's eyes darkened, and he quickly followed.

This wasn't the first time.

She really didn't care about her safety.

She was willing to risk her life to win!

"The Racing Queen is out first!"

"Twelve minutes and forty seconds, the Racing Queen, an absolute champion."

"No wonder she was the five-time consecutive champion; she keeps breaking her own records."

As the sexy black figure got off the bike, the crowd gathered around Isabella, cheering and celebrating.

Michael took off his helmet and felt a pang of jealousy as if his belonging had been stolen by someone else.

She once belonged to him.

But now, he wasn't sure if she still wanted to come back to him.

Pushing through the crowd, Michael's deep gaze fixed on her, his voice low and powerful, "You won. As per the bet, I'm yours tonight!"

Isabella's eyes were indifferent, with a hint of sarcasm.

She had just praised him for being responsible, for helping a stranger, but within minutes, he had shown his true colors.

He had chased her down Sunset Ridge Highway to the foot of the mountain, and now he was doing it again on Everpeak Mountain?

He loved one after another, yet he still wouldn't divorce her.

Michael was truly despicable!

If he knew that the person under the helmet was his wife Isabella, whom he had neglected for three years, what would his expression be right now?

Thinking this, Isabella's eyes flickered. She casually took off her helmet, letting her long hair cascade down, blown wildly by the wind.

A beautiful and bold face appeared before everyone.

She looked at Michael, a mocking smile on her lips, "So, do you still want to keep playing?"

Michael's face showed surprisingly little reaction.

But the onlookers, seeing Isabella's true identity as Michael's wife, who had been hotly discussed online recently, were shocked.

Seeing the imposing Michael opposite her, they all backed away in fear.

They hadn't expected to see the people from the news in person.

These two were not to be messed with.

One was Isabella, who could even kick her biological father Indigo out of the house, and the other was Michael, who held the economic lifeline of Evergreen City. The crowd quickly dispersed.

Soon, only Michael and Isabella were left.

Isabella was about to leave but was pulled onto Michael's car. The person who had swapped cars with him, recognizing him, felt the keys burning in his hand.

His family couldn't afford to offend the Brown Family. He wouldn't dare take Michael's things no matter what.

"If I hadn't come over, how long were you planning to keep this from me, Isabella? How many things have you not told me the truth about?" Michael questioned her, his gaze sharp.

They were almost chest to chest, and Isabella felt suffocated by Michael's oppressive presence.

Feeling uneasy, she frowned and pushed him away hard.

Michael grunted, clutching his chest, his face turning pale.

When he had rolled with Isabella into the grass, she hadn't been hurt at all in his arms, but he had hit a rock.

Now, it was starting to hurt.

"Where are you hurt?" Isabella immediately noticed his discomfort and reached out in concern.

Michael grabbed her hand, placing it on his chest, his voice hoarse, "What do you think? You broke my heart, and now you want to go?"

Isabella was speechless.

She quickly shook him off. For him to say something so disgusting at this moment, it seemed he hadn't hurt his brain.

But the situation had been too critical just now. If he really was injured, she couldn't just ignore it. "You took a hard fall just now. You should go to the hospital. I'll cover all the medical expenses!"

After saying this, Isabella put her helmet back on, swung her long legs over the bike, and left swiftly.

Michael hadn't expected her to just leave like that.

What if he was really too injured to move? When had she become so heartless?

Back then, even a minor cold would have her staying up all night by his side, taking care of him, giving him water and medicine.

In the vast racetrack, only Michael was left.

The sky had completely darkened, and the cold wind blew, giving a sense of desolation.

He felt a pang of regret.

In three years, why hadn't he realized her worth from the beginning, and instead praised Bianca's understanding and gentleness in front of her?

The way Isabella felt back then was exactly how he felt now.

It was the punishment he deserved.

###chapter 60 Win Isabella Back Yourself

On the way back, the radio in Michael's car broadcasted news about Isabella.

Many netizens were calling out to Michael, telling him to stop bothering Isabella, saying she deserved better.

They urged them to get a divorce and let her be free.

As Michael listened, he felt upset, and he turned off the radio.

Back then, he was blinded, failing to recognize her goodness and taking everything she did for granted.

He even subconsciously thought she was using him as a tool to secure her position when she suggested having a child with him.

He never realized that Isabella owed him nothing.

He agreed the marriage at the very beginning, and having children was a natural part of being a couple.

Why did it take him so long to realize?

Back at the Brown Villa, Stella was sitting on the couch watching the latest news online, which happened to be a report about Isabella being a racing queen.

Seeing Isabella's flamboyant and beautiful face after she took off her helmet, Stella gritted her teeth in anger.

In a flash, she saw Michael's figure.

She seized the opportunity and held her phone up to Michael, "Michael, look at these news reports. Isabella has been deceiving us for three years, pretending to be harmless. And now, before you two are even divorced, she can't wait to reveal her true colors. What racing goddess? She's just flaunting her body in public. Look at what she's wearing. What decent woman would dress like that and stand among men? She's completely disgraced our Brown Family!"

Stella's voice grew sharper, and her words became increasingly harsh.

Michael's face turned completely dark.

His voice was icy, "Mom, that's enough. Isabella is my wife. Please show her respect! And as for the things you've done to Isabella, just because I haven't pursued them doesn't mean I've let them go."

Hearing Michael bring up that matter again, Stella's voice grew even more defensive. "What nonsense are you talking about? I'm your mother. Everything I've done is for your own good. Are you really going to go against me for Isabella?"

Michael walked to the stairs, turned sideways, and gave her a cold look, "If you are not my mother, do you think I would tolerate your actions even once?"

There was a hint of impatience in Michael's eyes.

Even a tiny bit was enough to make Stella feel unbearable.

She was Michael's biological mother, the one who gave birth to and raised him!

She would never allow any woman to hold a higher place in Michael's heart than she did. "Did that bitch Isabella say something to you? It's because of her that you've become like this! Isabella, that bitch, I won't let her off."

Stella was both angry and hateful, her face twisted.

There was no trace of the noble lady she once was.

Michael narrowed his eyes, "Even now, you still don't realize where you went wrong?"

Stella's eyes widened, "I did nothing wrong. It's her. She shouldn't have married into this family. Michael, I'm your mother. How can you talk to me like this?"

Michael couldn't be bothered to argue with her anymore, "Until you apologize to Isabella, your bank card will be indefinitely suspended. And don't let me see you associating with Bianca's family again."

With that, he returned to his room.

Downstairs, Stella, hearing that Michael was going to suspend her bank card and that she had to apologize to Isabella in person, smashed everything she could in a fit of rage.

It took a while for her to calm down.

Upstairs, Michael took a shower in his room and checked his injuries in the mirror. There was a bruise on his back.

He took some anti-inflammatory medicine and went to Aiden's place.

Isabella wouldn't be coming back tonight, and he wondered if Aiden would throw a fit when he found out.

Outside, Sophia had just left with a tray and greeted Michael, "Mr. Brown."

Seeing that a third of the food on the tray was gone, Michael was a bit surprised.

He pushed open the door to find Aiden holding a tablet, watching the news with a smile of pride.

It was news about Isabella.

Judging by Aiden's expression, he didn't seem surprised or shocked by it; rather, it was as if he had known all along.

Michael narrowed his eyes and walked closer, "Grandpa, did you know Isabella could race?"

Hearing Michael's voice, Aiden didn't even look up, just snorted, "She's your wife. If you didn't know, how would I? I just saw it on the news."

Michael didn't respond.

He clearly didn't believe it.

Aiden wasn't in a hurry. He was very happy watching Isabella on the news, but when he looked at Michael, his smile disappeared. "Isabella is excellent in every way. I don't know how she ended up with you. You don't know how good your wife is until you're abandoned. Then you realize what you've lost, and it's too late."

Michael felt uncomfortable all over and couldn't care about his pride anymore, "Grandpa, I know I was wrong. Please help me one more time. Does Isabella have any other secrets she's hiding from me?"

Aiden ignored him. He had helped Michael so many times, but did Michael ever take it seriously?

Only by letting him experience it himself would he understand Isabella's worth.

"Don't ask me. I don't know anything. If you truly realize your mistake, you should win Isabella back yourself, just like she once did for you." Thinking about how Isabella had been driven away by Michael, Aiden got angry. "Also, the Brown Group will hold a general shareholders' meeting tomorrow. You will preside over it, and Isabella will attend."

Michael frowned, "What is she attending the Brown Group's shareholders' meeting for?"

Aiden glared at him, "What do you think? Of course, it's to transfer the Brown Group's shares to Isabella. You're presiding so you can see it with your own eyes."

Aiden thought, 'You can't even have a child, so how do you expect to hold onto the position of heir?'

Michael's expression changed.

He knew Aiden liked Isabella a lot, but transferring shares was no small matter. Aiden didn't even discuss it with him and wanted to transfer everything to Isabella.

It sounded a bit too hasty.

But he knew Aiden's character. Once Aiden said something, he wouldn't take it back. Michael could only return to his room in frustration.

Closing the door, he called his assistant, Aaron. "Did you find out anything about Mrs. Brown in recent years?"

Receiving a call from Michael late at night was nerve-wracking enough, and hearing Michael's question made Aaron break out in a cold sweat.

He couldn't possibly say that he had found nothing useful.

Although Michael had given him a short time, with the Brown Group's influence, they should have found something by now.

But Isabella's identity was like a mystery. No matter how hard they tried, there were no clues.

He even looked into the Taylor Family, but the result was the same.

All information about Isabella stopped at the age of seven.

###chapter 61 Investigating the Identity of the Gambling King

After that, Isabella was taken to the countryside by Daniel.

But the village had long been abandoned, with only dilapidated houses left. Apart from the bare walls, there was nothing left.

No matter how capable Aaron was, it was impossible to find any traces in a bunch of empty houses.

But when faced with Michael's questioning, he couldn't really say he found nothing, or his career would be over.

"I found something. Mrs. Brown's identity is that of a mysterious race car driver. The recent hot news online is all about Mrs. Brown." Aaron had no other choice but to stall for time.

There was a moment of silence on the other end of the phone.

It was obvious that Michael already knew about this.

"I already know that. Continue to intensify the investigation," Michael said, clearly angry.

"Understood, Mr. Brown!" Aaron quickly responded, "I'll immediately assign more people."

"Wait!" Michael exhaled deeply. For some reason, he had a nagging feeling.

Isabella might really be connected to the Wilson Family!

Not because of Thomas, but because in Evergreen City, the fact that they couldn't find any information about Isabella itself indicated a problem.

Moreover, the place Isabella went to back then was in the eastern part of Valoria.

And the eastern part of Valoria was the Wilson Family's sphere of influence.

Besides the Wilson Family, he couldn't think of anyone else who had the ability to erase all of Isabella's past.

Even if the Brown Family intervened, they wouldn't be able to find a single trace.

Or perhaps, she had always been by his side.

He just hadn't noticed her other identity.

"Mr. Brown?" Not hearing anything for a long time, Aaron thought Michael wasn't talking to him earlier.

"Find a photo of Solterra Gambling King Mr. Wilson, from any period, and send it to me." Michael ordered in a deep voice.

Aaron, on the other end of the phone, was so scared he almost stuttered, "Mr. Brown, you don't mean... the Gambling King Mr. Wilson who was undefeated at the Golden Nexus twenty years ago?"

"Yes, him. Find the photo; I need it." Michael said.

Aaron wiped his sweat. He didn't know what was going on with Michael lately; the tasks he assigned were getting more and more difficult.

Now Michael was even looking for someone like the Gambling King.

But where was he supposed to find it?

The Gambling King's real name was Daniel Wilson.

He was also Aaron's childhood idol, and Aaron had even collected various legendary stories about him.

There were quite a few movies based on him back then.

Aaron had only seen some of his personal stories in old newspapers, which even had a photo attached. But the photography technology back then couldn't make high-definition photos.

It was said that he was a stunningly handsome man in his youth. Because of his exceptional abilities, courage, and vision, he caught the eye of a local overlord and married the overlord's daughter.

After that, Daniel took over the overlord's business and gradually rose to his current position.

But Daniel had stepped down twenty years ago and had never appeared again.

Investigating Daniel was very difficult.

Aaron wouldn't be able to sleep tonight.

The next morning.

Michael parked his car in front of the garden villa where Isabella was currently living.

Strangely enough, when Bianca's family lived here, he had never visited once.

But now, looking at this historically rich house, all he could think of were images of Isabella and Grace.

Isabella's mother, Grace, was a gentle-looking, elegant woman.

Isabella's personality was the exact opposite.

She had a fiery temper.

Isabella might not even remember that he had once lived nearby for a while.

Back then, before Bianca appeared, they went to school together, fed cats in the alley, and Isabella even gave him a cat-head doll.

He took her to the river to catch small fish.

Their laughter used to echo in every corner of this area. But why had they come to this point now?

Like familiar strangers, knowing each other well yet separated by an insurmountable barrier.

Inside the house, Isabella had gotten up early.

She received a call from Aiden, asking her to go to the Brown Group today.

Aiden said there was something important to discuss with her.

Isabella guessed it was about the shares. She had secretly missed the appointment with Aiden's lawyer yesterday, and today she couldn't escape Aiden's direct order.

She had to go.

If Michael agreed to divorce her and let her give up her inheritance of the Brown Group, it wouldn't be a bad thing for her.

Thinking of this, Isabella put on beautiful makeup and stepped out in high heels.

As soon as she walked out the door, she saw the conspicuous black sports car parked grandly at the entrance.

Isabella knew who it was.

She was about to pretend she didn't see it and turn away.

Michael stuck his head out of the car window, revealing a handsome face. "Aren't you going to the Brown Group? Come on, I'll give you a ride!"

Isabella gritted her teeth and took a deep breath. She really didn't want to see him this early in the morning.

She didn't want Michael to ruin her good mood.

She rolled her eyes. "No need, I have my own car!"

Michael raised an eyebrow, glanced at the passersby attracted by his horn, and smirked. "Are you sure you don't need a ride? I just saw quite a few reporters heading this way. You're the legendary racing queen. How long do you think it will take them to reach your doorstep"

"You..." Isabella's face changed before she could finish her sentence.

She quickly opened Michael's car door and got in. "Drive, unless you want to be the center of a big news story. I don't!"

Seeing her swiftly buckle her seatbelt, Michael's eyes curved with satisfaction. He stepped on the gas, and the car sped away from the villa like a flash.

By the time the reporters arrived with their equipment, Michael had already taken Isabella away from the villa.

On the road, Isabella looked at Michael, who was sitting very close to her, and the unique scent that occasionally wafted from him.

She coughed uncomfortably. "Let me make it clear, I only got in your car to avoid the reporters."

"Perfect, we can also discuss the divorce agreement." Michael glanced at her slightly reddened ears, feeling inexplicably pleased.

With a faint smile, he said, "Alright, as you wish. The traffic might be heavy at this time, so we can talk as long as you want."

Isabella looked at him as if she had seen a ghost, frowning deeply.

Was this still the Michael she knew?

The divorce terms she had prepared to say were stuck in her throat. Seeing Michael's amicable demeanor, Isabella felt something was off.

She decided to keep quiet.

Turning to look out the window, she didn't want to be played by him again.

###chapter 62 Putting on a Show of Affection

Isabella remained silent throughout the journey.

Finally, they arrived at their destination. Just as she was about to get out of the car, Isabella paused when she saw the surroundings.

Michael had parked the car several dozen feet away from the entrance.

"Why didn't you park in the underground garage?" Isabella frowned.

Walking from here would be too conspicuous.

She didn't want anyone from the Brown Group to see her getting out of the car with Michael and misunderstand their relationship.

Michael unbuckled his seatbelt. "If we go in, how are we supposed to act like a loving couple?"

Isabella's eyes widened. "Michael, are you crazy? Why should I play along with this act? We're about to get divorced!"

Isabella instinctively wanted to escape.

Before she could open the car door, she was pulled back. Michael reclined the seat and pressed down on her without any courtesy.

In the confined space of the car, Isabella's hands were held by him, and their bodies were tightly pressed together.

This action was too intimate.

Anyone passing by would think their relationship was unusual.

Isabella's breathing became erratic, and she didn't dare to move, fearing that Michael might actually do something here.

Seeing that resistance was futile, she simply tilted her head and asked, "Just say it, what's your purpose?"

Isabella, lying under him, exuded a faint sweet fragrance and lay quietly without making a fuss, making Michael feel a bit itchy inside.

His throat moved up and down. "I have only one request. When you get out of the car, stay by my side. Don't let anyone in the company notice anything, and by the way, dispel the rumors about our divorce."

Isabella was stunned. She never expected such shameless request.

The divorce had been delayed repeatedly by him until now.

It wasn't actually a rumor.

Now he wanted her to dispel the rumors. She was truly angry.

"Michael, you really have some nerve. Even at this point, you want to maintain your dignity. There's no room for negotiation about the divorce. I don't agree." As Isabella spoke, she tried to push him away, but Michael knew her too well.

He pressed her down and explained, "I told you, it's just an act, for one day. Besides, do you really think the mess you caused didn't affect the company? The stock market has been dropping for days. Can you say you're not responsible?"

Isabella didn't fall for his trick and sneered, "What responsibility? If you had been straightforward about the divorce, none of this would have happened. You're the one managing the company. You can't blame me."

Just as Michael was about to say something, a group of people walked by outside, and his eyes flashed.

He suddenly leaned close to her ear, his low voice sending a tingling sensation through her body. "Someone's coming. What do you think will happen if I roll down the window now? Do you want to try?"

Michael chuckled lowly, with a hint of seduction and intention.

Hearing this, Isabella became both anxious and angry. She knew Michael was capable of doing such a thing and was furious.

She bit him hard.

Michael frowned but didn't let go of her. "Bite all you want. I'll take it as your agreement."

Michael had planned all of this from the moment he appeared at her doorstep.

This was the Brown Group building. Even if he could bring himself to do such shameless things, she couldn't stand being watched like a live broadcast.

When they got out of the car, Michael extended his hand to Isabella, his eyes filled with a tenderness that could melt her.

Only Isabella knew how fake he was.

But with so many people watching, she took a deep breath and still took Michael's hand, walking intimately into the elevator together.

Everyone who saw them was shocked.

Recently, news about Isabella and rumors of their divorce had been all over the headlines.

No one expected that before they could get any follow-up, Isabella and Michael would appear hand in hand at the company, shattering the hopes of those waiting for Isabella to divorce and find a new husband.

As they watched the elevator doors close, a group of people at the front desk started gossiping.

"What's going on? Aren't they supposed to get divorced? How come they appeared together in the company lobby today?"

"Not just that. Mr. Brown had a smile on his face the whole time. Have any of you ever seen Mr. Brown that happy?"

"Maybe Mr. Brown and Mrs. Brown were just having a spat and aren't really getting divorced?"

"But what about Mrs. Brown and Thomas from the Wilson Family? A lot of people online say they're the real deal!"

"Yeah, and Mr. Brown has been seen getting close to Mrs. Brown's sister, Bianca. There are even intimate photos of them online!"

"That's why rich people live in a different world from us. It's so messy."

"Stop it. Last time somebody badmouthed Mrs. Brown and got fired. We need to keep our jobs."

Top floor.

In the serious and quiet conference room, Michael and Isabella walked in.

All eyes were on Isabella. Most of the people here were shareholders of the Brown Group, and their gazes were filled with dissatisfaction and scrutiny.

Isabella raised an eyebrow. It seemed these people were unhappy with her.

Good, she didn't like them either.

If she took this opportunity to bring up the divorce. Maybe these people would even help her.

Aiden, sitting at the head of the table, saw Isabella and waved her over to sit next to him.

Isabella let go of Michael's hand and walked straight to Aiden.

She finally felt relieved after acting all the way here.

"I've made myself clear. You've seen the contract. All my shares will be transferred to Isabella starting today! Isabella, sign it." Aiden smiled and handed her one of the two copies of the contract, his tone as calm as if he were talking about weather.

The people sitting below stared, their faces dark, but no one dared to voice any objections.

After all, Aiden was transferring his personal shares within the group, which didn't affect the group's overall interests. Even so, the amount was significant.

But the Brown Group had flourished under Aiden's leadership.

In the Brown Group, Aiden's words carried a lot of weight.

His decision was not something the shareholders could stop.

The contract had been drafted by Aiden's lawyer long ago. He was here just to inform them and back Isabella up, not to negotiate with them.

Isabella opened the contract and her pupils contracted.

Fifty-five percent of the shares!

Aiden hadn't kept any for himself. He was handing over his life's work to her.

And twenty percent of those shares belonged to Michael.

If she signed this, she would have decision-making power in the Brown Group.

To put it bluntly, Michael would be working for her.

But how was that possible?

How could Michael agree to this?

###chapter 63 Michael's Deep Schemes

Isabella instinctively looked at Michael beside her, her eyes filled with immense shock.

But Michael remained calm; he was clearly aware of this contract.

Isabella was even more confused.

She knew how much Michael cared about this heir position.

For the past three years, he had devoted almost all his time to work to secure his position as the CEO, which was why Aiden was satisfied to hand over the group to him.

But now, he didn't say a word. 

"Isabella, just sign it after you read it." Aiden urged her, and the assistant behind him handed over a pen.

"Grandpa, no, I can't sign this contract!" Isabella decisively refused.

Aiden had mentioned this to her before, but she thought it was just a joke to annoy Michael.

At that time, she was heartbroken and agreed casually just to make Michael uncomfortable.

But now, to accept half of the Brown Group's interests, she couldn't do it.

That would be too selfish, and it would betray Aiden's trust.

Because she was still going to divorce Michael.

Suddenly, Indigo sighed, his eyes reddening. "Isabella, do you not even recognize me as your father anymore?"

His voice was hoarse, filled with unspeakable sadness and pain, but Isabella felt nothing but exasperation.

Honestly, Indigo's acting wasn't as good as Harper's. At least Harper knew how to read the room.

Seeing Isabella's lack of response, Indigo forced out a couple of tears. "I know you've resented me all these years, but I had no choice. Your mother died when I was still young. I couldn't spend my life alone with just one child. Now that you're divorced, you should understand how I felt back then."

Isabella couldn't help but twitch her mouth.

How could Indigo have the nerve to say such things? He even found a justification for his infidelity? And he wanted her to understand him? It was really ridiculous.

###chapter 109 Have You Figured Out What I Said Yesterday?

Isabella was at her wit's end. "Indigo, do you even hear yourself? If you can't say anything nice, just shut up."

She really didn't have the energy to watch him put on a show.

Indigo, seeing Isabella's displeasure, quickly changed his approach.

With a very humble demeanor, he said, "Isabella, what I mean is, no matter what, we are still family. Our blood ties can't be severed. I love you, and you will always be my best daughter."

Isabella smiled sarcastically. "If I'm your good daughter, then what about Bianca, whom you were just asking me for?"

These two treat Bianca like a treasure when they need her, but when they can't find her, they start eyeing Isabella's money.

Did they really think she was so gullible that a few sweet words would make her give them money?

Harper was also taken aback and grabbed Indigo's arm, cursing, "Indigo, what did you tell me when we came here? Bianca can't be found, and you're still putting on this act?"

He pushed Harper aside and sat down in front of Isabella.

With a fawning expression, he said, "Isabella, I've thought it through. Bianca is too disobedient and always does things that make people worry. I can't save her, but I still have you."

"Don't worry, I can swear in front of you that from now on, you are my only daughter. Isabella, can you just forget about the past?" Indigo spoke very sincerely.

Afraid that Isabella wouldn't believe him, he added, "Even if we find Bianca, I won't acknowledge her anymore. She caused us to be in this situation. I don't want to see her ever again. Even if she dies out there, I won't care."

Isabella looked at Indigo's self-talk with a blank expression, feeling no emotional stirrings.

Because he had said these same words to her before, but he had forgotten all about it.

"Indigo, how dare you curse Bianca to die? You're too much." Harper was first shocked, then furious. "Isabella is your daughter, but isn't Bianca too?"

You think Bianca can't climb up the Brown Family anymore, so you've shifted your target to Isabella, that bitch, right? Indigo, I must have been blind back then to rely on a man like you, who can only depend on women. When you were young, you relied on Grace, and now you rely on Isabella. You're truly a useless man."

Having his true intentions exposed, Indigo became furious.

He glanced at Isabella and quickly denied it. "Don't talk nonsense. I never said Bianca isn't my daughter. She ran away from home and went missing, offending people she shouldn't have. It's her own fault. Who else can she blame?"

To prove himself, Indigo's eyes widened with excitement.

Harper wasn't backing down either. The two of them started arguing back and forth.

Isabella had initially wanted to send them away and get back to work.

But seeing the current scene, she wasn't in a hurry to leave.

One was her biological father, Indigo, who had ignored her for years, and the other was Harper, whom she hated the most. Watching them fight in front of her was quite a show.

But after watching for a while, she realized they were just exchanging the same insults, and it was getting boring.

So she decided to stir the pot a bit. "Bianca is actually with Michael."

Hearing this, Indigo and Harper immediately stopped.

Isabella took the opportunity to throw this big problem onto Michael. "Bianca caused trouble to me, and I was going to deal with her, but Michael hid her away first. You're looking in the wrong place. Bianca is with him."

Unexpectedly, Harper became even more aggressive. "I knew it. Bianca is too soft-hearted. Everything that belonged to her was taken by you, and now you even want to take Michael!"

With a cold snort, Harper continued, "Thanks God, even if you take Michael, his heart is still with our Bianca. You ended up divorced despite all your efforts. I advise you to let go. What's not yours will never be yours, no matter how thick-skinned you are."

Harper's accusations left Isabella stunned.

She was eager to push Michael away. It was Michael who refused to divorce her, and he even conspired with Daniel to force her to have his child. There was no man more detestable than him.

But before she could speak, Indigo grabbed Harper's hand. "Honey, is what you said true?"

He looked anxious. "So Bianca was taken by Michael for protection. Why didn't you tell me earlier? You know how much I suffer when Bianca is missing."

"You're so fake!" Harper, seeing through Indigo, pushed him away in disgust. "Just now, you wished Bianca dead. Now that you know Michael cares for her, you're playing innocent. Indigo, aren't you ashamed of your own words?"

"I'm calling Michael right now to have him bring Bianca home. Once she's back, we're getting a divorce!" Knowing that Michael was protecting Bianca, Harper felt emboldened.

She took out her phone and dialed.

But after several attempts, no one answered.

By the eighth call, still hearing the busy tone, Harper's face turned awkward. "Maybe Michael is busy with work. He's the CEO of the Brown Group, after all. He can't always be looking at his phone. He'll call me back when he sees the missed calls. And then, Indigo, you'll be packing your things and getting kicked out."

Isabella chimed in, "How about I try calling him?"

She wasn't being kind; she also wanted to see if Michael would bring Bianca out.

She had been looking for Bianca for too long.

This grudge couldn't be settled just because Bianca disappeared for a few days.

Harper glanced at her and said, "He's so busy he won't even take my calls. Do you think he'll answer a call from a woman he's divorced?"

Before she could finish, a deep, sexy male voice came from the phone. "What do you want? Have you figured out what I said yesterday?"

It was Michael, the man Harper claimed was too busy to take her calls, answering.

###chapter 110 She Brought It on Herself

Isabella played the external sound, not expecting Michael to start with such a sentence.

She naturally understood that he wanted her to keep her distance from Emilio.

But she didn't want to discuss this with him now; she had more important things to do.

Unexpectedly, he just paused for a moment and then agreed good-naturedly. "I'll be right over."

The call ended.

Hearing that Michael was coming, Harper's face was full of pride and arrogance. "I knew Michael only has feelings for Bianca, Isabella, you should give up. You haven't won Michael's heart in three years. The position of Mrs. Brown is definitely going to be Bianca's."

Isabella said nothing, quietly watching Harper already fantasizing about a future of wealth and prosperity.

Isabella knew better than anyone Bianca's place in Michael's heart.

But when she heard Michael say he was coming right away, her heart felt like it was blocked by a stone.

Sure enough, when it came to Bianca, he always got nervous.

Indigo's face was even more unsightly at this moment.

He never expected that after finally regaining some dignity as a father in front of Isabella, he would be made so awkward by Harper's words.

If he hadn't said those things earlier, would Michael have shown him a bit more respect when he arrived?

It was all Isabella's fault; she could have said it earlier, but she had to say it right after he made a vow.

Michael arrived quickly, taking just over twenty minutes.

The distance between the Brown Group and the Wilson Group was about the fastest one could drive.

Seeing Michael arrive, Harper was as excited as if she had seen a family. She grabbed his hand and wouldn't let go. "Michael, that bitch Isabella said Bianca is with you, is it true?"

"I understand you want to protect Bianca, but you should have told us. I've been so scared these past few days that I couldn't sleep, having nightmares of Bianca being bullied," As she spoke, Harper even started to tear up. "Fortunately, you protected her. Bianca is finally going to have a good life. She has never had a good life, and I couldn't give her the best. But with you around, I can rest easy."

Isabella raised her eyebrows and watched the drama unfold; she had to admit Harper's acting skills were much better than Bianca's.

No matter what, Harper had climbed her way up as a mistress, so her emotional intelligence was exceptionally high.

Today, she wanted to see how Michael would handle this.

She had previously asked him for Bianca, but he had refused to give her up.

Now that Bianca's parents were asking for her, could he still keep Bianca hidden?

Upon hearing this, Isabella's brow twitched, and she thought Michael was playing tricks on her.

Harper was not surprised; instead, she smiled and leaned in. "I understand. You must have sent Bianca abroad to protect her so that Isabella wouldn't trouble her. Thank you for your efforts."

But Michael's next words shocked everyone present. "Bianca brought this upon herself. No one is protecting her. She was sent to the Auroria mining district!"

Michael threw a stack of photos onto the table, each one showing Bianca's face, but the injuries on her face were horrifying. "These are her recent activities. You wanted to find her, here she is."

Staring at the scattered photos on the table, Harper's mind seemed to explode.

She could hardly believe what she was seeing.

Her fingers trembled as she picked up the photos, but the images made her almost vomit.

There were pictures of Bianca being beaten and cursed while pinned to the ground.

There were pictures of her being dragged by her hair into a small dark room, her clothes torn.

Most of the photos showed layers of scars on her body, not just from beatings but from other abuses.

Each gruesome photo was followed by an even more horrifying scene.

Harper couldn't bear to look any longer. She turned red-eyed and lunged at Michael. "Michael, you bastard, Bianca loved you so much. How could you do this to her?"

Michael easily pushed her away, his expression still cold. "I have said her fate was her own doing. You know better than anyone what she did and how she deceived me all these years. Do you want me to list them one by one?"

"I don't want to hear it!" Harper screamed, covering her ears, "You're all crazy. Bianca just wanted to marry you. What did she do wrong to deserve this? This is human trafficking. I'm going to call the cop. I'm going to put you all in jail. I'm going to save Bianca. She's only twenty-two. She's still so young."

Harper, nearly hysterical, took out her phone, on the verge of a breakdown.

From start to finish, Isabella just stood by, squinting her eyes and watching.

She was already shocked when Michael mentioned sending Bianca to the Auroria mining district, but she still watched everything unfold calmly.

At this moment, Michael walked up to Harper and, seeing her trembling hands about to call the police, said, "No need to bother."

Seeing his face, Harper backed away in fear. "What are you going to do? You took Bianca, and now you want to take me too?"

Michael shook his head, but his next words were even more terrifying than sending Harper away. "I've already called the cop. They should be here soon."

When Isabella called, he had already prepared everything.

He had said the Taylor Family should disappear.

He was only a few days late, but they couldn't wait any longer and even went to Isabella.

Just as Harper was in a state of panic and confusion, someone knocked on the door outside. "Mr. Brown, we're from the Evergreen City Police Department."

They showed two pairs of silver handcuffs. "Mr and Mrs. Taylor, right? Sixteen years ago, Ms. Wilson's death in the hospital was suspicious, and you two were the only ones present. Now someone has accused you of murder. Please come with us."

With a click, Indigo and Harper were handcuffed simultaneously.

There was no way they could find anything from over a decade ago, but Harper couldn't let Bianca be tortured to death by those beasts.

"Wait, I want to report a crime!" Harper looked at Michael. "I want to report him for human trafficking. He sold my daughter Bianca to the Auroria mining district. You can't just arrest me. His crime is even worse. He must be punished."

###chapter 111 Michael Takes a Knife for Her

Michael's expression remained unchanged, not even a flicker.

It was the police officer beside him who explained, "We have already taken a statement from Mr. Brown. Ms. Taylor had prior contact with the criminal gang abroad; she went voluntarily. Harper's face turned pale with rage, confirming Bianca was sent away by Michael.

If he hadn't promised to take care of Bianca back then, Bianca wouldn't have liked him. What's wrong with her using some means for the Michael she liked?

Isabella, who was the one deserved to die. Only her death could fulfill Bianca.

If she had been ruthless enough to strangle Isabella in the Taylor Family back then, Bianca would have been the Michael's wife, and she wouldn't have ended up in such a miserable situation.

The bodyguards were all outside, and no one expected Harper, a middle-aged woman who stayed home all day, to commit such an act.

Isabella stayed behind to manage the situation, but seeing her hands stained with Michael's blood, she momentarily lost control of her emotions.

Michael didn't protect Bianca back then but sent her to Auroria, and he took a knife for Isabella.

The incident had already happened, and blaming anyone was pointless. The most important thing was to handle the problem properly.

Bianca drugged her, Harper tried to kill her. She would never forget the grudge against this mother and daughter.

Everyone knew Isabella rarely lost her temper, but when she did, no one had a good time.

The bodyguards knew that even if it wasn't their fault, they had caused this trouble. There was no escaping it.

"This morning, Mr. and Mrs. Taylor pretended to be sick and went to the hospital. We followed them, but somehow they slipped out the back door of the examination room. We didn't notice, and by the time they did, they were gone."

Isabella said nothing, knowing Indigo and Harper had been sent to the police station.

Whether or not their attempt to murder Grace would be uncovered, the Brown Family and the Wilson Family wouldn't let them off for the hurt Michael took.

But this incident needed to serve as a lesson; otherwise, if it happened again, it would be her own fault.

"Participants will have three months' bonuses deducted and must undergo three days of physical punishment," Isabella snapped.

The bodyguards shuddered and replied, "Yes!"

Luckily, Isabella didn't fire them. If Jesse knew it, they wouldn't have been able to leave the training camp for three months, let alone three days.

The room was quickly cleaned up, and the front desk pretended not to have seen anything.

Isabella returned to her office.

Isabella was about to divorce Michael, yet he took a knife for her at this time?

Wasn't it said that Michael didn't like Isabella? So, for three years of marriage, he was very cold to her. Now, he took a knife for her. What was wrong with Michael?

Despite his resentment, he couldn't make decisions about this favor for Isabella.

On the other end of the phone, Isabella sighed, "It's good that he's okay. I won't go. Today's events were too chaotic, and I have a headache."

Michael's actions today completely overturned her worldview, leaving her unsure how to face him now, desiring only some quiet time, and deciding they shouldn't see each other for a few days.

The incident happened suddenly, and all they could do was get Michael to the hospital.

###chapter 112 Picking Someone Up at the Airport

###chapter 113 Going to the Hospital

Ethan: [Isabella, Michael got hurt for you. Can't you come see him? Do you know he's waiting for you?]

###chapter 155 Have You Said Enough?

###chapter 175: Harper Escaped

###chapter 176: Got Angry

One person returned to the villa and sat on the sofa in the living room.

###chapter 177: Is She Bianca?

They were telling the truth.

###chapter 178: He Is Not in Her Heart

He assumed she had gone to the kitchen and continued to wait for her in the living room.

Michael, here to ask for help, didn't care about appearances.

He walked up to Thomas's car and politely called out, "Thomas!"

Michael's tone was calm, but his eyes showed visible anxiety.

The first day Isabella disappeared, he thought the Wilson Family had taken action.

Daniel was on his side, but he couldn't be sure about her uncles.

He had thoroughly investigated all her usual places. If it wasn't the Wilson Family, how could he not find her?

"If it weren't for Daniel's concern, we would have already conducted a thorough search for Isabella. We don't need you pretending to be kind here. Every time Isabella is upset, it's because of you. I'm warning you, get out of the Wilson Family's territory and don't let me see you again!"

Thomas was truly angry this time.

He stepped on the gas and brushed past Michael's car.

Isabella was the most cherished member of the Wilson Family. She lowered herself to marry Michael, and what did she get in return? In these three years, had he ever shown her any care?

Now that Isabella was missing, he was anxious. What was he doing before?

Even if he knew Isabella's whereabouts, he wouldn't tell Michael.

Michael frowned deeply.

Besides her uncles, who else was close to her?

Olivia.

Isabella's only friend in Evergreen City.

If she was still here, she would definitely be in contact with Olivia.

Olivia felt a pang of anxiety.

She instinctively looked for her manager, but Michael's deep voice interrupted, "Ms. Smith, I have some questions. I hope you can answer truthfully."

###chapter 185: Afraid to Admit One's Heart

###chapter 186: This Revenge Must Be Taken

Whispering Pines Estates, Seaview Villa.
