Michael frowned and wouldn't let her go, "If you leave like this, what about me?"

Isabella didn't understand what he meant and frowned at his actions, "Let go. This is my house, of course, I can go wherever I want. If you don't want to hide, then come down with me!"

She deliberately provoked him.

After all, Atticus was downstairs. If he showed up, he wouldn't be able to escape.

She couldn't do anything to him, but Atticus wouldn't let him off so easily.

Michael could see through her thoughts and little schemes, but this version of Isabella was real and adorable.

Unlike when they were married, when she lost herself trying to please him, or when she was aloof after proposing a divorce, now she had shed those unnecessary disguises and masks.

Even if she played little tricks, it revealed her true personality.

He had finally found her, and he would never let her go again.

"I'm not going down, and you can't leave. Stay here with me."

Michael was afraid she would slip away if he wasn't careful, so he tightly held her in his arms, unwilling to let go.

"Michael, what are you doing? Let go of me!"

Isabella struggled hard.

Since that incident in the car, she had developed an instinctive aversion to Michael's proximity.

Whenever he touched her, she couldn't help but think of the humiliation she suffered that night.

###chapter 194: So Angry That I Don't Even Want to Eat

"I just want you to stay with me, that's my only condition."

Isabella's body stiffened, and she couldn't break free. She said helplessly, "Didn't you hear Olivia calling me? If I don't go down, she'll come up soon, and you'll still be discovered."

Before Isabella could finish speaking, Atticus downstairs sensed something was wrong.

"Isn't Isabella already awake? Why isn't she responding when I call her?"

"How about I give her a call?"

He wasn't worried about the security of Whispering Pines Estates, but recently Michael had been frantically looking for Isabella, and he feared something might have happened.

Olivia, on the other hand, thought Atticus was making a big deal out of nothing.

But Atticus thought about how Isabella had been in a bad mood lately, so it was better not to disturb her.

It was just a bit awkward for the two of them to stay downstairs.

Isabella just wanted to provoke Michael, but her words inadvertently reminded him.

He couldn't stay here for long.

If he got caught, it would be hard to explain.

But why should she help Michael escape?

She would be happy if Atticus caught him and gave him a beating.

Isabella's heart tightened, and before she could deny it.

Isabella's eyes widened instantly. How could he be so righteous, "Michael, this is my house. Why should I take you to the back door and help you leave?"

He was delusional!

He knew her too well. She wouldn't let herself be misunderstood like this.

Besides, he was carrying his wife Isabella back to his house, and no one could stop him.

No matter how she fought, he remained unmoved.

Isabella's strength was like scratching an itch to Michael, with no deterrent effect.

So he had to take her away.

With him watching, at least she would eat properly.

Seeing Isabella's lack of interest, Michael didn't force her. He ordered some of her favorite main dishes and let the waiter prepare them.

###chapter 195: Giving Each Other Dignity

The humiliation in the car that night would be a scar she would never forget for the rest of her life.

If Nolan hadn't suddenly returned to the country, Isabella wouldn't have put all her thoughts on Nolan and abandoned him as her husband.

If they could part amicably and minimize the impact on public opinion, it would be good for both of them.

If it really got out, not only would both groups' reputations be damaged, but it would also affect future business.

Every point she made was for his consideration. She didn't even show a bit of jealousy or bitterness when mentioning his future wife.

###chapter 196: Nolan is Here Too

###chapter 197: Could She Be Pregnant?

Once their marriage was completely over, it would be Violet's time to shine.

Isabella, standing in place, squinted her eyes at Violet's somewhat familiar figure.

After thinking for a moment, she took out her phone and called her subordinate.

But Violet was too calm, and she couldn't find any flaws.

However, she still wanted to find clues about Harper from Violet.

Even if there was the slightest chance, she would never give up on finding Harper.

Harper was the suspect in Grace's murder.

Violet and Nolan were both gone.

Michael, sitting in the chair, had a cold expression, his eyes deep and unreadable.

Seeing her reluctant expression, Michael was filled with jealousy.

She wanted to see Nolan so much that she was reluctant even when he left.

She had just found his number and was about to call when a big hand suddenly snatched her phone and placed it on the table.

Michael was so angry that he couldn't control his expression.

She knew he cared most about her ambiguous relationship with Nolan, yet she still wanted to call Nolan in front of him?

Was she trying to drive him crazy?

"The more I don't want you to have contact with Nolan, the closer you want to get to him?"

Isabella was stunned, "Weren't you the one who told me to call?"

###chapter 199: Having a Child

###chapter 201 How Can You Be So Heartless

Childbearing agreement?

###chapter 202 Moving Out

"I understand."

The next morning, in the president's office of the Brown Group.

"This is the plan your entire department spent three days writing? Anyone off the street could write something better than this. If you can't use your brain at work, then don't bother coming!"

###chapter 203 Unintentional Teasing

"I found out, she's the student named Violet who previously caused trouble for Ms. Taylor and got humiliated. I heard she's an international student and has a close relationship with Mr. Nolan Brown of the Brown Family."

Hearing Violet's identity and past scandals, the crowd clicked their tongues.

They immediately saw through Violet's intentions and schemes.

"No wonder Violet looks so unpleasant. She's clearly taking advantage of the issues between Michael and Isabella to become the third party in their marriage."

"Doesn't she know Mr. Brown's wife is Ms. Taylor Wilson? How dare she compete with Ms. Taylor, she thinks too highly of herself."

"If you ask me, Mr. Brown is also at fault. Doesn't he know he's married? Bringing Violet out so openly, no wonder Ms. Taylor doesn't want him, bad man!"

Because of Violet and Michael's presence, the dessert shop turned into a discussion forum.

Isabella realized for the first time that so many people online were defending her.

Everyone unanimously pointed their fingers at Violet and Michael.

Some even took out their phones to record videos, explaining the relationships of the people in the video as they filmed.

The scene became chaotic.

Isabella knew very well that she couldn't reveal her identity at this moment.

If she suddenly stood up now, especially with Nolan, even though they hadn't done anything, in this situation, who knows what rumors might spread?

As she hesitated, Nolan suddenly took her hand.

He signaled her to leave quietly.

To prevent the situation from escalating, Isabella decided it was best to leave first.

Fortunately, Michael had attracted everyone's attention, and Nolan placed cash on the table and left with Isabella.

"Isabella, take my car. I'll drive you home first. Michael can handle this small matter."

Nolan stopped outside, and a white business car pulled up from the roadside, stopping in front of them.

The driver got out, politely nodded at Isabella, and then helped Nolan into the car, properly securing the wheelchair.

Nolan reached out to her, gently comforting her, "Isabella, come on, you're pregnant and can't be stressed. Someone will come to pick up your car later. Just take my car, please."

Isabella stood by the roadside, listening to Nolan's meticulous care, but her mind was on what had happened in the dessert shop.

Her feelings were incredibly complex.

She didn't want to worry Nolan, but she had to stay to deal with Michael's trouble.

Given the backgrounds and influence of the Wilson Family and the Brown Family, a mere rumor wouldn't have much impact, but she feared that if this matter spread, it would reach Daniel's ears.

Their marriage was already full of holes; how could it withstand another blow?

Daniel was in a period of recuperation and couldn't handle such stress.

For Daniel's sake, she had to quell this matter in advance.

In the end, she made a decision.

"Nolan, I'm fine. You go ahead. I'll handle this and then leave."

Nolan's expression changed slightly, but he maintained his usual gentleness, speaking with resignation, "Isabella, are you going back to help Michael?"

She still cared about Michael.

Isabella shook her head, "Nolan, I'm not going back to help him. I'm afraid if this scandal spreads online and my grandfather sees it, it won't be good."

Nolan sighed in relief, "But if you go back now, it will only make the situation more chaotic. You're pregnant, listen to me, come with me."

"Nolan, you go ahead, don't worry about me."

This time, Isabella didn't listen to Nolan. She pressed her lips together, having made up her mind.

She was going to go in and resolve the situation.

After speaking, she turned and walked quickly towards the dessert shop. Just as she was about to push the door open, her phone in her bag suddenly rang.

Seeing the name on the screen, Isabella frowned. It was her trusted assistant, Jesse.

He had been keeping an eye on things at the company for her.

If Jesse was calling, something must have happened.

Isabella stepped aside to a quiet spot and quickly answered, "Jesse, what's wrong? Is there a problem at the company?"

Since Emilio took over as vice president of the Wilson Group, she had left Jesse to assist him. Unless there was a major issue requiring her attention or signature, Jesse rarely contacted her.

This was also because Isabella was pregnant, and Atticus had secretly taken over company affairs to let her rest.

Jesse's voice was urgent, "Ms. Taylor, where are you?"

Isabella grew anxious, "Just tell me what's going on."

The more urgent Jesse sounded, the more uneasy Isabella felt.

"Ms. Taylor, a scandal about Mr. Brown just broke online. It's gaining a lot of attention, and we can't suppress it."

Isabella's heart sank.

Her worst fear had come true.

Without ending the call, Isabella opened the latest online news.

Sure enough, photos of Michael and Violet in the dessert shop were already online, and the two of them were trending.

Even the headlines were about them.

[Brown Group CEO Michael secretly appears in a dessert shop, with Violet, the third party, clinging to him.]

[Third party Violet's identity exposed, many speculate they have been having an affair, poor original wife Isabella is still in the dark.]

###chapter 234 The Influence of Public Opinion

Isabella saw the headline and pressed her temples helplessly.

She had anticipated that things would escalate, but she didn't expect it to happen so quickly. After all, it had only been a matter of minutes since the incident occurred.

She was still on the scene, not even thinking about how to control the situation.

The hot news online had already started to spread like wildfire.

The speed and reaction of these reporters were almost comparable to a sprint race.

It was so fast that it hardly gave anyone time to respond.

Although it seemed that the Brown Family was the one being impacted, she and Michael were still married, and at this rate, it was only a matter of time before the Wilson Family would be affected as well.

"Jesse, how is the company doing now?"

These reporters were always the quickest to react to such matters. As soon as the news broke, they would definitely seek confirmation from the company to grab the exclusive interview.

Jesse replied, "The PR department has already started looking for the media outlets that posted online, striving to suppress the false statements."

"Mr. Blair has also issued orders to reject all calls and inquiries regarding you and Mr. Brown, and not to accept any media interviews."

This topic was currently at the forefront, and one wrong word could easily bring negative impact to both the company and herself.

Only by first understanding the direction of public opinion and then responding accordingly could the impact be minimized.

Hearing what Jesse said, Isabella breathed a sigh of relief.

She knew that bringing Emilio back from abroad to help her was the right decision.

With him there, she could rest assured about the company.

"Follow Emilio's instructions at the company. Make sure to keep this matter from my grandfather. I will contact you immediately if there are any changes."

Jesse responded, "Yes."

Ending the call, Isabella quickly took a hat and mask from her bag to disguise herself as a passerby and followed the crowd into the store.

By this time, a large crowd had already gathered inside the store, making the scene so chaotic that even the waitstaff couldn't control it.

Everyone's attention was focused on Michael and Violet, and no one noticed Isabella standing among the crowd.

Michael's bodyguards immediately surrounded the two, while others dispersed the crowd and escorted them out through the back door.

But the reporters who had finally grabbed the headlines were not about to give up such a great opportunity.

They ignored the bodyguards' attempts to drive them away and desperately tried to get the first piece of material.

"Mr. Brown, there are rumors that your wife Isabella is pregnant. How can you do this to her?"

The bodyguards immediately rushed over and snatched the microphones from the reporters.

"Our Mr. Brown hasn't said a word. If you dare to spread rumors online, the lawyer's letter will be in your hands immediately!"

A black luxury car quickly arrived, and Michael and Violet got in the car and left the crowd.

The reporters left disappointed.

The crowd and cars gradually dispersed.

The heavy stone in Isabella's heart finally fell.

Indeed, Michael had seen all kinds of storms and waves. A small unexpected event was nothing to him; he wouldn't even take it to heart.

Her rushing back was just causing herself unnecessary trouble.

Isabella shook her head and was about to leave when a modified black luxury car suddenly stopped by the roadside.

The car honked at her.

Isabella stopped and saw Atticus waving at her from the car.

"Uncle Atticus?"

She was stunned for a moment, seeing that no one was looking her way, she quickly walked over, got in the car, and sat in the passenger seat before asking.

"Why are you here?"

Atticus sighed and looked at her, "Of course, I saw the news and was worried about you."

Then he angrily said, "Michael is getting more and more outrageous. I can't control him gambling with the entire Brown Family, but I can't let him mess with you. You are the young lady of the Wilson Family; you don't need to suffer this grievance."

Hearing Atticus protect her like this, Isabella felt a warmth in her heart.

"I'm not suffering any grievance. Didn't you see that even the reporters are on my side, standing up for me?"

She said this, but her eyes were red.

It felt so good to be cared for by family.

"Uncle Atticus, how is Grandpa? I'm very worried that he will hear about this."

Daniel couldn't let go of her the most. No matter how well she and Michael cooperated usually, once this matter was exposed, how could Daniel not be angry?

Atticus gently comforted her, "Dad doesn't know yet. The company suppressed the news immediately. You don't need to worry about the rest. Taking good care of yourself is the most important thing."

With Atticus backing her up, Isabella felt much more at ease and nodded silently.

Atticus took her back to Whispering Pines Estates.

Opening the door, Isabella saw Olivia sitting in the living room.

She turned to Atticus in surprise and quickly understood Olivia's purpose from his eyes.

It was Atticus's idea.

He was worried she would be affected by public opinion, so he brought Olivia over to accompany her.

However, Isabella still felt a bit guilty. She walked up to Olivia and said, "Olivia, aren't you with the crew? Will coming over now affect your shooting schedule?"

Olivia smiled indifferently, pulling her to sit on the sofa.

"Don't worry about me. My scenes with the crew are already finished. But you're pregnant, you should stay home and rest. You're always running around all the time, who wouldn't be worried?"

Olivia's seemingly reproachful tone was actually full of concern for Isabella.

The two had always had a good relationship, and now they had endless things to talk about. Isabella's mood shifted from low to a smile.

"Alright, alright, Uncle Atticus scolded me on the way, and now you're nagging me at home. You two are quite in sync."

Olivia didn't expect Isabella to compare her with Atticus suddenly. She instinctively looked at Atticus and found him looking at her too.

Her heart couldn't help but tremble.

She had made up her mind to forget him, but Atticus kept appearing in front of her from time to time.

Making it impossible for her to forget.

Her heart fluttered.

Olivia's face turned red, and she quickly looked away.

Isabella, who was intentionally trying to matchmake the two, saw this clearly.

Sure enough, she guessed right.

Olivia definitely had feelings for Atticus.

And Atticus's behavior and reaction didn't seem like he had no feelings for Olivia either.

The strange thing was, if they both had feelings for each other, why hadn't there been any progress for so long?

###chapter 235 Delivering Oneself to the Door

The Brown Group, President's Office.

Michael leaned back in his office chair, pinching the bridge of his nose, looking exhausted.

He had disguised himself to enter the dessert shop, originally intending to follow Isabella and see what she and Nolan were discussing in private. But Violet's appearance had escalated the situation into a "public opinion crisis."

The internet was now flooded with scandalous news about him knowing Isabella was pregnant yet still having a rendezvous with Violet.

The criticism was overwhelming.

Fortunately, Isabella was not affected and had left the scene early.

She was still carrying their baby, and if she were to be agitated, he couldn't even dare to imagine the severe consequences.

So, instead of resting at home to recover from his injuries, he had to return to the company to handle this matter.

This time, he used the power of the Brown Group to suppress the online buzz with a firm attitude.

However, after this incident, Isabella probably wouldn't forgive him anymore.

Their relationship had once again hit rock bottom.

Thinking about this made Michael extremely agitated.

His injuries also started to ache faintly. Just as he was about to light a cigarette to relieve some stress, the office door suddenly opened.

Violet, with her exquisite makeup, walked in.

Her eyes were filled with emotion, "Mr. Brown, I'm sorry, I caused you trouble. I won't shirk any responsibility that needs to be taken."

Michael squinted his eyes, almost forgetting that Violet had followed him back.

Ever since he discovered her true identity from Stella's words, Michael had been thinking about how to get her back. He didn't expect her to come to him on her own.

Well, it saved him some time.

"The responsibility is not yours. It's about the company's reputation. The Brown Group will handle it entirely."

Michael's expression softened slightly, and his tone lowered a bit, "Why haven't you gone home yet? Weren't you frightened?"

Since their relationship was exposed in the Brown Family's study two days ago, he had seen through Violet's actions clearly.

Earlier in the dessert shop, he had already taken her away from there. With the news about them spreading all over the internet, anyone would think of separating to avoid the limelight.

But Violet didn't care at all. Wherever he went, she followed.

Her intentions were now blatantly obvious.

Violet's eyes reddened, and she took two steps forward, looking pitiful, "Michael, I know you're still mad at me, but I really like you. I don't know how today's situation turned out like this."

"I really didn't mean to cause you trouble. If there's anything I can help with, I'm willing to come forward and explain to the public."

Violet's heartfelt confession made Michael even more certain of his thoughts.

People's emotions couldn't lie when they were nervous.

The person standing in front of him now was too much like Bianca.

But looking at her reminded him of Isabella.

In such an urgent situation earlier, would Isabella have cared about his predicament even a little?

Or would she have left without hesitation with Nolan?

Thinking about her possibly forming a new family with another man in the future, and their child calling someone else "dad," made it hard for him to breathe.

No, he would never allow his child to call another man "dad."

And he would never let her go.

While Michael was lost in thought, Violet gently draped a blanket over his shoulders.

"Michael, your injuries haven't healed yet. You need to keep warm to avoid catching a fever."

Violet's considerate care and humble attitude of seeking reconciliation.

No man could resist that.

Especially after being abandoned by Isabella.

Violet had precisely calculated this, which was why she followed Michael back to the company.

The commotion in the dessert shop was so big that even though the Brown Group suppressed the public opinion immediately, there were certainly still reporters outside trying to seize the opportunity.

As long as the news of her and Michael appearing at the company got out, she wouldn't need to say anything, and people would confirm her relationship with Michael.

As long as the identity of "Violet" remained, she wasn't worried that Michael would really drive her away.

She knew him too well.

As long as it didn't touch his bottom line, acting coquettish and weak, or even crying, would always earn his forgiveness.

Violet's mind was racing with schemes, while Michael, sitting in the chair, had a calm and emotionless expression.

He stared at Violet without any emotion in his voice.

"Ms. Cooper, do you really like me that much?"

Suddenly being asked such a straightforward question by Michael, Violet's heart skipped a beat, and her face turned red.

"Michael, can't you see my sincerity by now? I truly like you. This feeling has never been mixed with any impurities."

Violet didn't understand Michael's thoughts.

He should have already seen through her intentions and thoughts, so why was he asking such a question now?

Was he testing her again?

Violet became defensive.

Michael seemed to see through her wariness and said something that dispelled her doubts.

"We've only known each other for a few months, and we just met several times. But you give me a very different feeling. You're very much like someone from my past that I can't forget."

Hearing the last sentence, Violet's eyes lit up.

So Michael really hadn't forgotten her.

He said he couldn't forget her because he had feelings for her?

A huge surprise overwhelmed Violet. She could hardly believe that the person Michael truly liked was herself.

Suppressing her emotions, she trembled as she confessed to Michael once again.

"Michael, please give me another chance. I will prove to you that we are the most compatible pair. No one can love you more than I do."

Michael's eyes flashed with a complex expression, and he asked in disbelief, "Are you telling the truth?"

"Yes!"

Violet excitedly grabbed his hand, not waiting for him to finish speaking, and eagerly expressed her determination.

"From the moment I first saw you, I fell deeply in love with you. Besides you, I could never look at another man in this lifetime. I know you and Ms. Taylor have to maintain a non-divorce relationship for unavoidable reasons, but I don't care."

"As long as I can be with you, I don't care about anything. Let's give it a try. You clearly have feelings for me too, right?"

As she said this, Violet couldn't help but recall the scene when she first returned to the country, and Michael threw her a birthday party.

At that time, he would protect her in front of others, thoughtfully drape his coat over her shoulders, and even shield her from drinks she didn't want.

Even when Isabella came over, he stood by her side.

As a result, she completely indulged in his protection, and everything about the Taylor Family improved because of his presence.

How could she not be captivated by Michael's gentle affection?

###chapter 236 Successfully Getting Him

"Love?"

Michael curled his lips, finding it highly ironic to hear this word from Violet.

But on the surface, he masked it well, "Alright, since you're so sincere, then love me well in the time we have left."

After all, the time left for Violet, no, for Bianca, was running out.

"That's great, Michael, I'm finally with you."

Violet was so excited that she lost herself. She opened her arms and threw herself onto Michael.

This time, Michael didn't push her away.

Instead, he loosely wrapped an arm around her and gently patted her shoulder. The expression on his face was more calm than affectionate.

But Violet didn't care.

She knew that Michael was not someone who could easily express his feelings through his expressions. The fact that he said these words was enough to show his intentions.

She felt like the happiest person in the world right now. If she could, she would freeze this moment forever.

He had to find the flaw in Violet as quickly as possible and make her disappear from his sight completely, never to return to Evergreen City.

"Mr. Brown, I brought the light-flavored porridge you wanted."

Michael and Violet were hugging?

What had Violet, an intern, done to deserve Michael's personal attention and the best quality of life? It meant that from now on, Violet's status had changed.

Michael had fallen for her.

Not only did Michael admit to liking her, but he also asked Aaron to arrange the best accommodation for her.

Michael truly belonged to her now.

She bit her lip, her face blushing, showing a delicate and shy demeanor of someone in love.

Her status?

Violet's heart melted at Michael's domineering words.

She had no mind to think about any hidden meanings in his words.

The latter part was directed at Violet.

Violet bit her lip, knowing he was right, but still feeling aggrieved.

At his last words, Violet couldn't help but recall their intimate moments at the lakeside villa.

Her face blushed.

As soon as the door closed, Michael's expression changed.

He got up, took his keys, went to the underground parking lot, and left through another exit, driving to Elysian Heights Estate.

###chapter 237 She Still Loves Him

This set of wedding house was specially prepared by Aiden when he and Isabella got married.

Ever since she proposed to completely separate the child from him and move out, he never came back.

She was his.

The cold winter was approaching.

###chapter 238 Clingy Michael

Giving him the gift that was originally his, she would have no more regrets.

Once Daniel recovered, it would be time for their divorce.

Ending things amicably, without disputes, would be best for both of them.

###chapter 264 Sincerity

###chapter 316 Renee Gets Injured

The Adri Family despised traitors the most.

Despite being around the same age as Isabella, Renee had a mature demeanor that complemented Isabella's personality. No wonder they always had so much to talk about.

"Grandpa, Renee and I were thinking about watching a show to pass the time. What about you? Why aren't you watching your TV shows in the living room?" Isabella asked.

Lately, Daniel couldn't understand what Isabella and Renee were talking about, so he spent his days in the living room trying to catch up on the latest entertainment trends for young people.

Hearing this, Renee couldn't help but laugh. Daniel always watched TV with the volume turned up high, and sometimes she could hear the plot from her room. But Daniel would always seriously ask what the main characters were talking about. It was quite amusing.

"Oh, forget it. I can't understand you young folks. They drag out a romance for a hundred episodes before resolving a misunderstanding. It's too much trouble," Daniel waved his hand, getting more frustrated the more he watched, his blood pressure rising.

"Grandpa, you can't just give up like that. How about I teach you how to follow celebrities?" Isabella suggested.

Older people needed to engage with new things to avoid sitting around and overthinking.

Daniel pointed a finger at her, "Do you think I'm a teenager? Those kids are younger than you. Why would I be interested in them?"

Daniel, the renowned Gambling King, doing something so childish? It would be laughable!

"No way, Grandpa. Lots of older people follow celebrities now. I can teach you. You can read news online, watch variety shows, and at least recognize their faces," Isabella said, picking up her tablet to show Daniel how to use Facebook and keep up with the latest news and trends, including fashion.

Daniel, with his poor eyesight, put on glasses and followed Isabella's instructions. Just as he was getting the hang of it, a servant came to remind him to take his medicine.

Isabella handed him the tablet and helped him out, "Grandpa, take your time with this. If you have questions, ask me or Renee."

"Alright," Daniel said, a bit confused as he left.

Isabella watched him take his medicine without looking away from the tablet and couldn't help but laugh. Turning around, she saw Renee's helpless expression.

"Mr. Wilson is completely wrapped around your finger. Making an eighty-year-old man follow celebrities and watch variety shows? What are you thinking?" Renee asked.

Isabella shrugged, not seeing the problem. Daniel had worked hard all his life for his six children and the entire family. Now that he was older, he didn't need that pressure anymore. He should enjoy himself.

But she had a bit of a selfish motive. Sitting next to Renee, she said, "You don't know how strict Grandpa has been with me lately. He won't let me move much, eat certain things, or even have some cold fruit. I just want to distract him a bit so he doesn't focus on me so much. Otherwise, I won't be able to eat anything."

Renee shook her head, "Mr. Wilson is worried about you. You're pregnant, after all. You need to take care of yourself."

Isabella knew that, but she was trying to find a way for both of them to relax. Pregnancy wasn't a short-term thing, and with five more months to go, she needed a break from Daniel's constant watch.

"I know he's worried, so I want him to experience new things and see there's more to the world," Isabella said just as someone knocked on the door.

"Ms. Taylor, the security outside says there's a man here to see Ms. Faith. He seems very anxious."

A man? Isabella frowned. Only the Wilson family knew about Renee's situation and her stay with them. Who could be looking for her now?

"Did he say who he is?" Isabella asked.

"He said his name is Hill, and Ms. Faith would want to see him."

Aaron? He's back!

Isabella instinctively looked at Renee, who showed a moment of surprise before regaining her composure.

"Renee, do you want to see him?" Isabella asked. It was a matter of their relationship, and she didn't want to interfere.

Renee glanced out at the yard, lost in thought for a moment before shaking her head. "No, let him go. There's no point in seeing him. We have no future together."

Renee hadn't forgotten her identity or the day she was chased. Someone like her didn't deserve to have feelings.

Isabella knew Renee had her reasons and didn't push further. She got up and left with the servant.

The room fell silent. Renee looked at the darkening sky, thinking Aaron would surely leave after her refusal.

But after a nap, she woke to find Isabella and the servant standing by her bed.

"Isabella, what are you doing?" Renee asked, still groggy and surprised.

Isabella got straight to the point, "Aaron is still waiting outside."

The servant looked troubled, "While you were asleep, Ms. Taylor and I told Mr. Hill your decision, but he refused to leave. He said he must see you today or he'll stay at the door."

"Why does he think I'll see him? If he wants to stand there, let him. I'm not seeing him," Renee said stubbornly, angered by Aaron's persistence.

###chapter 324 Heartache

Isabella watched the scene unfold, feeling like she was looking at a reflection of her past self.

Back then, she had also decided to give up on Michael, swearing to herself that she would never look back.

But these could fool others, not herself.

When you cared about someone, it was not something you could just cut off with a single sentence.

However, she knew better than to get involved. Matters of the heart were complicated, and even if an outsider saw through it, they couldn't just spell it out.

They needed to figure it out on their own, step by step.

But, would it really snow today?

An hour later, the sky darkened, and a strong wind picked up, soon bringing heavy snow.

Isabella blinked in surprise. The weather forecast had been spot on.

She wondered if Aaron was still standing at the door.

Walking to the courtyard and looking towards the gate, Isabella saw the black car still parked there, with Aaron standing rigidly beside it.

The car was right there, but he showed no intention of getting inside to wait.

Isabella admired this about him.

To see Renee, he was showing his sincerity.

And over the past few years, Aaron had been working for Michael, and she hadn't heard of him having a girlfriend.

For him to go to such lengths for Renee, it seemed like he was genuinely in love.

She had a servant bring a tablet to check the surveillance at the gate. Aaron, dressed in a thin suit, was already turning blue from the cold.

His hands were clenched tightly, clearly suffering from the biting wind.

If this continued, he would surely get sick.

Just then, Daniel, having heard about the situation outside, came over with the help of a servant and saw Aaron on the tablet.

He immediately exclaimed, "Isabella, isn't that Michael's assistant Aaron? You should ask Renee to reconsider. No matter how much they argue, she can't leave Aaron out in the cold like this. If he really gets sick, it won't be a small matter."

Isabella thought the same. Who would have thought Aaron would actually wait outside for so long?

If Aaron got frostbite at the Wilson Family's place, she would be responsible, and she wouldn't be able to explain it to Michael.

But Aaron was here to see Renee, and if Renee didn't agree, she couldn't just let Aaron in secretly.

At that moment, Aaron suddenly dropped to his knees outside the gate.

He shouted towards the door, "Renee, I know you're in there. Please, let me see you."

Aaron used all his strength.

But the Wilson Family's house was equipped with the highest level of soundproofing technology by Atticus, so Renee inside couldn't hear him at all.

However, Isabella and Daniel heard him clearly in the courtyard.

Seeing Aaron's desperate plea on the tablet, Isabella couldn't help but feel soft-hearted.

Thinking about how Aaron had helped her many times while working for Michael, she decided to repay the favor.

Isabella came up with a plan to have a servant secretly open the gate, letting Aaron in and pretending not to know.

But before she could execute her plan, a calm and gentle voice came from the hall.

"Isabella, let him in. He won't give up otherwise."

Isabella was stunned and turned around to see Renee, now sitting in a wheelchair, being pushed out by a servant.

She had heard Aaron's shout.

"Renee, are you really willing to see him?"

Isabella felt a mix of guilt and relief. If she had spoken up, it would have been truly awkward to be caught by Renee.

Renee sighed, looking at Isabella with a guilty expression. "He's Michael's man. If something happens to him here, how would you explain it to Mr. Brown?"

She already felt like a burden to Isabella by staying at the Wilson Family's place and didn't want to add more responsibility.

Her words were innocent, but Daniel couldn't help but frown.

Renee and Aaron arguing was one thing, but why were Isabella and Michael being so formal with each other?

They were husband and wife!

No matter what, Michael wouldn't blame Isabella. Why would she need to explain? Aaron was just an assistant anyway.

It seemed a bit odd.

Isabella was startled and quickly gave Renee a look, hurriedly saying, "I don't need to explain anything to Michael. He should be grateful he's not here to coax me. Renee, if you want to see Aaron, I'll let him in right now."

With that, Isabella quickly instructed the servant to call Aaron in and helped Daniel to the hall.

She was afraid Aaron might say something wrong and arouse Daniel's suspicion.

Twenty minutes later, Aaron, having changed into the clothes the servant brought, followed the directions to Renee's room.

He took a deep breath, thinking about how to explain his sudden trip abroad and his recent disappearance.

Inside, he heard the voice he missed the most, "Come in."

Aaron's heart tightened. He gripped the handle and realized the door was ajar. With a gentle push, it opened.

In the elegantly decorated room, Renee sat in a wheelchair, wearing a white loungewear set with a gray blanket over her legs.

Seeing him enter, she slowly wheeled herself from the window.

Even in her worst state, she didn't want him to see her lying in bed, looking lifeless.

"Aaron, you came after all."

Renee's voice was calm, but the confidence and brightness in her eyes were gone.

Aaron felt a sharp pain in his chest, making it hard to breathe.

In just ten days, she had lost so much weight.

Michael had sent him her medical report: head injury, broken right leg, multiple abrasions.

But those were just words on a paper. Seeing her in person, he couldn't forgive himself.

Why did he leave her at that time?

Why did he go abroad when she needed him the most, leaving her alone?

"Renee, I..." Aaron choked up, unable to speak.

He had betrayed her trust.

Abroad, to avoid exposure, he used a fake identity Michael arranged and had a new phone.

When he returned and got his phone back, he saw three missed calls from her, and it felt like a lightning strike.

Each call was a cry for help, but he hadn't responded.

He took a deep breath, walked to Renee, and knelt down, his eyes red as he held her hand.

"Renee, I'm sorry I'm late!"

Renee instinctively turned her face away. She didn't want him to see her vulnerability or drag him into her troubles again.

"It's not your fault. No one could have predicted this... But Aaron, let's break up."

###chapter 325 Isabella in Trouble

From the moment the Adri Family sent assassins after her, Renee knew she had to make a decision.

She could face death, but she couldn't drag innocent people into this chaos.

She couldn't handle the burden of this relationship, and she couldn't let Aaron risk his life for her.

"No way!"

Aaron gripped her hand tightly, his eyes filled with determination as he looked at Renee. "I'm not letting you go like this. I love you. It's not some fleeting feeling. I want you by my side for the rest of my life, just you."

"Renee, I know you're mad at me. I can't even forgive myself for leaving you. When I found out you were hurt, you have no idea how terrified I was."

"Now that I'm back, even if you hit me or scream at me, I'm not letting you go."

Aaron's heartfelt words almost made Renee falter.

"Aaron, it's too late. When I was in danger and called you, you weren't there. If Isabella hadn't saved me, I would've died on the street."

Renee closed her eyes. "I met you today to tell you that it's impossible between us. We're from different worlds. Instead of suffering later, it's better to part ways now. This way, it's better for both of us. I've said everything I needed to. You should go."

Renee unceremoniously asked Aaron to leave.

"I don't need you to make it up to me. I don't want you by my side. Just leave!"

Renee bit her lip, turned her body away, and pointed towards the door.

She had made up her mind. No matter how much Aaron begged, she wouldn't soften.

Love was something to yearn for, but right now, even living was a luxury for her. What right did she have to talk about love?

Aaron collapsed straight to the ground.

"Aaron! What's wrong with you? Don't scare me."

Renee instinctively wanted to help him up, but her legs couldn't support her. In her haste, she fell out of her wheelchair.

When she pushed open the door, she saw Aaron unconscious on the floor and Renee beside him.

Both of them lying on the ground looked strange.

"What happened? How did you both end up on the floor?"

Isabella was puzzled.

She knew Renee would reject Aaron, but she didn't expect him to be so heartbroken that he'd pretend to be dead.

"Isabella, quick, call 911. Aaron suddenly fainted."

Renee couldn't care about anything else. She was only worried about Aaron's health.

"What?"

Isabella finally realized what was happening. Aaron had been standing outside for hours. Could he have caught a fever?

She had the servants help Renee back to bed. Isabella touched Aaron's forehead and immediately winced.

He was burning up.

How long had he been holding on, not saying anything despite such a high fever?

"What's wrong? Does he have a fever?" Renee asked anxiously.

"Yeah, and it's very serious. He needs to go to the hospital."

Isabella frowned.

The family doctor could treat him, but Aaron's condition seemed like a sudden high fever. It was safer to go to the hospital.

Renee tried to get out of bed, but Isabella stopped her. "Don't be ridiculous. Your legs can't walk yet. If those people find out about you, it'll be like handing yourself over."

Isabella glanced at Aaron and gritted her teeth. "I'll go!"

"No!" Renee's face changed. "Isabella, you're one of their targets. Bianca failed last time. She must be waiting for another chance. And you're pregnant. You can't go!"

Renee tried to grab her, but Isabella patted her hand. "Enough. Now's not the time to waste. He's burning up!"

If they kept arguing, Aaron might really become brain-damaged from the fever.

That finally shut Renee up.

"Alright, I'll take care of him. I'll have him taken to the hospital now. If Grandpa asks, just make up an excuse."

Isabella called the bodyguards to take Aaron to the car.

She followed in another car with trusted bodyguards.

Revving their engines, they surrounded the cars. Within minutes, the motorcycles disappeared.

And so did Isabella.

The bodyguards realized something was wrong, but it was too late.

They immediately called Atticus to report.

Their main duty was to protect Isabella. If she disappeared, they couldn't bear the consequences.

Isabella was the Wilson Family's cherished daughter, the wife of Michael, the CEO of the Brown Group.

If something happened to her, they couldn't afford the responsibility.

###chapter 326 The Lead is Gone

The Wilson Group

Atticus was in the conference room, listening to the annual report, when his phone buzzed. It was his bodyguard. He stood up immediately.

"What? Isabella's missing?"

Atticus's face went pale, and Emilio, the company's vice president sitting next to him, noticed. He watched as Atticus quickly left the room.

He wouldn't let those who hurt Isabella get away.

Her grandfather had passed away long ago.

###chapter 327 Revenge on Two People

###chapter 328 They Both Should Die

Bianca walked up to the door and kicked open the rusty iron gate.

"Bianca, I've repaid my debt for saving me. Now, tell me where Isabella is, or I'll send you to Auroria again. You know how chaotic it is there, don't you?"

###chapter 334 She Hates

Michael's voice was as cold as ice, revealing his true nature-arrogant and ruthless.

To him, everyone except the one he loved was just like merchandise.

Bianca was utterly shaken.

From the moment Michael mentioned Auroria, her body began to tremble uncontrollably.

He was the one who sent her to that hellhole. How could Michael not know what it was like there?

It was no place for a human being.

Calling it hell on earth wouldn't be an exaggeration.

And as a woman, the only way she could survive there was by using her beauty and body to buy temporary safety and stability. What other choice did she have?

All of this was orchestrated by Michael.

Though it was only a month or two, it felt like a lifetime to her.

Michael would never know what she had to do to survive.

She had endured the filthiest things. If she hadn't met that man by chance, she might have been tortured to death by now.

Those dark memories flooded her mind, and Bianca was instantly consumed by hatred.

"Michael, do you really think I'm still afraid of you? You can send me to Auroria all you want, I don't care. But you'll never find Isabella."

"Do you really think I'd let you take advantage of me and then let that bitch Isabella go, so you can have your happy little family reunion?"

"You're dreaming. I'm telling you, I never planned to let Isabella leave here alive. She and her bastard child must die. Neither of them will survive."

Bianca's eyes were bloodshot as she screamed.

Ever since Isabella married Michael, everything she had was taken away. Now her family was destroyed, her parents were dead.

What did she have left?

Why did fate treat her this way? What did she do wrong?

She was filled with hatred.

She wanted everyone she hated to die.

Especially Isabella.

Her parents were dead because of Isabella. Why did Isabella get to live happily? It wasn't fair!

Even Michael, who had hated Isabella for years, had fallen in love with that bitch.

Everyone who truly cared about her was gone.

If she couldn't have it, neither could Isabella.

"You want to know where Isabella is? I'll tell you. Before you came, I had someone ready to take her to a cliff and push her off. She'll be dead by now."

"Even her bastard child won't survive."

"Hahaha, because they both deserve to die!"

"Shut up!"

Michael grabbed Bianca from the ground, glaring at her fiercely. "Isabella won't die. She won't! Tell me where she is!"

If Isabella wasn't still in her hands, he would have torn her apart.

But now that Isabella was missing, he had to get some useful information from Bianca.

Isabella couldn't be harmed.

He was waiting for his child to be born, waiting for her to hold the baby at home, waiting for the child to call him "Daddy."

As long as he got a clue from Bianca, everything would still be in time.

But Bianca was determined to keep her mouth shut.

She looked indifferent. "I told you, she's already been taken to the cliff by my people. If you want to find her, go search every cliff. I don't know exactly where."

But after saying this, Bianca felt immense regret.

If she hadn't been so focused on getting with Michael, she would have arranged for someone to kill Isabella.

Now that Isabella had escaped, Bianca was filled with regret.

Seeing Bianca deliberately stalling, Michael suddenly realized something and stood up abruptly.

He threw a cold remark at her, "Bianca, do you think I only brought a few people? If you won't talk, someone else will."

He could grab anyone outside and get some information.

Instead of wasting time here with this lunatic, it was better to quickly send people to track Isabella's whereabouts while there was still time.

"Michael, don't go. I'll tell you where she is."

Seeing Michael about to leave her, Bianca panicked.

She couldn't let him find Isabella.

But Michael didn't believe a word she said anymore and strode out of the warehouse.

Outside, another team had already subdued the people outside the warehouse, waiting for Michael.

Before the bodyguard could say anything, Michael asked, "Did any vehicles leave here recently?"

The bodyguard was stunned and quickly replied, "A motorcycle."

A motorcycle?

Michael frowned. If Bianca wanted to move someone, she would use a van or something. A motorcycle was too conspicuous, definitely not Isabella.

"You, go in and interrogate Bianca about Isabella's whereabouts. Report any news immediately."

"The rest of you, check all the exits. Detain any suspicious vehicles."

Michael's tone was serious. He couldn't afford to stay here. He took the car keys from the bodyguard and quickly drove away.

Where could Isabella be?

He didn't believe Bianca would let her people just push her off any random cliff. She hated Isabella so much, she would choose a place that would leave a lasting impression.

A place he was also familiar with.

Where could it be?

Moon Bay!

The name suddenly flashed in Michael's mind.

That was where Bianca had once saved his life, and where she had almost been swept away by the water.

From that day on, he remembered her kindness.

And from then on, Bianca clung to him.

Thinking of this, Michael stepped on the gas and sped towards Moon Bay.

Isabella, please be safe.

On the wide road, a black motorcycle sped by like a flash of lightning.

The cold wind howled in her ears, and Isabella instinctively tightened her grip around the man's waist, her face pressed against his back.

It wasn't that she wanted to take advantage of him, but the cold winter weather left her no choice.

Besides, she had a baby to think about.

If anything happened, she would regret it forever.

Suddenly, the motorcycle stopped by the roadside, in front of a sports car.

The man took off his helmet and turned to her, "Isabella, get off."

His voice sounded so familiar.

Isabella's eyes widened in disbelief. "You are..."

"Shh!"

The man made a gesture, signaling behind her. "Hurry up, don't you fear they'll catch up?"

Remembering the hours she had just spent in the dark warehouse, Isabella's face changed. She nodded and carefully got off the motorcycle.

The man casually left the motorcycle by the roadside, opened the car door, and gestured to the passenger seat.

"Let's go. I'll take you home."

###chapter 335 Saved His Life

The guy wore a black leather jacket, giving off a chill, carefree vibe.

Isabella thought of someone.

A friend she always talked to online, Shadow.

He was the one who braved this dangerous place to save her. Whether he was Shadow or not, she decided to trust him right now.

The cold wind howled outside as Isabella got into the car. The guy followed, taking the driver's seat and shutting the door.

The heater was cranked up, warming Isabella. She couldn't help but glance at the guy next to her.

From her angle, his profile was strikingly handsome, with a rebellious edge.

He had a magnetic personality, but there was something oddly familiar about him.

Had she seen him somewhere before?

"Are you really Shadow? Why do I feel like I've met you before?"

Isabella's eyes lingered on his face, her mind racing to remember.

No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't place him.

Hearing her question, the guy chuckled softly, started the car with a push of a button, and glanced at her. His clear voice reached Isabella's ears.

"We've met before. You just forgot."

The next second, the car sped down the road.

Isabella frowned, then shook her head after a moment. "Sorry, I can't remember."

She genuinely had no recollection.

Especially since Shadow had only ever contacted her online.

Even their first meeting was due to an unexpected mission, where neither revealed their identities.

The guy smiled nonchalantly. "If you can't remember, don't stress about it. It's not a particularly pleasant memory."

After driving for a while, the guy asked, "Where to now?"

Isabella's mind was in turmoil; she needed some time alone.

The intimate scenes and conversations between Michael and Bianca kept replaying in her mind.

Isabella knew why Michael came to rescue her.

He came not for her, but for the child she was carrying, to give Aiden a reasonable explanation.

But the tenderness in Michael's voice when he spoke to Bianca, and their closeness, was voluntary.

Thinking of Michael's gentle tone with Bianca, Isabella's eyes reddened.

They were approaching the coast.

Feeling suffocated, Isabella told the guy a location, "Please take me to Moon Bay."

Due to its unique geography, the beach looked like a crescent moon from above, hence the name Moon Bay.

And there lay a secret of hers.

It was where her connection with Michael truly began.

After her grandfather took her away, she once came to Evergreen City alone, missing her mother. Before returning, she wanted to see the sea.

There, she encountered a drowning Michael.

She was young then, and seeing a boy about her age struggling in the shallow water, she initially thought his parents were nearby.

But as time passed and the boy grew weaker, battered by the waves, Isabella realized he couldn't swim.

With the tide rising and hardly anyone around, Isabella quickly waded into the water to save him.

But she overestimated her strength and underestimated the boy's weight.

Both young and inexperienced swimmers, Isabella barely managed to grab his shirt before swallowing several mouthfuls of water.

But saving him was all that mattered, and she couldn't think of anything else.

The waves grew stronger, and she had to drag him out before the tide came in.

Several times, they were nearly swept out to sea.

Despite her exhaustion, Isabella refused to give up, dragging him to shore.

Lying on the beach, Isabella felt dizzy.

She was utterly spent.

As the sky darkened, she tried to look at the boy she saved but only saw a blurry profile.

Even though she couldn't see his face clearly, his handsome silhouette was etched in her memory.

She thought then, how wonderful it would be to marry such a good-looking man when she grew up.

Isabella couldn't help but smile, lying weakly beside him.

Exhausted, she soon passed out.

Before losing consciousness, she tightly gripped a small bear pendant from the boy.

When she woke up, she was back at the Wilson Family, in her princess-themed room.

Her grandfather was beside her, worried sick. "Isabella, if you miss your mom, tell Grandpa. I'll take you there. Don't run off alone again, okay?"

"Okay, Grandpa, I understand."

Isabella nodded obediently, but the boy remained in her memory.

Shadow parked near Moon Bay, draped his jacket over Isabella, and walked with her towards the beach.

The cold weather left the beach deserted.

Isabella tightened the jacket around her, walking step by step to the spot where she saved Michael.

She stopped when the water touched her feet.

Gazing deeply at the sea, she took a deep breath.

Seeing her distress, Shadow joked to lighten the mood.

"Isabella, you're not thinking of jumping into the sea, are you? It's winter, it's freezing. If you love the beach that much, wait until summer."

Isabella gave him a helpless look. "Don't worry, I'm just here to clear my head. I'm not that impulsive."

"Good. The Isabella I know isn't afraid of anything. She wouldn't break down over something small."

"Besides, you're going to be a mom. You need to be strong."

Isabella smiled, her hand resting on her rounded belly, thinking how resilient her child was, not even stirring after all that had happened.

He was right anyway. She wasn't alone. She had her unborn child, her grandfather, and her uncles waiting for her at home.

How could she let a bad man drive her to impulsive thoughts?

She came here to say goodbye to the past and end where it all began.

After saving Michael at the beach, she couldn't forget him.

Unexpectedly, she saw him again at a party, dressed like a prince in a suit.

###chapter 336 I Will Be There Immediately

Nolan was with him.

Even though the two brothers looked a lot alike, she could instantly tell who she had saved from the sea that day.

It was also that day she remembered they had met briefly before, just before her grandfather took her away.

After getting home that day, she had a thought.

She wanted to marry Michael.

She did everything she could to convince her grandfather and uncles, declaring Michael as her one and only.

She would marry no one but him.

Everything that happened afterward was her wishful thinking. She believed Michael would realize she had saved his life and see her differently.

But in the end, she loved the wrong person and ended up in this situation.

Now, she just wanted to forget everything. Forget all the memories with him.

Even the life-saving moment at Moon Bay, she wanted to erase it all.

Inside the box was the little bear charm she had pulled from Michael that day.

She had discovered it in her hand when she got home and had kept it with her all these years.

But he never did.

So, she chose to make peace with herself and let go of the past.

"Goodbye, Michael."

From today, she decided to let go.

Shadow, who had been by her side the whole time, nodded and led her to the car. They drove away from the place.

Michael looked around but saw no sign of Isabella.

Just as he thought he might have come to the wrong place, a familiar object caught his eye.

A silver charm was washed up on the beach by the waves.

Could it be?

Michael's eyes tightened as he quickly ran over, not caring that the water soaked his shoes.

When he held the charm tightly in his hand, he confirmed it was the little bear charm he had lost.

He remembered it clearly.

His father had bought it for him during a trip to Europe, and he had loved it, carrying it with him every day.

Until the day he almost drowned at the beach. Someone saved him, but the charm was lost.

After his father's unfortunate accident, he wanted to find the charm even more, as a memory of his father.

He had always thought Bianca had it, as she was the first person he saw when he woke up on the beach.

He had asked Bianca for it several times.

But Bianca always had excuses, eventually saying it was lost over time.

Now, the charm reappeared at Moon Bay, which made no sense.

Unless...

Michael's eyes flashed. Unless someone had just thrown it into the sea, and the waves brought it back.

And judging by its well-preserved condition, it must have been thrown in recently.

He hadn't untied Bianca before coming here, so it couldn't have been her.

Thinking back, every time he mentioned the incident at Moon Bay, Bianca would quickly change the subject.

Now he realized he had mistaken the person all along.

Bianca had just happened to be there.

Who else could have come here?

Michael's heart started pounding.

Could it be her?

If it was Isabella, why hadn't she mentioned it all these years?

If it wasn't her, who else could it be?

Just then, his phone rang.

Seeing the number, Michael quickly answered, hearing the urgent voice on the other end.

"Mr. Brown, she escaped while we weren't looking."

"Who?"

Michael had a bad feeling. If it wasn't someone important, the bodyguard wouldn't be so nervous.

Sure enough, the next second, he heard a familiar name.

"It was that woman, Bianca."

Michael's face darkened. "Find her, no matter what it takes!"

Bianca had admitted the Adri Family was behind everything. Letting her go was like leaving a ticking time bomb.

He had to bring her back.

He wouldn't allow anyone to harm Isabella and their child.

Meanwhile, Shadow took Isabella to a cozy roadside diner and ordered her some hot soup and a main course.

As soon as they sat down, Isabella borrowed his phone to call Atticus and let him know she was safe.

Hearing Isabella's voice, Atticus finally relaxed. "Isabella, as long as you and the baby are okay, I'm relieved."

"Okay, Uncle Atticus, I'll be back soon. Please don't tell Grandpa about the kidnapping."

Isabella was about to hang up when Atticus sighed softly.

Isabella paused, thinking she had misheard, but then Atticus spoke in a hoarse voice.

"Isabella, your grandfather already knows. He's in the hospital now."

Isabella felt her world collapse.

Atticus hadn't wanted to tell him.

But somehow, the Wilson Family found out and informed Daniel about Isabella's kidnapping.

Daniel, who cherished Isabella like a treasure, fainted upon hearing the news.

He had left all the bodyguards to continue searching for Isabella and rushed to the hospital, where Daniel was now in surgery.

Fortunately, Isabella returned safely. Otherwise, Atticus wouldn't know what to do.

"I'll be there right away."

Isabella hung up the phone.

At the hospital, Atticus stared at the surgery light that had been on for half an hour, his eyes red despite his usual stoic demeanor.

Holden walked over with various test results, his heart in knots.

###chapter 337 Self-Blame

"Wait, are you serious? Isabella's safe?"

Before he could ask more, Renee, who had come with him, also heard the news. Her voice was thick with emotion.

No one could guarantee his post-surgery condition. Moreover, Daniel was already in recovery when he suddenly fell ill, which was a disaster in itself.

The doctor's words plunged everyone's spirits into the depths. Isabella's eyes immediately reddened, and tears began to fall uncontrollably. No, Grandpa wouldn't leave her like this. She had caused this to her grandpa.

Isabella couldn't accept it. She grabbed Atticus's sleeve, as if stopping him would somehow bring her grandpa back.

Even though she knew Atticus was trying to comfort her, Isabella couldn't argue. Only endless regret weighed on her heart.

"Isabella."

"Grandpa!"

Isabella rushed to his side, carefully holding his hand. "I'm back. My friend saved me. I'm fine, and the baby is healthy."

She still held onto the greatest hope in her heart. If her grandpa knew she was safe and the baby was fine, maybe he would look forward to the baby's arrival and find the will to survive.

Hearing this, a faint light flickered in Daniel's eyes. As Sean had said, his body was extremely weak, but he still wanted to remove the breathing mask. Seeing his intention, Isabella helped him take it off.

Without the breathing machine, Daniel's breathing became labored. But even so, he insisted on giving Isabella his final instructions.

"But I can't bear to let you be alone, Isabella."

Isabella bit her lip, shaking her head vigorously. She didn't want this. Without Grandpa, she didn't know how to go on.

Saying this, Daniel took a breath and looked at his five sons around him, his eyes filled with relief.

"I'm not worried about you. I know you all have your own ideas, careers, and abilities. But Isabella is different. When I'm gone, you need to help her more."

Daniel's words, like a final will, made his sons' hearts ache.

###chapter 338 She Admitted Defeat

A legendary figure had passed away.

###chapter 339  Not Welcome

"Grandpa Daniel's dead?"

The only way to make Isabella truly believe him now was to expose Bianca and the Adri Family behind her, revealing the truth to Isabella.

Only then could he have a chance to win her back.

No matter what, he wouldn't divorce her.

Just as he left the hospital, Michael received a call from Aaron.

"Mr. Brown, I'm okay now. Have you found Mrs. Brown?"

Aaron's voice was still hoarse, but there was a cautious tone. He had learned from the guards that Isabella had been kidnapped while bringing him to the hospital. For the past three days, he had been on edge, fearing something had happened to Isabella, which would make him feel guilty for life.

"Yeah, she's safe now," Michael replied, his voice calm, though his eyes involuntarily glanced upstairs.

"Really? That's great. Thank God. Mrs. Brown is such a good person; nothing bad should happen to her."

Hearing the good news, Aaron almost jumped with excitement. The heavy weight on his heart finally lifted.

"Mr. Brown, I'm planning to take tonight's flight back to Auroria."

With things settled here, he was ready to return to work. After all, he had left in a hurry, and there must be a pile of work waiting for him.

"Tonight?" Michael frowned. "Have you and Renee made up?"

Michael had brought Aaron back, fearing he would lose his loved one, but Aaron had spent the past few days in the hospital. When did he have time to make up with his girlfriend?

"Mr. Brown, Renee and I..." Aaron sighed, all his helplessness turning into one sentence, "She won't see me. Instead of staying here, I might as well focus on work."

But he wouldn't give up. If she had found new happiness, he could step back and sincerely wish her well. But if she was just afraid of causing him trouble and danger, he would prove to her that he wasn't afraid of death and could take her away from that hell.

Matters of the heart were the hardest to understand and the most haunting. Michael couldn't even handle his own feelings, let alone advise others. Since Aaron had made his decision, there was no need to ask more.

"I understand. Contact me if you need anything over there. Stay safe."

That was all he could do. He had once thought like Aaron, using work to numb himself, but in the end, the problem remained unsolved. He hadn't won back Isabella's heart. Instead, their relationship had worsened. He didn't want Aaron to face the same disappointment. If some time apart could help Aaron and Renee, then let Aaron go.

Aaron agreed and ended the call. Michael got into his car and, before starting it, called his subordinate.

"Any news on Bianca?"

"Not yet."

Michael frowned, feeling something was off. How could Bianca disappear under everyone's noses? All traces of her couldn't just vanish unless someone was helping her!

Michael's eyes darkened. "Stop following the usual methods. Ignore any information others release. Investigate the people around her and see who's helping her."

"Yes, Mr. Brown."

The guard quickly agreed, fearing a reprimand if he delayed. But Michael hung up and drove away from the hospital, heading back to the Brown Group. He needed to find out who was backing Bianca and, more importantly, not let the Adri Family take advantage of the situation.

###chapter 340 No Right to Refute

In a luxurious mansion, Bianca was on a video call with someone on her phone.

"Baby, I wanna be back with you ASAP, but my mission's almost done. Just hang in there a little longer, and I promise I'll come straight to you when it's over, okay?"

Bianca's voice was sultry and captivating. A bodyguard who had come to report something overheard the conversation and quickly lowered his head in fear.

Seeing this, Bianca shielded the phone screen with her body and casually asked, "What's up?"

The bodyguard immediately replied, "Ms. Taylor, we've lost the people tracking us."

Bianca snorted arrogantly and waved her hand dismissively. "I know. You can go now."

Once the room was quiet again, Bianca resumed her alluring demeanor. "Baby, why aren't you saying anything?"

"I need a specific time for your return."

The man's voice on the video was deep and emotionless, his face hidden in shadows.

Bianca pretended to think, trying to buy more time. "It'll take at least two months, right?"

The man was silent for a moment.

Even though they were half a world apart, Bianca still felt intimidated by his presence.

Without thinking, she quickly shortened the time. "How about one month? I'll definitely be back by then to be with you. You know I hate being away from you."

Her coquettish tone and pitiful expression would soften any man's heart.

Sure enough, the man's expression improved, but his tone remained firm. "Ten days."

Bianca bit her lip and pouted at the man on the screen. "That's too short. I really want to help you with some things. We haven't achieved the results you want yet."

"And I haven't avenged those who wronged me. I'm not satisfied."

How could she deal with Isabella in just ten days?

No, she had to negotiate for more time.

But the man had no intention of letting her argue.

"You've wasted enough time. Your mission has been reassigned."

"But I haven't..."

Before Bianca could finish, the man cut her off coldly. "Bianca, don't forget your place. Angering me won't end well for you."

Bianca trembled and didn't dare to say another word.

"I'll do as you say. I'll handle everything here in ten days and then fly back to you immediately."

"That's my good girl."

The man's approval made Bianca's eyes sparkle, and she returned to her seductive demeanor.

"You have no idea how much I've missed you these days. I wonder if you've missed me too."

A beautiful woman's flirtation was a powerful weapon.

It was Bianca's willingness to lower herself and please him that allowed her to thrive.

Her stunning looks and flexible body had initially caught the man's eye.

But it was her cunning and manipulation that helped her survive and rise to her current position.

Seeing the man's softened expression, Bianca finally felt relieved.

After soothing him with all her might, Bianca "reluctantly" ended the call.

Staring at the black screen, Bianca felt a strange sensation.

She could easily say such things to any man, even engage in more intimate acts.

But with Michael, she couldn't bring herself to do any of it.

In the months she'd been close to him, they'd only held hands.

But that didn't matter anymore.

From the moment Michael tied her to the bed and left, she saw him through.

He never loved her.

Even his previous actions were just repaying her for "saving" his life.

She had foolishly mistaken it for affection.

She had loved him wholeheartedly for years.

Now, he treated her like an outsider, with no remorse for sending her away.

What was there to miss about a man like Michael?

With only ten days left in the country, she had to avenge herself and her parents.

Otherwise, she might never return.

So, before Bianca left, Isabella and her unborn child had to die.

Thinking of this, Bianca called out, "Someone!"

A bodyguard entered promptly. "Ms. Taylor, what are your orders?"

Bianca lit a cigarette and instructed, "Find out Isabella's whereabouts. See where she's been recently."

The bodyguard nodded and left.

In just a few minutes, there was another knock on the door.

Bianca, surprised, said, "Come in."

The bodyguard brought both good and bad news.

"Ms. Taylor, our people report that the hospital confirmed Daniel's death due to illness, and the Wilson family has now activated their highest security measures. All information about Isabella is sealed."

Isabella was being protected, and given the Wilson family's current situation, it would be nearly impossible to track her.

Just as the bodyguard feared being scolded, Bianca burst into laughter.

"Daniel is dead?"

Isabella always talked about Daniel. Now that he was dead, she must be in immense pain, unable to eat or sleep.

If something happened to her unborn child now, would Isabella be so devastated that she'd consider suicide?

Just imagining the scene made Bianca feel ecstatic.

Perfect.

Bianca had lost her parents, and now Isabella was losing her loved ones one by one. It was the perfect retribution.

Bianca took a deep drag of her cigarette, her eyes gleaming with malice.

To get back at Isabella, she'd start with her child.

Whispering Pines Estates.

After lying in bed for a day and a night, Isabella finally woke up in the morning.

Looking at the familiar surroundings, her eyes were filled with confusion.

Cinda, who had been by her side, quickly approached. "How are you feeling now? Any better?"

"Cinda, I..."

Isabella's voice was hoarse, and speaking even a few words caused her throat to ache.

Cinda comforted her, "Don't rush. Take your time. Do you want some water?"

Isabella nodded slightly.

Cinda poured a glass of water and helped Isabella sit up, bringing the glass to her lips.

After sipping half the glass, Isabella's throat felt better.

She finally spoke again, "Cinda, how did I get back? My grandfather..."

###chapter 341 The Last Journey

As soon as Daniel's name came up, Isabella couldn't hold back her tears, and her eyes turned red.

Cinda, feeling for her, stepped forward and hugged her gently. "When Mr. Daniel Wilson passed, you and your uncles were all there. He went peacefully, which means he was blessed."

Hearing this, Isabella placed her hands on her belly.

Yes, she still had the baby.

"Cinda, don't worry. I won't let anything happen to the baby."

Before Daniel passed, he had told her to live for herself. Maybe Daniel always thought she kept the baby because of Michael.

Daniel probably didn't want the baby to become a burden to her, which is why he said those things.

But this baby was the only connection she had to Michael over the years. How could she possibly give it up?

Cinda's voice grew softer as she spoke.

As a woman, she understood Isabella's deep feelings for Daniel. If Isabella missed today's funeral, she would regret it. It was better to let her say goodbye to Daniel in person so she could find some closure.

Isabella's face changed. She threw off the covers and tried to get out of bed. "Cinda, go get me some clothes. I need to go now."

Cinda, worried about her, followed with some essentials.

That gemstone pendant, she had heard from the Brown Family's servants, wasn't something Michael had bought but something passed down from his grandmother.

It was valuable, but she just wanted to return everything related to him. Eventually, she hoped to forget him entirely.

The Wilson Family estate.

Daniel had been a renowned Gambling King, and now that he had passed, the estate was filled with people coming to pay their respects.

Seeing Daniel's peaceful and serene face in the portrait, she couldn't help but cry again.

Before she came, Cinda had repeatedly told her not to cry at Daniel's funeral, saying that his spirit would be pained to see her like this.

She missed Daniel so much.

Why couldn't everything in front of her be just a dream?

She just wanted Daniel to be okay. Was that too much to ask?

Atticus, who was receiving guests, saw Isabella crying in the hall and went to comfort her.

"You've already fainted once. Do you want to scare me?"

It was his idea to keep Isabella from coming.

Pregnant women shouldn't have too many emotional fluctuations. He was worried she would get too upset at the funeral and faint again, which would be bad for both her and the baby.

But he had underestimated Isabella's love for Daniel.

Isabella steadied herself and looked up at Atticus with tear-filled eyes.

Atticus wanted to say something but swallowed his words, finally sighing in resignation.

Isabella wiped her tears.

At that moment, a servant came to report that an important guest had arrived.

It was Michael's grandfather, Aiden.

Aiden and Daniel had been friends for many years. Daniel's sudden death was hard for Aiden to accept.

Isabella wanted to go and support him, but with Atticus there, she didn't want to overstep her bounds.

Aiden, trembling, moved closer to the portrait. Atticus quickly went over to take the flowers.

"Mr. Brown, we're grateful you came to pay your respects. Let me take the flowers."

Atticus could see that Aiden was genuinely saddened by Daniel's sudden passing. In just a few minutes, Aiden's eyes had already welled up.

As a junior, he couldn't let Aiden be more heartbroken.

But Aiden gently waved his hand, looking at Daniel's portrait with a deep sigh.

"Because your father and I were friends for so many years, I must personally give him these flowers. It's the least I can do."

Aiden felt a deep sense of guilt towards Daniel.

At this moment, he just wanted to tell Daniel, "Old friend, I'm sorry. I couldn't keep my promise to you."

###chapter 342  Is She Hidden by You?

When Daniel agreed to marry his granddaughter into the Brown family, Aiden had been so enthusiastic. Now, Daniel's decision was causing him immense pain.

What had happened to him?

He had Bianca now. How he was doing had nothing to do with her anymore.

Isabella's response was calm, and her gaze held no emotion.

###chapter 343 The Hypocritical Man

###chapter 344 Your Thing Dropped

"Isabella, this is Jessa, the actress I invited."

"Atticus, I was talking to someone at the door and lost track of time. It's my fault."

After all, today was about honoring their father, and many old acquaintances from the east were present.

As a son of the Wilson family, it was only natural for Orion to exchange a few words with familiar faces.

"Alright, go check on Isabella. And you-"

Atticus suddenly frowned, noticing Orion's unusual appearance. Normally, Orion had an artistic flair, but today he was different.

He wore a formal black suit, complete with a tie, and had even cut his usually long hair short.

That was his favorite hairstyle. Even when Daniel was alive and constantly nagged him about it, Orion would always brush it off with a laugh or play the sympathy card to make Daniel relent.

After all, among the five brothers, he was the only one born prematurely and the one who resembled their mother the most.

Daniel could never stay mad at him for long.

But today, he had cut his hair?

Atticus hadn't noticed earlier, thinking Orion had just tied it back. But now he saw the change.

Orion lowered his head, embarrassed. "Atticus, don't stare. Today is Dad's funeral. I just wanted to make him happy. That's all."

###chapter 345  Why Are You Here?

Atticus, being the older brother, got what Orion was saying and nodded.

"You're still Dad's son, no matter what. But seeing you change would definitely make him happy."

Atticus had a lot on his plate, so he patted Orion on the shoulder and handed Isabella over to him.

When Orion approached Isabella, she looked pale, and her lips were colorless from all the grief.

He went to her side. "Isabella, don't cry anymore. Go back to your room and rest, okay?"

Even though the ceremony in the hall was simple, Isabella was only three months pregnant.

She had rushed to the funeral right after waking up from fainting, which would be exhausting for anyone, let alone a pregnant woman.

But Isabella didn't want to leave. She wanted to stay with her grandfather, even if it was just for a little longer.

But Daniel was already gone. If something happened to Isabella now, they wouldn't be able to face Daniel.

Orion, seeing that he couldn't persuade her, said, "Dad always cared about your health the most. Do you think he'd be happy seeing you like this?"

Hearing that, Isabella felt a pang of sorrow.

When she looked up, she was surprised to see that Orion, who usually dressed casually, was now more formally dressed than Atticus.

Daniel had tried countless times to get him to dress properly.

Now, even Orion had matured.

Cinda quickly stepped forward to support Isabella, who had just stood up, thanked Orion, and helped Isabella to a nearby chair.

No one spoke.

Cinda, worried that Isabella might catch a chill, went back to the room to get a blanket to cover her legs and folded a coat to place behind her back for support.

Isabella, being pregnant, needed to be especially careful at a funeral. Any emotional distress could be dangerous.

Seeing Isabella silent, Cinda asked if she wanted something to eat to regain her strength.

Isabella shook her head.

She had no appetite at all. She didn't even want to drink water.

Isabella told Cinda to stop fussing.

She had nothing to do now, so she told Cinda to sit down and rest for a while.
