Isabella was taken aback when she saw her.

"Olivia, what are you doing here?"

Olivia had been busy promoting her new movie and preparing for her new song release. She was swamped.

Isabella hadn't wanted to trouble Olivia with this, so she hadn't called her.

But such a big event couldn't be kept secret. Given Daniel's status in Evergreen City, Olivia had almost frozen in place when she found out.

She had called her family to confirm the funeral's location and time. Otherwise, she would have thought it was just a rumor.

But for such a significant event, her best friend Isabella hadn't told her a thing.

Olivia had urgently asked her manager for time off and rushed over. But when she saw Isabella, all her accumulated anger dissipated.

In such a short time, the usually well-kept Isabella had become pale and thin.

Her eyes were swollen from crying.

The usually fiery Olivia now looked like a pitiful child, staring at Isabella.

Isabella hadn't forgotten her. She just didn't want Olivia to see her like this.

And she hadn't forgotten about Olivia and Atticus.

Having Olivia here now would only make things harder for her.

Olivia didn't care about that. No matter how busy she was, she couldn't ignore something like this.

"Don't forget, Daniel was my grandpa too. He used to give me treats when I was little. How could I not come to his funeral?"

She had recently taken on a new movie and was in the middle of a closed shoot. As soon as it ended, her manager had her promoting it.

Her manager also wanted to release a series of new songs to capitalize on the buzz.

She was about to explode from all the work.

When she finally got the news, she realized what Isabella had been through while she was away.

"Isabella, once I finish my current commitments, I won't take on any new projects. I'll take a break. Can I stay with you?"

No one understood Isabella's deep bond with her grandfather better than Olivia.

This was when Isabella needed someone the most.

As her best friend, Olivia would push aside all her work to be there for her.

"Of course, I'd be thrilled to have you."

Isabella touched her belly. "I'm about to enter my second trimester. I won't be able to go out much. Having you around will keep me company."

With her grandfather gone, she needed to take good care of herself and her baby.

Only then would she feel that life still held promise, that it continued with the birth of her child.

Isabella then introduced Renee and Cinda to Olivia.

But before she could say anything, Olivia had already started chatting with them, introducing herself.

"Hi, I'm Olivia. I've been best friends with Isabella for over ten years. We share everything."

Olivia's outgoing personality quickly made everyone feel at ease.

"By the way, I haven't paid my respects to Daniel yet. Isabella, you stay here. I'll be right back."

After all, she had come to attend Daniel's funeral. If she hadn't been so worried about Isabella, she would have gone to the hall first.

"Olivia, I'll go with you."

Isabella said, suggesting that Renee and Cinda go rest in the room.

Renee still had injuries and shouldn't stay outside for too long.

Cinda was worried when she heard Isabella wanted to go to the hall.

"I'm fine. I'm just going with Olivia. I'll be right back."

###chapter 346 Olivia Likes Atticus

Seeing their hesitation, Olivia stepped forward and took Isabella's hand. "Cinda, you can trust me with her."

"I promise I'll bring her back safe and sound."

If they were really together, she would have been the only one making an effort, and the outcome was obvious. As he said, they were not from the same world. Even if they were together, it would only cause trouble for each other.

That made sense. Olivia liked Atticus. But Atticus was always so composed and restrained, only having room in his eyes for his family and career. Plus, there was an age gap of over ten years between them. Even if Olivia could accept it, Atticus might not be able to accept such a relationship.

However, she had never asked Atticus about his feelings on this matter. She didn't know how he truly felt about Olivia.

He was looking at Olivia.

It seemed Atticus did have some feelings for Olivia.

What if Atticus and Olivia ended up together?

Then her long-time best friend would become her aunt?

She would definitely support such a wonderful thing.

Atticus's marriage had always been a wish of Daniel's. If a beautiful story could come true, Daniel would be happy to see it in the heaven.

"Isabella, don't be sad. Daniel knows you miss him, but you have a baby and all of us. You need to take care of yourself."

Seeing Isabella's pale face, Olivia felt even more heartbroken for her.

"I'm fine."

Isabella patted Olivia's hand and led her to a nearby resting area to sit down.

But she knew Isabella was just holding on.

Even the words she said were just to keep others from worrying.

A few minutes later, the hot milk was in Isabella's hands.

Olivia worried about her strength and the cold weather, urging her to warm up.

Olivia's last words seemed to unlock Isabella's emotions.

Tears streamed down her face.

But her uncles all said it wasn't her fault.

But her grandfather fell ill because of her. If not her, then who?

Olivia's words flowed into Isabella's heart like a warm current.

His face had only a faint smile and reluctance, with no trace of blame or anger.

###chapter 347  It's Blood

At that moment, her grandfather dreamed of the person he missed the most.

Her grandmother and mother were waiting for him there, so he wasn't afraid to leave, just worried about her.

In a relationship, if only one person was always giving while the other kept avoiding, it wouldn't last.

Olivia's struggle and suppression were clear to Isabella.

She was usually straightforward, but when it came to feelings, she was so cautious.

She must have been heartlessly rejected by Atticus after confessing.

Both of them were equally stubborn.

If he agreed, it would feel like he was taking advantage of a younger person.

Blood.

How could this be happening?

###chapter 348 Miscarriage

Daniel's funeral was winding down.

To lose her most precious child at her grandfather's funeral.

Empty.

###chapter 349 Someone Deliberately Plotted

Inside, Isabella was already lying down to rest.

Olivia, who was by her side, made a quiet gesture to Holden as he entered.

###chapter 350  Can't Let It Go Like This

Holden knew Olivia, as Isabella's best friend, was just trying to help. But he had something urgent to tell Isabella and couldn't waste any time.

He turned to Olivia. "Hey, can you give us a minute? I need to talk to Isabella about something important."

Olivia saw the seriousness in his eyes and, though confused, nodded and stepped out.

Holden walked over to the bed, seeing Isabella's tear-streaked face. He gently took her hand and spoke softly.

"Isabella, I know you're awake. I need to tell you something urgent. It's about the baby."

Isabella's eyes snapped open, red and swollen from crying. She thought he was there to console her again.

"Holden, I can't talk about the baby right now. Please."

The baby was gone. She knew she'd have to come to terms with it eventually, but the pain was still too raw.

"Isabella, I'm not here to console you. I have some bad news."

Holden took a deep breath, looking into her eyes. "This is going to be tough to hear, but you need to promise me you won't get too upset, okay?"

Isabella had never seen him so hesitant. She felt a growing sense of dread but couldn't imagine what could be worse.

Her grandfather was gone, her baby was gone. What else could she lose?

"I'm okay. Just tell me."

Seeing her calm, Holden finally spoke. "I just found out there were some suspicious people at your grandfather's funeral. We think your miscarriage might have been caused by someone trying to hurt you, and that person could be connected to Bianca."

"Because of the chaos, Atticus and the others focused on you and the unfinished funeral, missing the evidence, which was then cleaned up."

"Uncle Holden, what can I do to help?" Isabella interrupted.

She knew Bianca's schemes better than anyone. Hearing that the baby's death might be linked to Bianca, her anger flared.

She had been too careless, thinking she was safe in the Wilson family home, only to fall victim to another of Bianca's plots.

Suddenly, Isabella remembered something.

"It was the milk!"

Before Holden could tell her the truth, she had already figured it out.

At the funeral, she had been too grief-stricken to eat. The only thing she had consumed was the glass of milk Olivia had given her.

"That's right," Holden said gravely. "The problem was with the milk. But all the evidence was cleaned up, and your blood tests showed nothing unusual. So the only thing we can check now is the residue in your stomach to see if we can find any clues."

This meant Isabella, already devastated by the loss of her baby, would have to undergo a deep stomach examination, which would be physically and emotionally taxing.

Isabella didn't hesitate. "Uncle Holden, I understand. Even if the examination might not find anything, I'm willing to try."

She would do anything to find the person responsible for her baby's death.

"Alright, let's get to the examination room."

Holden helped Isabella up, and they headed out. Olivia, waiting by the door, was taken aback.

"Isabella, Holden, where are you going? Isabella, you're still very weak. You shouldn't be getting out of bed."

She moved to support Isabella, but Isabella shook her head. "Olivia, I need to get a check-up right now. Holden will go with me. You stay here and wait for me."

"A check-up?"

Olivia was confused but, seeing Holden by her side, she still felt uneasy about Isabella going alone.

"If it's a check-up, I should go with you. It's not appropriate for him to be in the examination room."

Olivia assumed it was a gynecological exam and insisted on going along.

Not wanting to waste time, Isabella agreed and let Olivia accompany her.

They arrived at the examination room, and the doctors and nurses quickly understood Isabella's needs, starting a series of procedures immediately.

Soon, a long tube was inserted into Isabella's mouth.

Seeing Olivia's frightened expression, Isabella couldn't speak but squeezed Olivia's hand to reassure her.

Olivia didn't know what was happening, but seeing Isabella in such pain, she couldn't stop her tears.

Isabella was the beloved princess of the Wilson family. If it weren't for Michael, she wouldn't have to endure this suffering.

The examination was grueling, but fortunately, it yielded results.

The doctors found undigested milk in Isabella's stomach, which was immediately sent to the lab for testing.

Now, all Isabella and Holden could do was wait for the results.

When Isabella returned to her room, she looked even paler than before.

Olivia poured her a glass of water and carefully helped her drink a few sips before letting her lie back down, reminding her not to move around too much to avoid further health issues.

Afterward, Olivia went to check if Cinda, who was making soup at home, had arrived.

Thomas had also been called away by a phone call earlier.

Now, only Isabella and Holden were left in the room, and she had some questions for him.

"Uncle Holden, how did you find out so quickly that the person was sent by Bianca?"

Bianca had been trying to harm her and her baby for a long time, but this time she had dared to infiltrate the Wilson family and do it so discreetly.

Someone must be helping Bianca.

"It wasn't me. It was Renee. She told Atticus right away."

"You know how much Atticus cares about you. He wouldn't overlook any clues, especially since the baby was the future of the Wilson family. Even if the baby is gone, we can't let it be for nothing."

Hearing the truth, Isabella nodded.

"Holden, I won't let this go. Bianca dared to mess with the Wilson family. No matter what, I will avenge my baby."

Her baby couldn't have died in vain.

She had felt his presence during those three months of pregnancy. She had even prepared clothes and toys for him, but now he was gone.

She should have known. The baby had been fine until that sudden, intense pain.

Someone must have tampered with her.

###chapter 351 Don't Push Yourself

Isabella never thought Renee would be the one to find all these clues.

Renee was on Bianca's side, after all.

Isabella had always known that, so she never pushed Renee to join her side.

When Isabella saved Renee at the mall entrance and brought her back to the Wilson family, it was just a coincidence.

She never intended to force Renee. Even if she had considered persuading her, she never brought it up.

During their time together, Isabella had come to see Renee as a real friend.

Now, without saying a word, Renee was looking out for her, even while recovering from her own injuries, searching for clues on Isabella's behalf.

Isabella was deeply moved.

Maybe she could try talking to Renee about joining her side.

Meanwhile...

After discussing everything with Atticus, Renee slowly wheeled herself towards the main hall.

It wasn't until she realized what she had done that she broke out in a cold sweat.

How could she forget her own identity?

She was sent by the Adri family to work for Bianca.

Renee closed her eyes in pain, stopping her movements, and buried her face in her hands.

She didn't regret helping Isabella find evidence.

But she hadn't forgotten the Adri family's methods. She might escape unscathed, but what about her family?

Her mother was still under their surveillance. The Adri family already considered her a traitor. If they couldn't find her, what would happen to her mother?

She didn't dare to think too deeply about it.

Once she recovered, she needed to return to her mother as soon as possible and find a way to take her away.

As Renee was planning her next steps, she heard footsteps outside the hall.

At this time, everyone was in the main hall mourning Daniel, so hardly anyone would come to the main hall.

She composed herself and opened the door, only to see a tall, stern figure walking in against the light.

Renee didn't recognize him, but the man introduced himself.

"I'm Michael Brown."

Hearing the name, Renee was stunned for a second.

She hadn't met him many times, mostly hearing about him from Aaron, who often mentioned his boss and his past with Isabella.

Over time, she remembered.

Renee assumed he was here to see Isabella. After all, with such a big event, it wouldn't make sense for him not to show up as the baby's father.

"Mr. Brown, you must be here to see Isabella. She's..."

Before Renee could finish, Michael's deep voice interrupted her.

"Renee, I'm here to see you!"

Michael got straight to the point. "I have something to discuss with you."

After being rejected by Isabella, he should have left with Aiden, but he couldn't shake the uneasy feeling.

So he had the driver stop the car and returned to the Wilson family.

The once-crowded funeral was now almost empty, which Michael found strange, so he decided to ask around.

He spotted Renee sitting in the hall, lost in thought.

He had been wanting to talk to this defector from the Adri family, but Isabella had always stopped him.

Now he had the chance.

Renee frowned when she heard Michael was there to see her.

Didn't he know Isabella was in the hospital?

Why would he want to chat with her?

Besides, he was Aaron's boss. She and Aaron had already made things clear, so there was nothing left to say to Michael.

"Mr. Brown, I don't get it. I'm just someone down on my luck, relying on friends for help. I don't think we have anything to talk about."

Despite Michael's status, Renee didn't give him any courtesy.

They had no mutual interests, and she didn't need his help. The only thing they could talk about was Aaron.

Michael didn't miss the opportunity. "The day you were attacked, I had sent Aaron abroad for business. That's why he missed your call, causing your misunderstanding. I owe you both an apology."

Renee raised an eyebrow. Michael, the president of the Brown Group and heir to the Brown family's century-old legacy, was speaking up for his assistant? Instead of being aloof and indifferent?

This surprised her.

She recalled what Aaron had said to her. "So, Mr. Brown, it's Aaron asking you to be here?"

Michael shook his head lightly. "He doesn't know I'm here. He returned abroad for business last night."

"He's gone again."

Renee muttered softly, then looked at Michael, understanding why he was there.

It wasn't because of Aaron or Isabella. It had to be about her identity.

But she wouldn't discuss that with an outsider.

"Thank you, Mr. Brown, for coming to tell me this. I know now. My injury has nothing to do with anyone else, and I don't blame him."

"Mr. Brown, please leave."

Renee wheeled herself away, but before leaving, she wanted to remind Michael. She could see Isabella cared about him.

Isabella was in the hospital and needed support.

"Mr. Brown, as an outsider, I think it's necessary to remind you to go see the Wilson family. Don't wait until it's too late to make amends."

As an outsider recovering at the Wilson family, she couldn't say much.

Michael had to take action himself.

And she needed to get to the hospital.

With nothing left at the Wilson family, and no news from Isabella, she was worried.

If that female "servant" was really sent by the Adri family, Isabella's unborn child would be in danger.

Renee left quickly, not giving Michael a chance to ask more.

Michael found it strange, but his unease had brought him back here, and he hadn't seen Isabella.

Renee's words, "Don't wait until it's too late," made him even more anxious.

He hurried to the main hall.

Inside, only Atticus remained, standing before Daniel's portrait, his posture straight and expression stern.

Michael approached, glanced at Daniel's photo, and stood behind Atticus.

Seeing Michael, Atticus gave him a cold look. "Why are you standing here?"

"Isabella has already told you she wants a divorce. Given your current status, it's inappropriate for you to stand before the Wilson family. Leave!"

###chapter 352  Do You Have Business Here?

Atticus's voice was calm and steady, but filled with unmistakable distance and coldness.

Even though Atticus never really liked Michael, his nephew-in-law, he always maintained the decorum expected of an elder.

Even when Atticus had hit him before, it was with a tone of disappointment, like a parent scolding a child.

But today, Atticus was treating him like a complete outsider.

He didn't even bother to look at him.

Something must have happened to make Atticus act this way.

Michael sensed it immediately.

For Atticus to change so drastically, there had to be a reason.

Michael still stood there obediently, cautiously probing, "Atticus, I know as Isabella's husband, I should be here by Grandpa Daniel's memorial. It's my fault for not being here and making you angry. From now on, I'll stay here."

He had left earlier because he was worried about his grandfather's health, afraid that returning home would make him even more upset.

And he knew that Daniel's death was a huge blow to Isabella. Staying by her side would only make her more emotional, so he thought it was better to leave for a bit and come back when she had calmed down.

But who knew that in just a few minutes, everything would change so drastically.

Of course, he was angry!

He couldn't stand the thought of Isabella suffering for three whole years because of Michael, enduring countless grievances and bullying, and now she had even lost her baby.

He wanted to beat Michael to death!

But he couldn't do that, not just because Michael was the heir to the Brown Family, but also because he still held an important place in Isabella's heart.

He didn't want Isabella to hate him in the future.

Daniel was dead, and the Wilson Family would no longer tolerate him.

She was the only one in his heart.

As long as their child was there, their marriage couldn't be severed.

Michael was more eager than anyone for the child's arrival, hoping it would ease the tension between him and Isabella. He wanted to learn to be a good father and husband.

He wanted to rebuild his marriage with Isabella.

Atticus took a deep breath, as if he was pained for Isabella, or maybe he was just sighing.

Michael's face went pale at those words.

The baby had already passed the three-month danger period, and all the prenatal checkups showed healthy development. How could anything have gone wrong?

"Atticus, this isn't funny. Tell me what happened!"

Michael was genuinely panicking.

Atticus looked at him coldly and said, "The baby's gone. Isabella almost got hurt because of it, and it's all because of your past mistakes."

Michael collapsed to the ground, disbelief written all over his face.

"That's impossible."

He had just seen Isabella not long ago. She was fine, still arguing with him. How could things change so quickly?

Atticus turned away, facing the hall, and said, "Isabella is at the hospital. If you want to see the baby one last time, go. After three months, the fetus was already formed. It's not just you who is heartbroken."

Atticus couldn't bring himself to completely deny Michael the right to know as a father.

But seeing Michael now, Isabella would finally give up on him.

Michael wasn't right for her, and continuing this would only hurt Isabella more.

Even if it was cruel, he had to cut off her hopes.

Michael was already on his way to the hospital.

The whole way, he was stiff and numb.

The baby was gone!

Their baby was gone.

But he had just seen Isabella. She was fine, and the baby was healthy.

What had happened? How could the baby be gone?

The car sped through the streets, and Michael reached the hospital as quickly as possible.

Outside the hospital room, Michael saw Isabella sitting on the bed, her face pale as a sheet.

Isabella looked more like her mother, a cold beauty, but now she was pale, her lips bloodless.

Her long hair fell over her thin shoulders, making her look small and fragile.

Isabella was focused on a report in her hands, so she didn't notice Michael's arrival.

But Michael saw something was wrong. Her hands were shaking, and she was biting her lips, on the verge of breaking down.

What was wrong with her?

"Michael, who let you in here? Get out. Isabella doesn't want to see you!"

Olivia knew how fragile Isabella's emotions were right now. If Michael appeared, she wouldn't be able to handle it.

Olivia's voice snapped Isabella out of her thoughts.

She slowly looked up and saw Michael at the door. His eyes were filled with pain and urgency, and the sorrow of losing their baby.

But her eyes were filled with despair and emptiness.

His emotions no longer affected her.

She looked at him deeply, then turned away, speaking calmly, "Do you need something?"

###chapter 353  Who Did It?

"Olivia, let him in."

Hearing Isabella's voice, Olivia stepped aside, allowing Michael to enter.

Michael had rushed over from the Wilson family estate and now stood in front of Isabella, panting and looking anxious.

As long as she was okay, nothing else mattered to him.

From the day they got married three years ago, Isabella had always talked about having a baby.

Even when he said the most hurtful things to her, she didn't care. She would even climb into his bed in the middle of the night just to get pregnant.

The answer was no.

That was their child, their first child in three years of marriage!

Right, that made sense. He never cared about her, let alone their child.

Her child's death wasn't an accident; someone had deliberately harmed her to make her lose the baby.

Her grandfather wouldn't have died from a sudden illness caused by her kidnapping.

Those were two lives.

If Michael hadn't repeatedly supported Bianca, how would she have dared to harm Isabella and the child?

If she could muster the strength, she would slap him hard and demand to know what he really wanted.

Olivia, worried that Isabella might lose control, stayed close by.

Isabella looked at her and said calmly, "Olivia, wait outside for a bit. I need to talk to him alone."

She wanted Bianca to pay with her life for her child's death.

She wanted Michael to remember this moment forever, to feel double the pain she felt.

Especially not alone with Michael.

Olivia had seen firsthand how deeply Isabella loved him.

Their child had been lost due to poisoning.

###chapter 354 He Does Not Deserve to Be a Father

Because it was all his fault.

###chapter 355 The Source of the Poison

Renee could hardly believe what she was seeing.

She widened her eyes and held the papers up to Isabella, incredulous. "Isabella, did you lose your baby because of this?"

How could these things be here?

Was she seeing things?

So she had locked herself in the lab day and night, developing various experiments and drugs for them.

In Isabella's mind, Renee was Bianca's subordinate, but her job was managing a beauty salon.

Renee knew she couldn't hide her identity any longer and didn't intend to keep it from Isabella.

She pointed to the final results on the test report and said, "This poison is an experimental drug I was forced to develop, labeled T5. It can quickly dissolve in water and cause rapid poisoning within seconds, but it leaves no trace afterward."

"And it's specifically designed for pregnant women."

Ordinary people would only suffer for a short time before metabolizing it, but even a tiny amount could cause a miscarriage in pregnant women.

The initial purpose of this drug was as a weapon in the power struggles of wealthy families abroad.

Someone had paid a high price for it, prompting the Adri Family to have her develop it.

Knowing she couldn't reverse the outcome, she had secretly reduced the toxin's harm to the mother. As long as the baby was lost, the mother wouldn't be affected.

"The drug quickly harms the mother's body, causing severe bleeding. Trying to save the baby would only harm both the mother and the child, but ultimately, the baby couldn't be saved. The best option was to terminate the pregnancy."

Renee couldn't continue.

Fortunately, the Wilson Family had prioritized Isabella's safety over the baby's, or the consequences would have been unimaginable.

Because she had personally developed the drug, she was well aware of the process and results.

But Isabella frowned. "According to you, this drug leaves no trace. So why were there milk residues in my stomach?"

"It's the milk. I said the drug dissolves in water, but that doesn't mean it can dissolve quickly in all liquids. Milk hindered its metabolism."

Renee hadn't expected the Adri Family to overlook this detail.

But it wasn't always detectable. Isabella had found out early. If it had been another half hour, even the milk would have been digested without a trace.

With these explanations, all of Isabella's questions were answered.

Others might not know Renee's special identity, but Michael certainly did.

Now it was clear that the drug that killed the baby was developed by Renee, which indirectly confirmed one thing.

The person who poisoned her was Bianca!

"Isabella, I don't expect your forgiveness. I just wanted to tell you the truth. I'm truly sorry. I didn't know the drug I made for them would be used on you."

Renee sincerely apologized to Isabella.

But she knew that no matter how many remorseful words she said, the baby couldn't come back.

But Isabella shook her head. She wasn't someone who couldn't distinguish right from wrong.

The drug was used by Bianca to target at her. No matter how much she blamed anyone or regretted drinking that glass of milk, the baby was gone.

If she continued to dwell on this, she wouldn't be able to avenge her baby and would only exhaust herself.

She sighed and looked at Renee with a calm tone.

"Renee, I know your character. This isn't your fault."

"And working for those people wasn't your choice. No one can control how the drugs they make are used. How could I blame you for this?"

The result was clear. The baby was gone, and what she wanted most was to sever ties with Michael.

In her future, he would no longer exist.

###chapter 356  Are You Having Performance Issues?

Isabella's eyes turned cold as she glared at Michael.

"Even now, you're still defending Bianca?"

With Renee presenting the evidence herself, Michael had no more excuses.

If their child had once been a bond between him and Isabella, now, in her eyes, he was nothing but a despicable man.

There was no way to mend their relationship anymore.

"Isabella, take care of yourself. I'm outta here."

With those words, Michael couldn't bear to stay any longer. In his haste, a small, delicate trinket fell from his pocket.

The sound of it hitting the floor drew everyone's attention. On the white tiles lay a small silver bear charm.

Michael bent down to pick it up, but Isabella's voice stopped him.

"How do you have that bear charm?"

Even from a distance, Isabella recognized it as the one she had thrown into the sea at Moon Bay.

But how could it have ended up with Michael? Unless he had lost it back then and bought an identical one, which was very easy for him.

Michael's eyes lit up with a spark of hope as he held the charm out to Isabella. "You recognize this bear charm? Did you throw it into the sea at Moon Bay?"

If Isabella knew the charm, did it mean she was the one who saved him back then, not Bianca?

If it was really Isabella, had he been mistaken all these years?

The thought made Michael's heart race.

But Isabella shook her head, denying it.

"No, I was mistaken. My grandfather bought me a similar one when I was a child, but it wasn't this color."

Seeing the flicker of joy in Michael's eyes, Isabella understood. Just as she had hoped countless times that he would recognize her, she could see the hope in his eyes now.

But she wanted to sever all ties with him.

So she had to say this.

She had once hated him for mistaking Bianca as his savior. Now, to get rid of him, she had to throw this back onto Bianca.

After all, he had been unconscious when she saved him and hadn't seen her face clearly. Otherwise, he wouldn't have been fooled by Bianca for so many years.

Let it be.

She didn't want any more entanglements with him.

Even if he found out she was the one who saved him, she wouldn't admit it.

"So, it just looks similar."

Disappointed, Michael couldn't hide his sadness. Without another word, he clenched the charm and left quickly.

Late at night, at the Starlit Tavern.

Michael sat in the largest private room, downing one drink after another of the strongest liquor.

The deafening music from outside seemed distant and unreal to him. He didn't even know how he had ended up there.

All he knew was that he couldn't do anything but drown himself in alcohol.

Ethan arrived as soon as he got Michael's call. He had planned to give him a piece of his mind, but seeing Michael recklessly drinking, he was stunned.

"My God, Michael, have you lost your mind? How much did you drink?"

The table was littered with empty bottles of strong liquor, and Michael, head down, was pouring drink after drink into his mouth.

When Ethan arrived, there were already seven or eight empty bottles at Michael's feet.

But Michael showed no sign of stopping.

He was like a soulless body, still gulping down the alcohol.

"Enough, man, you're killing yourself."

Ethan snatched the glass from Michael's hand and sat on the couch beside him, getting straight to the point.

"Something big must've happened to get you this upset. If there's a problem, let's figure it out. What good does drinking do?"

Michael shook his head numbly. "It can't be fixed."

He reached for another drink, but Ethan wouldn't let him. At this rate, he'd drink himself to death.

Ethan didn't want to return a drunkard to the Brown Family and get chewed out.

"Stop drinking!"

Ethan angrily pushed the bottles aside and gave Michael a hard slap on the shoulder.

"Michael, we've known each other for years. Don't you trust me?"

"Whatever it is, just spill it. Even if I can't help, I can at least give you some advice. What's the point of keeping it all inside?"

Michael kept his head down, but his thoughts were starting to clear.

He leaned back on the couch, closed his eyes, and asked a question.

"Ethan, do you think I'm a terrible person?"

Ethan was taken aback.

Terrible?

He must be really drunk to say something like that.

This was Michael, a man who held the economic lifeline of Evergreen City. Wealth, power, background-he had it all.

He was a man who was always in control, never allowing anyone to contradict him.

And now, this golden boy was questioning his own worth?

Ethan swallowed, shocked but ready to answer.

"Why would you think that? In my eyes, you're already exceptional. You took over the Brown Group at a young age and made it even better. Doesn't that prove your capability?"

Ethan was being honest.

Though they had grown up together, Michael was the most hardworking of all the privileged kids he knew.

In their circle, most people were arrogant and entitled.

But Michael had never shown those traits.

"I don't want to hear that. I'm asking about me as a person, not my abilities."

Michael waved his hand in frustration. "Do you understand what I want? Can you evaluate me as a man?"

A man?

Ethan's eyes flashed with realization, quickly catching the hint of something more personal.

As a fellow man, Ethan couldn't help but think about Michael's sex life. Given Michael and Isabella's ongoing issues, he wondered if there was a "cruel" truth.

"Michael, are you having... performance issues? No wonder you're drinking like this."

Ethan shook his head, looking Michael up and down. Michael was taller and more robust than him. How could he have performance issues at such a young age?

It didn't make sense.

###chapter 357 Bianca's Face

"Ethan, have you lost your mind?"

Just as Ethan was starting to second-guess himself, Michael shot him a look that could kill, like he wanted to strangle him.

Ethan had just asked a simple question, and Michael had the nerve to curse his sex life?

Michael was good at everything; how could he possibly have issues in the bedroom?

But ever since he and Isabella had been intimate, he hadn't been interested in any other woman.

If he couldn't win Isabella back, he might never want to have sex again.

"Come on, I was just joking. Don't take it so seriously!"

Ethan laughed it off, thinking Michael was just too embarrassed to admit it. He patted Michael on the shoulder.

"Seriously, I get it. We're all guys here. It's no big deal. I'll find a reputable clinic for you. They'll get you back on track, no problem."

Michael slapped his hand away.

"Who needs to get back on track? I told you, there's nothing wrong with me. Stop talking nonsense."

Who said he had issues? He was perfectly fine.

But Isabella was now demanding a divorce. She wouldn't even let him get close, let alone touch her.

Even if he had the energy, he had nowhere to release it.

Otherwise, he wouldn't be here drinking.

"Alright, I called you here to drink. If you keep talking about this, you can leave right now."

Michael irritably poured himself another drink.

"Come on, I drove here as fast as I could. I just sat down, and you're already kicking me out? That's not cool."

Ethan suddenly remembered something and smacked his forehead.

"If it's not about your sex life, then you and Isabella must have had another fight."

Michael didn't respond, but Ethan knew he was right.

The only person who could make Michael this upset and drive him to drink alone was Isabella.

And considering the news he heard today, it all made sense.

Ethan poured himself a drink, took a sip, and then spoke slowly. "I just heard this morning. Daniel, Isabella's grandfather, had his funeral today."

"She's just lost a family member and is carrying your child. It's normal for her to be upset. You should be more understanding."

Isabella was probably at her most vulnerable right now. Instead of being by her side, Michael was here drinking. They must have had another fight.

Isabella and Michael were always like this. They could never talk things out calmly; they had to argue all the time.

As soon as Ethan finished speaking, Michael fell silent.

After a long pause, he spoke in a hoarse voice, "Our child is gone."

Their marriage had always been on the brink of divorce. The only reason they hadn't signed the papers was because Isabella didn't want to worry her grandfather.

But their marriage problems were hard to hide, especially for such a long time.

Daniel was too sharp to be fooled.

So Isabella had kept them in this half-divorced state.

But now her grandfather was dead, and the child was gone too.

All the ways he had thought to keep Isabella were now useless. This time, he really had no options left.

"What did you say?"

Ethan's eyes widened, almost spilling his drink. "Are you serious? When did this happen?"

Michael lowered his head and said, "Today."

The cold look in Isabella's eyes at the hospital filled him with fear.

But more than that, he felt guilty towards her and their child.

One was the woman he loved, the other was the child he had eagerly awaited. How could he not be heartbroken?

"Have a drink with me, to remember my unborn child."

Michael clinked his glass with Ethan's and then downed his drink.

"Alright, if you want to."

Ethan hadn't realized Michael was carrying such a heavy burden.

Now he understood why Michael was drinking himself into oblivion.

As a friend, he couldn't leave Michael alone at a time like this.

After a few bottles, Ethan's mind was getting fuzzy.

He swayed with his drink and asked, "I haven't asked you yet. During that time you and Isabella were fighting, wasn't there a woman named Violet hanging around you? Where did she go?"

He remembered Michael being particularly fond of her.

Ethan had almost thought Violet would become the future Mrs. Brown.

Michael leaned back on the couch, his hand over his eyes, in the dark.

He sighed. "You actually know her, and quite well."

Ethan laughed sarcastically.

"You're kidding. I've only seen Violet a few times. How could I know her well? If you hadn't brought her around, I wouldn't even know who she was."

But Michael's next words almost made Ethan choke.

"She has another name: Bianca."

"Bianca?"

Ethan's eyes widened. He thought he must have misheard, but Michael's calm demeanor made him believe it.

But when he tried to recall Violet's face, something didn't add up.

"Wait, if she's really Bianca, how could she have two completely different faces? Did she get plastic surgery and come back with a new face?"

Bianca had been a well-known piano prodigy in Evergreen City. When she disappeared, the media had covered it extensively.

But that was only a few months ago. Even if Bianca had gone abroad for surgery, she couldn't have recovered so quickly.

It was too unbelievable!

"Michael, are you messing with me? I saw Violet on the yacht. Her face didn't show any signs of surgery, and in such a short time. Are you sure she's really Bianca?"

Michael gritted his teeth. "It's her, no doubt about it."

Even she had admitted it. He had no reason to doubt it anymore.

But as Ethan said, there was something off about Bianca's face.

How could she change her face so drastically in such a short time?

Could it be that the Adri Family had some advanced biotechnology?

Michael suddenly thought of someone.

Renee!

If what she said today was true, then she was a pawn in the Adri Family's pharmaceutical schemes.

Since she was in research, could Bianca's new face be her work?

###chapter 358 Drunk as a Skunk

If it really was her, then he was one step closer to uncovering the truth about the Adri Family.

But before tackling that huge problem, he had to deal with Bianca first.

She had killed his child.

She had also made Isabella lose all trust in him, causing Isabella and Michael to separate with no chance of reconciliation.

If it weren't for her, he would have already made up with Isabella and been there to watch their child grow up healthy and happy.

He would never let her go.

Seeing Michael's reaction and expression, Ethan couldn't help but sigh deeply for his friend's plight.

He had never liked Bianca.

In his opinion, she couldn't hold a candle to Isabella.

Bianca always put on this weak, helpless act, as if everyone was out to get her.

Women like that made him uncomfortable.

But Michael protected her no matter what she did, never getting angry and always cleaning up her messes.

Ethan just couldn't understand it. Did Michael have terrible taste in women? How could he choose to protect a fake, innocent Bianca over a cool, elegant wife like Isabella?

Ethan wanted to ask, emboldened by the alcohol, but seeing Michael's dark expression, he swallowed his curiosity and quickly changed the subject.

"Alright, alright, let's not talk about unhappy things."

"So, what are you going to do about Isabella? You can't just leave it like this, right?"

Ethan didn't dare say it outright, but knowing Isabella's temper, losing her child meant she probably wouldn't get back together with Michael.

After all, she was a cherished daughter of the Wilson Family, a princess who had been pampered all her life. There was no way she would come back to endure this pain.

"Divorce is not an option!"

Michael's tone was firm.

He had just thought of a solution.

Isabella always thought there was something going on between him and Bianca, right?

Then he would get rid of Bianca.

If she thought he wasn't sincere enough, he would lay his heart bare for her. He would solve any problem standing in their way.

Whether she forgave him or not, he would never let her go again.

"Michael, isn't that a bit much?"

She didn't like him anymore. Forcing it would only make things worse.

Seeing Michael's determined look, Ethan couldn't bear to burst his bubble and sighed.

"You've come this far. If you keep pushing, you'll only make things harder for Isabella and more painful for yourself."

Why bother?

Couldn't they just part ways amicably?

"But she's all I have. I only love her."

Michael's voice was soft but unwavering.

He hadn't realized how much he cared for her at first, but after three years of marriage and her filing for divorce, he finally woke up.

He had feelings for her, but he just didn't want to admit it.

They had gone through so much together during the divorce turmoil, and he had come to understand her more deeply, learning about her hidden sides.

His affection had long since turned into deep love. He didn't know what he would become if he let go.

But he never wanted to find out.

Hearing Michael's heartfelt confession, Ethan decided not to push further.

It was something he should have realized sooner, but it took an irreversible situation for him to understand his own heart.

Ethan didn't know whether to be happy for Michael or sad for Isabella.

But no matter what, outsiders could never truly understand the feelings of those involved.

All he could do was understand and respect.

"Alright, I won't say more. I support you in finding true love. Don't let her down again."

That night, they both drank heavily.

But Michael drank the most.

Ethan helped him, called a driver, and took him to the Brown Villa.

It wasn't that Ethan didn't know Michael's other places, but with Michael this drunk, Ethan couldn't leave him somewhere unattended.

But the Brown Villa was different.

Aiden and Michael's mother, Stella, were there, ensuring he wouldn't pass out alone in the middle of the night.

Ethan dropped Michael on the couch, exhausted.

Aiden was already asleep, but Stella, woken by the noise, saw Michael passed out on the couch and immediately called for help.

Worried about waking Aiden, Stella had Michael taken to a bedroom upstairs.

But Michael, as if deliberately opposing Stella, refused to be touched, shouting, "Isabella, you can't divorce me! I won't agree! I'll never agree!"

Stella turned pale, gently patting Michael's arm and soothing him, "No divorce, no divorce. We'll do as you say, okay?"

"Calm down, or if you wake your grandfather, we'll both be in trouble."

Stella wished she could gag him.

But her words worked.

Michael quieted down immediately, "You said it, no divorce."

"Yes, yes, I said it, no divorce."

Seeing this, Stella signaled the servants to help him upstairs.

Only then did she breathe a sigh of relief. Seeing Ethan equally drunk, she said, "Ethan, you're too drunk to go home. Stay here tonight. It's safer to leave when you're sober."

Ethan and Michael's close relationship was well-known, and their families were acquainted.

Though they didn't interact much as adults, Stella's offer showed their bond hadn't faded.

Ethan, with a pounding headache, politely asked, "Mrs. Stella Brown, will it bother you if I stay?"

Stella laughed, waving her hand, "Not at all. You always stayed with Michael when you were kids. It's late, don't go."

She called a servant, "Take him to the guest room on the first floor."

"Thank you."

Ethan, too tired to go home, agreed.

As Ethan staggered away, Stella, worried about Michael, sighed and went upstairs.

Michael was already in bed, his jacket off.

He had lost a lot of weight, dark circles under his eyes, and looked utterly worn out.

Seeing her son like this, Stella's heart ached.

###chapter 359  Can't Escape

The next morning.

Michael squinted against the sunlight streaming through the window, raising a hand to shield his eyes. To his surprise, he saw his mother, Stella, asleep in a chair by his bed.

"Mom? What are you doing here?"

Michael thought he was still at Elysian Heights Estate, the home he shared with his wife, Isabella. Stella rarely visited him there.

Stella, a light sleeper, woke up instantly at the sound of his voice. She realized her son was still hungover and confused about where he was.

She glared at him, "Open your eyes and look around. This is the Brown Villa, not your place. You're a grown man, Michael. When will you stop making me worry?"

Michael looked around and finally recognized the familiar surroundings. Ethan had brought him back to the Brown Villa last night.

He was in the master bedroom on the second floor, the room he and Isabella had shared for a long time. It was filled with memories of her, memories he had been avoiding.

Now, seeing these familiar scenes, he finally understood why Isabella couldn't forgive him.

He had been such a jerk.

She had treated him with genuine love, and he had taken it for granted, neglecting her in countless ways.

Seeing his mother had stayed up all night to take care of him, Michael shook his head and gently held her hand.

"I'm fine, Mom. I'm sorry for worrying you."

He had been so immature, always thinking his mother was too controlling, trying to manage every aspect of his life.

So he had rebelled against her at every turn.

He never paid attention to family matters.

It wasn't until everything happened with Isabella that he started to focus on his family. He realized how much he had neglected.

His understanding of his mother began to change.

If he had shown more concern for his mother back then, maybe she wouldn't have blamed Isabella for his rebellion.

He had been indifferent, leaving his mother to believe that all his unhappiness was caused by Isabella.

This had made her increasingly harsh towards Isabella.

Now that he finally saw the truth, it was too late.

"A mother worrying about her child is only natural. As long as you're okay, I'll do anything," Stella said, her voice choking with emotion.

She sighed, "Michael, I can see everything clearly now. If you can't let go of Isabella, go and win her back. But you have to treat her well this time."

Stella reflected on her own actions. "I was misled by the Taylor family's lies and blamed everything on Isabella. If she comes back to the Brown family, I'll really nice to her."

The recent events had made Stella realize a lot.

She wouldn't interfere in Michael's marriage anymore.

But she wondered if it was too late for her to change, and if Isabella would forgive her past mistakes.

"Mom, it's good that you understand, but please stay out of my business with Isabella."

Michael couldn't bring himself to tell her about the miscarriage, so he kept it a secret for now.

"Where's Ethan? He brought me back last night. Did he leave?"

Michael remembered the drinking session with Ethan. They had both had a lot to drink. He wondered how Ethan was doing now.

"Ethan left already," Stella said, recalling the report from the servant last night. "He was going to stay the night, but he got a call and left in a hurry."

"He left in the middle of the night?"

Michael was surprised.

He couldn't understand what could be so urgent for Ethan to leave in the middle of the night.

He knew Ethan's parents were in good health, and the company didn't need Ethan's attention. Ethan usually spent his time partying or racing.

Maybe Ethan had found something new and exciting.

Seeing it was getting late, Michael got up to leave. "Mom, I have to go to the office."

Stella quickly stopped him. "Michael, you haven't been home in a while. Your grandfather has been in a bad mood since attending Daniel's funeral yesterday. Why don't you spend some time with him?"

Michael hesitated. "It's better if I don't. Seeing me will only make him angrier."

He remembered how Aiden had been upset when Isabella returned the gemstone pendant.

Aiden's eyes had been red with sorrow.

Now that the baby was gone, Michael felt even more ashamed to face Aiden.

If Aiden asked about Isabella, he didn't know if he could keep lying.

Stella understood and sighed, not pressing the issue.

"Alright, I'll have the servants make you some hot porridge. You drank a lot last night, and your stomach must be upset."

"No need, Mom. I'm not hungry. I'll eat something at the office."

It was clear Michael was avoiding Aiden, and Stella had to go along with it.

He wasn't a child anymore; she couldn't make decisions for him.

"Okay, go ahead."

As Michael headed downstairs, he saw Sophia waiting.

Sophia was Aiden's personal attendant.

"Mr. Michael Brown, Mr. Aiden Brown has been waiting for you. Please follow me," she said respectfully.

Michael was taken aback.

"Sophia, there's an urgent meeting at the office. Tell my grandfather I'll see him later."

Sophia interrupted him, "Mr. Michael Brown, you know Mr. Aiden Brown's temper. You should go see him."

There was no point in avoiding it.

In the backyard garden, Aiden was sitting at a table, enjoying his coffee and the flowers, looking quite relaxed.

But Michael knew better than to be complacent. The calmer Aiden seemed, the more uneasy Michael felt.

Aiden snorted, "You finally decided to show up. Sit down!"

###chapter 360  What Have You Done?

Michael nodded and sat down, bracing himself for a harsh scolding or, at worst, a physical beating from Aiden.

He was ready for the worst.

But instead, a steaming cup of coffee was placed in front of him.

Aiden spoke slowly, "Give it a try. A friend sent me this new blend."

Michael stared at the cup, momentarily stunned.

Aiden had made it sound so serious earlier, only to have him come over for a cup of coffee?

Aiden's emotions were always hard to read, his face a constant mask. Michael decided it was best not to bring up any sensitive topics.

Under Aiden's expectant gaze, Michael picked up the cup and took a small sip.

He wasn't much of a coffee drinker and knew little about it. Naturally, he couldn't offer any insightful comments on the coffee.

If he had to say something, he could only comment on the taste.

The strong coffee slid down his tongue, and the bitterness instantly made Michael, who was already hungover from the night before, furrow his brows.

Aiden's coffee was usually rich and aromatic, but today's coffee was absurdly bitter.

Before he could put the cup down, Aiden's voice rang out, "How does it taste?"

Michael looked up to see Aiden's serious expression. Not wanting to upset his grandfather, he forced himself to swallow.

"It's... unique."

"Glad you appreciate it. Have another cup. I wouldn't share this with just anyone."

Aiden raised an eyebrow and poured Michael another cup, watching him drink it all.

Michael's temple throbbed. If he couldn't see Aiden's intention by now, he didn't deserve to be the heir of the Brown Group.

But Aiden had spoken, so he had no choice but to drink.

Facing Aiden's "deliberate difficulty," Michael downed the cup of coffee in one gulp, the bitterness spreading from his tongue to his stomach.

His hangover was completely gone.

"Not bad. This coffee can only be appreciated by those who understand its flavor. I didn't expect someone your age to appreciate it."

Aiden said, placing another cup of coffee in front of Michael.

It was clear Aiden was making things difficult for Michael.

He was waiting to see when Michael would give in.

Looking at the increasingly bitter coffee in front of him, Michael had no choice but to surrender.

"Grandpa, I know you have issues with me. Just say what you need to say and stop torturing me."

Aiden had always treated him as his favorite child, speaking his mind directly.

Even when Aiden was angry, he would vent his anger with a good scolding.

Aiden's sudden change to a silent approach made Michael feel extremely tormented.

But Aiden didn't get angry. Instead, he calmly stared at Michael for a moment before suddenly smiling.

"Do you even know what good coffee is? I called you over to try a new coffee, and you say I'm torturing you?"

As he spoke, Aiden picked up the coffee pot and poured Michael another cup.

He raised his hand, "Drink up. Didn't you say you liked it?"

Michael finally understood.

If he didn't finish this pot of coffee, Aiden wouldn't speak the truth.

So he picked up the cup and downed the rest in one go, the bitterness numbing his lips.

Seeing Aiden about to brew another pot, Michael quickly stopped him, "Grandpa, please, give me a break. How much more do you want me to drink?"

He didn't want to touch another drop.

Hearing this, Aiden finally let him off, sneering, "So you do know what bitterness is? I thought you were so spoiled you didn't know what suffering was."

Michael was at a loss for words.

How was he supposed to know Aiden was waiting for him here?

But his situation with Isabella was exactly like this. He was suffering in silence.

"If you won't speak, then I will."

Aiden's demeanor changed instantly, his face cold, "Michael, tell me, what did you do to Isabella? Why would she return the gemstone pendant you gave her so heartbroken? Don't tell me you don't know why."

Michael felt a tightness in his chest at these words.

Before Aiden spoke, he only felt panic. But now that Aiden was asking these questions, he felt like a huge stone was pressing on his heart.

He could hardly breathe.

"Grandpa, I don't know what to say."

He hadn't told Isabella the significance of the gemstone pendant, only wanting her to wear it to fulfill a small wish of his.

But she had returned it in front of Aiden, saying she wouldn't reconcile with Michael.

She had made her stance clear, so any explanation now was pointless.

"You don't know what to say?"

Aiden frowned in anger, "I think you're too guilty to speak. I know Isabella's character well. If you hadn't wronged her, why would she be so heartbroken to return the pendant at her grandfather's funeral?"

"Do you still want to hide the truth from me? Tell me, what did you do to her?"

"Grandpa, believe me, I did nothing!"

Michael looked up at Aiden with unwavering determination.

Whether it was three years ago or now, he had misunderstood Isabella, but he had never betrayed their marriage.

He had never wronged her.

He had always liked her, and despite the misunderstandings and obstacles, he wasn't the kind of person to betray his feelings.

"Say that again?"

Aiden had always believed that the heir he had raised, despite some minor mistakes, would never cross the line of basic morality and integrity.

But now, he had to reconsider.

"How can you say that? How did that woman, Violet, come into our family? And that night at the lakeside cottage, do I need to spell out what you did?"

That night, not only he but also Isabella and the Wilson family had witnessed everything.

Even now, Michael wanted to deny it?

"Michael, I'm old, but that doesn't mean I can't find out the truth. When Isabella was pregnant, you claimed to have cut ties with Violet, but you secretly kept her and even brought her into the office. You've disgraced the Brown family!"

He turned around and got involved with those women.

###chapter 361  The Baby is Gone?

"Today, the mining site manager approached us for a partnership, saying that if this deal is profitable, they would consider a long-term agreement in the future!"

###chapter 362 She Cannot Cry

This incident made it clear that while the Adri Family was vast and powerful, their internal relationships were more tangled than Michael had imagined.

If he could find a weak spot, he could start to dismantle this enormous, mysterious family from within.

In situations where the other party was eager to cooperate, it was usually necessary to concede some benefits. If they agreed too readily, it might make them seem desperate.

The Wilson Family

###chapter 363 A Lot of Effort

###chapter 364 Stella Visits

No wonder this place was a playground for the wealthy; it was indeed luxury.

Not to mention the luxurious decor, a simple meal here started at six figures, and the coffee and fine wines were priced in the millions.

Bianca couldn't help but raise an eyebrow.

Although she had seen many good things while being with Michael, she had to maintain her innocent persona in front of him and never dared to show her materialistic side.

Michael had never brought her to a place like this.

But now, with that man by her side, she could go to any luxurious place she wanted just by asking.

After all, the man she was with controlled the economic lifeline of Auroria.

About ten minutes later, the door to the private room opened, and a tall man dressed in a black trench coat and sunglasses, looking like a celebrity, walked in.

Seeing his outfit, Bianca couldn't help but laugh sarcastically. "Are you afraid people won't notice you dressed like that?"

"What do you know?"

The man didn't care about Bianca's mockery. He walked straight to the main seat, pulled out a chair, and sat down, removing his sunglasses to reveal a perfect face.

Even though Bianca had seen it countless times, she couldn't help but linger her gaze on that face.

After all, it bore a seven or eight-point resemblance to Michael.

Seeing him was like seeing Michael.

Facing a face so similar to the man she loved, who wouldn't be moved?

But Bianca knew their differences better than anyone and quickly shifted her attention.

"Is this really necessary? Your identity isn't something to hide."

She said this, but Bianca knew better than anyone what would happen if Nolan's identity as the second son of the Brown Family were exposed.

Just the fact that he wasn't in a wheelchair would be enough for the media to go wild.

Not to mention the agreements he had with the Adri Family.

No matter how much she suffered, she always had a way out, even if it meant being the woman behind that man.

But Nolan was different.

He only had this one path. Success meant he would have the power and the woman he dreamed of; failure meant death.

Even if he could escape the Brown Family's revenge, he couldn't escape the Adri Family's pursuit.

That was the fate of being a pawn.

They both understood this but were deeply entangled nonetheless.

Nolan didn't bother explaining. He glanced at the menu in front of Bianca. "Why haven't you ordered yet?"

Without the low, husky voice from the voice changer on the phone, Nolan's real voice was gentle and pleasant, paired with his gentle demeanor, making him incredibly attractive.

He had no idea how many female students he attracted at Evergreen City University.

No wonder he dressed like that when he went out.

Bianca squinted and casually spun the menu towards Nolan. "You do it. It's too expensive; I don't dare to order."

All her money from the beauty salon had gone to the big boss, and her mother had spent quite a bit during that time, leaving her with little money.

She didn't dare bring up money with the big boss, fearing he would investigate her and Michael's affairs.

Nolan took the menu without saying anything, called the waiter, and ordered a few dishes before sending him out.

Once the food arrived, Nolan finally spoke slowly.

"Bianca, do you know why I asked you here?"

She deliberately looked up and laughed. "It can't be that you know I'm leaving and wanted to give me a farewell, right?"

Bianca wasn't stupid; she knew what Nolan cared about most. But the deed was done, so what could he do?

She had the big boss behind her, and she bet he wouldn't dare do anything to her.

Nolan didn't beat around the bush and asked directly, "I need to confirm something with you face-to-face. Did you arrange for Isabella to lose her baby?"

Nolan's eyes were sharp.

He had planted someone in the Brown Villa, and an accidental phone call from Aiden had exposed the matter.

As soon as he got the news, he guessed who was behind it.

He had been busy planning a big move, which had diverted his attention from Isabella.

He didn't expect Bianca to take advantage of that.

That was the child Isabella had longed for, and now it was gone. She must be devastated.

"Didn't I tell you not to touch her?"

"You can target anyone in Evergreen City, but not Isabella."

He wouldn't allow anything to happen to Isabella under his watch, not even a little.

In Nolan's heart, no one was more important than Isabella. Not even himself.

"Nolan, are you feeling sorry for her?"

Bianca sneered, looking at Nolan with a completely uncomprehending expression.

"What do you think?"

Nolan had always thought Bianca was a bit unhinged, and now it seemed she was a lunatic to the core.

"I told you before, Isabella will choose me in the future. The person she loves has always been me, not Michael. Why can't you let her go?"

Nolan had already confirmed with Michael that Isabella's marriage to him was a mistake.

She had always loved Nolan.

Nolan and Isabella were the perfect match. Now that he was back, Isabella should be his, and no one could take her away.

Why did Bianca have to target Isabella so relentlessly?

So when he heard Bianca was leaving the country, he was more relieved than anyone.

"Let her go?"

Bianca sneered. "Nolan, do you hear yourself? Isabella killed my parents. Do you think I can let her go?"

"Besides, I only made her lose her baby, not killed her. Do you have to question me like this? Isn't it better for you if she loses the baby? If you want to be with her, do you really want to raise a child that's not your own?"

###chapter 367 Only Michael

The most important thing was that Michael had fallen in love with Isabella.

But Michael was the man Bianca had always dreamed of having.

But Bianca would never let Nolan hear about this.

When they returned to the country, they had set their goals.

She wanted Michael.

Nolan wanted Isabella.

She just wanted Michael, no matter what means she had to use.

Even if the kid in Isabella's belly was Michael's, so what? Whether the kid called Nolan uncle or dad, he didn't see a problem.

But unfortunately, she would never get Michael's love.

Since she couldn't have it, why should that tramp Isabella have a happy life?

What she couldn't have, Isabella shouldn't have either.

Every word Bianca said was like a needle piercing Nolan's heart.

He had no words.

His love for Isabella was unquestionable. As long as she agreed to marry him, he was willing to accept everything about her.

But if that kid was really born, would Michael let it go?

That was Isabella and Michael's kid. If Michael insisted on using the kid to harass Isabella, to morally bind her.

Just as Bianca said, Michael and their kid standing together as a family, while Nolan was ignored like an outsider, would he really not care?

Not to mention the intimate nights Isabella and Michael had shared.

Nolan frowned, neither agreeing nor disagreeing, but he didn't outright reject Bianca's plan.

Bianca could see his silent approval. Men, after all, were like that. They had a strange possessiveness over everything in their territory.

Although he didn't agree with Bianca's underhanded methods, she had indeed made it impossible for Isabella and Michael's relationship to reconcile.

Such a blunt request from Bianca didn't make her feel embarrassed at all.

Bianca always said he was stubborn, with his mind only on Isabella. But wasn't she the same?

Now she was about to leave the country and return to that person, yet her last wish was to sleep with Michael?

"Is it so strange that I have feelings for him? I've liked him for a long time."

Bianca casually ate something, took out a cigarette from her bag, and lit it. In front of her partner, Nolan, she no longer needed to hide her true self.

Thinking of Isabella seeing photos of her and Michael in bed, Bianca felt a rush of satisfaction.

But Nolan was clearly skeptical.

She had originally thought that if she could return to Michael's side, she would be willing to give up her life. She was delusional.

He knew about the warehouse kidnapping last time. Isabella had borrowed his men. Although he found out later that Isabella was the one kidnapped, fortunately, she was unharmed.

But his subordinates had reported every detail of the warehouse to him. Michael had treated her like that. She still wanted to sleep with Michael?

He even wondered if Bianca had some kind of masochistic tendency.

###chapter 368 As Long As I Get Him

Bianca's nearly crazed look piqued Nolan's interest.

But if it could disgust Michael, it was a tempting idea.

Michael wasn't someone who could be easily outsmarted.

If it weren't for the protection of that man, she wouldn't have come back so easily, doing whatever she pleased.

It was all thanks to that man.

Michael was nothing to her. At worst, she'd sleep with him and leave. What could happen?

Bianca didn't care. Whether Michael was looking for her or not, she wanted to see him.

After all, they had met in that embarrassing situation.

The big boss knew what her body had been through.

Auroria was a chaotic place. For a weak woman to survive, she had to rely on her body.

If she hadn't met the big boss there, she wouldn't have survived three months.

For someone in his position, a person's value was all that mattered.

Even if she slept with other men, the big boss wouldn't abandon her.

And as long as she kept it secret, he wouldn't find out.

Bianca smiled smugly, exhaling a puff of smoke.

She was already fantasizing about being with Michael.

"What's going on? Why isn't Mr. Brown here yet?"

"The company spent a fortune to host this at Celestial Dining. The Brown Group can't just ignore us."

The anxious man was Levi Morgan, owner of a cosmetic medical company in Evergreen City.

They had been trying to collaborate with the Brown Group for a long time and finally got a meeting. He booked the most luxurious Celestial Dining to discuss the opportunity.

But they had been waiting for nearly an hour, and no one had shown up.

As a seasoned businessman, he had never been treated like this.

His assistant quickly tried to calm him down.

"Mr. Morgan, please don't worry. We've called the Brown Group many times to arrange this. We can't give up now."

"And they promised Mr. Brown would come. A company that big wouldn't break their word. Think about the $50 million profit we'll make if we sign this deal!"

Levi saw the logic in that.

For $50 million, he could wait another hour.

Seeing the empty hallway, the assistant opened the private room door, inviting Levi inside.

"Alright, let's wait inside."

As the door closed, the elevator at the end of the hallway opened, and out stepped Michael in a charcoal gray suit, accompanied by a female assistant briefing him on the client.

"Mr. Brown, Innovations Group is very sincere. Their new product just launched, and they came to us first. I researched them; they have years of experience in cosmetic medicine and a good reputation."

"Most importantly, their new product's price is fair, even discounted. If we sign, we could gain nearly half the profit."

The assistant listed the project's advantages, but Michael immediately saw the flaw.

"Good quality, good reputation, yet they're giving us all the profit? Why?"

Business was about profit.

No one gave away money. If they did, why bother?

And a small company like theirs would want to profit and gain free advertising by partnering with the Brown Group.

He had never heard of a company willing to give up half their profit for a deal.

###chapter 369 Completely Disheartened

Michael never believed in such good luck. If it existed, it was probably a trap set just for him.

The assistant thought for a moment and suggested, "Maybe their CEO wants to use this collaboration to boost their reputation and expand their market?"

Over the years, many small businesses had used their partnerships with the Brown Group to get free advertising.

Michael raised an eyebrow. "Yeah, that makes sense."

He didn't dwell on it further.

A small company wasn't worth his time and effort.

Whether they genuinely wanted to collaborate or were setting a trap, he'd find out soon enough.

That voice?

Because she no longer had feelings for Michael.

###chapter 370 Don't Avoid Me, Okay?

Isabella was free now.

Did she like Emilio?

In Isabella's mind, he had never been her first choice.

She was truly heartless. She had stopped loving him just like that.

Emilio affectionately patted her head and led her away from Michael.

From start to finish, Isabella didn't look at Michael again.

All her tenderness and affection were for Emilio.

Michael could see that Isabella was doing this on purpose, but even if she was acting, he had to grit his teeth and close his eyes tightly.

He couldn't bear to watch.

He was afraid he would lose control and beat Emilio half to death right in front of Isabella.

She was doing this on purpose.

She just wanted him to back off and accept their impending divorce.

###chapter 373 Thomas's Phone Call
