She knew she still had some hold over him, but given his status and background, how could he drop everything and risk his safety to fly to the other side of the world just to save her?

Could he really be in love with her?

As this thought crossed her mind, Bianca almost wanted to celebrate.

What did Michael matter now? The man she was with now was far superior.

She threw herself into his arms, expressing her love with emotion.

"Mr. Earl Adri, thank goodness you came. Otherwise, I would've been dead."

She felt foolish.

With such a powerful and loving Earl by her side, why did she ever come back to Michael, who didn't love her?

If Earl hadn't taken her back then, she would've died under those disgusting men.

Now that Earl had gone to such lengths for her, what else could she not let go of?

"Earl, take me away. I promise I'll never leave you again. I'll stay wherever you want me to, okay?"

Bianca looked at him with teary eyes. If she didn't leave now, who knew when Michael might go crazy and kill her.

The only one who could save her now was Earl.

She had to hold on to Earl tightly.

"Alright, we'll leave in a bit and never come back here."

Earl agreed without hesitation.

Bianca was almost overwhelmed with happiness. Besides being possessive and a bit cold, Earl met all her requirements.

With his family's backing, as long as she behaved, she would live a life of luxury.

And she could easily escape from Michael. How could she let go of such a good thing?

Just then, Michael arrived outside the door.

He glanced at Earl and Bianca inside, then focused on Earl, speaking in a low voice.

"Mr. Earl Adri, the deal is done. You can leave."

Earlier, he had called Aaron to find out Earl's identity.

Earl Adri, the most capable heir of the Adri Family, and the eldest son of the previous family head, was highly trusted within the family.

He had taken over family affairs at a young age and quickly built his own empire and influence.

"What deal?"

Bianca was stunned. She understood Michael was letting her go.

But he was Michael. He hated her and wanted her dead. Why would he suddenly let her go?

"Earl, what deal did you make with him?"

Bianca instinctively asked Earl.

She wasn't worried about Earl or moved by this. She just didn't want Michael to gain anything from her.

He almost killed her, and now he wanted to profit from her?

How could he have the nerve to do that?

Earl frowned and pulled Bianca close. "This isn't your concern. Let's go home."

"No!"

Bianca's eyes were red as she looked at Michael outside the door. "Why? Michael, why are you still using me?"

She had been the victim all these years.

For him, she willingly stayed abroad for three years to be worthy of him, and what did he do? He married Isabella.

What did he take her for?

She was unwilling to accept this.

Michael's cold eyes narrowed, suppressing his anger.

"Alright, that's it. We should go."

Earl stood up, giving Bianca no chance to speak, and took her away.

Standing by the window, Michael could see the private jet across the way.

Watching Earl lead Bianca onto the luxurious jet, his eyes darkened.

This was his first contact with the Adri Family.

For Bianca, Earl had given him the largest diamond mine in the area?

It seemed too easy, and Michael felt a vague unease.

This mysterious family had initially spent considerable resources to get close to him for the power of the Brown and Wilson Families.

But now they suddenly handed over their interests.

It didn't seem that simple.

Unless, in the eyes of the Adri Family, there was something even more valuable.

###chapter 388  Can't Let Go

The bodyguard trailing behind couldn't help but ask, "Mr. Brown, after everything Bianca did to you, you're just gonna let her go?"

With the Adri Family's protection, trying to capture Bianca again would be nearly impossible. Even a bodyguard like him could see that. How couldn't Michael know that?

As the plane slowly took off, Michael withdrew his gaze and said in a deep voice, "Letting her go doesn't mean letting her off the hook. Things aren't over yet. The more impatient we are, the more likely we are to lose everything."

Although he knew Bianca was responsible for his child's death, he lacked the crucial piece of evidence. On the day Isabella was poisoned, Bianca had an alibi. Moreover, the person who administered the poison was her subordinate, not Bianca herself. With just the hospital report, he couldn't do anything to Bianca.

Instead of illegally detaining her, it was better to sell a favor to the Adri Family. This way, the Brown Group could quickly gain the benefits they wanted, and Bianca would be far from the country. Only then would Isabella be safe.

However, letting Bianca off the hook was absolutely impossible. The death of their child, Daniel, and her kidnapping of Isabella-these were things he could never easily forgive. As soon as he had the evidence, no matter where she was, he would find a way to capture her and bring her to justice.

What happened next was just as Michael had anticipated. The mining project fell into the hands of the Brown Group after the Adri Family withdrew. The contract was signed on the day of the collaboration, and the project proceeded as scheduled. The next step was to send professionals to start mining.

After finalizing the details and ensuring the project was on track, Aaron immediately flew back to Evergreen City. Without taking a break, Aaron went straight to the Brown Group to see Michael after landing.

"Aaron, you've worked hard during this time."

Seeing him return safely, Michael stood up and patted his shoulder. Because Aaron was the person he trusted the most, he felt comfortable sending him on this mission. However, seeing Aaron's pale and exhausted face, Michael didn't need to guess how hard he had worked.

"Mr. Brown, why are you being so polite with me all of a sudden? I'm just doing my job for the company. It's what I should do."

Aaron scratched his head, feeling a bit embarrassed by Michael's praise. Michael smiled and nodded, not continuing with the formalities. He turned and asked his secretary to bring two cups of coffee, inviting Aaron to sit on the couch and rest for a while. They chatted as they drank their coffee.

When the coffee arrived, Michael was already sitting across from Aaron. He took a sip and suddenly asked, "Now that you're back, aren't you planning to see Renee?"

Aaron paused with his coffee cup in hand, then smiled bitterly and shook his head. "I'd better not. My presence would only add to her troubles. She doesn't want to see me, so why should I bother her?"

With the Auroria project completed, he finally felt the pressure lift from his shoulders. From the moment he boarded the plane to leave the country, he didn't dare think about the possibility of a future with Renee. He buried himself in work, not allowing himself a moment's rest.

As soon as he had a moment to think, his mind would involuntarily replay Renee's words of rejection and the disappointment in her eyes.

He had thought that if he explained himself and promised never to hurt her again, she would forgive him. After all, he had turned off his phone for work, and he thought she would understand. But he had forgotten the fear and trauma Renee had experienced during the assassination attempt. From start to finish, he had only considered things from his own perspective. He had never truly put himself in her shoes.

And that time, insisting on seeing her had even led to Isabella's kidnapping and brought disaster to the Wilson Family. Even though he was back now, he didn't have the face to appear before Renee and Isabella.

"Aaron," Michael said, pursing his lips. "Honestly, can you really let her go?"

Aaron sighed. "Mr. Brown, if I could let her go, I wouldn't have gone abroad. But now, I no longer have the right to stay by her side."

He hadn't understood, thinking Renee was just threatened. But this time, having directly dealt with the Adri Family, he knew the extent of their power and ruthlessness. Their so-called "clean-up" meant killing to silence. He didn't even want to imagine what would have happened if Renee hadn't encountered Isabella's help that day. And where was he at that time? He hadn't even turned on his phone, completely absorbed in his work. Did he still have the right to ask for her forgiveness? Aaron couldn't even bring himself to say these words.

Michael looked at Aaron's dejected expression and couldn't help but think of himself. Isabella's attitude towards him was no different. He could hardly even see her now. In that moment, the large office was filled with silence, as two men troubled by love sat together, both lost in their own thoughts.

After a while, Michael put down his coffee cup and spoke to Aaron with heartfelt sincerity. "If you don't want to disturb her anymore, then letting go might be for the best."

Let go? Let go of who, and how? Aaron was suddenly pulled back to reality by Michael's words, and the first image that came to his mind was Renee's face, sometimes cold, sometimes lively. To be honest, he couldn't let her go. But he didn't want to talk about himself anymore. He was more curious about Michael and Isabella.

His eyes flickered. "Mr. Brown, have you let go of Mrs. Brown?"

After all, with the changes in the Wilson Family, Isabella and Michael's relationship must have worsened. But he could see clearly that ever since Isabella got pregnant, Michael had lost his heart to her. And Isabella had feelings for Michael too. But their misunderstandings ran deep, and resolving them would require time and mutual trust. He just didn't know if Michael was willing to keep trying.

Michael didn't know how to answer Aaron for a moment. Aaron and he were different. Aaron and Renee had just missed the right timing, and with some effort, they still had a chance. But Michael and Isabella had too many unresolved issues. Any one of those issues was a complex problem. He had never thought of letting go, but whether this marriage could be saved was no longer up to him alone.

Thinking of this, a trace of sadness crossed Michael's eyes. "My situation is different. Whether I can let go is no longer something I can decide on my own."

###chapter 389 He is Nolan

Michael quickly pulled himself together.

"I'm not giving up. As long as there's a chance, I'm gonna keep trying."

The guilt he felt about Isabella had been keeping him up at night. If he truly lost her, he couldn't imagine how he'd handle it.

With that thought, Michael turned to Aaron and said, "That goes for you too."

Men didn't need many words to understand each other; a single glance was enough.

"Thanks, Mr. Brown. Let's hope we both get a good outcome."

Aaron still had debts to settle with Renee. He couldn't leave until he made things right.

Michael glanced at his watch and suddenly stood up. "I gotta head out. You don't need to come with me. Take a couple of days off to rest."

Aaron quickly stood up, respectfully saying, "Mr. Brown, I can start working now. The files from Auroria need my attention, and I want to get them organized ASAP."

Seeing Aaron's determination, Michael understood that Aaron just wanted to keep himself busy to avoid thinking about Renee.

Michael nodded in agreement. "Alright, stay here and get the Auroria files sorted. I'll review them when I get back. But don't overwork yourself. Head home this afternoon."

"Yes, Mr. Brown."

Michael grabbed his coat from the chair, and as he did, a small, shiny object fell to the carpet.

Aaron looked down and saw a small silver bear charm, the kind you'd attach to a phone.

Michael never showed interest in such trinkets. When did he start carrying something so childish?

Michael had already put on his coat and hadn't noticed the fallen charm. Aaron picked it up and handed it to him. "Mr. Brown, is this yours?"

Michael turned at the sound of Aaron's voice and saw the bear charm in his hand. He paused, realizing it had fallen from his pocket.

He nodded and carefully placed the charm back into his coat pocket, patting it gently.

"Thanks. It would've been a disaster if I'd lost it outside."

Aaron was taken aback, then asked, "Did Mrs. Brown give this to you?"

In his mind, anything Michael valued this much had to be related to Isabella.

But Michael shook his head.

"No, but I wish it was her."

If Isabella had been the one to save him back then, he wouldn't have had to search so desperately.

Aaron's question reminded him of something. "By the way, now that you're back, I have an important task for you. Help me investigate something. It's crucial for me."

No matter what, he had to find the person who saved his life all those years ago.

Time might have passed, but he was determined to uncover the truth.

Michael explained the task to Aaron in detail, giving him access to any resources within the Brown Family to get answers as quickly as possible.

"I just want the truth. Got it?"

"Understood."

With that, Michael grabbed his coat and left.

It was the end of the year, and most of the company's affairs were settled. The Auroria project had also wrapped up early.

Michael didn't have any urgent business to attend to.

The real reason he was in such a hurry to leave was to meet someone.

As he stepped into the café, Michael immediately spotted the person sitting by the window.

The man bore a striking resemblance to him. If not for their vastly different personalities, many might mistake them for each other.

Isabella probably married Michael because of this resemblance, didn't she?

It was ironic. All these years, she had only seen him as a stand-in for Nolan, not for who he truly was.

Michael approached the table and sat down. Unlike Michael, Nolan was in his wheelchair, making their heights slightly different.

Despite this, Nolan remained calm and composed, seemingly unbothered by the disparity.

His deep, penetrating eyes seemed to see through everything.

Meeting Michael's gaze, Nolan's expression was indifferent. "Why'd you call me out here?"

Nolan, who usually avoided any interaction with him, had actually reached out to request a meeting.

Michael had been puzzled until he learned that Nolan had abruptly resigned from Evergreen City University three days ago.

It was Nolan's first job after returning to the country, one he had eagerly taken up. Yet, after just a few months, he had quit.

For someone as steady as Nolan, this was highly unusual.

"Michael, I'm no longer teaching at Evergreen City University."

Nolan didn't beat around the bush. He placed a document in front of Michael.

It was a termination of his employment contract.

Michael narrowed his eyes. He already knew about this, but he was curious why Nolan felt the need to inform him.

When had their relationship become so close?

Nolan seemed to view Michael as a rival, and Michael felt the same way about Nolan.

"So, what are you trying to tell me?"

Michael asked calmly, raising an eyebrow.

Nolan had quit his job and immediately sought out Michael. Did he expect Michael to find him a new job?

Ridiculous.

This was Nolan!

He was the man who had once single-handedly taken control of the Brown Group, even managing to build a successful career abroad after leaving.

Someone as cunning and strategic as Nolan wouldn't be short of job opportunities.

But to Michael's surprise, Nolan seemed to read his thoughts.

"I want a job that matches my status."

Nolan's tone was serious, his eyes locked onto Michael's, showing no hint of jest.

Michael's expression tightened, and he sat up straighter, a cold smile forming. "A job that matches your status? Are you eyeing my position, planning to take over?"

Michael laid it out plainly.

Nolan had called him out to discuss this, revealing his ambitions, huh?

Since that was the case, there was no need to pretend otherwise.

Back then, Michael might not have been as knowledgeable about running the company as Nolan, but three years had passed. He was no longer the same Michael.

The Brown Group was firmly under his control now.

Nolan couldn't just waltz in and take it away.

###chapter 390 Painful Memories

Before Nolan could get a word in, Michael jumped at the chance.

"Look, the Brown Group might be under my management, but I don't make all the calls on personnel changes. If you're thinking about this, you should really talk to Grandpa first."

"If he gives you the green light to take over the company, I won't stand in your way."

Michael spread his hands, acting like he was giving Nolan all the power to decide.

But in reality, the real authority was still with Michael.

Sure enough, Nolan's face darkened at this.

"Michael, what are you trying to pull? Don't think I don't know what's going on. Ever since you took over the Brown Group, Grandpa hasn't been involved in the company's affairs. How could he possibly agree to this if I talk to him?"

"You're just bringing up Grandpa because you're scared I'll take what you have, aren't you?"

Memories of the past rushed back to Nolan. Every time he thought about that day, it felt like a dagger to his pride.

Back when the Brown Group was in crisis and Aiden fell seriously ill, the whole company was in chaos.

At that time, Nolan was the most suitable candidate.

So, even though he never planned on taking over the Brown Group, Nolan was thrust into the role of CEO as a last resort.

Within a year, he had the Brown Group back on track, and by then, Aiden had mostly recovered.

Nolan thought he could step down, but Grandpa's health took a turn for the worse after surgery, making it impossible for him to handle the high-stress work and social engagements.

So, the entire burden of the Brown Group fell on Nolan's shoulders for three whole years.

To live up to Grandpa's trust, Nolan worked tirelessly every day, and his efforts paid off.

Under his leadership, the Brown Group thrived, and his status within the Brown Family grew increasingly important.

Even Grandpa often praised his business acumen.

Being recognized and encouraged made Nolan believe this was his life's purpose.

He was even willing to dedicate his entire life to it.

He worked harder, for the Brown Group and for himself, pushing himself to become stronger.

At that time, his reputation in Evergreen City was unmatched, and he was in the spotlight.

He thought it would always be this way.

After all, his older cousin had no interest in business and had moved abroad with his family, leaving only Michael and him in the family.

Michael, at that time, was in his rebellious phase and showed no interest in managing the company. In fact, he often expressed his disdain for it.

And Grandpa doted on Michael, the youngest grandson, indulging his every whim.

Since Michael disliked it, Nolan naturally wouldn't force him.

So, the Brown Group would eventually fall into Nolan's hands.

He even felt a bit guilty towards Michael, thinking that once the Brown Group grew stronger, he could just support Michael financially, as long as he stayed out of trouble.

It wasn't because Nolan particularly liked Michael as a brother, but because only during those three years of managing the Brown Group did he find his true purpose.

That feeling was something only he understood.

Until that day came, and his world collapsed.

On Michael's twentieth birthday, the Brown Family threw a grand party, attended by nearly all the elite of Evergreen City.

It was then that Aiden, holding Michael's hand, made the big announcement.

He was handing over the entire Brown Group to Michael.

Nolan, the current manager, felt like a complete joke at that moment.

People around him clapped and congratulated, but Nolan's mind went blank. He couldn't hear a single word after that.

After the party, Aiden called them both into the study.

He placed a prepared appointment document in front of them.

Nolan wasn't the only one stunned; Michael, suddenly thrust into this position, was equally shocked.

What was supposed to be an ordinary birthday party had turned into this?

Nolan didn't care about anyone else's reactions. He just wanted to understand what was happening.

But Aiden spoke first.

"Nolan, I know you've worked hard managing the company these past few years. Now that your brother Michael is old enough to take on the responsibility, you can relax and not be so tightly wound, stuck in the company all day."

Nolan was speechless.

Was Grandpa pushing him out?

But how could he just leave? He forced himself to stay calm, but inside, he was on the verge of breaking down.

"Grandpa, is it because I'm not doing well enough that you want to push me out of the company? Tell me, and I'll change, okay?"

In three years, he had poured all his efforts into the Brown Group.

Now that the company was thriving, Grandpa wanted to hand it all over to Michael, who knew nothing about it.

What did Nolan's years of dedication count for?

Nolan panicked.

He grabbed Aiden's hand, pleading, "Grandpa, I don't want to leave the company. I don't know what else I could do if I leave. Please, let me stay."

Before, he might have longed to leave the Brown Family and go somewhere far away.

But after taking over the Brown Group at such a young age, he had devoted himself entirely to its management. Over the years, he had come to see the company as his future.

He didn't know what he would do if he left.

But this time, Aiden pushed him away, speaking seriously and firmly.

"Nolan, just because I haven't said anything doesn't mean I don't care. Your position means you can never take over the Brown Group. I didn't explain this before out of consideration for your feelings, but today I'll make it clear."

"Everything in the Brown Family has been destined for Michael since he was born. No one can take that away."

"You were just a temporary stand-in while he was too young. I've already let you hold this position for three years out of gratitude for your contributions to the Brown Group. Do you still want to keep it?"

Aiden's words extinguished the last hope in Nolan's eyes.

From the beginning, in Aiden's eyes, there was only Michael.

Nolan was just a temporary substitute.

His efforts, his hard work, were never truly valued. To them, the fact that he could even be involved in the company's affairs was a great fortune.

He was only allowed in because Michael wasn't grown up yet.

How ironic.

Nolan couldn't even dream of having those that Michael didn't want?

This was the reality of a wealthy family.

Nolan felt a sharp pain in his chest.

He wanted to say more, but Grandpa's stern gaze silenced him.

How could a child ignored by everyone ever hope to be favored?

Asking further would only bring more humiliation.

###chapter 391 She Has Someone Else Beside Her

Ever since he was a kid, no matter how well Nolan did, all he ever got from his grandpa was a slight nod and a faint smile.

But Michael? He could get everyone's praise without even trying.

Even if he just poured Aiden a cup of coffee, he'd get praised for ages.

Over time, even the household staff could see where Nolan stood in the family and stopped asking for his opinion on anything.

He became the most overlooked person in the family.

Apart from normal interactions at school, he could hardly find anyone to talk to.

He had never experienced a shred of familial warmth.

Meanwhile, as the youngest child of the Brown Family, Michael effortlessly got everything Nolan ever wanted.

Having grown up watching the Brown Family shower Michael with love and affection, how could Nolan not be envious?

Sometimes, he couldn't help but think: if Michael didn't exist in this family, would he be the one receiving all the love?

But later, he found his sense of worth in the company.

He also felt a sense of recognition from the family.

But those were just illusions in his mind.

The company was handed to him to manage simply because Michael was still too young.

Once Michael grew up, Nolan became the one to be pushed aside.

Realizing this, Nolan felt like a joke from beginning to end.

He couldn't stay in Evergreen City any longer.

So, he chose to leave and go abroad.

Now, three years later, his absence hadn't affected the Brown Family at all, just as they had never cared about him in the first place.

Seeing Nolan lost in thought, Michael didn't say much more.

After all, no matter what he said, Nolan wouldn't believe him.

"If you want to come back to the company, you'll have to go through Grandpa. I can't make that call."

Michael added in a calm tone, "Like I said before, as long as Grandpa agrees, I have no problem with you joining the company."

Even though he now held all the power in the Brown Group, anything concerning Nolan had to go through their grandfather.

That was the Brown Family's rule.

There could only be one person in charge, and if anyone else wanted to compete, it would depend on their own abilities.

Unless Nolan was willing to lower himself and become just an employee, working without any shares.

But would this proud Nolan ever agree to that?

Michael's gaze returned to Nolan, narrowing his eyes as he looked at him.

Suddenly, a familiar thought crossed his mind.

Hadn't he seen this figure somewhere before?

Right, Celestial Dining?

Hearing Michael's words, Nolan didn't care at all.

"I called you here just to inform you of this. Whether you agree or not, I will return to the company."

Nolan understood Michael's meaning very well.

Everyone in Evergreen City's upper circles knew how much Aiden doted on Michael, his youngest grandson.

Back then, the person who most opposed Nolan joining the company was Aiden. If he brought up returning to the company, he would likely be kicked out again before he even started.

Nolan had already prepared thoroughly before today.

He wasn't seeking anyone's approval; he was making an announcement.

Whether it was Aiden or Michael, no one could stop him from reclaiming what was his.

He was determined to take over the Brown Group.

Facing Nolan's challenge, Michael raised an eyebrow. "Since you're so sure you can get into the company, I have nothing more to say."

Michael didn't take it too seriously. After all, Nolan had been away from Evergreen City for three years, and much had changed.

The company was no longer what it was three years ago.

But before leaving, there was something Michael needed to clarify with Nolan.

"By the way, I forgot to mention, Isabella and I are getting divorced."

Isabella had directly contacted the court for the divorce agreement, and she hadn't asked for a penny in the property division. Now, they were just waiting for the court to send the lawyer's letter with the hearing date.

Thomas was handling the entire matter, and as a top lawyer, he was likely working on the case with urgency.

Given Thomas's hostility towards him, he wouldn't allow any further entanglement between Michael and Isabella.

"Congratulations. Isabella can finally be free."

Nolan no longer cared about his familial ties with Michael. He just wanted Isabella to leave Michael as soon as possible.

Only then would he have a chance to be with her.

After waiting so long, he was thrilled to finally see a result.

But he knew he couldn't provoke Michael at this moment. "Michael, I've told you before, Isabella doesn't like you. Being together was a mistake. Now that you're separating, it's good for both of you."

"With your qualities, you won't have trouble finding someone new."

As for Isabella, Nolan would be the one to protect her in the future.

After their divorce, he believed Isabella wouldn't have any feelings for Michael anymore.

And this was the perfect time for Nolan to pursue Isabella.

Nolan had already planned everything in his mind. Since Michael knew Isabella liked him, he didn't need to hide his feelings for her anymore.

In the end, he was certain he would be the one with Isabella.

Hearing this, Michael felt nothing but irony.

He was getting divorced, while his own brother couldn't offer a word of comfort, instead eagerly wanting to be with his wife?

But Nolan seemed to overestimate his own charm.

"Nolan, do you really think that after we divorce, she will choose you without hesitation?"

"What do you mean?"

Nolan frowned.

Could it be that someone else had appeared in Isabella's life while he was busy with his plans?

Michael's lips curled into a cold smile.

Yes, this was the reaction he wanted from Nolan.

Why should he suffer the pain of losing Isabella while Nolan flaunted her love for him?

He hadn't forgotten seeing Isabella and Emilio holding hands at Celestial Dining.

"I'll tell you, Isabella already has someone else, and you have no chance."

His words successfully made Nolan feel a sense of crisis.

"Who is it?"

Nolan didn't believe it. For so many years, Isabella had only had Michael in her heart. Even if she wanted a divorce, she couldn't have fallen for someone else so quickly.

"Michael, are you making this up to scare me?"

###chapter 392 She Doesn't Want Him Anymore

The more Nolan thought about it, the more impossible it seemed.

It felt like Michael was just making up lies to mess with him.

He trusted Isabella; she wouldn't just be with someone so casually.

Michael, tired of arguing, smirked. "I don't have time to waste on lies. What would I gain from deceiving you about this?"

"Since you want to know, I'll tell you the truth. That guy is Emilio, Isabella's childhood friend and currently the vice president of the Wilson Group. He handles everything for Isabella."

"Plus, he's got the unanimous approval of Isabella's five uncles. They've been wanting to set him up with Isabella for a long time."

Michael said this last part deliberately.

Although he wasn't sure how Emilio was perceived by Isabella's uncles, the fact that they were willing to let Isabella go on a date with him was proof enough of their intentions.

So, Nolan couldn't be the only one feeling jealous.

Nolan wanted to compete with him for Isabella, right? How could he miss out on such news? If they were both losers in love, at least he wouldn't be the only one suffering.

He saw Nolan freeze upon hearing the news.

Michael couldn't help but ask, "Nolan, don't tell me you haven't even heard of your 'rival'?"

Nolan's face showed a hint of discomfort. He picked up his coffee cup to hide it.

"I know him."

When Isabella found out she was pregnant, she stopped managing the company and hired a professional to take over.

That person was Emilio.

Isabella had only mentioned that Emilio was a trustworthy friend.

But he hadn't expected Emilio to have feelings for Isabella too?

It was his fault for being so focused on his plans to break into the Brown Group that he neglected Isabella.

Michael's mocking voice interrupted his thoughts again.

"Nolan, I've looked into Emilio's background. I have to say he's a formidable opponent. Have you figured out how to deal with him?"

A man who could earn Isabella's trust and take over the entire Wilson Group must have extraordinary abilities.

From what he observed, the Wilson Group's recent success in Evergreen City was all thanks to Emilio's strategies.

Emilio was sharp and meticulous, with family support behind him, making him the perfect candidate for a family alliance.

No wonder Isabella's uncles were so united on this matter. They had already chosen a match for her.

As soon as Michael let go, Isabella would become his girlfriend.

Their plan was well thought out.

"This is my personal matter. How I handle it is none of your business."

With that, Nolan put down his coffee cup and wheeled himself away.

Leaving Michael alone on the couch, feeling desolate.

What he didn't say was, if Isabella truly developed feelings for Emilio, what would he do then?

If she didn't want him anymore, where could he go?

Isabella, sitting in her room, sneezed and rubbed her nose, looking helplessly at the gloomy weather outside. Was she catching a cold?

Why was she sneezing so much?

Meanwhile, the A4 papers on her desk were filled with messy sheet music, none of which satisfied her.

The more anxious she got, the harder it was to find inspiration. She put down her pen in frustration.

She had revised it three times already.

But the melody was still not good enough

She bit her lip, wanting to make changes, but the more she altered it, the more it lost its original soul.

In a fit of frustration, she crumpled the papers into a ball and tossed them into the trash can.

Maybe she was just too agitated these past few days. Every time she tried to calm down, all she could think about was Michael and Bianca together that night.

She sighed deeply.

She wanted to forget Michael more than anyone.

The repeated hurt he caused her over the years had built up her disappointment. This marriage had no reason to continue.

But why, even at this point, couldn't she stop thinking about him?

Why did he still affect her emotions?

She knew the outcome, so why couldn't she let herself move on?

He never loved her.

A deep sense of helplessness welled up inside her. Isabella held her throbbing head, staring blankly at the pile of empty papers in front of her.

Olivia had given her a tight deadline. In two months, her new song would be released.

She had to finish the remaining sheet music within a month.

Everything else was done; only the main track was left.

But for some reason, her state of mind had been terrible these past few days.

She couldn't focus at all.

Just then, a familiar voice came from downstairs. Olivia ran up to the second floor and knocked on Isabella's door.

"Isabella, I'm here to see you. Are you in there? Open the door for me, please?"

Isabella didn't say anything. She just got up and opened the door, letting Olivia in.

Seeing Isabella's lifeless appearance, the messy papers on the desk, and the piano by the window, Olivia didn't need to guess what had happened.

"Isabella, are you stuck with writer's block?"

She had already spoken to Isabella's manager on the way over.

The other songs, after Isabella's touch, were completed beautifully and had a unique style. Only the final main track was left.

Isabella, seeing that Olivia had figured it out, didn't hide it anymore. She nodded helplessly and sat in a chair, hugging her knees and staring at the half-written music on the desk.

She looked completely drained.

Olivia felt guilty. It was her fault for asking Isabella to take on this task. Isabella was dealing with a divorce from Michael. Her mood couldn't be good, so how could she find inspiration to write new music?

"Isabella, don't stay cooped up in here. Let's take a break."

Olivia, feeling sorry for her, pulled Isabella up and said seriously, "It's just a song. It's not like I can't live without it. There are plenty of people who can write it. Why not let someone else do it?"

"How about I take you out to clear your mind?"

Olivia had already planned this. She had worked like crazy to carve out a two-week vacation.

Now, she didn't want to do anything but take Isabella abroad for a good time.

With Daniel's death, Isabella losing her child, and now Michael refusing to divorce, Isabella was in a tough spot.

If she didn't get out and take a break, what if she fell ill from the stress?

"Sure, where to?"

Isabella also wanted to leave for a while. Out of sight, out of mind.

"Anywhere you want. Just the two of us. Whether it's shopping in Paris or watching the sea in the Maldives, I'll go with you wherever you want to go."

###chapter 393  Prank

Just as Olivia was about to book a flight on her phone, a stern voice suddenly rang out from outside the door.

"No way! Isabella, have you forgotten you just got better?"

Renee stood at the door, looking exasperated. She was clearly upset that Isabella wasn't taking care of her health.

Last time, she had helped Isabella sneak out without her uncles finding out, but Cinda had caught them.

Because of that, Renee had gotten quite the lecture from Cinda.

After finally getting a couple of days of peace, if Isabella tried to run off again, Cinda would definitely drag her by the ear for questioning.

"And besides, you promised me that you would stay home and take care of yourself. It's only been a few days, and you're already going back on your word?"

Renee's words left Isabella speechless.

She had indeed said that.

At the time, she just wanted to put Renee at ease, not expecting it to come back to bite her.

"Renee, Isabella has been out of the hospital for almost two weeks now. She should be fine, right?" Olivia chimed in, feeling a bit guilty since Renee was only concerned about Isabella's health.

Olivia had always been single and had never even had a boyfriend, so she was clueless about how to take care of someone after a miscarriage.

But she genuinely wanted to take Isabella out for some fresh air. Keeping her cooped up at home in her current state was definitely not good.

Renee, already fuming, nearly lost her temper at Olivia's casual remark about taking Isabella out.

"Should be fine?"

"Do you even realize how weak she is right now? A miscarriage is incredibly harmful to a woman. If she ends up with any lasting health issues, it could affect her for the rest of her life."

Hearing Renee make the situation sound so serious, Olivia's temper flared up too.

"So, according to you, Isabella can't go anywhere and should just stay locked up in her room all day?"

"Renee, she's a living, breathing person, not an emotionless machine. Do you really think keeping her cooped up until she gets sick is what's best for her?"

Olivia was breathing heavily in anger.

She might not understand childbirth, but she wasn't stupid. Isabella looked fine, not that fragile.

Seeing them about to explode into a full-blown argument, Isabella knew she couldn't say anything.

She quietly slipped downstairs.

It wasn't that she wanted to hide. It was just that no matter who she sided with, it would be wrong.

Trying to mediate would only deepen their misunderstandings.

Ever since she lost her baby, both Olivia and Renee had taken some of the blame upon themselves, and no matter what she said, they couldn't let it go.

She figured it was best to let them vent their frustrations today, so there would be no more barriers between them.

And since they were arguing for her sake, once they got it out of their system, everything would be fine.

Isabella knew them well. Even if they had a fight, two kind-hearted people like them wouldn't hold a grudge.

It was just a little spat.

Isabella came to the living room.

Cinda saw Isabella come down and had her sit and wait for a moment. She then brought out a small pot of chicken soup from the kitchen.

She served a bowl to Isabella and placed it in front of her. "Careful, it's hot."

Isabella had been sitting in her room all afternoon and was feeling a bit hungry. The delicious aroma made her mouth water, and she couldn't help but blink at Cinda.

"Cinda, it smells amazing."

"Then have more. Mr. Atticus Wilson specifically had someone get fresh ingredients from the mountains. It's good for your health."

Upstairs, Olivia and Renee were still arguing, but in front of Cinda, Isabella always felt a sense of warmth.

She nodded. "Alright."

She patted the seat next to her. "Cinda, sit with me. There's no way I can finish all this by myself. Have some with me."

Cinda declined, smiling and waving her hand. "I'm good. I have other things to do."

Isabella pretended to be upset. "Cinda, if you don't have some, then I won't either."

She never treated Cinda like a housekeeper but more like a gentle elder.

She didn't want Cinda to always downplay her own status.

"Alright, I'll have just a bit."

Cinda, with no other choice, served herself a small bowl and sat next to Isabella.

The atmosphere between them was quiet and warm. Meanwhile, Olivia and Renee's voices upstairs gradually died down as they bickered their way downstairs.

"Smells so good, Isabella. What delicious food has your housekeeper made this time?"

Olivia caught the scent at the top of the stairs, otherwise, she would have continued arguing with Renee.

Seeing that they both seemed calmer, Isabella smiled and invited them over. "Cinda made chicken soup. Come have some."

"Wow, it looks so appetizing. I'm having two bowls."

Olivia's eyes lit up as she quickly sat down at the table.

"It's just chicken soup. Do you have to be so dramatic?"

Renee, who followed behind, couldn't help but tease.

Isabella was momentarily stunned.

In her impression, Renee had always been a reserved person. Seeing her act so awkward yet genuine was quite different.

"Say that again, I dare you!"

Seeing them about to argue again, Isabella quickly intervened. "Alright, no more fight. Do you still want to the chicken soup or not?"

"Yes!"

"Yes."

They were surprisingly in sync at this moment.

Isabella couldn't help but shake her head, and even Cinda smiled as she served them each a bowl of soup.

Olivia, sitting next to Isabella, was the first to reach for her bowl, but Isabella noticed her hesitate for a moment.

As soon as Renee sat down, she let out a sharp scream.

"Ah, there's a bug!"

"What's going on?"

Isabella quickly looked over and saw a black speck floating in Renee's soup. At first glance, it looked like a small bug, but it was winter, so that was unlikely.

Besides, the Wilson family's cleanliness was maintained by professional staff. If it really was a bug, the entire staff would be held accountable.

Isabella took a closer look and realized the speck wasn't moving. She scooped it out with a spoon and found it was a piece of black thread.

And the only one wearing black today was Olivia.

Isabella was speechless.

Olivia was already an adult. Could she be any more childish?

Renee's face turned red with anger as she pointed at Olivia. "Olivia, pulling such childish pranks. How immature can you be?"

Olivia blinked, completely unfazed. "So what, you dare hit me?"

Renee, with her reserved nature, couldn't bring herself to act out, but she was terrified of such things. Olivia, on the other hand, deliberately used them to scare her.

"Olivia!"

Renee, fuming, waved her hand and told Isabella she was heading back to her room.

Olivia was left stunned, looking confused as Renee stormed off.

"What's her problem? It was just a little prank. Was it really worth getting so mad over?"

###chapter 394  Why Is He Here Again?

Isabella sighed and said, "Renee didn't mean it. You don't know, she's really scared of bugs."

She had discovered this by accident.

Renee, who was usually indifferent to everything, would turn pale at the sight of a bug in the garden.

Hearing Isabella's words, Olivia paused and glanced upstairs nervously.

She muttered softly, "It's just a bug. Even kids aren't scared of them. How can she be so timid?"

Isabella didn't know how to explain this to Olivia.

Renee had never mentioned the reason, so Isabella didn't feel it was right to pry.

Isabella also found it strange. Didn't Renee make things clear with him last time?

Who knew what trouble Aaron might bring this time?

Aaron closed his eyes and blurted it out.

How could things be that easy?

Aaron realized his mistake.

He nodded. "You're right. It's my fault. I didn't take this relationship seriously. I let her down."

Seeing Aaron admit his mistake, Isabella couldn't help but admire Olivia's boldness.

It seemed that outsiders could see things more clearly.

But Isabella's position made it difficult to criticize Aaron. He was Michael's man, and she needed to keep her distance from Michael.

###chapter 395  No More Try?

But Olivia's commanding presence still made her stand out.

As a friend, she should do something to help them, and also make Atticus realize his true feelings.

Since they liked each other, why torment each other?

Olivia was referring to her prank to Renee. It wasn't a big deal, but she didn't want any real rift between them.

"Renee, it's me, Olivia."

She didn't want anyone to see her sad over a relationship.

Renee took a deep breath and asked calmly, "What's up?"

"Yeah, Renee, open the door. Let's talk. If you don't, I'll think you're still mad at me. Renee, you wouldn't be that petty, right?"

###chapter 396  Who Hit Me?

When Olivia saw that Renee wasn't opening the door, she decided to try some reverse psychology.

"Renee, if you don't open up, I'm gonna start singing really loud!" Olivia called out in a playful, sing-song voice.

"Aaron, how can you be so self-righteous? Do you even realize where you are? Sneaking into the Wilson's house in the middle of the night? You sure know how to have fun," Olivia said, her tone casual, making Renee's face heat up.

Renee, standing behind Aaron, wanted to explain, but Olivia beat her to it. "Yes, it was me. So what?"

"You're just an assistant, sneaking into here at night. Should I commend your bravery or admire your luck for challenging the Wilson Family's security system?"

###chapter 397 Swear

Olivia let out a sarcastic laugh. 'Does he really think he's that hotshot? That the Wilson Family can just waltz in and out like they own the place?'

Aaron had already opened his eyes by now. Standing in front of him were Isabella and the sneering Olivia. But the person he most wanted to see wasn't there.

"But don't worry, I won't cling to her. If she tells me she doesn't want to see me again, I'll disappear and protect her from afar."

"What if something like last time happens again, and you're not there for her because of work? What will she do then?"

Hearing this, Renee's body trembled slightly. This was a knot in her heart. More than the threats from the organization, she feared that when she truly needed him, he would abandon her for other reasons.

But Aaron responded firmly, "It won't happen again. Once was enough for me to regret it. I won't let her be in danger again."

"Before coming here, I already sorted out my properties, car, and savings. I'll give them all to her. Mr. Brown has treated me well over the years, and I have enough money to provide her with a stable home."

His honest and sincere words left Olivia with no room to argue. After all, he had laid everything out. Continuing to make things difficult for him would be unreasonable.

Isabella felt the same. Although the money wasn't much in her eyes, it showed that Aaron was genuinely thinking about Renee's future. Because he had given everything he had. And, of course, his heart. That was more precious than anything.

"I really love Renee, Mrs. Brown. Please, let me see her."

Aaron pleaded once more, but this time Isabella shook her head, "Pleading with me won't help. You should ask the person behind you if she's willing to see you."

Hearing this, Aaron's body stiffened. His headache was so severe he hadn't noticed anyone behind him. When he quickly turned around, Renee slowly emerged from behind the sofa, coming to stand in front of Aaron.

Isabella and Olivia exchanged a glance and smiled, "Alright, we'll give you some space. We're going to our rooms to rest."

Olivia teased, "Keep your voices down when you confess, don't wake us up."

With that, they walked upstairs, giggling.

Only one lamp was on in the living room, not too bright, which was why Aaron hadn't noticed her. But now, with Renee so close, Aaron found himself at a loss for words.

"Renee, I..."

"Wait a moment, I need to get something."

Renee turned and left. Aaron looked at his outstretched hand, left hanging awkwardly in the air. This was Isabella's home, so he didn't dare move around. He sat on the sofa, waiting for Renee to return.

Fortunately, she came back quickly. She was holding what looked like iodine and cotton swabs. Was she worried about him? Hope surged in Aaron's heart, his eyes lighting up.

"Renee, I'm fine. It doesn't hurt. Ah!"

Renee paused with the cotton swab, ordering Aaron, "Don't move."

"Okay."

Seeing his girlfriend so worried about him, Aaron didn't dare move a muscle, sitting quietly as Renee cleaned his wound. Renee carefully disinfected the wound. Thankfully, it wasn't too big, or she would have felt guilty for a long time.

"Does it hurt?" she asked softly.

"No, not at all."

Aaron responded quickly and directly. The person he cared about was right beside him, just within reach. He was too happy to care about a little pain. He was overjoyed to be with Renee, and nothing could make him give up this sweet moment with her.

###chapter 398 I Am Serious

After a quick patch-up, Renee sat to the side, her face serious as she looked at Aaron. She had the air of someone about to demand answers.

"Alright, spill it. What are you doing here in the middle of the night? Do you even know where you are?"

Renee still felt a chill run down her spine when she thought about it.

If she hit Aaron harder, he might be in the hospital right now.

And the Wilson Family's security was no joke. For Aaron to get in unscathed, Isabella must have known right away.

Only she had been kept in the dark and almost hurt him.

"I know, but I've waited too long already. I couldn't wait any longer, Renee. I needed to see you. I was going crazy."

Aaron didn't hide his feelings or thoughts.

"You're unbelievable."

Renee's face turned red, and she shyly avoided Aaron's intense gaze.

She muttered, "We already talked about this. Why are you here?"

They were from different worlds, and continuing to entangle themselves wouldn't lead anywhere.

That had always been Renee's firm belief.

But Aaron's words in front of Isabella and Olivia earlier had deeply moved her.

It turned out, someone in this world wanted to be good to her unconditionally.

It was a feeling she had never experienced before.

"Renee, I know you feel insecure right now. I can wait."

"But I need you to know, Renee, that in this lifetime, I only want you. No one else."

Aaron looked at her nervously, wanting to hold her but afraid she might push him away.

He tried his best to control his emotions.

"Are you serious?"

Renee couldn't resist Aaron's heartfelt confession.

She knew they couldn't guarantee what the future held, but at this moment, she didn't want to reject him anymore.

Even if it was just a fleeting moment of warmth, she wanted to have it.

"Of course, I'm serious. Renee, trust me this once, okay?"

Looking into Aaron's eyes, which shone brightly in the dim light, Renee lost herself for a moment and blurted out, "Okay."

"You agreed, right? That's great!"

The next second, Renee was pulled into a warm embrace, Aaron's arms wrapping tightly around her.

Listening to his strong heartbeat, Renee didn't push him away this time. Instead, she sighed and responded by wrapping her arms around him.

No matter what happened next, she accepted it.

Hearing Renee sigh, Aaron thought she was still worried about their identities and future. He held her tightly and promised.

"Now that you have no ties with the Adri Family, there's no opposition between us. No one can predict the future, but let's face it together, okay?"

"No matter what happens, I'll always stand in front of you. So, marry me, Renee."

Hearing this, Renee couldn't hold back her tears.

She thought Aaron wouldn't consider these things, but he had thought of everything.

"Who said I was going to marry you? Don't say such things."

"Marriage is too soon for me, and you're just as unreliable as your boss. I just want to work with Ms. Taylor and not think too far ahead."

"Alright, alright. Whenever you're ready to get married, we'll do it. No rush. But my wife can only be you."

Aaron agreed wholeheartedly.

In his eyes, Isabella and Michael were inseparable. Keeping Renee by Isabella's side would also give him peace of mind.

"Who wants to be your wife?"

Renee retorted playfully, but the blush on her face revealed her true feelings.

"You already agreed. No backing out now."

Aaron said, holding her even tighter.

Feeling his warmth, Renee bit her lip and looked up at his face.

She made a silent decision.

She wanted to give her best self to Aaron before they faced any real danger.

Maybe this would be their last and sweetest moment together.

She didn't want to have any regrets.

With that thought, Renee blushed and wrapped her arms around Aaron's neck, whispering in his ear, "Aaron, take me to my room."

They were both adults, and Aaron understood the meaning behind Renee's words.

His grip tightened, and his breathing became heavy. "Renee, do you know what you're saying?"

He liked Renee.

When the person he liked invited him, he couldn't be indifferent.

But he was afraid Renee might regret it. After all, they had only held hands before, never even kissed.

"I can wait."

"No."

Renee pressed her fingers to his lips, slowly sitting up and straddling his lap, gazing into his eyes.

"Aaron, I'm serious. Don't you want me?"

"Yes, of course, I do."

Aaron's eyes darkened, and he stood up abruptly, scooping Renee into his arms and carrying her to the guest room on the first floor.

As the door closed, Renee closed her eyes deeply in Aaron's arms.

If she couldn't spend her life with him, at least becoming his woman would give Aaron an answer.

At the corner of the second floor, Isabella and Olivia were hiding in the dark.

They watched as Aaron carried Renee into the room. Their eyes widened, and they quickly covered their mouths and rushed back to their room.

Closing the door, Olivia clapped her hands in shock. "Aaron really is Michael's right-hand man. He got her into the room right after making up?"

"But Aaron does have a certain charm. He carried Renee with one arm. No wonder she can't let him go."

Olivia couldn't help but laugh at the scene she had just witnessed.

Isabella was still in shock.

But seeing them reconcile made her happy for Renee.

However, their thinking was too advanced.

They had just made up and couldn't wait to be together?

As a fellow woman, she was happy for Renee to find true love. Not everyone could find their own happiness.

"By the way, Olivia, don't tell Renee what we saw today, okay? She's easily embarrassed and can't handle your teasing, got it?"

"I understand. I won't say a word about this. Don't worry."

Olivia raised an eyebrow and gave Isabella a mischievous look.

Isabella shook her head helplessly.

She didn't know what Olivia was thinking, but she was now focused on getting Atticus and Olivia together.

If she could match them up, it would be perfect.

###chapter 399 Unwilling to Accept

The next morning, Isabella called Atticus.

Atticus, sitting in his office, immediately felt a pang of worry. "Isabella, what's up? Everything okay?"

Isabella had initially wanted Atticus to come home, and hearing his concern, she decided to play along. "Actually, Uncle Atticus, something did happen."

"The new security system you installed? It totally failed. Someone broke into the house last night, and the infrared sensors didn't go off at all. If they were after Renee or me, you wouldn't be hearing my voice right now."

She made the situation sound more dire than it was.

"Are you alright? Did they catch the guy?"

After the last kidnapping scare, Atticus had upgraded their home security to military-grade. He trusted it completely. How could someone break in without setting off any alarms? It seemed impossible.

Worried, Atticus quickly stood up. "Stay put and don't go anywhere. I'm coming home right now."

After hanging up, Isabella blinked and waited for Atticus to arrive. The security and bodyguards around her were all arranged by Atticus. Olivia had been there since yesterday, so Atticus must have known. Yet, it seemed like he was deliberately avoiding her. Whenever Olivia was around, he wouldn't show up.

But if they didn't meet, how could they resolve their issues? So, she had to "trick" Atticus into coming back, making sure he and Olivia had a chance to talk things out. He couldn't keep avoiding her forever.

Meanwhile, in the guest room on the first floor, Renee had already changed her clothes. She peeked outside while whispering to Aaron, who was still getting dressed, "Hurry up, we don't want anyone to see us."

Last night's events were too outrageous, and she didn't want Isabella or Olivia to see them. They would definitely tease her.

Renee's urgency made Aaron feel like a thief. He was her boyfriend, not some secret lover. Why did they have to sneak around like this?

Or was he really that embarrassing?

"I'm not leaving!"

Aaron walked over, wrapped his arms around Renee's waist, and buried his head in her hair, inhaling her scent. Last night, Renee had been so passionate and enthusiastic, and he was still savoring the pleasure she had given him. He didn't want to let her go.

"Come on, let go of me," Renee said, getting more anxious as time passed. She was losing her patience with Aaron. "If you don't leave now, do you really want everyone to see what happened between us?"

She liked Aaron, but she couldn't guarantee their future together. She didn't want to cause him unnecessary trouble. Besides, Isabella and Olivia had left early last night. As long as Aaron didn't run into anyone, no one would know what happened.

At least, that's what she thought. Unfortunately, Isabella and Olivia had seen everything from the second floor.

"So what if they see? We're not hiding anything. What's there to be afraid of?" Aaron said casually. "We can just tell them. Mrs. Brown won't mind."

Aaron thought it was simple. He planned to marry Renee eventually, so it didn't matter if people knew now or later. Besides, he didn't like the idea of Renee hiding their relationship.

"You..."

Seeing that Renee was about to get angry, Aaron pulled her into his arms and rested his head on her shoulder, speaking softly. "Babe, don't be so heartless. We finally got together, and I don't want to be apart from you."

Renee had a soft spot for Aaron's gentle side. Seeing him act cute and clingy, her anger dissipated. She couldn't help but pat his head. "Alright, alright. It's getting late, and this isn't our place. You should go."

If they ran into Isabella and Olivia, she wouldn't know how to explain.

"Ahem!" Isabella, standing on the stairs, couldn't hold back and coughed to get their attention. The couple, who were hugging at the door, froze and looked towards the sound, seeing Isabella slowly coming down the stairs.

The three of them exchanged glances, and Isabella felt a bit awkward. She couldn't ignore them, especially since the servants and Cinda would start their work soon. If she didn't say something, the whole Wilson family would know Aaron had stayed over.

"Ms. Taylor," Renee said, blushing.

Aaron, however, didn't seem embarrassed. He confidently took Renee's hand and led her out. Isabella invited them to sit in the living room, as she had something to discuss with them.

Perhaps their relationship had deepened, as Aaron never let go of Renee's hand, even when she signaled him to. He ignored her hints, thinking, 'Why can't I hold my girlfriend's hand?'

Seeing this, Isabella decided to be direct. "Aaron, since you two are at this point, what's your plan?"

Aaron was Michael's man, but Renee lived with the Wilson family and was under Isabella's care. She couldn't just ignore this.

"Mrs. Brown, we love each other. I promise to take care of Renee for the rest of my life. As long as she agrees, we can get married anytime," Aaron said, holding Renee's hand tightly, his words more confident than the night before.

It was clear that their relationship had improved after last night. Although Isabella's expression remained neutral, she felt relieved. During Aaron's business trips, Renee often sat by the window, lost in thought. They clearly cared for each other, and now that they were together, it was a good thing.

She smiled at Renee, who was hiding behind Aaron, and raised an eyebrow. "Renee, what do you think? Do you want to give Aaron a chance?"

"Since I rescued you from the mall, I've always seen you as a sister. I'll definitely help with your marriage. Of course, I'm happy if you find your own happiness."

Just as Isabella and Aaron expected Renee to shyly nod in agreement, she surprised them by pulling her hand away from Aaron's grasp. Her expression was calm and cold as she said, "Sorry, I don't want to."

###chapter 400 Everything Is Fake

As soon as the words left her mouth, both Isabella and Aaron froze.

Aaron's face changed as he felt Renee's hand slip from his grasp.

He thought Renee was joking.

But the next second, Renee's words left his mind completely blank.

"Ms. Taylor, you misunderstood. Aaron and I are just friends. I don't like him, and I will never marry him!"

Aaron's heart felt like it was being squeezed and then released. He couldn't believe Renee would say such a thing.

She had feelings for him, didn't she?

How could things change so suddenly?

"Renee, you're lying to me, right?"

Aaron's face turned pale as he tightly held her hand, his anxiety reaching a fever pitch. "It's not like that, is it? My presence is making you feel pressured, right? You know I can wait. Please, don't say things like this to scare me."

Renee remained expressionless.

Aaron was truly panicking. "This can't be true. We were intimate last night. You admitted you were mine. You gave yourself to me. How could you not have feelings for me?"

"If you don't want to get married, I'll wait. I'll wait as long as it takes."

Renee just gave a mocking smile.

She looked at Aaron with eyes devoid of any emotion. "Aaron, we're adults. I don't want to be harsh, but last night was just a one-night stand. We should part ways now. If I, as a woman, don't care, why should you?"

With that, she pushed Aaron away and pulled her hand back.

Aaron's eyes turned red. "A one-night stand? Renee, is that really what you think?"

"Then what about all the times you said you loved me last night?"

Renee let out a cold laugh. "Aaron, you're almost thirty. You don't still believe everything said in bed, do you? Those were just words."

"To be honest, I was just in the mood last night and needed someone to satisfy my physical needs. You happened to be there. I have no feelings for you beyond that."

"From today on, don't come looking for me. Let's pretend we never met."

Renee decisively stood up and left. As she passed by Isabella, she paused and said apologetically, "I'm sorry for causing this mess, but I don't want to see him anymore. Could you please handle it, Ms. Taylor?"

Isabella had been stunned by the scene for a while.

Hearing Renee's request, she could only respond, "Okay."

Renee quickly left.

Isabella watched as Aaron's face visibly darkened.

She also wanted to know what had happened.

Just moments ago, Aaron and Renee were fine, hugging at the door. How did things change so quickly?

Could it be that Aaron's performance last night didn't satisfy Renee?

That didn't make sense. If there was a problem, they wouldn't have lasted until now.

Isabella quickly shook her head, trying to dispel the inappropriate thoughts.

Aaron was still here!

Since Renee had left the mess to her, she couldn't just ignore it.

Looking at the heartbroken Aaron in front of her, Isabella couldn't bear to say anything harsh. "Aaron, Renee might have her reasons. But since she said that, maybe you should leave."

"Mrs. Brown, am I just being used and discarded?"

Before Isabella could think of a response, Aaron's words left her stunned.

"What?"

Aaron looked at her with a forlorn expression, hoping for an answer.

Isabella hesitated. "Aaron, I didn't expect Renee to say those things either. But I believe she's not someone who plays with your feelings. Don't overthink it."

Renee was cold by nature, but she had good character.

But those words just now didn't seem like something she would say.

And even Isabella could see Renee's feelings for Aaron. How could she not like him?

"Aaron, is it possible that Renee isn't rejecting you but just doesn't want to rush into marriage? After all, it's a lifelong commitment."

Even now, Isabella was still trying to defend Renee.

She had to. Renee was her friend.

Who else would she protect?

Aaron sat on the couch, looking lost. "Did I push her too hard, making her feel pressured?"

"Or does she just want a casual relationship, not a lifelong commitment? Which of her words are true, and which are lies?"

At this point, Aaron didn't know what to think.

He even doubted if he deserved Renee.

Because from any angle, he was just an ordinary person.

It was normal for her to look down on him.

But what he couldn't understand was, last night, Renee was so gentle, shy, and compliant in bed.

Was it all fake?

"No, I need to ask her. She clearly said she liked me. How could she suddenly stop loving me?"

"Aaron!"

Isabella called out just in time. "Renee already said she doesn't want to see you. If you go to her now, there will be no chance for you two."

Her words successfully stopped Aaron in his tracks.

Isabella didn't want to be too harsh, so she sighed. "I don't know what happened between you two, but since she made this decision, she must have her reasons."

"If you still want to be with her, give her some time."

"Okay, I'll give her time."

Aaron nodded, looking defeated, keeping his head down to hide his pain. "Mrs. Brown, it's late. I'll head out now."

"Alright."

Isabella didn't stop him. She glanced at the bodyguards outside, signaling them to let Aaron leave.

Watching him walk away so dejectedly, Isabella sighed and looked upstairs, thinking about asking Renee what was going on.

Just then, a servant came in and said Atticus was back, and his car was outside.

Isabella paused, deciding to talk to Atticus first before finding Renee.

A moment later, Atticus appeared in the hall, relieved to see Isabella was okay.

"Isabella, where's the intruder? Did you catch him?"

Isabella instinctively looked outside and pointed cautiously. "He just left, Atticus. Didn't you see him?"

"Just left?"

Atticus was stunned. "What do you mean, he just walked out of the Wilson Family like that? What are these bodyguards doing?"

Seeing Atticus getting angry, Isabella quickly explained, "Atticus, don't blame them. Actually, the intruder last night was Aaron!"

###chapter 401  It's Time to End

Atticus knew who Aaron was-Michael's assistant.

When he heard that someone from the Brown Family had shown up in the middle of the night, his face darkened immediately. "Does Michael think his life's been too easy lately? If he doesn't straighten up, I'll skin him alive!"

Isabella pressed her lips together, not daring to respond.

After all, Aaron was Michael's guy, so Michael, as the boss, had to take the heat.

Atticus suddenly thought of something and frowned. "Isabella, is Michael trying to mess with you again?"

"No, Uncle Atticus, why would you think that all of a sudden?"

Isabella was confused. Weren't they talking about Aaron? How did it turn into a discussion about Michael and her?

Besides, she and Michael were already going through a divorce. Even if Michael had any ideas, it was too late.

Atticus glanced at Isabella, hesitating whether to tell her.

Isabella, not getting an answer and seeing Atticus's hesitant expression, asked again.

"Uncle Atticus, are you hiding something from me?"

In her eyes, Atticus never talked about irrelevant matters. Now that he suddenly mentioned Michael, could it be that something happened with the Brown Family?

"Is it about Aiden?"

Aiden was the only thing she could think of.

"No!"

"Then what is it?"

Isabella pressed for answers.

Seeing her persistence, Atticus decided to come clean.

"It's about the Brown Group. I just got word that there's going to be a major personnel change within the company."

Personnel change?

Isabella frowned, then heard Atticus get to the point.

"I heard that Nolan from the Brown Family wants to return to the family business. He's already resigned from his position at the school. His capabilities are well-known, and if he returns to the Brown Group, it will undoubtedly cause a storm. So, Michael's current situation isn't looking good. I thought he might try to get to you."

Atticus didn't say the rest, but Isabella understood his meaning.

With Nolan's abilities, even if he didn't get support from Aiden, he still had the trust of the company's board members.

If Nolan fully aimed to take Michael's position, he would be Michael's strongest opponent.

And as the eldest daughter of the Wilson Family and the heir to the Wilson Group, if Michael could bring her back, the resources he would gain would greatly overshadow Nolan.

Isabella smiled helplessly.

She knew Atticus was worried about her, but she didn't expect him to worry to this extent.

"Uncle Atticus, you're overthinking it. Michael and I have been over for a long time. You don't need to worry about him trying to trick me back into the Brown Family for his own gain."

"Because we're getting divorced soon."

"And besides, Aaron didn't come over to deliver a message from Michael. He had his own reasons."

Atticus felt somewhat relieved by Isabella's explanation, but then he frowned again. "What do you mean by his own reasons? What business does an assistant have with you?"

Atticus still didn't trust that scoundrel Michael.

Isabella had no choice but to tell Atticus about Aaron and Renee's relationship.

"Aaron came over just to see Renee and apologize to her. It's not what you think, Uncle Atticus."

Atticus didn't hold it against Isabella for tricking him into coming back. As long as she was safe, he was relieved.

"Uncle Atticus, you must be starving after rushing back. Why don't you grab some breakfast? I need to go to my room for a bit."

Although she had tricked Atticus into coming back, it was clear that Renee's situation was more urgent now.

So, she had to put off dealing with Atticus and Olivia's matters for a while.

After speaking, Isabella went upstairs alone.

Taking advantage of the moment, she knocked on Renee's door. "Renee, it's me. Can you open the door and tell me what's going on? Don't worry, it's just me, no one else."

Isabella didn't believe Renee would change her mind so suddenly.

She clearly couldn't bear to part with Aaron, yet she said such heartless things. There had to be a reason behind it.

Inside, Renee sat on the edge of the bed, wiping her tears.

Hearing that Isabella was alone, Renee took a deep breath and opened the door.

"Ms. Taylor, I'm fine. Has Aaron left?"

He must have left.

After what she said, how could he stay? He would probably forget about her and never look back.

Thinking about this made Renee's heart ache.

But this was her decision. Why did it hurt so much to follow through?

"Yeah."

Isabella said softly, "Renee, I see you as a sister. Why are you calling me Ms. Taylor again? Can't you just call me by my name like before?"

Isabella knew what was troubling Renee.

It was about the child. The guilt in Renee's eyes when she was taking care of Isabella in the hospital was something Isabella had noticed.

But Isabella didn't blame her. The blame lay with the person who drugged her and the mastermind, Bianca!
