And Renee's behavior today was too unusual. If she didn't get to the bottom of it, Aaron and Renee might really have no chance.

"I'm not leaving. If you don't want to talk, that's fine. I can stay with you until you're ready to talk."

Isabella had a feeling that Renee had a reason for rejecting Aaron.

If Renee didn't want Aaron to know, Isabella, as a friend, could help her sort things out.

Seeing that Isabella wouldn't leave, Renee said no more. She stepped aside to let Isabella in and closed the door.

Inside the room, Isabella held Renee's hand and sat on the bed, asking softly, "Tell me the truth. What happened? Why did you say those things to Aaron?"

"Do you know, Aaron was devastated when he left. He was heartbroken."

Renee's chest tightened, and she spoke in a choked voice, "I know he was heartbroken. So was I, but I had no choice."

"Why?"

Isabella was puzzled.

Renee held back her tears and began, "Isabella, I'm very grateful you saved my life back then. But now, I have to go back to that place."

###chapter 402 Isabella's Phone Call

Isabella's heart skipped a beat, and she quickly realized what was happening, though she found it hard to believe.

"Where are you going? Don't tell me you're going back to that hellhole."

"Yeah, I am."

Renee didn't want to, but she had no choice.

Her mother's life was still in the hands of those people. She could run, but her mother couldn't.

She couldn't be that selfish.

"Renee, are you out of your mind? They're hunting you down. Going back is like walking into a death trap."

"I know, I know."

Renee was helpless. "But Isabella, I have to go back. This is my fate. It was sealed the moment the Adri Family set their sights on me."

She had been hiding long enough.

If she didn't show up soon, the Adri Family would use her mother's life to threaten her.

By then, it would be too late.

So, no matter what danger she faced, she couldn't let those people harm her mother.

Even if it meant trading her life for her mother's safety, she was resigned to it.

Aaron's appearance was something she hadn't anticipated.

She thought she would never find love again in this lifetime, but he showed up and brought her many beautiful memories.

Now that her last wish had been fulfilled, she shouldn't drag innocent people into the abyss.

Whether it was Aaron or Isabella, she shouldn't involve them any further.

Isabella ultimately couldn't get Renee to reveal her inner turmoil.

Someone who had made up their mind wouldn't change it because of a few words from others.

At the same time, at the Brown Group headquarters, Michael sat behind his desk, watching Aaron, who had been reporting on the situation in Auroria one moment and then zoning out the next.

He couldn't help but frown and tap the desk with his fingers.

"Aaron, what's going on with you? Didn't I tell you to go home and get some rest yesterday? You look worse than when you came back from overseas."

Zoning out at work, especially in front of Michael, his boss, was something Aaron had never done before.

What was going on today?

Hearing Michael's reprimand, Aaron quickly snapped back to reality and apologized, "I'm sorry, Mr. Brown. I didn't mean to."

Seeing Aaron's pale face, Michael couldn't bring himself to say more.

"If you're too tired, take a few more days off. It's your right."

Michael didn't know what had happened to Aaron. He thought he was just exhausted from the business trip and jet lag.

So, Michael simply told him to go home and get some sleep.

But Aaron refused outright, "Mr. Brown, I'm really fine. I can work. I promise to get back on track as quickly as possible."

"I won't make such a rookie mistake again."

After leaving the Wilson Family, Aaron had gone home to change clothes and then headed straight to the office.

Right now, he just wanted to bury himself in work to numb his mind, so he wouldn't think about Renee's rejection.

"It's not about getting back on track. Look in the mirror. Your face looks terrible."

Michael frowned, then realized something.

"Aaron, be honest. Did something happen?"

Having worked with Aaron for years, Michael knew him well enough.

The first person that came to Michael's mind was Renee.

"Is it because of Renee? Did you go see her?"

After all, the only person who could affect Aaron's emotions this much was her.

Aaron's expression changed when Michael hit the nail on the head, but he still didn't say anything directly.

This time, he was truly hurt.

"Mr. Brown, please don't ask. I have some documents to sort out. I'll head back now."

Aaron didn't dare to talk about what had happened today, but he was afraid Michael would keep pressing, so he practically fled the office.

Michael wasn't an idiot. Aaron's behavior was so out of character that it was obvious something was wrong.

This had to be about Renee.

And it wasn't good news, or Aaron wouldn't look so awful.

The phone on the desk rang, which caught Michael's attention.

But it wasn't his phone.

It was Aaron's.

In his rush, Aaron had left it behind.

Michael sighed and picked up the internal phone to call Aaron back, but his eyes caught the flashing contact name.

"Mrs. Brown!"

Aaron was his assistant, and the only person he referred to as Mrs. Brown was Isabella.

Michael quickly picked up the phone and saw that the number was indeed Isabella's.

Why was Isabella calling Aaron at this time?

Could Aaron have told her everything?

Michael panicked and, without thinking, answered the call.

"Who's this? Aaron's not here. If it's business-related, you can report to me."

Even though he knew it was Isabella on the other end, Michael pretended not to know and kept a formal tone.

Isabella was taken aback by Michael's familiar voice.

Michael was answering Aaron's phone?

That was odd, but Isabella never had a good attitude towards Michael.

"When did the Brown Group fall so low that the president has to do his assistant's job? Or did you see my number and grab the phone on purpose?"

"I'm not that bored. What do you need Aaron for? I'll pass the message along."

Michael didn't want to waste time on pointless chatter and got straight to the point.

Isabella suddenly remembered Atticus mentioning that the Brown Group was undergoing significant changes.

But from the looks of it, Michael didn't seem to feel any crisis.

Otherwise, he wouldn't have time to answer her call.

"Talking to you isn't a problem."

Isabella thought for a moment. "Tell Aaron that Renee is going abroad with me for a vacation. If he wants to make one last effort, he should come to the airport at 10 AM tomorrow. Otherwise, no one can guarantee what will happen next."

She had originally intended to tell Aaron about Renee returning to the Adri Family.

But since Michael answered the call, she didn't trust him. If he took action against the Adri Family, Renee would be the first to get caught.

For Renee's safety, she had to cover up the important part.

As long as she could help Renee see Aaron one more time, it would be enough.

"By the way, Renee doesn't know about this. I called Aaron because I don't want them to miss each other. Make sure to explain it clearly to Aaron and tell him not to be too obvious. Pretend it's a coincidence."

After saying that, Isabella decisively hung up.

###chapter 403  Not Letting Go

Aaron rushed over in a panic when he realized his phone was missing, only to see Michael holding it, still in the posture of having just finished a call.

"Mr. Brown, that's my phone, right?" Aaron asked, a bit stunned.

If he wasn't mistaken, Michael had just answered a call on his phone?

Compared to Aaron's surprise, Michael was much calmer, showing no embarrassment at being caught red-handed.

"Yeah, it's yours. A call came in, so I answered it," Michael said as if it were the most natural thing in the world.

Aaron let out a sound of surprise, only to realize what was going on when Michael continued, "It was Isabella calling."

That explained everything.

After all, the only person who could make the CEO concerned was Isabella.

But why was Isabella calling him at this time? Could something have happened with Renee?

Or maybe Isabella had found out why Renee rejected him.

Thinking of this, Aaron suppressed his inner turmoil and asked, "Did Mrs. Brown say anything important?"

"Yeah," Michael replied, waiting for this question. "Isabella said Renee is flying abroad tomorrow. If you have anything to say to her, go to the airport at ten tomorrow."

This news was good for both Aaron and Michael.

It had been a while since Michael had seen Isabella.

The airport tomorrow would be a perfect opportunity.

He could just watch her from afar without approaching.

"I'll be there. Thanks for letting me know," Aaron blurted out.

No matter what Renee had said, he believed she wasn't the type to change her mind easily. She must have her reasons.

Michael added, "One more thing, Renee doesn't know you're coming. So when you show up tomorrow, don't be too obvious, or she might avoid you again."

Aaron nodded seriously.

But he couldn't help but wonder.

Renee had just told him last night that she wanted to stay by Isabella's side, and now she was leaving the country. What had happened?

As far as he knew, Renee had only studied abroad. Where could she be going?

Could it be the Adri Family?

Aaron's eyes darkened.

If Renee was returning to the Adri Family, everything made sense.

She didn't want him to get involved, so she planned to leave quietly.

But if she really went back there, it would be extremely dangerous.

No way!

He couldn't just watch her throw her life away.

He had to stop Renee.

If he couldn't, he would go with her.

Only by resolving her inner conflicts could they be together without any burdens.

Michael watched Aaron's expression grow darker, unsure of what he was thinking.

Unexpectedly, Aaron immediately asked for leave, "Mr. Brown, I have an urgent matter and need a few days off. I hope you can approve it."

He said he was fine fine just a moment ago, but now he was asking for leave because of Renee. Michael didn't need to guess what Aaron was planning.

But he didn't ask further, nodding, "Sure, how many days do you need?"

Aaron thought for a moment, "I can't say for sure, but at least a week."

He could only confirm that Renee intended to return to her organization. As for when he could bring her back safely, he wasn't sure.

Michael shook his head helplessly. It seemed Aaron was truly caught up in love this time.

He was willing to put aside his most valued work to chase after his beloved.

"Alright, go ahead. Just don't regret it," Michael said, letting him go easily. He knew that with such a significant personal matter, Aaron wouldn't be able to focus on work anyway.

"Thanks, Mr. Brown," Aaron replied, grabbing his phone and heading out, leaving Michael alone in the large office.

Thinking of Aaron's anxious demeanor, Michael felt a pang of emotion. If he had realized his love for Isabella earlier, they wouldn't be in a situation where even seeing each other was difficult.

Because of the miscarriage, Isabella had been recuperating at the Wilson Villa. Her uncles, who already disliked him, now hated him even more. Not only was he unwelcome in Isabella's presence, but even stepping into the Wilson Family's territory would get him immediately escorted out by bodyguards.

Even their divorce agreement was handled entirely by Thomas. The last time he saw Isabella was when Bianca kidnapped him, and Isabella must have misunderstood.

He needed to find a way to see her and explain everything.

The next day.

Evergreen City Airport, Section B.

Renee pushed the suitcase Isabella had prepared for her, quietly heading towards the departure lounge. This was her last moment in the country. Once she boarded the plane, her life would no longer be under her control.

She couldn't imagine what the future held. The worst outcome would be death. She had mentally prepared herself.

At the entrance, Renee told Isabella not to see her off any further, "Isabella, you should go back. I can handle this alone."

"Renee, are you sure about this?" Isabella asked, concerned. She had initially planned to go with Renee to see what the situation was like. If it was truly dangerous, she would bring Renee back. But Renee had refused all her suggestions.

She already owed Isabella too much. And facing the entire Adri Family this time, her chances of survival were slim. Given the circumstances, she couldn't drag Isabella down with her.

"Yes, I've thought about this many times and won't change my mind. I'm glad I met you here. The time I've spent in the country has been the happiest of my life."

"Isabella, take care of yourself. I'm leaving," Renee said, holding back her tears. She gave Isabella a light hug and turned to leave.

Isabella watched Renee walk away, then looked around at the crowd, growing more anxious. Where was Aaron? If he didn't show up soon, Renee would really be gone.

Just as Isabella was about to start pacing, a man in a black coat appeared in the crowd, striding after Renee. Isabella's eyes lit up, quickly recognizing the figure. Aaron had finally come through and arrived.

As Renee was about to step into the departure lounge, someone bumped into her from the side. Just as she was about to fall, a strong arm caught her around the waist. By the time Renee realized what was happening, she was securely held in Aaron's arms.

"Aaron? Why are you here?" Renee stared at Aaron in disbelief, thinking she was seeing things. The person holding her was the very Aaron she had pushed away?

Quickly regaining her composure, she pushed Aaron away, but he immediately pulled her back into his arms. He held her even tighter.

Renee instinctively struggled, "Let go of me!"

"No way!" Aaron said firmly.

###chapter 404  Why Should I Listen to You

Aaron spoke to her in a tone he had never used before, leaving Renee momentarily stunned.

At this point, Aaron decided to stop holding back and gave Renee two choices.

"Stay here and be my wife, or go back to that place with me. Pick one."

Renee was taken aback but quickly understood what Aaron meant. She immediately rejected both options. "I don't want either! Move, I want to go back."

"No way, you have to choose one!"

Aaron tightened his grip on her hand, refusing to back down no matter what Renee said.

"Who do you think you are to control me?"

Renee had never seen Aaron act so domineering. She had always been the one in control in their relationship. When did he learn to treat her like this?

"You know why. Because I'm your man!"

"You..."

Aaron whispered this in her ear, but his domineering words still made Renee's face flush with embarrassment.

Was he doing this on purpose?

This was an airport, not their home.

How could he say something like that so confidently?

Seeing her blushing face, Aaron decided not to tease her any further and pulled her into the waiting area.

He had made up his mind. No matter where she went, he would follow.

Outside, Isabella watched this scene unfold and finally breathed a sigh of relief.

With Aaron around, she believed he would protect Renee.

She turned to leave, spotting Olivia in a black leather outfit and sunglasses, standing out in the crowd.

Seeing Isabella, Olivia approached and asked, "So, is Renee staying? If not, should we follow her and see what's going on?"

"I heard they have rare diamonds over there. You love red diamonds, right? We could get some and bring them back as family heirlooms."

"Plus, it's warmer there and less crowded. We could treat it as a vacation. What do you think?"

Isabella sometimes envied Olivia's outlook. No matter what happened, she always saw the bright side.

No overthinking, no internal conflict. Always true to herself.

Seeing Isabella's silence, Olivia took her hand and made the decision. "Your silence means yes. I'm booking the tickets now. We'll surprise Renee with a little 'coincidental' meeting."

Isabella did want to get away for a while. So much had happened recently, and Atticus and the others were worried about her safety, keeping her under the Wilson Family's protection.

But that only made her feel more depressed.

If possible, she wanted to find a quiet place where no one knew her and just relax.

"Okay."

Just as Isabella agreed, a familiar voice called out from behind her.

"No way! I won't let you go."

Isabella and Olivia turned to see Michael approaching.

Olivia had already booked first-class tickets.

Seeing Michael, Olivia's temper flared. "Oh, it's Mr. Brown. What does it matter to you where Isabella wants to go? Who are you to control her?"

"Because we're still married, and I'm still her husband." Michael's tone was firm.

He had heard everything. Isabella was planning to go to Auroria. That couldn't happen.

The thought of Isabella being in danger made him frown as he tried to pull her to his side.

Olivia quickly stepped in front of Isabella, glaring at Michael. "Michael, have some decency, will you?"

"Isabella isn't yours anymore. You're just one signature away from divorce. How can you say something like that?"

"I warn you, stay away from Isabella. She has nothing to do with you now."

Her words might have worked on someone else, but Michael didn't care at all.

His focus was solely on Isabella.

"Olivia, this is between Isabella and me. Step aside!"

He just wanted to take Isabella away, keep her in Evergreen City where she would be safe.

Olivia was furious. How dare this man come here and try to take her away?

"Over my dead body. What are you going to do about it?"

Olivia spread her arms to shield Isabella, her face red with anger. "Michael, if you had any conscience, you'd know how much you've hurt Isabella. Now that she's finally free of you, you want to drag her back? No way!"

Olivia's loud voice drew the attention of the crowd at the airport.

Some recognized them and started gossiping.

"Oh my God, isn't that Michael Brown? Didn't he have a public breakup ages ago? Why is he still chasing his ex-wife?"

"Ex-wife? Didn't you hear? They're not divorced yet, just separated. Looks like Michael Brown regrets it and wants her back, but she doesn't want him."

"He should have thought of that before. I remember he was all over some woman named Bianca back then. Now he regrets it? Too late."

Hearing Bianca's name, Isabella's hands clenched.

She looked at Michael with even colder eyes.

She had just wanted to avoid talking to him, but now she didn't even want to look at him.

"Olivia, let's go. Ignore him."

Isabella grabbed Olivia's hand and headed towards the VIP lounge.

"Stop."

Michael stepped in front of them, his eyes fixed on Isabella.

"No matter what, you can't leave Evergreen City. Just this once, listen to me, okay?"

Bianca was in Auroria now. The safest place for Isabella was Evergreen City.

If she went to Auroria, she'd be walking into danger.

He couldn't allow it. It was too risky.

And Bianca, that lunatic, would definitely do something if she knew Isabella was in Auroria.

Isabella didn't know what Michael was up to, but she hated his controlling attitude.

"Michael, you don't get it. Where I go is my choice. You have no right to control me, got it?"

Isabella didn't give him a chance to speak and started to walk away.

Michael had no choice but to grab her hand. "Isabella, please, stay. Don't go there!"

That place was the Adri Family's territory. He couldn't protect her there. If they wanted to harm her, he couldn't do anything.

And he wasn't Aaron. The Brown Group was facing major changes. He couldn't just leave the company and follow her.

So the best solution was for Isabella to stay.

That way, he could be at ease.

Isabella found his words laughable and shook off his hand without a second thought.

"Michael, are you kidding me? Who are you to me? Why should I listen to you?"

###chapter 405 Bianca Is There, You Can't Go

Michael's grip was shaken off, but he still stood firm in front of Isabella, refusing to back down.

"No way, you're coming with me today."

He couldn't convince her with words, so he was ready to use force.

As long as he could keep her here, he didn't care if Isabella ended up hating him.

Isabella took a deep breath and then let out a cold laugh. "Alright, give me one good reason why I should stay, and I'll go with you."

"Isabella."

Olivia was stunned, her eyes wide open.

Isabella patted her hand and whispered, "We don't have much time. If he keeps this up, do you think we'll still make our flight?"

Olivia immediately caught on.

Isabella was playing a strategy to make Michael let go on his own.

For a moment, Olivia was scared. She thought Isabella still had feelings for Michael and wanted to go with him.

Michael's eyes lit up when he heard she was willing to stay. He revealed his biggest worry and the most dangerous point.

"Isabella, Bianca is in Auroria. You can't go there."

Isabella felt a sharp pain in her chest.

She never expected that Michael's reason for wanting her to stay was because of Bianca.

"So, you're stopping me so ruthlessly just because you don't want me to run into your sweetheart, huh?"

As for why Bianca was there, it was definitely Michael's doing.

The Brown Group was in turmoil, and since they weren't fully divorced yet, Bianca's status was that of a mistress.

So he sent her abroad to hide for a while, waiting for things to settle down before bringing her back to marry her openly into the Brown Family.

He had everything planned out for Bianca.

He just wanted to give Bianca a legitimate status, so she wouldn't be criticized for her past.

If he loved Bianca so much, why did he still torment Isabella?

"Michael, if you're so worried about your darling, why don't you just bring her back and hide her in your place? Don't strip me of my right to go abroad just because she's there."

"I really don't get it. If you like her so much, why are you delaying our divorce? Only when we're no longer connected can you marry Bianca, right?"

"Isabella, what are you talking about?"

Michael frowned, never expecting that just mentioning Bianca would lead Isabella to such conclusions.

These things had nothing to do with him.

They said those involved were confused, while bystanders saw clearly.

Standing aside, Olivia finally understood this saying, watching Isabella pretend not to care when she clearly did.

She felt heartache for Isabella.

What was so good about Michael? Any random guy outside would be better than him.

Why couldn't she let go of such a bad man?

But she had to admit, Michael was right about one thing.

That was Bianca, the crazy woman.

If it weren't for her, Isabella wouldn't have lost her child.

Now that Isabella's body had just recovered, if she ran into that lunatic Bianca again, who knew what Bianca might do?

For safety's sake, this trip to Auroria was off the table.

Seeing Michael getting closer to Isabella, clearly intending to take her away, Olivia quickly pulled her aside and said to Michael, "Back off, Michael. I don't know what you're trying to pull, but we'll trust you this time. Just don't get too comfortable. Keep your distance from Isabella."

With that, Olivia pulled Isabella away quickly.

As they walked out, Isabella looked at Olivia in confusion. "Olivia, are we not going?"

"No!"

"Why not? Do you also think I'm afraid of Bianca?"

Isabella was baffled. She was actually eager to find Bianca. If Bianca was in Auroria, she wanted to confront her.

She wanted to capture Bianca and avenge her child.

"It's not about fear."

Olivia sighed and explained, "Isabella, Bianca is a complete lunatic now. A lunatic can do anything. We can't risk your safety."

"Besides, abroad is different from Evergreen City. Here, we have people everywhere. But if we go abroad, there's no one to control the situation. Bianca is vengeful. If something happens, we won't even have anyone to call for help. It's too dangerous."

"If you're worried about Renee, we can send someone to protect her. How about that?"

Isabella didn't respond. Just then, her phone buzzed.

It was a text from Aaron.

He said he was on the flight to Auroria with Renee and assured her he would protect Renee.

Olivia, standing close, saw the message too.

"Aaron went with her, Isabella. Now you can relax, right?"

"Okay."

With Aaron there, she felt much more at ease.

Meanwhile, watching Isabella get into the Wilson Family car, Michael finally felt relieved and returned to the office.

But as soon as he arrived, he was faced with a big problem.

The project confirmation from Auroria had come through.

The Adri Family's concession had finally given him the mining rights to the largest mine.

But the Adri Family had a condition. The mining rights had to be bought out in one go, worth a billion dollars.

Otherwise, they would take a 20% cut of the profits from each batch of diamonds mined.

Even though diamonds were highly profitable, they could only be monetized after being brought back to the country.

They not only had to invest in mining but also manage the entire process, including risks and resource costs.

The Adri Family demanding 20% was outrageous.

Michael took one look and knew this wasn't the contract Aaron had signed.

He quickly dialed Aaron's number to clarify, as Aaron was the one in charge of the project.

And the contract had already been stamped by the local government. If not handled promptly, the Brown Group would suffer.

But his phone was turned off.

Michael frowned deeply. How could he forget? Aaron was on a plane and likely out of the country by now.

He sat down to calm himself.

Luckily, he had reviewed the contract. Even though the Adri Family had stamped it, it wouldn't be valid without his signature and submission.

The worst outcome would be a delay in the project's start.

He rubbed his temples, wondering if he was overthinking.

Lately, whether it was the Brown Group or his personal life, strange things kept happening, never a moment of peace.

Just as Michael shook off his thoughts and started working, his phone buzzed again.

###chapter 406 He Already Knew

The call was from Aiden, urging Michael to come back to the Brown Villa.

Michael figured Aiden was going to lecture him about Isabella again, so he refused without a second thought.

But the next second, Aiden's angry roar came through the phone.

"You little punk, you think you're all grown up now, huh? How dare you keep such a big deal from me? That's a billion-dollar project in Auroria! If you mess this up, I'll break your legs!"

"Get home right now and bring the project contract with you. I need to review it personally."

Hearing it was about the company, Michael didn't dare to argue.

After all, he was just the CEO of the Brown Group, managing the company's day-to-day operations, but Aiden was still the chairman of the board.

With such a big issue at hand, Aiden had the right to know, and Michael couldn't refuse.

"Got it. I'll be there right away."

On the way back, Michael grew increasingly uneasy.

From the moment he received the contract to the moment he opened it, it had only been about ten minutes. How did Aiden find out so quickly?

If someone in the company had leaked the information, they couldn't have known the details of the contract so precisely.

He was sure he was the first person to handle that document.

Who could have tipped Aiden off and accurately guessed the amount involved?

He didn't believe it was a coincidence. If it was deliberate, who could it be?

With a sudden screech of brakes, Michael swerved the car sharply to the side, narrowly avoiding a figure that had appeared in front of him.

If he had been going any faster, he would have run them over.

He got out to check and found that the obstacle in the middle of the road was just a mannequin that looked eerily human.

This was the only road leading to the Brown Family estate.

It didn't appear earlier or later, but right when he was passing by. It seemed like someone was deliberately messing with him.

His eyes darkened as he tossed the mannequin aside.

If he had any doubts before, he was now almost certain someone was watching him, someone who not only wanted to ruin him but also wanted him dead.

In the Brown Family's grand hall, Michael walked in to find Aiden sitting on the couch, staring at him with a stern expression.

Michael knew Aiden was angry.

Angry that he hadn't informed him about such a significant matter.

Stella, hearing her son had returned, was already waiting downstairs. She took Michael's coat and said, "Michael, you're finally back. Your Grandpa has been waiting for you for a long time."

"And he seems to be in a bad mood. Be careful with what you say, okay?"

Stella whispered to her son.

Michael didn't say anything, just nodded slightly.

Stella turned to Aiden with a smile, "Dad, it's lively at home today. Michael and Nolan are both here to keep you company. I'll go ask the kitchen to prepare a few more dishes."

"Alright, go ahead."

Aiden waved her off.

"Nolan's here too?"

Michael caught the key point and couldn't help but ask.

Nolan, who usually avoided coming home, had suddenly decided to show up?

Even Michael, who wasn't the most perceptive, could sense something was up. It seemed Nolan's talk about joining the company at the café wasn't just idle chatter.

"Yes, Nolan resigned from his teaching job and came back to see me."

Aiden didn't say much, but it was clear he welcomed Nolan's return.

After all, he felt he owed Nolan a lot. He had only wanted to place Nolan in a branch office, but Nolan had left for three years abroad without a word.

Now that he was older, Aiden wanted to make amends as much as he could.

Michael didn't ask further. Since Aiden wanted to review the Auroria project, he handed over the documents.

"Grandpa, here's the contract and agreement from Auroria. Please take a look."

Aiden took the documents and slowly flipped through them, finally stopping at the last page, his brows furrowing.

"You promised me you'd secure this lucrative deal with Auroria. Look at this. How is this any different from throwing money away?"

"I can't agree to this. A billion dollars is no small amount."

"Grandpa, you misunderstood. I just noticed the discrepancies in this contract myself. Don't worry, this isn't the agreement we initially approved. I'll have it verified."

Hearing this, Aiden finally relaxed.

"That's more like it. Michael, I've entrusted the company to you. Don't let me down."

"I understand, Grandpa."

After discussing business, Aiden brought up Isabella. "I heard the Wilson Family sent you divorce papers. Is Isabella really not willing to come back to the Brown Family?"

Michael's mood instantly dropped. He no longer knew what Isabella was thinking.

He didn't know if she would ever forgive him.

"Grandpa, I don't know. She doesn't want to see me. We can't even have a conversation without arguing or saying hurtful things. We can't communicate calmly at all."

When it came to Isabella, Michael was at a loss.

No matter what he said or did, she would get angry and bring Bianca into the mix, creating a barrier between them. He didn't know how to explain things to her anymore.

"In the end, it's your own fault for not realizing Isabella's worth sooner. If you had, you wouldn't be in this situation where you can't even see her."

"I know the company is a heavy burden on you, but if you don't fight for Isabella, you'll really lose her."

After their divorce, Isabella would have no ties to the Brown Family.

With the Wilson Family's resources and background, Isabella could find someone better. Michael would be out of the picture.

Michael understood Aiden's advice, but he felt powerless.

Feelings couldn't be dictated by one person alone.

Moreover, Isabella no longer had any affection for him and wouldn't even spare him a glance.

"Grandpa, it's getting late. I'll go check on the kitchen."

Michael genuinely didn't know what else to say to Aiden and chose to avoid the topic.

Aiden didn't say anything, just sighed to himself.

At that moment, Nolan wheeled himself over and stopped in front of Aiden.

His eyes immediately noticed the contract on the table, but he didn't look at it or ask about it.

Because he already knew what was in it.

"Grandpa, what's wrong? Why are you sighing?"

Nolan asked with a concerned expression.

"Nolan, you're here."

Aiden looked up and smiled. "It's nothing. I'm just getting old and have many regrets. I was just thinking about some things."

Seeing the documents on the table, Aiden instinctively put them away.

After all, the company was now in Michael's hands, and the documents contained confidential information.

Even though they were family, it wasn't appropriate for Nolan to see the contract.

###chapter 407 Confession

Nolan saw everything clearly.

Even though he didn't care about the contents of the contract, Aiden's actions still hurt him.

He had been right all along.

In this family, his status was nowhere near comparable to Michael's.

The truth was right in front of him. To Aiden, Michael was his beloved grandson, while Nolan was just an insignificant outsider.

But Aiden didn't see it that way. He had always thought highly of Nolan.

When the Brown Family faced trouble and Aiden fell seriously ill, the responsibility of the company fell on Nolan, who had just graduated from college.

Nolan didn't complain at all and managed to keep the company afloat.

Nolan had once been a source of pride for Aiden.

But after that incident...

Aiden didn't know if he had truly made a mistake, causing Nolan to distance himself.

Nolan had been abroad for three years without visiting him once.

Now that Nolan had finally returned, he could no longer stand on his own two feet.

As his grandfather, how could Aiden not feel regret?

At least Nolan was still willing to be close to him, and that was enough.

"Nolan, you're not getting any younger. Did you meet anyone special while you were abroad? When will you bring her home for me to meet?"

"Don't worry, as long as you like her, her family background doesn't matter. I won't oppose it."

Now that Michael had driven Isabella away, Aiden's only great-grandson was gone too.

He had no choice but to shift his attention to Nolan. The house had been too quiet for too long; a happy event would bring some cheer.

Nolan didn't rush to respond. His gaze instinctively fell on his "immobile" legs.

He sighed softly. "Grandpa, I don't have any plans for that right now. Let's take it slow. I'm not in a hurry."

But in reality, the person he was waiting for was Isabella.

Michael was still refusing to sign the divorce papers. How could he bring Isabella back to the Brown Family for Aiden to meet?

Aiden, however, couldn't sit still when he heard Nolan wasn't in a hurry.

"Not in a hurry? You're already over thirty. If you don't hurry, it'll be too late. I see you're not taking this seriously. How about this: I'll find a few suitable girls for you to meet. You can have dinner and chat with them."

If it had been before, Aiden might not have focused on Nolan.

But now, he couldn't manage Michael anymore.

With Nolan back in the Brown Family, as a grandfather, he had to make plans for him. It was also a way to make up for his past guilt.

Nolan heard the word "matchmaking" and a faint, cold smile appeared on his lips, quickly disappearing.

"Grandpa, I have my own plans for this. You don't need to worry about it."

"Your own plans? Does that mean you already have someone in mind?"

Aiden immediately caught the key point, his eyes lighting up.

Seeing he couldn't hide it, Nolan decided to be straightforward. "Yes, I have someone I like. But I haven't confessed my feelings yet. I don't know if she wants to be with me. So, Grandpa, please don't introduce anyone to me."

"If she sees or hears about it, she might misunderstand."

Aiden's face lit up with a smile when he heard Nolan had someone he liked. "Alright, alright. I won't interfere. But you need to be proactive. Don't keep her waiting."

"Okay, Grandpa. I will tell her how I feel."

A smile flashed across Nolan's face.

If Aiden knew the person he was talking about was Isabella, he wondered if Aiden would still be smiling so happily.

But he didn't plan to reveal that.

He said he was going out for a walk and wheeled himself outside.

Earlier, he had seen Michael heading out. Michael had said he was going to the kitchen, but in reality, he was looking for some peace and quiet.

Sure enough, as soon as Nolan reached the hallway, he saw Michael standing in the shadows.

Before Nolan could say anything, Michael spoke up.

"Nolan, what's the point of this? You can't beat me openly, so you're resorting to underhanded tactics?"

Michael's face showed blatant sarcasm. "Do you think this will help you take my place and gain control of the company? Dream on."

Michael knew one thing for sure: if Aiden didn't want to hand the company over to him, what happened on his twentieth birthday wouldn't have occurred.

No matter what, he was the biggest beneficiary of that event.

Some things, coming from his mouth, would only seem insincere and hypocritical.

So, he never explained anything.

But that didn't mean Nolan could mess with him without consequence.

Unexpectedly, Nolan didn't get angry. Instead, he smiled and explained, "Michael, I haven't done anything. Why are you so worked up?"

Suddenly, as if he had thought of something, he looked at Michael.

"Do you think I peeked at the documents you gave Grandpa? Don't worry, Grandpa didn't let me see them. He didn't even touch me. If you don't believe me, you can ask him."

Michael didn't believe him. "Really? Then what did you and Grandpa talk about?"

Nolan's eyes flickered. "Grandpa is concerned about my personal life. He wants to find a few suitable candidates for me to marry."

At this point, he paused and looked directly at Michael.

"Do you think I should tell Grandpa that the person I want to marry is Isabella? What do you think his reaction would be?"

"Don't you dare!"

Michael was furious, his eyes turning sharp.

If Nolan dared to tell Aiden that, Michael would make sure he didn't leave the Brown Family today.

Seeing Michael so tense, Nolan felt satisfied.

He smiled and shrugged. "Don't be so angry. I was just joking. Don't worry, I only told Grandpa that I have someone I like, but I can't bring her home yet because it's not convenient for her right now."

As for why it wasn't convenient, that was something Michael would have to answer.

Michael's face darkened.

He hadn't expected Nolan to admit to Aiden that he had someone he liked.

Was he planning to confess to Isabella next?

If Isabella agreed, what would Michael do?

After lunch, Aiden called Michael into the study.

He had something to discuss with him privately.

Michael didn't think much of it, assuming it was about the company, and followed him in.

But Aiden's first question caught him off guard. "Nolan mentioned wanting to join the company. What do you think?"

Michael's expression immediately darkened.

The issue had to be addressed.

Now it was up to Aiden's attitude.

###chapter 408  A Promise

"Grandpa, if you want Nolan back, I'm cool with it," Michael spoke sincerely.

"That's your answer, huh?"

Aiden's tone was flat, giving nothing away.

But Michael could sense Aiden's reluctance. He knew Aiden didn't want Nolan back, especially since Nolan was gunning for the top spot. Aiden saw it clearer than anyone.

"Grandpa, I don't get it. If Nolan was the right guy to take over, why did you give me the reins back then? What are you hiding?"

Michael didn't know what had gone down years ago, but he could tell Aiden had trusted and admired Nolan's skills.

Otherwise, he wouldn't have looked so proud whenever he talked about Nolan.

Yet, just when the company was thriving under Nolan's leadership, Aiden suddenly announced that Michael would be the future heir of the Brown Group, handing the company over to him without any prep.

This decision forced Nolan to leave.

Hearing this, Aiden lowered his eyes. So many years had passed, and he still didn't know if that decision was right or wrong.

But in the end, he had hurt Nolan.

He had caused Nolan to go abroad alone for three years. How could he not feel guilty during those years?

Thinking about it, Aiden sighed and decided not to hide the truth any longer.

"I had planned to take this secret to my grave, but since you asked, I'll tell you the truth. But don't ask about it anymore after this."

"I chose to hand the company over to you because I made a promise to someone that I would never let Nolan take over the Brown Group."

If it weren't for that promise, he wouldn't have made such a sudden decision.

Michael was stunned. A part of his steadfast beliefs seemed to crumble instantly.

Aiden had suddenly announced him as the heir and driven Nolan out of the house just because of a "promise"?

What did all his years of dedication mean then?

He had thought that Aiden had chosen him because of his potential or talent, which was why the Brown Group was handed to him.

But it turned out to be for this reason.

If that was the case, he would have preferred that the Brown Group had never been handed to him. That way, he could have pursued what he wanted freely, without being bound by responsibilities that kept him away from the person he loved most. He wouldn't have had to watch Isabella leave.

"Grandpa, if that's the reason, then I think there's no harm in Nolan coming back. At least Nolan's abilities and vision are no less than mine. If he manages the company, he might do a better job than me."

"Why should you bear the burden of that promise for so many years?"

Aiden wasn't the only one trapped by this situation.

In front of Nolan, Michael was the villain who had seized power. Nolan directed all his hostility towards him.

But back then, Michael had been pushed into this position without knowing anything, without any choice.

For years, he had to hold onto power tightly for himself and his mother.

But what did he gain in the end?

He lost his child, and Isabella left him.

He couldn't even get close to her.

And now Nolan was about to confess to the family about his relationship with Isabella.

If Nolan wanted to take the Brown Group from Michael, Michael would rather give up the power.

That way, he could do what he wanted.

He couldn't stand by and watch Isabella and Nolan together without feeling anything.

Aiden looked at him deeply. "Michael, you shouldn't be saying these things. What are you thinking?"

Michael struggled to find the right words. "Grandpa, I just think Nolan might be more suited for that position. If you don't want to break your promise, why not discuss it with the other party again?"

"I knew I shouldn't tell you this. Don't ask anymore."

Aiden sat down wearily and waved Michael away. "I can't give you an answer about Nolan right now. I'm tired. You can go."

Michael said nothing more and quietly left the study.

The room fell silent.

Aiden stared blankly out the window, looking as if he had aged decades.

He knew what Michael and Nolan were thinking.

His decision back then was too hasty. It hurt Nolan and didn't give Michael any time to prepare.

Now, seeing the result, he knew he bore the greatest responsibility.

But he had made that promise.

Now that the other party was dead, he still clung to that promise, indirectly causing his two grandsons to almost turn against each other. Should he continue to hold on?

Meanwhile, Michael slowly descended the stairs.

His mind kept replaying Aiden's mention of that "promise."

Who could have made Aiden change the company's leadership with just a word?

How much did that person hate Nolan?

As he was about to leave, he glanced out the first-floor window and saw Nolan sitting in the garden.

Even though it was spring, the weather was still cold.

Nolan, dressed in a light blue cashmere coat, sat in a wheelchair, his gaze seemingly on the flowers or somewhere else, with a gray blanket over his legs.

He exuded a deep sense of loneliness.

Michael didn't plan to disturb him.

His feelings for Nolan had long faded over the years, but he didn't hate him either.

After all, Nolan hadn't actually harmed him.

But Nolan's presence had driven a wedge between Michael and Isabella.

So, whether Nolan eventually joined the Brown Group or not, Michael wouldn't feel any guilt. This was their fate as members of the Brown family.

At the Wilson Group, Atticus had just hung up the phone. Isabella hadn't boarded the plane to Auroria; she was already on her way back. He breathed a sigh of relief.

As he put down his phone, he ran into Holden, who had also received the news.

Before he could speak, Holden started ranting.

"Atticus, I have to say, even if you spoil her, you can't let her go to such a dangerous place like Auroria alone. Have you forgotten that the people who wanted Isabella dead last time were sent by that mysterious family from Auroria?"

"No way! I can't rest easy. Notify them that I'm taking a private jet to get there ahead of her. I'll block her at the airport before she lands."

Holden was about to leave when Atticus grabbed him.

"Calm down. You're getting worked up over nothing. Isabella didn't go to Auroria. She's already on her way home."

"Really?"

Holden paused, thinking Atticus might be lying to him, so he asked again, "Atticus, are you covering for Isabella, trying to delay me?"

###chapter 409  New Boyfriend

Atticus rolled his eyes at Holden and tossed his phone over. "I don't have time for this. Isabella didn't go. The bodyguard just called."

Seeing the call log from a minute ago, Holden finally relaxed. "Good, that place isn't safe. If something happened to Isabella, Dad won't be at peace."

Atticus didn't say anything. Daniel's last wish was for Isabella to live a happy life. They, as her uncles, would protect her with their lives if necessary.

Holden pulled up a chair and sat down, glancing at the documents on the desk. He suddenly frowned. "Atticus, didn't you hand the company over to Emilio? Why are you still handling things? Ever since Dad passed, you've been busy with family matters. Isn't your own work important?"

Atticus was the head of the Southern Military District, constantly busy with affairs. Now he had to juggle the family business and Isabella's safety. He must be exhausted.

Hearing this, Atticus's eyes slowly darkened, and he sighed lightly. Some things didn't need to be said; they were already clear.

Holden grew anxious. "Atticus, don't wear yourself out. Your work is just as important. Let the professionals handle the company. As for the family, leave it to me."

Atticus looked up at him, surprised but pleased. "Holden, it's enough that you care. The company is stabilizing, and with Emilio there, I'll soon be able to step back. But I'm still worried about Isabella."

If it weren't for his concern for Isabella, he would have already thrown himself into his own career.

Holden nodded in agreement. "True, a lot has happened to Isabella recently. If we keep her cooped up at home, her emotions will suffer."

Atticus shared this concern. The next moment, Holden had a bright idea. "Hey, Atticus, since we're worried about Isabella going out, why not arrange for someone reliable to accompany her? That way, we can be at ease wherever she goes."

Atticus didn't quite get it and frowned. "Isabella isn't lacking for company. Her friend Olivia is staying with her, and there's also Cinda. What more does she need?"

Cinda was someone they had chosen, though Isabella didn't know that. But Cinda wouldn't encourage Isabella to do anything dangerous. As for Olivia... Just thinking about her gave Atticus a headache. He avoided dealing with Olivia whenever possible, as long as she didn't drag Isabella into trouble, he was content.

"Atticus, I don't mean friends or a nanny. I mean finding Isabella a boyfriend!"

"A boyfriend!" Atticus nearly choked on Holden's words. "What nonsense are you talking about?"

"Isabella and Michael aren't even divorced yet. If this gets out, how will Isabella face anyone?"

"So what!" Holden didn't care about such things. "Thomas is handling their divorce. They're already done for. Or do you want to push Isabella back to that scumbag Michael?"

"Of course not!" Atticus frowned. "The Browns won't pick on Isabella again. The divorce has to happen."

They had kept quiet out of respect for Aiden and Daniel being old friends, but now that Daniel was gone, they were Isabella's only support. As long as they were around, no one would dare mess with Isabella.

"Exactly! Atticus, think about it. Isabella was deeply in love with Michael. Who knows if she's really over him? If we don't introduce someone suitable now, what if she rekindles things with Michael? That would be worse!"

Holden's words hit home for Atticus. As the uncle who doted on Isabella the most, her love life was his biggest worry. The Browns couldn't have Isabella back. The best way to separate her from Michael was to introduce a new "boyfriend."

But he needed to confirm one thing. "Do you have someone in mind?"

Holden caught Atticus's drift. Clearly, he agreed with the idea. Holden grinned and leaned in. "I think Emilio is a good match. You admire him, don't you? He could help Isabella with the company too. They'd be perfect together."

Holden had thought it through. Atticus nodded. "Emilio is indeed suitable, but will Isabella agree?"

He had spent a lot of time with Emilio at the company recently. Emilio's abilities and character impressed him. He had considered this before, but Isabella seemed to see Emilio only as a friend.

"Don't worry, I'll handle Isabella. Leave it to me." Holden patted his chest, taking on the responsibility.

Meanwhile, at the Wilson Villa, Cinda was surprised to see Isabella and Olivia return so soon. "Ms. Taylor, you just left. Why are you back so quickly?"

Isabella, recalling the argument with Michael at the airport, felt a headache coming on. "Not going."

Michael, that jerk. They were getting divorced, yet he still tried to control her.

"Didn't Renee come back with you?" Cinda asked, noticing it was just the two of them.

"Her?" Olivia smirked. "She has company abroad. We didn't need to follow."

"I see. I'll make lunch for you. It's almost noon, and you must be hungry." Cinda headed to the kitchen.

"Cinda, I want your shrimp. Can I help?" Olivia linked arms with Cinda and followed her.

Isabella went to her room and sat at the piano to compose. Though Olivia suggested finding someone else to write the music, Isabella didn't want to give up halfway. She had promised Olivia.

Once she sat down, Isabella immersed herself in her world, not even hearing the knock on the door. Olivia had to push the door open. Seeing Isabella focused on her sheet music, she sighed.

"Isabella, I said we could find someone else to compose. You're going to wear yourself out."

Hearing her, Isabella snapped back to reality and explained, "I'm just sitting around at home anyway. I might as well finish this piece. It'll save your manager from bothering you."

###chapter 410  The Careful Thoughts of Pursuit

Olivia knew Isabella couldn't stand to see her struggling, which only made her feel worse.

Every song Isabella wrote was amazing, just like her design skills, always leaving people in awe.

But Olivia didn't want Isabella to wear herself out.

"It's fine, it's just one song. If it comes to it, I'll just tell them to pick another one for the lead single."

"You can't be so nonchalant about your work. We still have plenty of time, so don't stress. I can handle it."

"But-"

Before Olivia could finish, Isabella's phone rang, cutting her off.

Seeing the caller ID, Isabella was a bit surprised.

It was Emilio.

They hadn't really kept in touch since they last met at Celestial Dining.

Emilio had recently been promoted to vice president of the Wilson Group. Why would he be calling now? Could something have happened at the company?

With that thought, Isabella answered the call without hesitation.

To her surprise, Emilio's first question was, "Isabella, I heard from Mr. Atticus Wilson that you were planning a spontaneous trip abroad today. Have you left yet?"

Relieved that it wasn't a company emergency, Isabella relaxed.

Emilio's tone was gentle, suggesting he was just calling for a casual chat.

Isabella smiled lightly, "No, I'm at home. I was planning to go with a friend, but her boyfriend showed up unexpectedly, so I didn't need to go."

"Emilio, why did Atticus mention this to you?"

Atticus was usually very tight-lipped and didn't like gossip. Why would he tell Emilio, the vice president, about her plans?

"It's not what you think. I asked Mr. Atticus Wilson about you, and he mentioned it in passing."

"You know, with you away, Mr. Atticus Wilson has been managing the company, so we've had many opportunities to meet."

Emilio explained tactfully.

"Mr. Atticus Wilson mentioned you wanted to visit Auroria. I was thinking of calling you later to show you the scenery there via video."

"Maybe another time. There will be other opportunities."

Isabella chuckled but didn't elaborate.

If Emilio knew she was going to Auroria despite the danger, would he still want to see the scenery through her phone?

But since Michael had given her Bianca's location, she had to go and catch Bianca.

"Last time we met, you mentioned you were bored at home. The company just finished a big project, and I have a few days off. How about you show me around Evergreen City?"

"You know, I haven't been back in a long time and don't know the fun spots here."

Emilio's question seemed casual, but only he knew how nervous he was.

When both Atticus and Holden expressed their approval of him, he was thrilled.

With the support of the Wilson Family, he had to seize this opportunity to convey his feelings to Isabella.

"Fun spots around Evergreen City? Honestly, I'm not too familiar with them."

She hadn't explored much herself and couldn't think of any places off the top of her head.

Seeing Isabella about to refuse, Olivia quickly grabbed her and shook her head.

Isabella realized Emilio's good intentions. Wouldn't it be too harsh to reject him now?

After all, he was the vice president she had hired, working hard for the company. He finally had a few days off and was still thinking of her. She couldn't just turn him down.

"Well, I remember there's a Graceful Haven Church in Evergreen City that's been popular online recently. It's built on a hillside with great views. How about I take you there?"

Isabella was just making a suggestion.

She wasn't familiar with the local attractions and didn't go out much.

To her surprise, Emilio agreed immediately, "Sure, any place you pick will be great. I'm free these days. When do you want to go?"

Emilio didn't mind Isabella's past marriage. In fact, he was glad she was divorced. Otherwise, he might never have had the chance to get close to her or dream of a future together.

As long as Isabella accepted him, he would be the happiest man in the world.

"How about tomorrow? My friend is here too, so we can all go together. It'll be nice to have company."

Isabella smiled and pulled Olivia into the plan.

The moment she finished speaking, both Emilio on the phone and Olivia beside her fell silent.

Emilio had hoped to develop his relationship with Isabella, not expecting a "good friend" to join.

Olivia's eyes widened. She waved her hands and shook her head at Isabella, her face clearly saying, "No way!" She almost spoke out loud.

Anyone could see Emilio's feelings for Isabella.

Isabella was single, and after being hurt by Michael for so long, she needed someone to comfort her.

If Emilio and Isabella spent more time together, they might develop a beautiful relationship. If Olivia went along, she'd just be the awkward third wheel.

She didn't want that!

But the next second, Isabella sent Olivia a pleading look.

Olivia was speechless.

So Isabella knew Emilio's intentions but was too embarrassed to refuse him.

All Olivia's plans went out the window.

She had heard about Emilio from Isabella. He was just as good-looking, capable, and well-off as Michael. Why couldn't Isabella give him a chance?

Who knew, she might fall for him. Love was unpredictable.

Olivia decided to give Emilio another chance. She cleared her throat and said, "Emilio, I'm not much of an outdoor person. How about you and Isabella go alone?"

She had made it clear. Emilio, a grown man, couldn't pretend not to understand, right?

Isabella's brow furrowed.

But Emilio just chuckled, "Olivia, don't be so shy. Since Isabella and I are old friends, that makes you my friend too. It'd be nice to have you along."

Olivia's mouth twitched.

Fine.

If both Emilio and Isabella insisted on her presence, what was she afraid of?

Olivia gritted her teeth, "Alright, I'll go!"

After hanging up, Isabella quickly apologized to Olivia, "Olivia, don't be mad. I didn't mean to put you on the spot. It's just that if you don't go, Emilio and I will feel awkward."

Olivia huffed, thinking, 'I'm the one who'll feel the most awkward.'

But she realized Isabella wasn't interested in Emilio. If she had no feelings for him, it was better to keep a distance.

"Just this once. Don't use me as a shield again."

"Absolutely, Olivia. You're the best."

###chapter 411 Switched

Isabella was still busy composing, so Olivia didn't want to disturb her and left shortly after.

As soon as the door closed, Isabella picked up her phone and called Atticus.

She had agreed to go out with Emilio, but now she had a different idea.

She had been wanting to set up Olivia and Atticus for a while.

But Atticus seemed to be avoiding her on purpose. It had been two or three days since he last came home. Matters of the heart required mutual willingness, and him avoiding her like this wasn't going to help.

So, she needed to create some noise to help Olivia out.

The phone connected, and Atticus's deep, magnetic voice came through, "Isabella?"

"Hey, Uncle Atticus. Emilio invited me to go to Graceful Haven Church tomorrow to relax. Thought you should know."

Isabella was always a free spirit, so it was surprising that she would call about something so trivial. Atticus was taken aback.

But he also found it considerate.

Since Isabella married Michael three years ago, she hadn't been this close to him.

"That's fine. I'm cool with you going with Emilio, but be careful. Take a bodyguard with you, don't come back too late, and definitely don't stay out overnight."

Atticus knew Emilio would make a move, so he wasn't surprised.

But he was still cautious about Isabella's safety.

Even though Emilio was someone both he and Holden approved of, men were still men. He didn't want Isabella to suffer any grievances or be taken advantage of by Emilio.

Hearing Atticus's advice, Isabella couldn't help but laugh.

"Atticus, what are you thinking? We're just going for a walk nearby."

Isabella deliberately hesitated, waiting for Atticus to take the bait.

Sure enough, Atticus quickly asked, "But what? Why are you only saying half of it?"

Isabella cleared her throat, trying not to make her intentions too obvious. "Atticus, I see you've been very busy lately and haven't had time to come home. Why don't you take a break and come out with us? Just to keep me company."

"You want me to keep you company? No problem. But isn't tomorrow already planned with Emilio? How about I join you another day?"

Atticus knew Emilio's intentions. Since Emilio had already set the time, it wouldn't be appropriate for him to tag along as an elder.

"No, it has to be tomorrow!"

Isabella quickly changed her tone to avoid suspicion. "Uncle Atticus, I just want you to be with me tomorrow. Please, I feel safe with you around."

After hearing her plea, Atticus couldn't refuse.

"Alright, if you want me to be there, I'll go with you."

Atticus had already thought of a plan.

At worst, he would drop Isabella off and leave early.

"Deal. Uncle Atticus, I'll wait for you at home tomorrow."

Hanging up the phone, Isabella smiled triumphantly.

This time, she was sure she could set up Atticus and Olivia.

At the Brown Group, Michael stood in his office, looking out at the sunset pouring into the room, feeling a deep sense of loneliness.

At this time, he should be heading home like everyone else, enjoying the company of his family. Or preparing dinner with his wife, chatting about trivial matters.

But he had none of that.

He was alone.

The Brown Villa had Aiden and Stella's nagging, which he couldn't stand.

His other residences were dark and lifeless, so he didn't bother going there.

As for his and Isabella's marital home at Elysian Heights Estate, he didn't have the courage to step foot in it.

So, his only refuge was the office. It was the only place that gave him peace.

He walked to his desk, knowing that work was the only thing that could temporarily distract him from his troubles.

At ten o'clock, Michael called Aaron internationally, timing it perfectly.

Aaron and Renee should have arrived by now.

If it weren't urgent, he wouldn't have called Aaron at this hour.

As soon as the call connected, Michael got straight to the point. "Aaron, did you thoroughly review the contract proposal from Auroria?"

Aaron was taken aback but quickly responded, "Mr. Brown, I checked every clause carefully before signing and sending it to the local government for notarization. Is there a problem?"

Michael's eyes narrowed.

This meant the document in his hand wasn't sent from abroad but had been swapped beforehand.

But he couldn't determine if the switch happened in Auroria or domestically.

Michael couldn't immediately pinpoint the source of the error.

Fortunately, Aaron was in Auroria.

And as the project lead, Aaron knew the contract details better than Michael and could investigate locally.

"There's an issue. I can't explain over the phone. I'll send you a copy, and you'll understand."

Michael hung up and sent the document.

Aaron, at a nearby hotel, opened Michael's email on his laptop.

Given the seriousness, he reviewed every page meticulously.

The more he read, the more his back chilled.

Thankfully, Michael hadn't impulsively signed it.

If he had, the company would have suffered a huge loss.

How could the local government resort to such underhanded tactics?

During negotiations, every term was clearly discussed, especially the financial aspects. Both sides had repeatedly confirmed the contract details.

How dare they falsify the contract?

Did they think they didn't understand the law and could be easily deceived?

Renee, exhausted from a nearly ten-hour flight, was resting. Aaron, not wanting to disturb her, took his phone to the balcony.

He called Michael.

He intended to clarify the situation and discuss solutions.

Michael, waiting for the call, answered immediately. "Aaron, how do you explain this?"

The Auroria project had been Aaron's responsibility from the start. Now, with a contract issue, he couldn't escape accountability.

Aaron understood this and sought Michael's advice.

"Mr. Brown, I won't shirk my responsibility. But please trust me. The contract I saw was definitely not this one."

###chapter 412 A Huge Net

"Alright, so what's the plan now?"

Michael wasn't just looking to point fingers; the priority was to fix the mess.

Aaron quickly replied, "I'll head over to the local government office that handled the stamping. I'll check if they made a mistake or if someone's trying to screw us over."

"Don't worry, I'll let you know as soon as I find out anything."

"Good. Be careful with this. Whatever you do, don't go at it alone."

Michael was worried Aaron might act rashly and get into trouble.

"I got it. I'll keep you updated."

With that, Aaron hung up.

Michael put down his phone, sinking deep into thought.

The Adri Family had willingly given up this project. Why would the local government in Auroria pull something like this?

The Brown Group had been a top company in the country for years, with enough experience to not fall for a fake contract.

Such documents would be scrutinized upon arrival in the country, leading to interception, investigation, and eventually uncovering the truth. This would only delay the project, and mining operations couldn't start just anytime; they required strict timing and professional surveys.

What were these people after?

Michael couldn't figure it out. He decided to take the fake document out of the safe and look for clues.

Starting from the first page, he meticulously reviewed every detail.

When he reached the last page, he noticed something odd in the signature section.

He touched it and felt the embossed stamp.

But he hadn't signed or stamped it. How could there be such an imprint?

Suddenly, something clicked in Michael's mind.

He knew what the other party was up to!

Michael, furious, slammed the document onto the table.

He had been played!

The contract was in duplicate. After noticing something was off, he had one copy sent back for redrafting.

But it seemed someone had tampered with the blank document sent back in his absence.

The last page of the contract had the mine manager's signature and the local government's stamp in the "Party A" section.

In the "Party B" section, his name was blank, but there were traces of a stamp.

This meant someone had forged his signature and stamped the company's seal!

This made the contract legally binding. He had no choice but to accept the loss.

Damn it! He hadn't considered this possibility.

Meanwhile, Aaron, who was in Auroria to negotiate with local officials, received an urgent call from Michael.

He had to pause his conversation and find a quiet place to answer.

"Mr. Brown."

"Aaron, you don't need to investigate anymore!"

"What?"

Aaron was stunned, thinking Michael was joking. He cautiously said, "Mr. Brown, this is no time for jokes. You know how much effort we've put into this mine. The capital investment alone is over a billion dollars. If there's a problem with the contract, it's a big deal."

Aaron's rebuttal was understandable. He was in charge of the project in Auroria.

If something went wrong, Aaron would be held accountable, but as the CEO of the Brown Group, Michael would bear the ultimate responsibility.

Moreover, once the project started, the Brown Group would need to allocate 70% of its liquid assets to support it.

If a problem arose now, not only would their preparations and efforts be wasted, but the Brown Group's funds could also be restricted due to cross-border issues.

Such a significant portion of funds being tied up would be dangerous, even for a large group like the Brown Group.

If the funds were frozen, they could face predatory competitors.

This would also harm the Brown Group's reputation and future development.

But Michael was telling him to stop. Aaron was baffled.

Michael's voice deepened, "You heard me right. There's no need to investigate further. I found the reason!"

Although the implications were significant, he had no doubt about the other person's ambition.

To achieve this outcome, that person had personally intervened to make Michael believe in the project's credibility.

In hindsight, the scheme likely began when Michael decided to enter Auroria's mining industry. He had been targeted from the start.

The Adri Family had the strength to remain standing for over a century.

Initially, the Adri Family stayed quiet, even using internal conflicts to make Michael lower his guard, thinking he could dominate the mining sector.

Once the project started, it wouldn't be easy to withdraw. The initial investment was too significant for Michael to give up.

The Adri Family exploited this, leading Michael into their trap step by step.

They never intended to let go of Auroria's largest mine.

So, when Michael considered giving up, they panicked.

The Adri Family used various means to make him believe victory was within reach, just a bit more effort needed.

Whether it was internal family strife or Earl personally showing sincerity to take Bianca away, it was all a grand illusion. A web spun for Michael.

How could he have believed Earl, a survivor of such family battles, was a man of deep feelings?

Once Aaron received the project proposal, the Adri Family's plan was set in motion.

Now, the document in Michael's hand was fake but stamped by the local government.

This meant the Adri Family had colluded with the local government.

No matter who Aaron approached, he wouldn't find the truth.

Michael's signature wasn't their concern. As long as the contract was sent back, someone in the country could forge his signature and stamp the Brown Group's seal. This made the document legally binding, trapping the Brown Group.

Realizing this, Michael was relieved the Adri Family targeted the Brown Group first, not the Wilson Family. Otherwise, it would be Isabella losing sleep.

Her health was too fragile to handle this.

But his situation wasn't much better.

He had to intercept the contract before it reached Auroria.

If the contract landed in the local government's hands, there would be no turning back.

###chapter 413 Unexpected Situation

Michael had never felt so clear-headed.

The Brown Group had someone from the Adri Family within its ranks. Given the current situation, this person was either lurking close to him or already held a high position in the company. Otherwise, they wouldn't have been able to sneak into his office, forge his signature, and use his stamp without a trace.

But there was one thing he couldn't figure out. Apart from Aaron, he didn't trust anyone else around him.

And Aaron would never do something like this. He had no reason to harm the company or his own interests.

So, the only person who could enter his office and access the safe was someone close to him.

Recently, with Aaron being away, he had promoted a new assistant, Ruby Hill.

His suspicion wasn't without reason.

There weren't many people in the company who could enter his office, but recently, due to various contract signings, only Ruby knew where he kept the key to the safe.

If his hunch was correct, the problem lay with her.

As for how the Adri Family had bribed her to frame him, that was a matter for later.

Right now, he needed to find evidence and expose the mole.

She knocked on the door and found that Michael seemed to have stayed overnight, still in his suit, asleep in his chair.

"Mr. Brown, did you not go home last night?"

Hearing her voice, Michael opened his eyes. Seeing her, a glint of sharpness flashed in his eyes.

But he didn't show anything on his face.

He just rubbed his temples and asked, "What's up?"

Ruby carefully placed the documents on the desk. "This is your schedule for today. The department head asked me to bring it to you for review."

"Okay."

"I have something to do at noon and will be out of the office. Cancel all my morning appointments. Also," he pointed to the documents on the desk, "print these out and notify everyone that there will be a senior management meeting at 2 PM."

"Yes, Mr. Brown."

Ruby took the documents without showing any unusual expression.

But Michael had already set a trap.

The documents Ruby took were prepared in advance, with all information about Auroria deliberately removed, leaving only some cooperation terms. If she was indeed the Adri Family's mole, she would react to this information.

Isabella woke up early because she had plans to go out with Emilio.

When she went downstairs, she didn't wake her friend Olivia, who was sleeping in the next room. Instead, she quietly went to the first floor.

Cinda, knowing they were going out today, was already making breakfast.

Seeing Isabella up so early, Cinda offered her some food.

Isabella sat at the dining table, quietly eating the sandwich Cinda had made, but her mind was on Atticus and Olivia's relationship.

Yes, she had brought Olivia along to create an opportunity for her and Atticus to meet.

Even if they didn't talk, they couldn't avoid each other once they met.

"Emilio, I need to tell you something, but promise you won't get mad."

Emilio's heart sank, but his first thought was whether Isabella was feeling unwell.

"Okay, tell me. I won't get mad."

He blamed himself for being too eager. Isabella had just been discharged from the hospital and needed to recuperate. How could he invite her to go hiking?

Emilio didn't want Isabella to think he was meddling, so he asked cautiously.

But he didn't know that Isabella was actually in need of help. Having Emilio as an ally was a relief for her!

"Sorry, Emilio, but I need to hide you for now. Atticus hasn't arrived yet, and I don't want him to know you're here."

Isabella explained as she directed him.

Emilio didn't mind. In fact, sharing a secret with Isabella made him feel closer to her.

Once the car was parked, they didn't rush to get out.

Isabella explained the situation to him.

"And my friend Olivia likes Atticus too, but something happened between them, and neither wants to break the ice."

By now, Emilio understood everything.

"The minor issue you mentioned is helping them face their feelings?"

But why today? Emilio didn't ask.

Since Isabella had a plan, she must have her reasons.

"Yes, I think they're perfect for each other, so I have to do this."

"Oh, I almost forgot."

Isabella took out her phone and showed Emilio a photo of her and Olivia. "I remember you don't follow celebrities much, so you might not know what Olivia looks like."

Emilio looked at the photo of Isabella and Olivia, but his eyes were drawn to Isabella's bright, smiling face.

So, this was how happy she was with her friends.

###chapter 414  The Strategy of Provocation

"Hey, what do you think?"

In the quiet, enclosed garage, they were sitting so close that Isabella's breath was right next to him.

She and Emilio were no longer a good match.

Atticus couldn't believe that ending an imperfect marriage had made Isabella feel so insecure.

As the eldest daughter of the Wilson family and the heir to the group, how could she think she wasn't good enough for any man?

Even if she was divorced, so what?

In his eyes, Isabella was the best in the world.

It was all Michael's fault.

If Michael had cherished Isabella and not hurt her, how could the Wilson family's esteemed daughter have such low self-esteem?

His Isabella used to be a dazzling princess, excelling in business and management, achieving success in every hobby she pursued.

How could such an outstanding person have these thoughts?

That damned Michael. What had he done to Isabella over the past three years?

They must get divorced!

Isabella must not have any ties to that scumbag Michael.

Thomas was usually efficient when working on Sterling Avenue.

Isabella needed to be truly divorced from Michael to move on and accept new people.

Isabella blinked at Atticus, her eyes full of "sincerity."

She wanted to see how long Atticus could keep his cool.

He liked Olivia but wouldn't say a word.

Today, she would try to provoke him. She didn't believe Atticus would have no reaction.

Just putting their names together made Atticus frown deeply.

Olivia had always claimed to like him. How could she switch so quickly?

Even though he knew Olivia and Emilio wouldn't end up together, the thought of Olivia possibly dating, marrying, or even having children with another man was hard for Atticus to accept.

Isabella watched Atticus's reaction closely but said nothing.

She waited quietly for him to speak.

###chapter 415  Wake Up Olivia

Atticus, a former special forces soldier, had an impressive counter-surveillance ability that was always at work in his mind.

Why should Olivia just give up and walk away? Why should she say no and mean it?

He was a living person, not some object.

What now? Did she regret it?

Or had she stopped liking him?

Whatever it was, he wouldn't let her throw away their relationship like it was nothing.

Isabella calmly took a sip of water, noticing Atticus's clenched fists under the table, and couldn't help but want to laugh.

He had just been suppressing it for too long, always finding reasons not to believe in the longevity of their feelings.

But what he didn't realize was that the more he thought about it, the deeper he got entangled, and the more firmly this feeling took root in his heart.

Even if Olivia wanted to escape, Atticus wouldn't truly let go.

This was a man's possessiveness.

Seeing this side of Atticus made her feel that her efforts hadn't been in vain.

The next second, her phone rang.

Atticus going upstairs to find Olivia had piqued Isabella's curiosity.

Emilio saw the mischievous look on Isabella's face and knew she was up to no good.

###chapter 416 I Am Here For You

###chapter 417  Are You Going Too?

###chapter 418 The Car Broke Down

As soon as Atticus stepped out of the car, he knew something was wrong. The engine was acting up, and white smoke was pouring out. It was clear the car wasn't going anywhere.

This was odd.

His car was always kept in top shape by professionals and had never had any issues before.

What was going on today?

To make matters worse, the car had broken down in the middle of nowhere. If they were closer to Graceful Haven Church, Atticus could have asked Olivia to walk the rest of the way.

Now, stranded on a deserted road, he had no choice but to call for his bodyguards.

Just as he hung up the phone, Atticus turned around to see Olivia, who had somehow gotten out of the car and was now standing beside him.

"Is the car broken?" Olivia asked, having seen the white smoke herself. The atmosphere between them was already awkward, and she felt the need to say something.

"Yeah, it won't start. I've called for help," Atticus replied.

"Guess we'll have to wait here for a bit," Olivia suggested.

In the past, Atticus would have dreaded being alone with Olivia. Her feelings for him had always been so obvious and intense that he couldn't handle it and didn't know how to respond.

So, he had kept his distance, hoping she would eventually see that their relationship wasn't meant to be.

But now, the thought of her giving that love to another man filled him with an inexplicable sense of frustration and discomfort.

And the source of all these feelings was Olivia.

When Atticus realized this, he was shocked.

"Isabella, it's me. We're on the road, but the car broke down. We have to wait for help, so I don't know how long it will take. You and Emilio go ahead and have fun. We'll join you as soon as the bodyguards arrive."

With no shelter, the cold wind made them shiver.

Despite this, Olivia didn't get back into the car.

She didn't want to.

The flicker of emotion that had just risen in Olivia's heart was instantly extinguished.

He glanced at his watch. "They've probably just left. It'll take at least thirty minutes for them to get here."

After all, they were quite a distance from the Wilson family estate, and they had been driving for a while.

For the first time, she felt time dragging on. She was usually the life of the party, never letting things get dull.

No topic seemed to work between them.

Left with no choice, she pretended to sleep.

"Are you still tired?"

She had just gotten up not long ago, so Atticus was curious. "Didn't you sleep well last night?"

Ever since he realized he had feelings for Olivia, Atticus couldn't bear to push her away anymore.

Now that it was just the two of them, he didn't want to waste this opportunity.

Olivia usually talked so much that he didn't know how to respond. But now, she didn't even want to say a word to him.

This was unsettling for Atticus.
