She lied without batting an eye, just to avoid talking to Atticus.

Seeing her reaction, Atticus recalled what Isabella had told him that morning.

So, Olivia was really planning to forget about him and start a new relationship?

Why was he feeling this way?

He had been the one rejecting her all these years, refusing to accept her feelings.

He had wasted so much of her time. Now that she was finally ready to move on, he couldn't bear it.

Habits were dangerous things.

He didn't want to let go.

Once the thought took hold, the urge to have her overwhelmed him.

"Olivia, I need to talk to you," Atticus said, closing his eyes.

His mind was a mess, and even though he had the words, he didn't know how to start.

Should he ask if she still had feelings for him, or should he first confess his own feelings?

But what if she really was ready to move on? Wouldn't his words just complicate things for her?

Olivia was both angry and speechless. She bit her lip and said, "Fine, go ahead. I'm listening."

Atticus was momentarily at a loss for words.

Looking at Olivia's beautiful face, his heart skipped a beat.

###chapter 419  Dazzling Scene

Graceful Haven Church.

Isabella and Emilio had bought tickets for the church halfway up the mountain and were ready to start their climb.

Although he had only tampered with the car's engine a little, the car was moving at high speed, and no one could guarantee there wouldn't be any danger.

If anything happened to them, he would regret it.

Having barely slept the night before, he had planned to find a place to rest. But then he received a call from his mother, Stella, asking him to go to Graceful Haven Church to pray.

He hadn't wanted to go, but his mother said it was to pray for Isabella's safety and health, so he went.

He had come to pray for Isabella.

But Isabella was here, holding hands with another man.

At this moment, Michael felt like a complete fool.

But since he was here, he wasn't going to leave.

Besides, he wasn't the one who should leave.

Legally, he and Isabella were still married. He was still her rightful husband.

Emilio was just an interloper.

As soon as they entered the church, Isabella was captivated by the giant ginkgo tree in the center of the square.

The tree was covered in red ribbons, each one a wish for love.

It was said that this tree had been planted by an emperor for his beloved concubine centuries ago, earning it the name "Love Tree."

Many people came here just to wish for a happy and fulfilling love.

Over the years, the tree had become covered in red ribbons, each one filled with wishes. When the wind blew, the tree seemed to be ablaze with red, making it a striking sight.

Next to the tree was a sign explaining its history and the guidelines for making wishes.

Emilio glanced at Isabella, his ears turning red as if he had thought of something.

###chapter 420 It Really Is Him

Isabella stood there, her face a mask of indifference as she took in the scene around her.

This kind of stuff was for people who still believed in love and marriage. She was on the verge of a divorce and had long since stopped caring about such things.

After leaving Michael, all she wanted was to live the rest of her life in freedom.

Love and marriage? She was done with them.

She no longer let anyone else's happiness or sadness affect her, nor did she care if Michael loved her or not.

From now on, she just wanted to live happily for herself, not for anyone else.

The child didn't care about that. He only knew his toy was broken, and the person responsible wasn't making it right.

"Young man, you can't be so unreasonable."

Michael felt utterly misunderstood. As the CEO of the Brown Group, would he care about a kite worth a few dollars? But he really didn't have his wallet.

Michael?

With that thought, Isabella quickly looked away.

"I'm not trying to avoid paying. I just didn't bring my wallet."

That voice was unmistakable, even from a distance. Isabella turned abruptly, realizing the tall figure she had seen was indeed Michael.

###chapter 421  The Key to Emotions

###chapter 428 Unexpected Accident

Atticus, after making a phone call, turned to Emilio, who was standing there in shock. "Emilio, take Isabella to the hospital for a check-up. I'll handle Michael. The Wilson Family will be here soon."

When it happened, he had been with Olivia, sharing an intimate moment, until Isabella's scream interrupted them.

Then he got Emilio's call, saying Isabella had fallen down the hill.

It all happened so suddenly that he didn't even know how Michael had shown up there so quickly to protect Isabella.

"No!"

Hearing that she had to leave Michael, Isabella instinctively refused, holding him even tighter.

"I'm not leaving. Michael got hurt because of me. I'm not going anywhere until he wakes up."

She had questions for him when he woke up.

She wanted to know why Michael was there and why he rushed to save her the moment she was in danger.

He hadn't mentioned divorce for a while. Did he finally realize he had feelings for her?

If that was true, then maybe her years of hope and dreams weren't in vain.

"Isabella!"

Atticus's stern voice quickly quieted her down.

"Stop being stubborn. Go with Emilio now. I'll make sure Michael gets to the hospital and is taken care of. He'll be fine, trust me."

Although Atticus had his issues with Michael, he wasn't unreasonable.

Michael had gotten hurt saving Isabella, so Atticus would ensure he got to the hospital safely.

As time ticked by, Atticus didn't give Isabella a chance to refuse. He helped her up and handed her to Emilio.

"You take her and go."

Just then, Olivia arrived, a bit late. Seeing Isabella hurt, she was about to speak but noticed Michael's severe injuries.

She was stunned and didn't know what to say.

Atticus saw her too and gently advised, "Don't stay here. Isabella's hurt. Go with her to the hospital."

Seeing Isabella's dazed state, Olivia swallowed her questions and nodded obediently. "Okay, you be careful too."

She and Emilio helped Isabella out. "Isabella, let's go to the hospital, okay?"

Isabella didn't speak until they reached the foot of the hill and got into the car. "I don't want to go to the hospital. I'm really fine. Take me to Michael. I want to know how he's doing."

If he was in so much pain that he passed out, his injuries must be severe.

Emilio fell silent.

Olivia, noticing Isabella's concern for Michael, sighed and gently persuaded, "Isabella, I know you're worried about Michael, but you're hurt too."

"You might feel fine now, but you need a check-up to be sure. And if you want to see Michael, Atticus will take him to the hospital first."

Olivia's last sentence made Isabella realize.

Right, Atticus would take Michael to the hospital. If she wanted to see him, she had to go to the same hospital.

"Okay, I'll go to the hospital."

Isabella agreed calmly.

Olivia apologized to Emilio and asked him to drive them to the nearest hospital.

Emilio looked at Isabella deeply and sighed with relief. "Of course. I'll feel better once she's checked out."

His voice was full of concern and affection.

Olivia glanced at Isabella, who was still preoccupied with thoughts of Michael, and could only sigh.

What kind of spell were they under?

Isabella and Olivia had both held on to their love for their men for over a decade, refusing to move on.

She had seen it clearly. When Emilio heard Isabella had fallen, his face changed with worry. After calling Atticus, he risked his safety to find her.

He was the first to find Isabella.

If it weren't for Emilio, who knows how long it would have taken them?

Yet, despite Emilio being a perfect man deeply in love with Isabella, she only saw him as a good friend.

Was it some kind of curse that once they fell in love, they couldn't love anyone else?

On the way to the hospital, Isabella's emotions gradually calmed down.

She held Olivia's hand and softly said, "I'm sorry. I got too emotional and made you all worry."

Earlier, when she insisted on going to Michael, she noticed Emilio's face had changed.

But she hadn't thought much about it then. Now she realized she must have hurt his feelings.

"We don't mind worrying about you. As long as you're safe, that's all that matters."

###chapter 430 The Right to Pursue

"Mr. Blair, don't you think so?"

Olivia turned to Emilio in the front row, trying to get him involved in the conversation.

After all, Emilio had helped save Isabella too. Just because he wasn't hurt didn't mean his efforts should be ignored.

As Isabella's best friend, Olivia secretly thought that a kind and thoughtful guy like Emilio was perfect for Isabella.

But it was Isabella's personal feelings, and there wasn't much she could do about it.

"Yeah, Olivia's right. Isabella, how are you feeling now? Anything still hurting?"

As soon as he said it, Emilio regretted it.

Bringing that up was just making Isabella relive her time with Michael.

If he could, he wished he had been the one injured and unconscious instead of Michael.

That way, Isabella's worry and guilt would be all for him.

He hated himself for not protecting Isabella in time. If he had shielded her, maybe she wouldn't be in this mess with Michael.

Isabella shook her head calmly. "Emilio, thanks for coming to save me. I'm fine. By the way, did Atticus tell you which hospital he's taking Michael to?"

Emilio nodded. "Yeah, Atticus said he's taking Michael to the best hospital in Evergreen City. Given Michael's status, a smaller hospital might leak info."

Atticus had trusted Emilio to handle things quickly.

Michael was the CEO of the Brown Group, and if anything serious happened to him, or if he was left with any lasting injuries from saving Isabella, the divorce agreement Isabella had worked so hard on might fall apart.

Isabella had finally managed to break free from the Brown Family, and Atticus was determined not to let her get trapped again.

Atticus believed his niece deserved a better man.

In other words, Michael needed to stay far away.

Hospital.

Under the watchful eyes of the Wilson Family's bodyguards, Michael suddenly woke up during his examination. He asked about Isabella's condition, and upon confirming she was fine, he passed out again.

The final diagnosis showed that Michael had minor scrapes, a concussion from hitting his head, and a dislocated vertebra from the impact.

Isabella's report, however, was all clear. She had no serious injuries aside from some scrapes.

But Isabella was deeply shaken.

She had seen Michael's report. The concussion was from him shielding her with his arm when they hit the rock, and the dislocated vertebra was from hitting the tree that stopped them.

All of this was because of her.

Michael didn't have to do any of it.

What was he trying to achieve? If he wanted her to feel guilty, why risk his life?

Thinking back to the situation, she felt terrified, but Michael had stood firmly in front of her, taking on all the danger.

They were supposed to be getting divorced. What was he trying to do?

Why did he choose this moment to be kind to her?

How was she supposed to move on from this relationship?

Looking at the pale-faced Michael on the hospital bed, Isabella took a deep breath. He was lying there peacefully, but did he ever think about what she was supposed to do?

Outside the hospital room, Emilio stood in front of Atticus, looking guilty. "Mr. Wilson, today's mess is on me. I couldn't protect Isabella, and that's why she ended up in such a dangerous spot."

Atticus shook his head and patted Emilio's shoulder. "Don't beat yourself up. This accident wasn't your fault. If you hadn't called me in time, I wouldn't have known Isabella was in trouble."

Atticus glanced at Emilio, then at Isabella, who was deeply worried about Michael. He felt a pang of guilt for Emilio.

He wanted Isabella to find a man who would love and cherish her for the rest of her life. And Emilio seemed like the perfect match for her. But fate had other plans.

No matter how good Emilio was, Isabella only saw him as a friend. And at the scene of the accident, her concern and anxiety for Michael said it all. From the beginning, the only person she loved was Michael. She had never truly let go of that relationship. And now, Michael had risked his life to protect her. She would never be able to accept anyone else in this lifetime.

A relationship with no future shouldn't continue. He didn't want to hurt Emilio any further. Emilio was a good man and deserved his own happiness.

"Emilio, I need to talk to you."

Atticus paused, thinking about how to say it without hurting Emilio. But Emilio interrupted him. "Mr. Wilson, whether you blame me or not, it was my failure that led to Isabella's distress. I'll accept any punishment you give me. But please don't ask me to stop pursuing Isabella. I truly care for her. This isn't a fleeting feeling or a momentary impulse. I've had these feelings for a long time. I didn't have the chance before, but now I don't want to give up my right to pursue her."

"Emilio, why put yourself through this?"

Atticus sighed. He knew Emilio liked Isabella, but he didn't realize how deep his feelings ran. But Isabella didn't feel the same way about Emilio. Continuing like this would only bring him pain.

He glanced at the hospital room, then back at Emilio, offering a heartfelt piece of advice. "You've seen how Isabella feels about Michael. I'm not trying to discourage you, but continuing like this won't lead to anything."

Emilio should understand that no matter how hard he tried, it would be in vain. Especially now that everyone could see Isabella's feelings for Michael. Supporting Emilio's pursuit would only harm him.

"I don't care!"

Emilio's eyes were resolute. "I love Isabella. Even if I can't be with her, I'm willing to cherish the time we have together. Besides, she hasn't said she'll be with Michael. I still have a chance, don't I?"

Even if she didn't choose him in the end, he would accept it. Just like when he returned from abroad and found out she was getting married. She married the man she loved most. He buried his confession deep in his heart and offered her his sincere blessings. But now that she was getting divorced, he had no reason not to fight for himself.

Atticus saw this and knew further persuasion was useless. He nodded. "Alright, I respect your choice. If you love her, go after her."

If possible, he didn't want Isabella to return to Michael either. Michael had hurt Isabella too many times.

###chapter 431  Owe You an Apology

In the ward, Michael slowly opened his eyes, and the first person he saw was Isabella.

His mind was instantly flooded with the dangerous scene of her rolling down the hill, and he immediately became anxious. "Isabella, are you okay? Are you hurt anywhere?"

The pain in his body made every word feel like a stab, but he didn't care. He just wanted to know if she was injured and how serious it was.

Seeing Michael in such a state, the first thing he did upon waking was to ask about her condition. Isabella couldn't help but feel touched. But she had more questions and had to suppress her emotions for now.

"The test results came back, and I'm fine. You're the one who's seriously hurt. Don't you care about your own condition?"

Michael felt relieved hearing she was okay and lay back on the bed, breathing heavily. "What's a little injury? I'll be fine in a few days."

Compared to Isabella's injuries, his pain was nothing. She had just gone through a miscarriage and was in a fragile state. She couldn't afford any more harm. Otherwise, he would never forgive himself.

"What do you mean, 'a little injury'?" Isabella frowned at his dismissive tone. "The doctor said you had a head injury that almost caused a severe concussion, and your bones..."

"It's nothing." Before Isabella could finish, Michael interrupted her, waving his hand dismissively. "I know my body. These injuries are no big deal. You don't need to worry about me."

Isabella was frustrated with his irresponsible attitude. "If you don't want any lasting effects, you'd better take some time to rest and recover."

"Okay, fine." Michael agreed verbally, but anyone could tell he didn't mean it and wouldn't take it to heart. It wasn't that he didn't want to rest, but the Brown Group was facing too many issues lately. The Adri Family was watching him like a hawk, waiting for any slip-up to pounce and slowly take over the Brown Group. In such a situation, how could he rest?

But he couldn't let Isabella know about this. Their families were closely connected, and he wasn't sure if Nolan really intended to introduce her to his grandfather. He didn't want to take that risk. Her life was peaceful and happy now, and that was enough.

"Michael, why did you save me?" Isabella's eyes were fixed on him, demanding an answer. Since he woke up, besides asking about her condition, he had been avoiding her, even becoming cold and impatient. If he really hated her so much, why did he choose to save her?

Michael was stunned by her question and instinctively looked up, only to meet Isabella's piercing gaze. At that moment, Michael felt like Isabella had seen right through him. For the first time, he avoided her eyes, looking down and not answering her question directly. Instead, he sincerely apologized.

"Isabella, I've wronged you all these years. Whether you accept it or not, I owe you an apology."

Three years of marriage, from her initial warmth and kindness to her eventual coldness and numbness, it was all because of him. If he hadn't allowed Bianca to pick on her, if he hadn't let his family ignore her, if he hadn't constantly neglected her, Isabella wouldn't have become like this.

When she asked for a divorce, he was angry and resentful, but there wasn't much love.

But as he spent more time with her, he was forced to understand her, to uncover the side of her he never knew.

He found himself becoming obsessed with her, thinking about her all the time.

He realized he was truly in love with her, perhaps it was inevitable.

He started caring about her actions, where she went, who she met.

Until Nolan's return made him lose his mind completely.

It was then he truly understood that loving someone wasn't about being domineering and controlling, but about mutual understanding and respect.

But by then, Isabella was no longer willing to forgive him.

Isabella bit her lip.

Memories of the past flashed through her mind, and she controlled her emotions to keep from crying.

Maybe Michael didn't understand why she insisted on the divorce.

It was because she had a grudge in her heart.

As long as that grudge remained, she could never reconcile with him.

He knew better than anyone what kind of life she had in the Brown Family.

But she never cared about that; she only cared about him.

But he forgot that she was the wife he married.

He didn't have to love her, but he couldn't humiliate her, especially by teaming up with Bianca, whom she hated the most, to mess with her.

She believed she had given him enough face as his wife, but he wouldn't even touch her.

She just wanted a child, a child of their own.

For that, she even lowered herself to beg him, but he told her to get out.

One thing after another piled up, how could she forget?

If he had treated her a little better back then, they wouldn't have so much resentment between them.

Now, they had reached the end of their marriage.

But he showed up at this moment, risking his life to protect her, and personally apologized for the past three years.

Isabella felt a void in her heart.

So much time had passed, and the grudge had settled deep in her heart, but his simple apology felt like a cloud drifting in front of her.

It was so light, yet it weighed her down, making it hard to breathe.

He was like a potent poison; once touched, it was impossible to get rid of.

And she had been deeply entangled for years.

The apology that came three years late made all her pent-up resentment seem to dissipate in the wind.

Isabella's emotions suddenly became unusually calm.

She clearly felt that the suppressed emotions in her heart seemed to start beating again.

Whether it was because she couldn't truly let go of this relationship or still had hopes for Michael, she accepted it all.

But she needed to know the real reason.

"Michael, I accept your apology. It's what I deserve."

She tried hard to control her emotions. "But since it's all in the past, let's not bring it up again. Our current situation was destined from the start."

She just wanted to know one thing. "I just want to ask you, why were you at Graceful Haven Church today? Why did you follow me and Emilio, and why did you risk your life to save me when I fell?"

Her fall was purely accidental.

Even Emilio, who was right beside her, couldn't react in time.

How did Michael see her in trouble and rush to catch her at the bottom?

###chapter 432  Repay the Debt

Unless, Michael had never left at all. He had been watching her from behind the entire time.

That's how he managed to reach her just in time and save her.

This was the most plausible explanation she could think of.

If that were true, it meant Michael cared about her. He risked his life to save her, didn't he?

Michael had no idea why Isabella was so insistent on getting to the bottom of this.

Not wanting to come off as a stalker, he pressed his lips together and finally spoke after a long pause.

"I didn't know it was you who fell. It was just a coincidence."

This was the best excuse Michael could come up with.

He couldn't possibly tell Isabella that he was worried about her being alone with Emilio, so he had secretly followed them, keeping an eye on her every move.

That would only make her resent him.

So, even if Isabella didn't believe him, he couldn't tell her the truth.

Admitting that he had followed his wife and another man up the mountain would be too humiliating.

"Michael, do you think I'm a child? Do you believe your own words?"

Isabella had waited a long time for an answer, only to be met with Michael's dismissive response.

She had been so worried about him that she almost cried, but when he woke up, he was still full of lies.

He was driving her crazy.

Michael looked deeply into her eyes. God knew how much he wanted to tell her the truth, to hold her and comfort her.

But now wasn't the right time. The Brown Group was trying to interfere, and the Adri Family overseas was watching him closely.

Bianca was in Auroria, and given Bianca's hatred for both him and Isabella...

If he admitted everything now, Isabella would inevitably get dragged into it.

And she would become their next target.

He didn't want her to get hurt.

So, he had to keep things under wraps for now.

"Isabella, I told you it was just a coincidence. If you don't believe me, there's nothing I can do. I went to Graceful Haven Church not for you, but because Mom wanted me to pray for her. I had no choice but to go."

"If you don't believe me, you can ask her yourself."

Michael shifted the blame onto his mother, Stella, because he was sure Isabella wouldn't confront Stella over something so trivial.

And she certainly wouldn't step foot into the Brown Family's home for his sake.

"Michael, are you really not willing to tell me a single truth?"

Isabella's suppressed emotions were about to burst.

She had loved him for over a decade, deeply and passionately. She thought she would never receive his love, but today she felt his concern.

Yet he claimed it was all a coincidence.

How could she accept that?

"When you held me, you were so tense. I don't believe you don't care about me at all."

Isabella couldn't hold back her question any longer.

She desperately wanted to know the answer.

"Michael, we've been married for three years, and this is the first time you've made me feel like you care about me, even a little. Are you sure this is all just my imagination?"

She didn't believe he didn't know how much she cared about him.

In the past, a single glance from him, a moment of attention, would fill her with joy.

Maybe these things meant nothing to Bianca, but Isabella cherished every little bit of it.

Because it was the warmth she had longed for but could never attain.

"Yes, it's all an illusion."

Michael shattered Isabella's hopes without hesitation.

He also destroyed any last possibility between them.

Compared to Isabella's safety, he could sacrifice anything.

Besides, he hadn't forgotten that the person Isabella truly loved was Nolan, not him.

When Nolan suddenly disappeared, Isabella, heartbroken, mistook him for Nolan and did everything she could to marry him.

Michael kept telling himself that Isabella was only asking these questions to find an outlet for the pain of those three years.

If he admitted the truth, she would undoubtedly mock him.

Isabella didn't like him.

She had always been indifferent and disdainful towards him. How could she possibly develop feelings for him just because he saved her once? It was impossible!

"Michael, is this your answer? You don't even have the courage to admit it. Can you still call yourself a man?"

Isabella's eyes were red as she glared at him.

"Or is it that admitting you care about me is so hard for you?"

Isabella didn't give him a chance to back down. Michael looked into her eyes, filled with pain and despair.

Was it really because of him?

Michael's heart trembled. As Isabella said, he didn't dare face her like this.

He didn't even dare to ask if her words meant she cared about him too.

He feared the answer would be someone else's name.

That would only bring him more pain.

He shook his head, unsure if he was admitting his cowardice or just wanting to end the conversation.

"Isabella, I don't know why you're thinking about this. I chose to save you because you're still my wife, the mother of my child. You lost our child because of me. I owe you a life."

"Consider this my way of repaying that debt. Please, don't hold any more grudges against me."

Isabella's face turned pale.

So, he risked his life to save her not because he cared, but to atone for the loss of their child.

But what about her?

What did she mean to him? After all these years, he couldn't even say he cared about her.

She was his wife, yet she could never earn his love.

She understood now.

It was all her wishful thinking, her unrequited love for Michael.

"Fine, as you said, we're even now. I don't hate you anymore, Michael."

Isabella stood up calmly and took a step back. "No matter what, thank you for saving me today. The Wilson Family will cover all your hospital expenses. If you need anything else, you can ask Atticus."

"I don't want anything."

Michael shook his head. He saved Isabella willingly; it had nothing to do with money.

Isabella bit her lip hard. "Then, goodbye."

She turned and walked out the door.

As the hospital room door closed, her face was already streaked with tears. She wiped them away with the back of her hand and walked away briskly.

What was this? She thought her years of waiting had finally borne fruit.

She had laid her heart bare before him, but he had coldly said it was just a life for a life.

Olivia had been waiting outside for Isabella. When she saw her come out, she was about to ask what happened, but Isabella suddenly hugged her tightly.

"Isabella?"

"Olivia, it hurts so much."

Isabella didn't want anyone to see her in such a vulnerable state. She buried her face in Olivia's embrace and cried softly.

The more subdued her sobs, the more Olivia could feel Isabella's pain.

She sighed and gently patted Isabella's back.

"Isabella, if you need to cry, just let it out. It might make you feel a little better."

###chapter 433 This Time Really Saying Goodbye

For years, Olivia had been the one who truly understood just how deeply Isabella loved Michael.

And it was exactly because of this that she didn't want Isabella to make the same mistakes again.

But she hadn't expected Isabella to be so affected by Michael's every move. He got a little hurt, and Isabella was already losing her cool.

Even her previous attitude towards Michael had shifted.

"Isabella, you gotta let go of Michael. It's time to move on," Olivia couldn't help but advise her.

As a friend, she couldn't stand to see Isabella clinging to a hopeless love and suffering so much.

"Olivia, I get it," Isabella said in a raspy voice. She understood everything, but why did it still hurt so much when Michael said he wasn't there for her?

He could spoil Bianca without a second thought, but he couldn't show her even a little care?

Why?

He agreed to marry her, yet he wouldn't give her even a bit of love.

She had told herself a thousand times to let go, but every time, she softened because of his small acts of kindness.

But thanks to what he said in the hospital room, she could finally see her place in this relationship clearly.

After today, she wouldn't have any more expectations of him.

After a while, Isabella lifted her head from Olivia's embrace, wiped away her tears, and smiled at her.

"Olivia, I'm not sad. After this, I can finally cut ties with him completely and never have any illusions about him again."

She would never think of him again.

But Olivia, who had known her for over a decade, wasn't fooled by Isabella's words.

She knew Isabella was just pretending to be strong.

Olivia understood the pain of loving someone who didn't love you back. She had experienced the agony of having to force herself to let go when she didn't want to.

"Isabella, don't do this. If you want to cry, just cry. No one will laugh at you. Seeing you like this breaks my heart. It's not your fault, so why should you bear all this pain?"

"It's all Michael's fault. From now on, we'll stay far away from him and pretend he doesn't exist."

Olivia had always thought no one had a more heartbreaking love story than hers.

She had loved for so many years without any response.

But she hadn't realized that Isabella's pain was a thousand times worse.

Olivia's words almost brought tears back to Isabella's eyes.

That's right.

She was just pretending to be strong.

Those words weren't her true feelings, but she was in so much pain. She wanted to forget Michael.

Only by completely forgetting him could she start anew.

But she had overestimated her ability to let go of her love for him and her persistence.

Someone she had silently loved for over a decade couldn't be forgotten just because she said so.

In the hospital room earlier, she had really wanted to pour out all the love she had kept inside for years.

She wanted to know his thoughts after hearing her feelings.

She wanted to ask if he had ever felt even a little bit for her over the years.

Even if he rejected her, she would accept it.

But he said, "Isabella, I saved you only for that poor child, a life for a life."

It was this sentence that extinguished all her thoughts.

She couldn't say another word.

She loved Michael deeply, but she also had self-respect and dignity.

In that situation, if she had still shamelessly asked if he had any feelings for her, even she would have felt utterly humiliated.

She wasn't just Isabella; she was also the heir to the Wilson Group.

She couldn't let her dignity be trampled on.

So, she held back her questions and let go of her last bit of hope for Michael.

From now on, she wouldn't soften towards him or let his matters disturb her peace.

Maybe this was a good thing for her.

After all, everyone around her had hoped she would separate from Michael.

Olivia continued to comfort her.

"Isabella, don't waste your tears on that jerk. Michael's a jerk who deserves to be left in the dust. He doesn't know how to appreciate someone as amazing as you. I can't wait for the day he regrets it, so I can laugh in his face."

Olivia glared at the hospital room door, her eyes practically shooting sparks.

If Michael hadn't been hurt because of Isabella, she would have stormed in and slapped him by now.

The person who loved him the most was right beside him, yet he was too blind to see it.

He would regret it one day.

Isabella shook her head slightly. From the moment she had said "goodbye" to Michael, she had already stopped caring about him.

"Olivia, I don't want to think about the future. I just want to live well in the present. As for him, he has nothing to do with me anymore."

Seeing that Isabella had come to terms with it, Olivia quickly nodded in agreement. "That's right. From now on, we'll live our best lives. Why waste our emotions on someone like Michael?"

"Okay," Isabella said, pressing her lips together and wiping away the last traces of her tears.

She turned and saw Atticus and Emilio walking towards her.

Atticus immediately noticed something was wrong with Isabella and frowned. "Isabella, what's wrong? Why are your eyes so red?"

Isabella shook her head, unwilling to say more. "Uncle Atticus, I'm fine. I just got some dust in my eyes on the way here."

Seeing that Isabella didn't want to talk, Atticus turned his gaze to Olivia, hoping to get an answer from her.

Olivia glanced at Isabella and then at Atticus. Torn between her best friend and the man she liked, she could only say, "Isabella was startled. Let's go home for now."

After all, Emilio was still there.

Atticus instantly understood Olivia's meaning. He had been too anxious. Seeing Isabella cry, he had forgotten there were others around.

"Alright, you take Isabella home. I'll handle the rest."

After all, Michael's status and position were significant, and he had been hurt because of Isabella. He couldn't just ignore it.

Michael could have anything the Wilson family could offer, but if he dared to mess with Isabella again, Atticus wouldn't let him off.

Isabella nodded, picked up her bag, and started walking.

At that moment, Olivia turned to Emilio. "Mr. Blair, could I trouble you with something?"

Emilio instinctively looked at Atticus. He knew their relationship well.

He spoke cautiously, "Ms. Smith, what do you need?"

Olivia smiled. "Mr. Blair, don't worry. It's nothing major. Isabella isn't feeling well, and I thought having someone accompany her on the way home would be good. Of course, only if you're not busy."

Her words were almost a direct hint to give Emilio and Isabella some alone time.

Emilio naturally didn't want to miss such a good opportunity.

"I have time, but..."

Emilio glanced at Isabella. Without her consent, he didn't dare follow.

Isabella hadn't walked far and had heard Olivia and Emilio's conversation clearly.

She knew Olivia was trying to help her move on from Michael, and Emilio was undoubtedly the most suitable candidate.

###chapter 434  Will the Wilson Family Take Action?

Isabella turned around, slowly lifting her head to meet his expectant gaze. "Emilio, sorry to trouble you."

Emilio's eyes lit up. "Not at all, taking you home is no problem."

Isabella forced a smile and nodded. "Alright, let's go."

Emilio quickly caught up, offering his arm for Isabella to hold. He then greeted Atticus before they left.

Outside, the Wilson Family's bodyguards were stationed, ready to escort Isabella and Emilio. Atticus had no reason to worry about their safety.

As their figures faded into the distance, the gentle expression on Atticus's face disappeared.

His eyes turned cold as he walked towards Michael's hospital room.

In the past, he had tolerated Michael out of respect for the relationship between the Brown and Wilson families and for Isabella's happiness.

He feared that if he hurt Michael, it would be Isabella who would suffer.

So he had held back.

Today, what Michael did indeed changed Atticus's opinion of him. Although he saved Isabella, a debt is a debt; the Wilson family would repay his kindness, but the fact that he bullied Isabella could not just be overlooked.

Isabella had been worried sick about him, and yet, as soon as he woke up, he made her cry.

The door was pushed open forcefully, and Atticus's tall figure appeared in the room. He took a few steps to the sofa opposite the hospital bed.

He crossed his long legs, leaned forward slightly, and stared at Michael with suppressed anger, exuding a strong sense of intimidation.

Michael didn't need to guess why Atticus was here.

Isabella's five uncles were extremely protective, especially when it came to their niece.

Knowing that he had wronged Isabella, it was already a courtesy that Atticus had waited this long to confront him.

But Atticus said nothing.

He just stared at Michael with a murderous look.

It felt like a sharp knife was hanging over Michael's head, and he never knew when it would drop and end his life.

Maybe in the next second, maybe when he wasn't paying attention.

This unknown torment was far more excruciating than any blatant threat or intimidation.

Michael knew Atticus was a former special forces soldier, and this silent interrogation was his specialty. But it was Michael who couldn't take it any longer.

He decided to speak up.

"Uncle Atticus, if you have something to say, just say it. There's no need to torture me like this."

Michael's voice was still hoarse from just waking up.

He realized that unless Atticus vented his anger, he wouldn't have any peace.

Atticus snorted coldly. "Mr. Brown, you're exaggerating. You're the Wilson Family's savior. Of course, I came to check on you. But I haven't done anything since I got here. How is that torturing you?"

"And I've reminded you more than once, you and Isabella are no longer married. You should stop calling me 'Uncle.'"

Every word Atticus said was polite, but together, they left Michael speechless.

Michael didn't want to divorce Isabella, so he wouldn't change how he addressed Atticus.

"Uncle Atticus, Isabella and I are still married, so I will continue to call you that."

Atticus's face darkened suddenly. "Michael, you need to let it go. No matter how much you cling, Isabella's never coming back to you."

Michael was so angry he almost passed out.

He took a deep breath and sat up. "Atticus, before I state my position, I want to ask you something else."

"If the Brown Group were targeted overnight and faced a crisis, would the Wilson Family step in?"

Though it was a test, only Michael knew the Brown Family was truly on the brink.

Atticus looked up at him and quickly answered.

"The Wilson Family doesn't get involved in matters that don't concern us."

Since Daniel's death, the relationship between the Wilson and Brown families had ended.

As for Michael and Isabella's marriage, her uncles had long considered it over.

They wouldn't help him; they were already being kind by not taking the opportunity to crush Michael and make him pay.

He was dreaming if he thought they would help.

"It seems my guess was right."

Michael smiled bitterly. "But I didn't expect you to be so direct, without any hesitation."

The result didn't surprise him.

Their families' connection was based on his marriage to Isabella, but he couldn't even face how he had treated her over the past three years.

How could he expect the Wilson Family to help him in his time of need?

Atticus's answer was likely out of respect for Aiden and Daniel's long friendship.

"Why hesitate? The Brown Family's issues have nothing to do with the Wilson Family. I'm just stating the facts."

Atticus's cold words made him frown. "Does this have anything to do with Isabella?"

He had heard about the Brown Group's recent turmoil. Since Isabella and Michael weren't officially divorced, any trouble with the Brown Group could affect Isabella.

He needed to inform Thomas to finalize Isabella and Michael's divorce quickly to avoid any complications.

Michael didn't answer, just lowered his head and asked another way.

"Atticus, if Isabella and I still had feelings for each other, and she cared about me, would the Wilson Family step in if the Brown Group was in trouble?"

Atticus's face turned black.

"You're delusional! After everything you've done to Isabella, you think she still has feelings for you?"

"Do you really think she is so strong that she can be hurt over and over without it mattering? She's human too. How can you expect her to stay by your side after you've broken her heart?"

Michael's ears rang.

It felt like his heart was being squeezed, making it hard to breathe.

Every word from Atticus was like a mountain pressing down on him, making him feel the weight of his guilt towards Isabella.

He knew better than anyone how much pain and suffering Isabella had endured over the years.

But he needed an answer.

He clenched his fists and took a deep breath. "Uncle Atticus, please answer my question. If we still had feelings for each other, what would Isabella do if the Brown Group was in trouble?"

Atticus was speechless.

Michael knew how to hit where it hurt.

Everyone in the Wilson Family knew that Isabella had a soft spot for Michael, despite everything.

If she found out the Brown Family was in trouble, even if she pretended not to care, she wouldn't be able to let go of Michael.

###chapter 435 Only Want to Protect Her

Atticus lowered his gaze, speaking calmly. "If that's really the case, Isabella wouldn't just throw the Wilson Family's resources at the Brown Group's problems. But she'd be right there with you, fighting by your side. She wouldn't leave you hanging."

The Wilson Family was like that-they'd sacrifice everything for their loved ones but wouldn't drain the family's resources.

His professionalism and management skills had likely surpassed Nolan's.

The Brown Group was in trouble. There was a mole in his company. The Adri Family had set a massive trap for him in the Auroria mining project, where he had invested nearly a billion dollars. If he stepped into it, the Brown Group would be ensnared. And he would become a puppet in the Adri Family's hands.

That was the last thing he wanted.

He hadn't been able to give her a stable life during their three years of marriage, and he already felt guilty enough.

How could he let her suffer with him again?

The Adri Family's intentions were clear. Their target wasn't just the Brown Group. If he was right, once this plot succeeded, the Adri Family's next target would be the Wilson Group.

The Wilson Group was Daniel's lifelong achievement and the most important thing to Isabella.

If anyone dared to target the Wilson Group, Isabella would fight them with everything she had.

So, he had only one choice left.

He had to use the Brown Group to fight the Adri Family, even if it meant risking everything. As long as he could crush the Adri Family, it would be a victory.

Only then would the Wilson Family be safe.

That was why he had to harden his heart and say those hurtful words, preferring to drive Isabella away rather than admit he had any feelings for her.

But when she left, he thought he saw her crying.

Atticus's expression changed upon hearing this.

As a man, he understood the sincerity in Michael's words.

"Michael, you better be telling the truth, or else."

Michael seemed different from what he had imagined.

Since he didn't want the Wilson Family to intervene, Atticus didn't say more.

After all, if outsiders intervened too early in company matters, it would only lead to more gossip.

Their divorce rumors had already spread. If Michael accepted the Wilson Family's help now, it would be like admitting to the public that he couldn't handle things himself.

The fact that he could still calmly arrange a way out for Isabella at this time showed that Michael had some backbone.

Atticus appreciated that.

Since the conversation had reached this point, there was no need to stay. Atticus decisively stood up and said to Michael, "I'll take care of Isabella. You don't need to worry."

"Michael, as Isabella's uncle, I don't want the person spending the rest of her life with her to be you. But Isabella is too stubborn, I have no choice."

###chapter 436  Discharge from the Hospital Now

"The Wilson family usually doesn't get involved in other people's business, but if you really need help, just give me a call."

Atticus had just offered to help him personally.

In the past, every time Atticus saw him, he seemed ready to beat him half to death to vent his anger.

Now, Atticus was willing to help him unconditionally, without even asking for a reason.

"Move aside. I said I'm checking out. Don't you understand?"

Only by identifying the mole in the company could he follow the clues and investigate further.

So, he had to be ready for anything.

At such a critical moment, how could he stay in the hospital?

The bodyguards, knowing Michael, didn't dare to stop him and quickly stepped aside.

He had underestimated Michael's determination.

Holden's tone made Atticus feel both helpless and unsurprised.

Before realizing Michael's genuine concern for Isabella, he had felt the same way about Michael.

Holden, though not involved in company management, had been exposed to these matters for a long time. The Brown Group was a significant entity, and any major move would cause a stir.

"Just investigate. Why so many questions?"

Atticus didn't want to say too much over the phone, especially about Michael.

Holden was with Isabella now. If he told him, Holden might spill everything to Isabella before Atticus even got home.

As an elder, Atticus hoped Isabella would be with someone like Emilio, who had a gentle nature.

Michael was destined to work hard for the Brown Group, while Isabella had her own mission. If she accommodated him, her future would be tough.

But Emilio was different.

He wasn't overly ambitious. Even if he wanted to make a mark in the business world, he could manage the Wilson Group.

This way, Isabella wouldn't have to work hard, and her loved one would be by her side. It was a win-win.

###chapter 437  Predicament

The Brown Group.

The more Olivia listened, the hotter her face felt. She couldn't help but try to cover his mouth.

For so many years, because of Atticus's rejection, they had never been this close. They rarely even touched hands, let alone embraced so intimately.

Atticus's presence made her heart race, and being in the Wilson Family's hall made her even more uneasy.

"I'll go with you, okay? Just let me go first."

Olivia decided to compromise for now and deal with the rest later.

But Atticus wasn't going to let her off that easily. He had already invited her, and now it wasn't up to her to decide.

He chuckled softly, tightened his grip, and lifted her up. As Olivia buried her face in his chest in fright, he whispered in her ear.

"Do you really think I don't know you? If I let you go now, how could I get you again? So be good and don't move. I'll carry you."

Atticus didn't give her a chance to refuse, carrying her straight into his study.

The room's decor was in cool tones, with a sophisticated black-and-white color scheme, matching Atticus's personal style.

Atticus closed the door and set Olivia down, pulling out a chair for her to sit.

He then walked to the opposite side and sat in the main seat.

Seeing his calm and serious expression, Olivia realized he hadn't brought her here to talk about love but because he had something important to discuss.

She felt a bit foolish for thinking he wanted to continue the sweet talk from Graceful Haven Church.

If she had known he had something serious to discuss, she wouldn't have hesitated outside for so long.

Olivia wanted to smack herself. Could she stop thinking about nonsense all the time?

They were a couple now. Having a physical relationship was inevitable, so why rush?

She cleared her throat, pulled out the chair, and sat down, refusing to admit she was a bit disappointed Atticus hadn't done anything more.

But what she didn't know was that Atticus, fourteen years her senior, had already seen through her little thoughts.

He was a normal man who had been abstinent for years. Now that he had confessed to the woman he liked, it was impossible for him not to have any physical reaction while holding her.

But he didn't want to scare her or leave a bad impression.

He wanted to take things slow, make up for the lost years, and let everything happen naturally.

Returning to the present, Atticus suppressed his desires and looked at her with the calm and mature demeanor of the eldest son of the Wilson Family.

If it weren't for his affectionate and loving "Olivia," Olivia might have thought the confession at Graceful Haven Church was a dream.

"You were outside the ward when Isabella and Michael were talking, right?"

###chapter 440  Can I Come to See You?

Olivia nodded, catching on quickly to why Atticus had called her over. He was worried about Isabella and wanted to get the full story about what had happened with Michael.

Just a moment ago, Atticus had been so close to her, and now he was suddenly so calm, asking about something else. This abrupt change left Olivia feeling a bit disappointed. It wasn't about Isabella; it was about her own insecurities with Atticus. Whenever he reverted to his old self, she couldn't help but remember how he had rejected her before.

She realized she needed to change. He was right; they were in a relationship now, and being close was normal. She couldn't keep getting shy and wanting to run away. But Isabella's situation was still right in front of them. She couldn't just think about herself anymore.

"Olivia, can you tell me what you heard?" Atticus asked. "I want to know how far things have gone between them."

Normally, as Isabella's uncle, he shouldn't interfere in her personal affairs. But after what Michael had said, he had no choice but to find out. Michael had made such a big decision; he needed to know how much it would hurt Isabella. Only then could he plan what to do next.

Olivia hadn't heard much, but she recounted the harsh words Michael had said to Isabella. When she finished, she couldn't help but get angry. "Michael is such a jerk. Isabella practically told him she liked him, but instead of being a man and taking responsibility, he said those hurtful things and made her cry."

"If he hadn't insisted on saving Isabella, she wouldn't have lost control and confessed her feelings."

"Michael is a bad guy. He can forget about Isabella ever forgiving him!"

Atticus didn't comment after hearing this. He just pressed his lips together and narrowed his eyes. If it had been before, he would have sought justice for her. But now that he knew the real reason Michael had rejected Isabella, he hesitated. He didn't know what to do.

In that situation, Michael had chosen to get hurt himself to save Isabella, which showed his feelings for her were genuine. His biggest wish now was for Isabella to be safe. All Atticus could do was try to keep it a secret.

Meanwhile, Holden, who had sneaked upstairs to find some peace and quiet, didn't want to disturb Isabella. He planned to find a random room to sit in for a while. He would go back downstairs after Atticus and Olivia left.

But as he passed Isabella's room, he noticed the door was ajar. He stopped and peeked through the gap, seeing Isabella sitting by the piano, jotting down notes and testing the keys. Seeing this, Holden finally relaxed. If she could sit down and do what she loved, it meant Isabella was starting to move on, at least emotionally stable.

Holden left, feeling reassured. Isabella, lost in her own world, didn't notice anyone passing by. She was completely absorbed in her sudden burst of inspiration. After a while, Isabella suddenly stopped writing. Looking at the completed sheet music, she eagerly began to play it on the piano.

The melody started off cheerful, gradually becoming more somber, and finally exploding in the chorus. The pain of unrequited love, frustration, breakdown, and ultimate release were all captured in the music, reflecting her current emotions.

Love was letting go.

That was her interpretation of the piece. Even though she had loved, if the end result was a tragedy, the best way was to let go of herself and the other person. To make peace with the past.

Even so, she didn't regret the time she had spent married to Michael. At least she could prove she had once had him. Loving, having loved, and having had everything about him was enough for her.

As she finished playing, Isabella closed her eyes, feeling a sense of inner peace. Satisfied with this version, she took out a recorder and played it again.

Just as she finished, her phone lit up. She put away the recorder and picked up her phone, surprised to see it was Nolan calling.

Isabella was taken aback, then answered excitedly, "Nolan, why are you calling all of a sudden? Do you miss me?"

Nolan chuckled softly, his voice gentle, "Of course I miss you. But do you miss me? It's been so long since I called, and you never reached out to me."

Isabella laughed nervously, "I didn't want to bother you. Nolan, is there something you need?"

"Isabella, I have something important to tell you."

Nolan's tone was unusually serious.

Isabella asked curiously, "What is it?"

She had been staying home to recover and had no idea what was going on with Nolan lately.

Nolan didn't want to discuss it over the phone. "Isabella, this is very important to me, so I want to tell you in person. Can you meet me?"

As he said this, Nolan was nervous and uneasy. He feared that he no longer had a place in Isabella's heart, that she had moved on with that man named Emilio.

Isabella didn't think too much about it. She had already done what she promised Olivia. Going out to meet someone wouldn't be a bad idea, especially since it was Nolan inviting her.

Just as Isabella was about to agree, she looked down at the bandages on her arm and hesitated.

"Nolan, can we do it another day? I'm not in a good condition to go out today."

Nolan pretended not to know, "Is something wrong?"

Isabella didn't plan to hide it from him but didn't mention Michael. "I accidentally got hurt. I just got back from the hospital and still have bandages on."

"Injured?"

Before Isabella could finish, Nolan got worried, "What happened? Are you seriously hurt?"

Nolan sounded genuinely concerned, with no hint of pretense.

"Just a minor injury, nothing serious. Don't worry, Nolan. I'll be fine in a couple of days."

Isabella didn't want Nolan to worry, so she told the truth.

"Really?"

Nolan was skeptical, still worried, "I don't feel comfortable. Isabella, you're at the Wilson Family's house, right? Can I come to see you?"

Afraid she might refuse, he added, "I just want to see you with my own eyes. I won't stay long."

He had always met Isabella at her Whispering Pines Estates villa, but that wasn't the Wilson Family's home. If he could get into the Wilson Family's house this time, meet the family, and gain their approval, it might help him win Isabella over.

###chapter 441  Nolan's Thoughts

Isabella hesitated when she heard Nolan's suggestion.

It wasn't that she didn't want Nolan to visit her at home, but the current situation was just too complicated.

She had just gone through a complete breakup with Michael and had indirectly turned down Emilio's advances. If Nolan came over now, it would easily lead to misunderstandings.

Besides, Nolan looked so much like Michael.

Atticus and Holden would definitely overthink it. It was better if Nolan didn't come.

"Nolan, it's too much trouble for you to come over here. How about we meet at that café we usually go to? I've been craving their hand-brewed coffee."

She used to love going to that café, but so much had happened since then that she hadn't gone out alone in a long time.

Nolan felt a bit disappointed, but as long as he could see Isabella, he still had a chance.

Over the years, he had developed a habit of indulging Isabella.

He could never say no to her.

"Alright, I'll wait for you there."

They hung up the phone after that.

When Isabella walked into the living room, she didn't see anyone, so she snuck out alone.

Half an hour later, she parked her car outside the café.

She immediately spotted Nolan sitting at the best spot by the window.

Isabella waved in his direction and quickly entered the café, taking off her coat and sitting across from him. "Nolan, have you been waiting long?"

This café was close to Whispering Pines Estates, where Atticus had sent her, but it wasn't near the Wilson Family home.

Even at her fastest, it would take her half an hour to get there.

Nolan clearly looked like he had arrived early and had been waiting for a while.

"No, I just got here. Your safety comes first, especially with your injury."

Nolan's eyes immediately fell on the white bandage on Isabella's arm, filled with concern and worry.

"How did you get hurt? Does it still hurt?"

Isabella didn't want to think about the accident on the mountain, as it would only remind her of Michael desperately saving her.

Since she had chosen to move on, she needed to be decisive.

She shook her head and instinctively lowered her hand. "It doesn't hurt anymore. It's just a minor injury, nothing to worry about. Nolan, you don't need to be so tense."

Seeing that Isabella didn't want to talk about it, Nolan wisely changed the subject. "That's good to hear."

"The café has recently added some new desserts. I ordered two for you. See if there's anything else you want to drink. It's on me today, so order whatever you like."

"Really? Then I won't hold back."

Isabella's eyes sparkled with a smile. Nolan always knew how to make her happy, always so gentle.

She picked up the menu and called over a server, ordering a hand-brewed black coffee and a classic mango mousse. She couldn't eat much more than that.

Besides, Nolan had already ordered other things for her.

After the server left, Isabella smiled and asked Nolan about recent changes.

"Nolan, why have you been so busy lately? I haven't seen you in ages."

Nolan didn't mention that he had resigned from his job at the school. Instead, he told her mysteriously, "I've been busy, but it will be over soon. I'll tell you all about it then, okay?"

"Before that, I have some good news to share."

Isabella had known Nolan wanted to tell her something important, and now her curiosity was piqued. She couldn't wait to find out.

"What is it, Nolan? I'm already here, so don't keep me in suspense."

To Isabella, Nolan was like an older brother.

Even if she and Michael divorced in the future, their relationship wouldn't change.

So when Nolan repeatedly hinted that he had good news, she was genuinely happy for him.

Seeing the curiosity in Isabella's eyes, Nolan smiled and made a shushing gesture.

"Isabella, promise me that no matter what you see, don't get too excited or scream, okay?"

Isabella tried to suppress her laughter and nodded.

She was in her twenties, and Nolan still treated her like a child.

What news could possibly make her scream?

Nolan didn't explain further. He just looked at Isabella, then backed his wheelchair up a bit and removed the gray blanket covering his legs.

Then, he stood up straight in front of her.

But he quickly sat back down in the wheelchair.

Isabella was so shocked that she covered her mouth with both hands, her eyes wide as she stared at Nolan.

She was so excited she could barely speak. "Nolan, you can stand up!"

"Oh my God!"

"This is amazing news."

Isabella cheered but quickly covered her mouth, remembering Nolan's reminder.

Nolan had already covered his legs with the blanket again and nodded with a smile. "Yes, I've been working hard, and it's finally paying off. I still can't walk very well, but with rehab, the doctor says I should be back to normal in less than six months."

"That's wonderful! Fate has finally smiled on you. Nolan, you can go back to being yourself. I'm so happy for you."

Nolan had endured so much over the years. She didn't want him to spend the rest of his life in a wheelchair.

Now that his legs were better, maybe his life could get back on track.

To Isabella, Nolan had always been the epitome of an excellent man. He would surely find his own happiness.

"Isabella, thanks. Your words mean a lot to me."

Nolan's lips curved into a smile, his deep eyes fixed on her face. His usual gentle and kind gaze now had a hint of intensity.

Isabella noticed it immediately but didn't think much of it. She touched her face, thinking something might be on it.

"Nolan, what are you looking at? Is there something on my face?"

She instinctively reached for the napkin on the table, but Nolan grabbed her hand and then quickly let go.

He casually handed her the napkin.

Isabella thought Nolan was acting a bit strange today, but since he didn't say anything, she couldn't figure it out.

"Isabella, do you remember I told you I had someone in my heart, someone I've liked for many years?"

Isabella nodded.

She had heard Nolan mention it before, just as Nolan knew how much she liked Michael.

They used to share everything.

But Nolan never revealed the person's name or any details, only that there was someone he could wait for forever.

"Nolan, now that your legs are better, are you planning to find that girl again?"

Isabella had a rough idea of what Nolan was thinking.

His legs had suddenly given out before, and he had lost hope for the future. It was understandable that he had given up.

Now that he could stand and had his passion for music, finding the person he loved was an act of courage.

###chapter 442 The Secret Crush is Her?

"Yeah, I really want to tell her I've always liked her, that my feelings haven't changed all these years. But I'm scared she'll reject me, and we won't even be friends anymore."

This was what had always haunted him.

He wanted to confess, but he feared the outcome wouldn't be what he hoped for.

"How come?"

Isabella tried to comfort him, "Nolan, you're one of the kindest and most amazing guys I know. Anyone would be lucky to have you."

"So, Nolan, how do you know it won't work out if you don't try? What if she feels the same way? Be brave and tell her how you feel. You won't have any regrets that way."

"Really?"

Nolan's voice trembled as he listened to Isabella. "Isabella, do you really think I'm the best?"

"Of course, Nolan. Everyone knows how talented you are. You run the company, play the piano, and you're so gentle. How could you not be the best guy?"

Isabella was still mentally listing Nolan's good qualities. Nolan was one of her best friends, and she was the first to support him in confessing his feelings.

But the next second, her hand was suddenly held tightly by a warm palm.

Isabella instinctively looked up and saw Nolan gazing at her with deep eyes. "Isabella, what if I told you that the girl in my heart is you?"

"I've liked you since the moment I met you."

Nolan's voice suddenly became low, but his extremely serious expression showed he wasn't joking.

For a moment, Isabella was stunned.

She even had a hallucination, imagining Nolan's face as Michael's.

But the environment she was in and the wheelchair Nolan was sitting in told her he was Nolan, not Michael.

What she couldn't understand was that the person Nolan had liked for years was her!

But she was his brother's wife. How could anything happen between them?

While Isabella's mind was blank, Nolan's voice rang out again.

"Isabella, I know this is hard for you to accept. I didn't say anything before because your heart was full of Michael, and you were determined to marry him. So, I buried my love deep inside. I thought if Michael was your happiness, I would willingly step aside and never disturb you."

"But later, when I got your call from abroad, I found out you hadn't been happy all these years, that you were even suffering. At that moment, I couldn't suppress my love any longer. I wanted to come back to you, to tell you my feelings, and to protect you in a different way. But I didn't expect my legs to get injured."

Mentioning this, Nolan's eyes were filled with resentment. "Since that accident, I couldn't say what I wanted to say to you. I thought I'd never have the chance to pursue you again."

"Fortunately, fate didn't abandon me. Now my legs have recovered, and you and Michael have ended. Isabella, I don't expect you to give me an answer right now, but at least give me a chance to stand by your side, okay?"

Perhaps Nolan's long-hidden love shocked Isabella too much.

Looking at the face that resembled Michael's, she almost mistook Nolan for Michael.

If the person she had fallen for back then was Nolan, maybe she would be very happy now.

After all, Nolan was such a gentle and considerate man.

But life didn't have "ifs."

The man she fell in love with was Michael, who didn't love her back.

Even if she no longer loved him, she couldn't fall in love with someone else.

So, Nolan's love was something she couldn't accept.

Isabella didn't want to hurt Nolan. She had always seen him as a big brother.

She opened her mouth, "Nolan, I-"

"Isabella."

Nolan, sensing a rejection, interrupted her to explain.

"I get it. It wouldn't look good if you got together with me right after divorcing Michael. But I'm not asking you to be with me immediately after your divorce. I can wait, just like I have all these years. As long as you need me, I'll always be there for you."

"I didn't ask you out today for an answer. You can go back and think about it."

"You know my love life. The only person I've ever loved is you!"

Nolan's heartfelt words left Isabella at a loss for how to refuse.

She knew very well that she only had familial and friendly feelings for Nolan.

Even if he wasn't part of the Brown family, she didn't have romantic feelings for him.

If she did, they wouldn't have been friends for so long.

But looking at Nolan's eyes, which seemed on the verge of breaking, she couldn't bring herself to say the words of rejection.

This confession came too suddenly, and she was caught off guard.

Most importantly, she didn't want to break Nolan's heart.

From a young age, Nolan had few people who cared about him. She still had her grandfather and uncle, but Nolan had no one who loved him.

His parents were gone early, and the Brown family treated him like he was invisible.

Aiden had stopped caring about him years ago over the inheritance issue.

So, Nolan had almost no important people in his life. She was probably the only one he could confide in all these years.

If she rejected him so abruptly, it would be cruel. She was also worried he might be devastated and never recover.

He had just started to stand again.

"Nolan."
