Nolan's eyes brightened when he heard Isabella didn't reject him outright. His eyes were slightly red, and he tightly held her hands.

"Okay, Isabella, I knew you would give me this chance."

Isabella was stunned, but when she looked up, she saw Nolan's bright smile.

She had never seen him so happy and excited.

Usually, Nolan was always calm and gentle.

Isabella panicked.

She didn't dare stay any longer, afraid she might blurt out a rejection.

Finding an excuse, Isabella quickly left.

But after she left, a man in a black bodyguard uniform approached Nolan and respectfully handed him a phone.

"Mr. Brown, I recorded everything as you requested."

"Good."

Nolan, sitting in his wheelchair, responded coldly but didn't take the phone. He quietly watched Isabella's car disappear from sight.

His gentle expression instantly turned gloomy.

"Find the right time to post it online."

"And get some people to stir things up, make it as big as possible."

"Yes, sir!"

The coffee on the table had gone cold. Nolan didn't even glance at it and instructed the person beside him, "Let's go."

###chapter 443 I Have Something to Ask Him

The next morning, Aiden was having breakfast at the Brown Villa restaurant when he heard a car pull up outside.

The butler came in and announced, "Mr. Nolan Brown is back."

Aiden glanced outside with an unreadable expression and said calmly, "Perfect timing. Have him join us for breakfast."

Stella, who had been eating with Aiden, looked displeased upon hearing Nolan had arrived.

She immediately stood up and said, "Dad, I'm done eating. I'm going back to my room."

With her son not around, she had no desire to face the illegitimate child her husband had brought back from outside.

Just seeing him brought her bad luck.

"Alright, go ahead."

Aiden didn't stop her, instead instructing the maid to prepare another breakfast.

At that moment, the bodyguard wheeled Nolan in.

"Grandpa."

"Nolan, come over here."

Aiden smiled and waved him over, indicating for him to sit beside him.

Nolan obediently took the wet towel handed to him by the maid, carefully wiped his hands, and then joined Aiden for breakfast.

They ate in silence until Nolan put down his utensils. Only then did Aiden speak, "Nolan, you didn't come back just to have breakfast with me, did you?"

It wasn't that Aiden was overthinking it, but Nolan had never been close to the family, especially after the inheritance swap incident. Nolan had left the country in a fit of anger and hadn't returned for three years.

So why would Nolan come home now just to see his grandfather?

Nolan's visit at this time must mean he had something important to discuss.

The last time Nolan returned, he had asked to rejoin the company.

Aiden had thought Nolan had finally forgiven him, but it turned out Nolan was after the position of CEO of the Brown Group.

Initially, Aiden had no intention of agreeing, but seeing what Michael had been through recently, he had a change of heart.

If his actions back then were wrong, he should be the one to bear the consequences, not the innocent Nolan.

With that thought, Aiden sighed deeply. At his age, he shouldn't be meddling in his grandchildren's affairs.

But fate had been unkind to him. Both his sons had passed away, leaving only his grandchildren by his side.

His eldest grandson had been taken abroad by his mother due to his background, severing ties with the Brown Family. His remaining two grandsons were at odds because of his actions.

In the end, it was all his fault.

Hearing this, Nolan dropped the pretense and got straight to the point, "Grandpa, you're right. I have something important to discuss with you."

"But this isn't the right place. Let's go to the study."

Nolan glanced at the file bag by his side, making his intentions clear.

He had come prepared, and this conversation was not for others to hear.

Aiden's old eyes dimmed, but Nolan didn't give him a chance to refuse.

He picked up his cane and headed to the study.

Inside the study, Aiden had just settled into his chair when Nolan opened the file and placed the contract in front of him.

"Grandpa, you might not be involved in the day-to-day, but you're still the chairman. You should check out this document. You might find it... surprising."

Nolan spoke with confidence, a sense of pride radiating from him even as he sat in his wheelchair.

Aiden didn't immediately take the document. Instead, he looked deeply at Nolan, sensing something had changed in his grandson. But he couldn't quite put his finger on it.

"Grandpa, aren't you going to take a look?"

Nolan asked again.

Aiden had no choice but to pick it up. As soon as he opened the first page, he understood Nolan's meaning.

He didn't read further and placed the document back on the table.

"Michael already showed me this contract. Nolan, just say what you want to say. There's no need to beat around the bush!"

Since their last conversation, Aiden had been considering Nolan's proposal. It wasn't that he was unwilling to fulfill the promise, but reality had forced him to compromise.

Moreover, he knew Nolan's management skills well. If he were to push Nolan out again, even Aiden would feel it was a waste of talent. Not to mention, Nolan was his grandson.

Nolan's gaze remained on the document as he sighed softly, "Grandpa, are you sure you don't want to read to the end?"

"What do you mean?" Aiden frowned.

He couldn't guess what Nolan was up to.

Nolan's lips curved into a smile, "I told you, there's a surprise in there that you need to see for yourself."

Aiden found it odd. He already knew the background of this document from Michael. It was a one-sided agreement.

Michael, despite his temper, had good judgment in important matters. Otherwise, Aiden wouldn't have handed over the Brown Group so easily. Over the years, Michael's abilities had grown to match Nolan's at an impressive rate. Michael even showed signs of surpassing Nolan.

Given Aiden's understanding of his grandson, Michael would never sign such a contract!

But as Aiden flipped through the pages to the end, he was shocked to see Michael's signature and the official Brown Group seal on the partner's line.

"This can't be!"

Aiden couldn't believe it.

Just days ago, Michael had assured him he would handle this tricky contract and prevent any financial crisis for the Brown Group. Yet, he had signed this obvious trap?

It involved billions of dollars.

If the contract took effect, Aiden couldn't imagine the Brown Group's fate.

Michael must be joking!

The Brown Group was Aiden's lifelong effort. If something went wrong, he would be letting down the Brown Family's ancestors.

Aiden's face turned dark with anger. He picked up the phone and called the headquarters.

"Where is Michael? Tell him to come back immediately. I have questions for him!"

He slammed the phone down, his anger evident.

Nolan remained calm, knowing his opportunity had finally arrived.

He wheeled himself forward, as obedient and respectful as ever.

"Grandpa, don't be angry. You know Michael's temperament. He likes to take unconventional paths. Maybe he has his reasons. Let's hear him out before you question him."

###chapter 444 We're in Court For Our Divorce Case

But Nolan's words only deepened Aiden's disappointment in his grandson Michael.

Aiden had been worried sick about Michael and Isabella's marriage for a while now.

Isabella was the granddaughter-in-law Aiden had chosen, and she was carrying the only great-grandchild of the Brown family.

But what had Michael done?

He neglected the company, flaunted another woman in front of Isabella, and acted like a complete jerk.

In the end, he caused Isabella to lose the baby and become completely disheartened with the Brown family.

She even returned the family heirloom.

All of this was because Michael didn't appreciate what he had. If he hadn't been so reckless, he wouldn't have driven away such a good wife.

"Listen to what? His excuses?"

Aiden pointed at the documents, his hand shaking with anger.

"Everything is right here, and he still has the nerve to explain? As the head of the Brown Group, how could he be so stupid? It's a wonder I haven't stormed into the company to knock some sense into him."

"Michael, that idiot, just wait and see how I punish him!"

Hearing this, Nolan's eyes darkened.

He had thought that Aiden's first reaction upon seeing the documents would be to have Michael step down from his position as president.

Then Nolan could step in and become the savior of the Brown Group.

But all he heard was Aiden's anger at Michael's actions, with no mention of changing the heir.

So, even though Michael had made such a huge mistake that harmed the company, he was still forgivable in Aiden's eyes?

This favoritism had always belonged to Michael since they were kids.

But what had Nolan done wrong? He had worked tirelessly for the company for years without anyone caring.

As soon as Michael turned eighteen, Aiden replaced him without a second thought.

Nolan gritted his teeth. He was also a member of the Brown family, also Aiden's grandson. Why could Michael have everything, but he couldn't?

Jealousy filled Nolan's heart, and he clenched his fists on his lap.

But his voice remained calm.

"Grandpa, the company is in such a big mess right now. A verbal warning might not satisfy the higher-ups. The Auroria project involves a lot of money, and Michael made a huge mistake. If word gets out, who will still trust his lead?"

A leader must have the ability to manage the whole situation. If he wasn't transparent and couldn't win people's trust, it would lead to bigger problems over time.

Nolan knew how to push buttons.

A few words hit Aiden right where it hurt.

Aiden narrowed his eyes, his sharp gaze falling on Nolan, his tone unclear.

"Isn't this the result you wanted?"

"If the company fails under Michael's leadership, he will have to step down to take responsibility. You, being in the country and having managed the company before, would be the perfect person to take over after I'm gone."

Aiden's tone was calm, but his words sent chills down Nolan's spine.

He was old, but not senile.

He admitted that Nolan had the ability to help the company through tough times, but Nolan was too impatient.

Aiden wasn't dead yet, and Nolan was already trying to seize power.

In a big family, everyone had their schemes. Aiden wasn't an unreasonable elder, but if Nolan used his cunning against his own family, he was on the wrong path.

Aiden sighed deeply in his heart.

It seemed his actions had hurt Nolan back then, or Nolan wouldn't still be trying to take back the position from his brother.

Nolan was shocked and quickly tried to explain himself, "Grandpa, how can you think that of me? I'm just worried about the Brown family. Don't I even have that right?"

He lowered his head, looking aggrieved.

Anyone else would think he was being treated unfairly. The Brown family had treated him this way, so why should he bother doing thankless tasks?

But Aiden wasn't an outsider. He had managed the Brown Group for decades and had seen all kinds of people.

Nolan's act didn't work on him.

"Nolan, it's not that I can't see through things. I just don't want to embarrass you. I remember the hardships you've endured, so don't be too blatant."

Nolan's face changed, and just then, Aiden's phone rang.

It was Michael calling.

"Grandpa, it's me. I have some things to handle this afternoon, so I might not be able to come back until later or tomorrow."

Michael's voice was low, as if he was speaking from a quiet place.

Aiden didn't care. He was already furious with Michael, and now Michael was making excuses not to come back.

"Dare you say that again?"

"Michael, I'll give you half an hour. If I don't see you today, I'll come to the company and break your legs in front of everyone!"

There was a moment of silence on the other end.

When Michael spoke again, his voice was hoarse and his mood low.

"Grandpa, I'm not joking. I really can't leave."

"What could be so important? You never come home, and you don't care about the company."

"Grandpa, Isabella and I are in court for our divorce case."

Michael's heart bled as he said this.

After what he said to Isabella at the hospital, he had pushed Thomas to expedite the divorce.

Isabella had completely given up on him.

Even though he was doing it for her safety, it couldn't wait any longer.

Fortunately, Thomas was quick, and Michael received the court summons the next morning.

With Thomas personally handling the case, the process was much faster.

But this was what Michael wanted.

Isabella was the recognized heir of the Adri family. If Michael lost the battle with the Adri family, they would target her next.

If they were still married, she would inevitably be dragged into it.

The Brown Group's situation was worsening, and Michael had to consider Isabella's safety.

The only way to protect her was to end their marriage.

He sat across from Isabella in court, but she wouldn't even look at him.

They both had their own thoughts, and the only thing they agreed on was to sign the divorce papers quickly and cut all ties.

###chapter 445 Early Divorce, Early Relief

Outside the courthouse, Isabella stared at the divorce papers in her hand, feeling a bit dazed. They had finally reached this point.

From today on, she and Michael would have nothing to do with each other.

Thinking about how eager Michael had been to finalize the divorce in court, Isabella couldn't help but feel it was unfair to herself.

She knew Michael didn't like her, but she never expected him to be so desperate to get rid of her.

But maybe this was for the best.

Only this way, she wouldn't have any more expectations of him.

Michael came out a moment later and saw Isabella standing on the steps, not moving.

He hesitated, feeling an urge to approach her. Perhaps this was his last chance to speak with her.

"Isabella, I-"

Before he could finish, Isabella turned around and cut him off, waving the divorce papers in her hand with a smile on her face.

"Michael, congrats on being single again. From now on, we have nothing to do with each other. Goodbye."

If she could, she hoped never to see him again!

Her tone was polite yet distant, as if she were speaking to a stranger.

Though she was smiling, Michael felt the distance between them growing.

His heart felt like it was being squeezed, making it hard to breathe.

Thomas came out last, seeing Isabella and Michael standing together, talking about who knew what.

Thomas despised Michael for how he treated his niece and wished he would stay far away from her.

Seeing them together, even if they were just talking, made Thomas furious. He strode over and pulled Isabella to his side.

"Isabella, let's go. You're divorced now, why waste time talking to him?"

"Atticus and Holden are waiting to celebrate with you. Let's not waste any more time here."

"Celebrate what?"

Isabella was puzzled. "Atticus and Holden must be mistaken. This is a divorce, not a wedding. What's there to celebrate?"

Thomas sneered at Michael, "Of course, we're celebrating you being single again. Now you can find any man you like, and your uncle will make sure he's perfect for you."

"After all, you're now just the heiress of the Wilson Family. You've finally escaped that hellhole, so why not throw a party to celebrate?"

With that, Thomas pulled her away, not wanting to stay in Michael's presence any longer.

Watching the love of his life disappear before his eyes, Michael couldn't help but follow her with his gaze until her car sped away.

He took out a cigarette and lit it.

He had pushed the love of his life away with his own hands.

Michael would never forget the moment Isabella, with tears in her eyes, confessed her love for him. His heart had almost leapt out of his chest with joy.

But now, thinking back, the happiness he felt then was matched by the pain he felt now.

If he hadn't misunderstood her, if he hadn't thought she had schemed to marry him, if he had realized his love for her sooner...

They could be living a happy married life now, maybe even with a child in their first year of marriage.

He would come home to see her and their child waiting for him.

How happy those days would have been.

But he realized too late. He had missed his chance with her.

Now, he just wanted to quickly deal with the Adri Family's schemes. If Isabella was still single by then, he would do everything to win her back.

He knew she must be hurting now.

But he couldn't explain the truth to her yet.

He had to wait until he had resolved everything. Then he would find her and tell her everything.

At least she had her uncles and friends to help her through this tough time.

With that thought, Michael crushed his cigarette underfoot and walked down the steps.

Just then, he received a call from Aaron overseas.

"Mr. Brown, good news. We've tracked down the courier who sent the suspicious documents."

If they could find this person, they might be able to intercept and retrieve the documents, temporarily saving the Brown Group from crisis.

Michael exhaled.

But he hadn't forgotten the call from Aiden earlier, clearly ready to hold him accountable.

That wouldn't be easy to deal with.

Meanwhile, Isabella was in a much better mood.

Throughout the ride, Thomas couldn't stop smiling.

Isabella had finally divorced Michael.

As her uncle, Thomas was happier than anyone.

Now that she was free from that bad man, she could find any man she wanted. Why should she settle for Michael?

Isabella, on the other hand, had a calm expression since leaving the courthouse. It was hard to tell if she was happy or not.

But Thomas assumed she was happy.

After all, anyone would be relieved to be free from what Michael had done.

The sooner the divorce, the sooner the relief.

Back at the Wilson Family home, Isabella made an excuse to go to her room.

Thomas couldn't wait to share the good news with Atticus and Holden.

Only Olivia noticed something was off with Isabella and quietly went upstairs to be with her.

No one knew better than Olivia how much Isabella loved Michael. He was the only man she had ever loved.

Even if he was a jerk, he was different in Isabella's heart.

They had broken up and gotten back together so many times, but Olivia could see that Isabella didn't really want to divorce Michael.

She was just waiting for him to change.

But in the end, Michael had let her down, and they had reached the point of divorce.

How could Isabella possibly be happy?

At this moment, Olivia wished Isabella would cry out loud, at least to release her pent-up emotions. It was better than silently bearing it alone.

At noon, Atticus asked Cinda to prepare more dishes. After all, Isabella's divorce was a big deal for the Wilson Family.

Thomas had just returned, so it was a good time for a family gathering.

Kian and Orion also received calls from Thomas, learning the good news of Isabella's divorce.

They were thrilled and happy for Isabella.

She was still young and deserved someone better to spend her life with.

As lunch was almost ready, Atticus received a call.

His subordinate had some news.

Michael's overseas mining project had run into big trouble. The specifics were still under investigation.

###chapter 446 Approaching Good Things

With Atticus's special instructions, the lunch was set up lavishly.

Holden even brought out a bottle of red wine he had been saving for a long time, pouring it for everyone, clearly in high spirits.

Isabella looked at the people around her, all there to support her, and the sadness in her heart gradually faded away.

She had family, she had friends; she shouldn't let herself be consumed by grief any longer.

Taking a deep breath, she raised her glass and gently clinked it with Olivia's.

The glasses made a crisp, clear sound, and a smile spread across Isabella's face. The aroma of the wine brought back a sense of her old self.

"Olivia, aren't you going to congratulate me on being single again?"

Hearing this, not only Olivia was stunned, but even Isabella herself was surprised.

This was the real her, the carefree and spirited Isabella who never let others drain her energy.

A glimmer of joy flashed in Olivia's eyes.

"Of course, congratulations! Welcome back, Princess of the Wilson Family."

They raised their eyebrows, lifted their glasses, and drank heartily.

After a few drinks, Olivia started singing, and Isabella danced along to her voice, completely immersed in their own world. It was like they were back in the days when they used to go wild at the bar together.

The three Wilson brothers at the table didn't stop them, just watched with smiles as Isabella let loose.

Isabella drank too much and, after a few spins, felt dizzy. She leaned over and fell onto Olivia's shoulder.

Taking advantage of the alcohol, she pointed a finger at Olivia and asked, "Olivia, tell me the truth, are you hiding something from me?"

Because of the alcohol, Isabella's face was flushed, and her speech was not as smooth as usual.

"Of course not," Olivia quickly denied. "You're my best friend. How could I hide anything from you? No way, no way."

"Really?" Isabella snorted, clearly not believing Olivia at all.

She glanced in Atticus's direction and asked deliberately, "If you're not hiding anything, then why did Uncle Atticus keep looking at you when you started singing? He couldn't take his eyes off you."

His gaze was almost enough to sweep her off her feet and into his arms.

"No way, you must have seen it wrong."

Olivia's face turned bright red when Isabella mentioned Atticus.

At Graceful Haven Church, she didn't know that Isabella had orchestrated everything to make it seem like a chance encounter with Atticus. She had even told Isabella that she wanted to forget Atticus and start anew.

But now, she had somehow ended up with him.

"I didn't see it wrong," Isabella teased. "Tell me, have you and Atticus already promised each other forever? Are you going to be his wife?"

His wife?

Olivia almost buried her head in embarrassment at the mention of that title.

Although she and Atticus hadn't reached that point yet, if things continued as they were, she might really marry him.

Just thinking about it made Olivia clutch her chest, her heart racing uncontrollably.

"Isabella, I didn't mean to hide it from you. Atticus and I are indeed together."

"If you're upset, you can tell me directly. I can handle it."

She hadn't planned to tell Isabella so soon, considering Isabella was still dealing with the pain of her divorce.

But now that Isabella had asked, she didn't want to keep it from her anymore.

Isabella was her best friend, and she valued their friendship as much as she valued Atticus.

If she didn't get Isabella's blessing, she wouldn't be happy.

Isabella patted Olivia and laughed.

"Why would I be upset? Did you forget I was the one who supported you and Uncle Atticus from the start? I'm happier than anyone that you two are together. I'm serious, Olivia."

"I want you to be happy, and if Uncle Atticus is the right one, then that's perfect."

She and Michael were not meant to be, but if Atticus and Olivia could find happiness, it would be a comfort to her.

"Isabella, you're so kind. I was so scared you'd be mad when you found out, so I didn't dare tell you. You have no idea how anxious I was."

Olivia was moved to tears.

After all, she loved Isabella's uncle, the person who adored Isabella the most. She thought Isabella would be angry with her because of it.

But instead, she received Isabella's most sincere blessing.

She was truly touched.

"Don't cry, this is a good thing. You haven't told me how far you and Atticus have gotten. Have you discussed when to have the wedding?"

"I can't wait to see you in a wedding dress. You'll definitely sweep Atticus off his feet."

At the mention of this, Olivia blushed and didn't know where to put her hands.

Especially with Atticus not far away, just a glance up and she could see him.

Olivia didn't dare to discuss these things loudly with Isabella.

"Well, I don't know. We just confirmed our relationship. Isn't it too early to talk about marriage?"

She did want to marry Atticus soon, but it wasn't something she could decide on her own.

She had to see what he thought.

Seeing Olivia's shyness, Isabella stopped teasing her. "Alright, I'll ask Atticus about it later. I won't rush you. You just wait to be his wife."

"Isabella, stop it. I told you, I'm not his wife yet. Even if we get married, our relationship won't change. Just call me by my name."

"Alright, alright, I'll call you whatever you want."

Isabella sat for a while and felt a bit uncomfortable, so she wanted to go to the restroom.

Olivia, worried she might be unsteady, went with her.

They left the dining room together.

At the table, Atticus watched Isabella and Olivia leave, then turned his gaze back to his wine glass.

He took a sip of the red wine, as if something had come to mind, and suddenly turned to Thomas.

"What's going on with you? Didn't you say you had urgent business at the company? How come you're back to handle Isabella's divorce?"

At the mention of this, Thomas's anger flared up.

He gripped his wine glass tightly and downed its contents in one gulp.

"Atticus, don't bring it up. The more I think about it, the more I feel Isabella wasted so many years and emotions on that jerk Michael!"

"That bastard Michael doesn't deserve our Isabella."

"You have no idea how despicable he is. He actually came to me, asking to expedite the divorce, saying he was in a hurry and couldn't wait any longer."

"Did he forget he's the one at fault in this marriage? Isabella hasn't said anything, and he's the one who can't wait. Luckily, I managed to clear my schedule and make time to come back."

###chapter 447 I Just Want The Truth

Holden slammed his hand on the table, his face red with anger. "This is ridiculous! Does that jerk Michael really think we're gonna let him get back with Isabella?"

"Exactly! Why do the Wilsons need to suck up to the Browns? They should know we're just as good as they are," Thomas added, feeling vindicated.

Across the table, Atticus stayed quiet, taking it all in. The suddenness of Isabella and Michael's divorce had caught his attention, and Thomas's words only confirmed his suspicions. Michael genuinely cared about Isabella's well-being.

While others might misjudge Michael, Atticus, who knew the truth, couldn't let him be painted as the bad guy. "Maybe Michael has his reasons for acting so quickly," he suggested, trying to defend Michael without spilling too much.

Holden's face twisted in displeasure. "Atticus, how can you defend that jerk Michael? Have you forgotten how he treated Isabella? She went through hell with him. If anyone's got it tough, it's Isabella, not him."

Thomas jumped in too. "Yeah, Atticus, you're usually the one who looks out for Isabella the most. You were all for the divorce, so why are you sticking up for Michael now? Feeling sorry for him or something?"

Maybe it was the alcohol, but Holden and Thomas were speaking more freely. Atticus, however, kept his cool. He thought for a moment and said, "Holden, Thomas, I'm just trying to see things from a different angle. Maybe there's more to this than we know."

"And now that Isabella's divorced, she's got no ties to the Brown family. Let's not bring up Michael's name around her; it might upset her."

As the eldest, Atticus was always the thoughtful and mature one, so Holden and Thomas listened to him. Little did they know, Isabella was standing in a corner of the hall, overhearing their conversation.

She knew how much her uncles cared for her, but Atticus's reaction puzzled her. He had always been her biggest supporter, especially after she lost her grandfather and child. He was the one who most supported her decision to divorce.

Yet now, Atticus was defending Michael. Isabella grew suspicious. If Atticus had discovered something, he wouldn't side with Michael without a good reason. After coming back from the hospital, Atticus had stayed behind alone. Could he have found out something?

The thought nagged at her, making her wonder if something had happened to Michael, something he didn't want her to know. Olivia soon joined her, linking arms as they returned to the dining room. Isabella chatted and laughed with everyone, hiding her inner turmoil.

Later that night, back in her room, Isabella found a number on her phone and dialed it. The call was quickly answered by Shadow, who sounded surprised. "Isabella, you finally decided to call me. Thought you'd forgotten all about me."

Isabella got straight to the point. "Shadow, I need to ask you something. Has anything happened with the Brown Group recently?"

Atticus's words tonight were too unusual, and she needed to confirm her suspicions. Shadow immediately connected the Brown Group with Michael. He knew about their divorce, and it hadn't been long since then. Isabella was already inquiring about Michael.

Shadow sighed. "Isabella, why can't you see Michael for who he really is? He doesn't deserve you. You're amazing and deserve better."

"Listen to me, let him go. You've divorced him, so move on. There are better people out there for you."

Isabella fell silent. Though she wasn't asking about Michael directly, Shadow's words hit home. She knew he was advising her as a friend to let go of the past and move forward. Since she was divorced, she shouldn't waste time and emotions on someone unworthy.

"Shadow, you're overthinking. I just want to know about the Brown Group. I'm not interested in anyone else," she said calmly, not sounding like she was lying.

But Shadow wasn't convinced. "Really? Do you truly not care about him at all?"

Isabella noticed something off about Shadow's persistence. He never usually pressed for reasons; their communication was always brief and efficient. When had he become so talkative? Especially when she asked about the Brown Group, he diverted the topic to Michael. This wasn't like him.

Unless...

Isabella's eyes flashed as she quickly asked, "Shadow, tell me the truth. Has something happened to the Brown Group?"

Shadow's rare silence confirmed her fears. Her intuition had been right. The Brown Group was in trouble.

Shadow was an expert at gathering information, especially about powerful families. If something had happened to the Brown Group, he would know the details better than anyone.

Before Isabella could think further, Shadow's voice came through the phone. "You're right. But Isabella, listen to me. The Brown Group's troubles are their own. You're no longer connected to them, so don't get involved."

Shadow's blunt honesty and warning made Isabella panic. She and Michael had just finalized their divorce. Despite everything, she couldn't completely turn a blind eye.

"I understand what you're saying, but Shadow, I can't pretend I don't know. Help me one more time. I just want to know what's going on with the Brown Group. I need the truth."

Even with the divorce papers in hand, she needed the truth. Shadow, knowing her stubborn nature, realized she wouldn't stop until she found out. It was better if he told her himself.

###chapter 448 He Is Not a Substitute

"Isabella, it's not that I don't want to tell you the truth, but I've heard a client paid big bucks to buy out all the info from the Brown Group. Their goal is to shut down any further investigation."

"So, just act like you never asked about this, and don't try to dig through other channels. It won't work."

Selling information was his job and livelihood. Even though Isabella was his friend, he had to follow the rules of the trade.

Otherwise, he would be the next target.

And now that someone had paid to buy out the information, it meant they didn't want any details to be uncovered. Anyone who dared to leak information at this point would be breaking the industry's code and principles.

For people like them, that was absolutely unacceptable.

"I get it."

Isabella didn't want to make things difficult for Shadow.

Since someone had already bought out the information, there was no point in her trying to find anything out now.

But she still felt uneasy.

"Shadow, can you keep an eye on Michael for me?"

Since the Brown Group was in trouble, if she could find out where Michael had been and what he had been doing recently, maybe she could indirectly figure out what the problem with the Brown Group was.

Shadow understood what Isabella was getting at, and this time, he didn't refuse her.

The confidentiality agreement only stated that he couldn't disclose information about the Brown Group, but it didn't say he couldn't keep an eye on Michael himself.

"Isabella, I can keep an eye on him, but let me be clear: you've already fallen into this trap once. You can't let yourself fall into it a second time."

Shadow had seen Isabella's feelings for Michael.

It was because he knew how much Isabella loved Michael that he had to keep reminding her.

They were already divorced. It was normal for Isabella to have a hard time moving on, but if she kept focusing on Michael's every move, he didn't know if it would be good or bad for her.

"Shadow, I know what I'm doing. Thanks for the reminder."

Ending the call, Isabella gripped her phone tightly, unable to calm down.

The Brown Group was really in trouble.

No wonder Atticus, who had always had a low opinion of Michael, had suddenly changed his attitude.

It seemed that Atticus had already discovered this at the hospital that day.

She knew Atticus's temper. If he didn't want her to know something, even if she asked him directly, she wouldn't get any answers.

So, she could only wait for Shadow's information.

Michael drove back to the Brown Family after leaving the courthouse.

Aiden had been genuinely angry on the phone, so he had no choice but to return.

But what Michael didn't expect was to see Nolan sitting next to Aiden as soon as he walked into the hall.

"Nolan, what a coincidence."

Michael raised an eyebrow, his face expressionless.

He then looked at Aiden and calmly asked, "Grandpa, you urged me to come back. What's the matter?"

Having just ended a three-year marriage with Isabella, he wasn't in the best of moods.

He didn't regret signing the divorce papers to ensure Isabella's safety. It was the only way to keep the Adri Family from targeting the Wilson Family for the time being.

But he feared Isabella's resolute nature.

What he had done was undoubtedly shattering her heart. She was probably left with nothing but disappointment and heartbreak.

If someone took advantage of this time to step in, Isabella and Michael might never get back together.

"Playing dumb?"

Aiden was furious as soon as Michael returned. "The papers, I need to see them with my own eyes to believe it."

"What papers?"

Michael realized that Aiden was doubting the authenticity of the divorce agreement.

He lowered his gaze, his voice hoarse. "Grandpa, it's real. We really got divorced."

"You..."

Aiden was at a loss for words.

His hands trembled with anger. "You brat, Isabella is such a good girl. You didn't cherish her. You didn't even tell me about the divorce. Do you even respect me as your grandfather?"

"Do you know what promises I made to Daniel when you married Isabella? I said you would treat her well, never let her suffer. Did you keep any of those promises?"

Aiden's face turned red with anger.

"Michael, Michael, how can I face Isabella's grandfather after I die? He entrusted his granddaughter to you, and this is how you treat her?"

"Isabella was too naive to fall for you. If she had chosen someone else, I wouldn't have..."

Michael quickly interrupted Aiden, disbelief in his voice.

"Grandpa, what did you just say?"

Aiden gritted his teeth. "Don't you get it? If Isabella hadn't fallen for you, do you really think you could have married such a good wife with your temper?"

"Isabella faced pressure from the Wilson Family to marry into the Brown Family. And what did you give her in return?"

"Do you really think the Wilson Family had no objections to you? They raised their little princess for over a decade. If she didn't truly love you, Daniel had a hundred ways to find her a husband. They wouldn't have let her suffer even a little."

Michael's mind went blank.

So, Isabella wasn't lying.

She had always loved him.

Not Nolan.

But why did Nolan tell him that Isabella married him out of heartbreak over Nolan's departure?

Nolan had said that Isabella only saw him as a stand-in for Nolan.

Michael's eyes turned red as he glared at Nolan in the wheelchair.

So, Nolan had been lying all along.

With the truth exposed, Nolan's face turned pale, and he couldn't utter a word in his defense.

For him, the lie had caused Michael pain and gave him the illusion that Isabella loved him.

Over time, even Nolan didn't want to wake up from this lie.

Aiden sighed deeply.

"What's the point of saying all this now? If you had realized Isabella's true feelings earlier, you wouldn't be divorced now."

"I know Isabella. She's Daniel's personally trained successor. Her character is unyielding. If she's decided to let go, it means she's truly heartbroken."

"Since you're divorced, don't bother her anymore. You've already ruined the relationship between our families. You may not feel ashamed, but I do!"

###chapter 449 You Are Not Qualified Enough

Aiden finished talking and glanced up to see Michael, eyes bloodshot and glaring intensely in one direction, the anger in his gaze almost tangible.

Aiden had no clue what had set Michael off this time and snapped at him, annoyed.

"What are you staring at? You couldn't even keep your wife, and now you have the nerve to be pissed?"

His words didn't faze Michael, who clenched his fists tightly, feeling like his heart was being ripped apart.

"Grandpa, you were right. It's my fault Isabella left."

"She must've really given up on me, that's why she divorced me and wished me well in my single life."

Michael's voice was low and raspy, his whole demeanor suddenly defeated.

He had been so foolish.

Isabella had once gone out of her way to please him, even wearing sexy lingerie to seduce him, hoping to have their child.

But he had pushed her away every time, belittling her.

He had always believed that no matter how he treated her, Isabella would never leave.

But he had forgotten that Isabella was a true heiress of the Wilson Family. If she didn't truly care about him, why would she endure three years of mistreatment in the Brown Family, even from the servants?

She had never complained to him, always treating him with kindness, and even taking care of his mother who didn't like her.

She did all of this for him.

She only wanted him.

Why couldn't he see that sooner?

Why did he let her suffer humiliation and grievances for three years?

The Wilson Family was right. He didn't deserve Isabella's love!

Aiden's voice continued, but Michael couldn't hear a word of it.

He mechanically took the brand-new divorce agreement from his pocket and handed it to Aiden, then numbly walked upstairs to the bedroom he once shared with Isabella.

He needed silence now.

As the door closed, Michael could no longer support himself and slid down to the floor.

He didn't dare look at the room's furnishings, especially the wedding photo hanging above the bed.

From the beginning, he had trusted the wrong person.

He thought Isabella married him for money or other reasons, never considering that she might actually love him.

She had spent three years proving the coldness of his heart, and on this day, she finally gave up and left him. It was only after the divorce that he realized the truth.

Michael felt his heart constricting painfully, making it hard to breathe.

He regretted it.

If fate gave him another chance, he would never treat her that way again.

But there were no "ifs" in this world, and he couldn't go back.

It was all his own doing, and he couldn't blame anyone else.

At some point, his face became wet. Michael touched his face in confusion and realized he was crying.

He buried his face in his hands.

He had pushed Isabella away himself, and now it was too late for regrets.

If seeking her out now would only bring her harm, then he would bear this pain alone.

Just then, there was a knock on the door.

Michael, sitting just behind the door, clearly heard someone outside.

"Who is it?"

He asked in a deep voice, quickly wiping away his tears.

He didn't want anyone to see him in this vulnerable state.

"Michael, it's me, your brother."

Nolan's voice was gentle and concerned, as if he genuinely cared about his younger brother.

But knowing the truth, Michael found Nolan's words "your brother" incredibly ironic.

Michael gritted his teeth and yanked the door open.

He glared coldly at Nolan, who was sitting in a wheelchair. "Nolan, from today on, you're not my brother anymore. Stop pretending to be pitiful in front of me."

"I'm not Grandpa. I don't buy your act."

Nolan, despite his extreme hypocrisy, put on an innocent facade, which made Michael sick to his stomach.

"How do you know I'm here to check on you? Maybe I'm here to congratulate you on your successful divorce?"

Nolan sat up straight in his wheelchair, his face no longer hiding his cold expression.

He had been waiting for this day. As long as Michael and Isabella were divorced, his opportunity would come.

Michael's eyes narrowed, and the next second, he grabbed Nolan's collar fiercely. "Nolan, do you think I won't dare touch you because Grandpa is downstairs?"

If it weren't for Nolan, Michael and Isabella wouldn't have fallen out when she was pregnant.

Their divorce was partly due to Nolan's instigation.

Michael knew exactly what Nolan was up to.

Isabella didn't like Nolan, but she didn't dislike him either. Nolan knew his strengths well. Once Michael and Isabella were divorced, he could use his charm to get close to Isabella.

He would exploit Isabella's dependence on him to replace Michael in her heart and become her partner.

The thought made Michael want to strangle him.

But no matter what he did now, it was too late. Isabella wouldn't trust him anymore.

She would rather trust Nolan, the hypocritical liar.

Michael hated himself for not realizing Isabella's feelings for him sooner. If he had confessed his feelings earlier, maybe they wouldn't have missed each other like this.

Despite the situation, Nolan remained calm, even smirking slightly.

"Michael, you're right. I'm taking advantage of Grandpa's presence to act recklessly. You saw how upset Grandpa was because of you. If you lose control again, imagine how disappointed Grandpa will be."

"Oh, and since you're divorced from Isabella, what if I tell Grandpa that she's the one I want to marry? How do you think he'll react?"

"Nolan, how dare you!"

Michael's hands tightened around Nolan's throat.

Rage burned within him, threatening to consume his sanity.

"Go ahead."

Nolan's face turned red, but a gleam of triumph flashed in his eyes.

At the last moment, Michael's rationality prevailed.

Nolan was deliberately provoking him.

With Aiden already stressed over the company's issues and Michael's divorce, losing control now would only make Aiden more disappointed in him.

And that's exactly what Nolan wanted.

No matter how much Michael wanted to strangle Nolan, he forced himself to let go, glaring at him with cold fury.

"Nolan, you think you can use me as your weapon? You're not worthy!"

Michael flexed his wrist, his face dark with anger. Even if he wanted to kill Nolan, today wasn't the day.

The truth hadn't come to light yet.

He had to stay calm!

###chapter 450 Board of Directors Meeting

Before this, he had even thought about convincing Aiden to hand the Brown Group back to Nolan so he could focus all his attention on Isabella.

He wanted to clear up all the misunderstandings with her and rediscover the feelings they had when they were together.

But now, the person who caused him to lose the one he loved most was Nolan, someone he had once felt guilty towards. Just because Nolan also liked Isabella, Nolan thought he could destroy everything he had.

Michael no longer felt any guilt towards someone as hypocritical and selfish as Nolan.

Now that he had lost Isabella, he had nothing left to care about.

From today on, he would fight Nolan to the end.

He wouldn't give up a single thing that belonged to him!

"Is that so?"

Nolan adjusted his clothes, seemingly indifferent to Michael's words, and said slowly.

"I forgot to tell you, Grandpa called you back earlier because of the Auroria contract. You ran off halfway through, so he asked me to come and tell you."

"What?"

Michael had a bad feeling.

Nolan smirked, "Grandpa is holding a board meeting tomorrow. As the CEO, you can't miss it. After all, this meeting has a lot to do with you."

With that, he wheeled himself towards the elevator.

Michael stood there, stunned by his words.

Aiden personally hosting a board meeting was something that hadn't happened in a long time.

Michael's heart sank.

Nolan had been present when Aiden called him, and now he was present when the meeting was announced. No wonder Nolan hadn't reacted to his warnings-Nolan had already gained special privileges from Aiden.

So, was Aiden really planning to replace him with Nolan as the CEO of the Brown Group?

How did it come to this?

Aiden had previously said he would never hand the company over to Nolan.

What had Nolan said to Aiden while he was away?

Michael couldn't sleep well that night because of this.

The next day, he got up early and went to the office.

In the large conference room on the top floor, Aiden, as the chairman, sat at the head of the table, a seat usually occupied by Michael.

Now that Aiden was there, Michael could only sit to his right.

Nolan sat across from him.

The meeting started faster than Michael had expected, and the board members, upon hearing that Aiden was hosting, had arrived early.

The large room was filled with people, but no one dared to make a sound.

Until Aiden waved to his assistant, and everyone received a copy of the project documents.

Each person had a copy.

Aiden had printed dozens of them.

Michael was the first to receive one, and as he opened it, his heart skipped a beat.

When he reached the last page, he was completely shocked!

It was the forged document he had been trying to recover at all costs, with the signature and seal clearly visible.

But hadn't it been taken and sent abroad? How did it end up in Aiden's hands?

Michael immediately locked his gaze on Nolan across the table.

Nolan didn't avoid his stare, openly allowing Michael to scrutinize him, looking completely confident.

Clearly, this was all part of Nolan's plan.

Without this document, how could Nolan overthrow Michael and take his place?

Michael had caused the trouble, but it was Nolan who would save the Brown Group.

As long as Aiden wasn't foolish, he would know what to do next.

Michael frowned deeply.

Nolan's reaction was too calm, as if he had known about this document all along.

So, had Nolan found this document and given it to Aiden?

But hadn't it been sent out? How did it end up with Nolan? Or had Nolan found the mole in the Brown Group before him?

Before Michael could figure it out, someone else couldn't sit still.

One of the board members, holding the document, angrily accused.

"Mr. Aiden Brown, even an employee can see the serious implications of this document. For Michael to sign it shows he doesn't care about the company's interests. I propose we remove him from the CEO position and give it to someone who truly cares about the company."

Once one person spoke up, others quickly followed.

"That's right, this project is clearly a bad deal. If it goes through, we'll be throwing away billions of dollars. If we can't recover it, it'll all be wasted. For him to sign such a terrible contract shows how negligent he is. We should replace him as soon as possible."

"Such a basic mistake shows he's not mature enough. I think we should hand the company back to Mr. Nolan Brown. When Mr. Nolan Brown was in charge, the Brown Group was a leader in the industry."

The board members' comments were almost all urging Michael to step down.

His three years of hard work were being dismissed because of one mistake.

It was true, you only saw people's true colors when you were down.

Michael listened to the accusations, feeling a chill in his heart.

These people had followed him for three years, always respectful and never questioning him.

He remembered the board member who was now the most critical had once told him he was more decisive than Nolan and the best fit to inherit the Brown Group.

Now, after one incident, they had all changed.

He wanted to argue, but it seemed pointless.

The facts were in front of them, and what he said didn't matter anymore.

They wanted him gone.

A loud bang on the table silenced the room. Aiden, with a stern face, looked at everyone.

"Enough. You are all their elders. You can discuss the matter, but if you bully my grandson in front of me, you're not respecting me."

"Although Michael is at fault, don't forget, you are all senior members of the company. If something happens, none of you can escape responsibility."

"You say he's unfit to be CEO, but look at yourselves. In the past three years, which of you hasn't made money? Which year's dividends weren't more than a percentage transferred to your accounts? Now that something has happened, you all want to pass the blame. What do you take my grandson for?"

His words left everyone speechless.

Because Aiden was right.

In the three years Michael had been in charge, almost every project had been profitable, and the board members had benefited.

The Brown Group had long established itself as a leader in the industry, not needing the board members' investments.

In fact, they couldn't do without the huge dividends the Brown Group provided.

So, when their interests were at stake, they naturally had to fight for themselves.

###chapter 451 Resignation

After Aiden finished speaking, the board members fell silent for a moment before one of them quietly voiced an objection.

"Aiden, we get that you care about your grandson, but this is a business. We can't let emotions get in the way."

"Look, it's normal to have ups and downs in business. If a project tanks because of the market, that's one thing. But the terms in this document are just crazy, and Michael still signed it. He's playing fast and loose with the company's money."

Others nodded in agreement.

"Yeah, Mr. Aiden Brown, we're all thinking about the company's future here. This time it's billions. What about next time? Even the biggest companies can't take hits like this!"

"Enough!"

Aiden cut them off, his face stern. "I know the situation, and there's no need to keep going on about it."

"I'm here to fix this."

"When mistakes are made, they need to be owned up to. I'm not playing favorites. Luckily, we can still manage this, so let's be fair and vote."

"Should Michael stay as CEO, or should Nolan take over? You decide."

The assistant quickly handed out paper and pens for the board members to cast their votes.

Aiden personally opened the votes.

Everything happened so fast.

By the time Michael realized what was going on, the assistant was already collecting the votes.

Michael instinctively looked at Aiden, who was seated at the head of the table. He couldn't figure out what Aiden was thinking.

Aiden had always been against Nolan taking over the company, and now he was the one calling for a vote to choose the successor.

What had Nolan said to Aiden in the past two days to change his mind so quickly?

Michael frowned.

He knew the odds were against him.

The senior board members were already upset with him because of the document, and now Aiden was having them vote between him and Nolan.

The result would likely favor Nolan, giving him the CEO position.

Unintentionally, Michael's gaze fell on Nolan's face.

He saw Nolan waiting for the result with a smug look.

Nolan's usually calm and polished face now showed confidence and arrogance.

This scene reminded Michael of the time when Nolan was publicly stripped of the CEO position.

Back then, Nolan must have felt the same disbelief and deep sense of defeat.

Michael sighed inwardly.

After all this time, he and Nolan had come full circle.

What was meant to happen had happened.

But this time, he wouldn't just hand over the company. He owed Nolan nothing and felt no guilt towards him.

No matter the outcome, he wouldn't give up the position of successor.

Even if it was just to prove a point, he would take back the company.

Nolan had used a lie to make him lose the person he loved most, and now he wanted to take what was rightfully his?

No way he would let that happen.

Soon, the collected votes were in Aiden's hands.

As the assistant opened each vote, Aiden's expression grew darker.

Michael had already guessed the result.

It made sense.

When Nolan took over the company years ago, he treated it like his home, working diligently and earning a solid reputation. Now, with Michael's recent blunder, it was no surprise they would back Nolan as the new leader.

Aiden spoke slowly, "The results are in. I announce that from today, the CEO of the Brown Group is-Nolan Brown!"

"Let's hear a few words from the new CEO."

As soon as he finished speaking, the room erupted in applause.

Nolan stood up straight, and Michael noticed he was wearing a formal dark suit, as if he had anticipated today's outcome.

Nolan's expression remained unchanged as he scanned the board members, smiling slightly.

"You are all my elders, and I have nothing to teach you. Thank you for your support and trust. Together, we will lead the Brown Group to new heights."

He bowed slightly as a sign of respect.

After all, he was still in a wheelchair and couldn't stand up.

This day had finally come!

He was back, reclaiming everything that was his.

And this was just the first step.

Once he had full control of the Brown Group, his real revenge against the Brown Family would begin.

His next plan was to win Isabella's heart.

Now that Isabella and Michael were divorced, he could approach her without hiding.

He dreamed of the day he and Isabella would get married, imagining Michael's reaction.

The decision was made.

Michael knew that from today, the Brown Group had nothing to do with him.

And he wasn't one to cling on.

Since Nolan had won this round, he would leave.

But he had no intention of truly giving up the company.

With that thought, Michael stood up decisively and gave a cold laugh to the room.

"If this is the result you want, so be it. I won't stay to hear the rest. You can continue your discussion."

As he pulled out his chair to leave, he glanced at Nolan with a meaningful look.

"Nolan, don't celebrate too soon. Whether you can hold onto this company is another matter!"

They were all part of the Brown Family. If Nolan wanted a fight, Michael would give him one.

Michael then strode out of the meeting room.

He didn't even go to his office, heading straight to the parking garage and driving away.

Without the burden of work, Michael felt a sense of relief, even the pain from his injuries seemed to lessen.

But when a person had free time, they thought of the ones they wanted to see most.

He wanted to see Isabella.

Seeing it was nine o'clock, Michael didn't hesitate to drive towards the Wilson Family's home.

Even though he knew Isabella might not see him, he still wanted to try, even if it was just to hear her voice through the door.

Halfway there, Michael received a call from abroad.

It was Aaron.

Michael connected the call through his car's Bluetooth and answered quickly.

"Mr. Brown, I just got the news-"

Aaron's voice was fast and urgent, but Michael wasn't in the mood to listen patiently. He interrupted him.

"Alright, if you're calling just to ask if I've been removed from my position, I can confirm, yes!"

"I'm no longer the CEO of the Brown Group. Anything else you want to ask?"

###chapter 452  Heartbroken

"Mr. Brown, is this for real?"

Aaron couldn't believe it. He had just gone abroad for a bit, and before he could wrap up his business and return to the company, Michael had already been ousted.

"But how is this possible? You were personally chosen by Mr. Aiden Brown as his successor. How could they suddenly announce your resignation?"

Michael just gave a calm smile.

"Aaron, nothing's impossible in this world. Besides, my grandpa still holds the ultimate power in the company. If he wants to change the successor, he can do it. It's no big deal."

He had to own up to his mistakes.

Even if someone had set him up, he could only blame himself for not being skilled enough.

He didn't hold a grudge against his grandpa for it.

In fact, he was grateful that his grandpa had given him some valuable time to think about how to deal with the Adri Family.

Michael, considering Aaron's position, asked him a question.

"Have you thought about what you're gonna do next?"

"You can't stay at the company anymore. Nolan will definitely replace you. If you don't mind, you can work at a branch office. I can arrange it for you."

Aaron had been his right-hand man for years, and this was the least he could do for him.

Knowing Nolan's personality, Aaron would likely face exclusion if he stayed.

It was better for Michael to arrange for him to go somewhere else, where he might have a better future.

"Mr. Brown, I..."

Aaron was at a loss for words.

Everything had happened so suddenly, and he was still trying to process it.

But before discussing his own situation, he hadn't forgotten the real reason he called.

He was worried that Michael, who had just been kicked out of the company, might not be able to handle another piece of bad news.

So he held back for now.

"Mr. Brown, my situation isn't urgent. I'll be in Auroria for a while and won't be back anytime soon."

"Did something happen?"

Michael knew Aaron had taken a risk for Renee. He had been so busy with company matters that he had forgotten to ask about the situation over there.

"It's strange. After we arrived here, the Adri Family people came to us. They said the order to hunt down Renee was a misunderstanding!"

Aaron was just as confused.

"They claimed that the internal order was only to bring her back to the organization for an internal trial, not to kill her."

Michael narrowed his eyes. "Did Renee go with them? Or is she still with you?"

The Adri Family was known for their tricks.

Who knew what they were planning behind the scenes?

Aaron sighed. "She left. She said she had a reason to return to the organization and didn't want me to go with her. She just asked me to wait for her news."

"Aren't you worried something might happen to her?"

Michael was surprised.

He had seen Aaron's feelings for Renee firsthand. Aaron had even returned to Auroria with her. Now he was letting her go into the Adri Family's internal organization alone?

"I had no choice. Mr. Brown, you know Renee never listens to me. I always listen to her."

"But she assured me multiple times that she wouldn't be in danger. I had to let her go."

Michael shook his head with a smile.

Was this still the same cold and unfeeling Aaron he knew?

Aaron had fallen in love and turned into a devoted partner.

But Michael could hear the happiness in Aaron's voice. If Isabella had controlled him like that, maybe he would have been just as obedient.

Unfortunately, everything was in the past.

Michael sighed. "Alright, be careful out there. I have things to do, so I'll talk to you later."

He was about to end the call when Aaron suddenly stopped him.

"Mr. Brown, wait."

"Is there something else?"

Aaron hesitated for a moment before speaking. "Mr. Brown, if I may ask, are you planning to see Mrs. Brown?"

"How did you know?"

Michael was taken aback.

He didn't have to tell Isabella the truth right now, but ever since he learned about her feelings yesterday, he couldn't stop thinking about seeing her.

Even if he didn't say anything, he just wanted to see her.

Aaron, on the other end, guessed it immediately. Normally, he wouldn't interfere in Michael's personal matters.

But now, if he didn't say something, it could lead to big trouble!

"Mr. Brown, take my advice. It's best not to go to Mrs. Brown's house right now. If you really want to go, check the top news online first."

Aaron couldn't say more than that.

He had been keeping a close eye on domestic news while in Auroria.

He had stumbled upon a fresh piece of gossip.

Curious, he clicked on it.

What he saw nearly scared him to death.

Then, he received an even more shocking message from the company: Michael had been removed as president, and Nolan was taking over all responsibilities starting today.

His heart had been racing ever since he made the call, and it took him a long time to calm down.

Michael hung up the phone, puzzled, and opened the news on his phone.

The top headline was explosive.

#Brown Group President's Ex-Wife Spotted with New Boyfriend, Suspected to be Brown Family's Second Son. Intimate Behavior Suggests Romance.

#The Bigger Brother Falls for His Younger Brother's Wife, Forbidden Love Exposed.

The people in the news were Isabella and Nolan?

Michael was stunned. He quickly clicked on the news, and the first thing he saw was a photo of them acting intimately.

Nolan and Isabella were in a café, holding hands and gazing deeply into each other's eyes.

Isabella didn't seem to reject it. On the contrary, she looked sincerely at Nolan.

If Michael had doubted the gossip before, the photo left him speechless.

Isabella had started looking for new happiness.

He had forgotten that Isabella had loved him for three years, but he had worn down her love with his coldness and neglect.

No matter how much she had loved him, after three years of such treatment, how could she still have feelings for him?

She was truly letting go of him.

So she had accepted Nolan's confession?

For the first time, Michael felt the true meaning of despair.

Even losing his position as successor hadn't made him feel this hopeless. But now, he felt like he had lost everything.

He had lost the company, his grandfather's trust, and now the woman he loved was about to be with someone else.

What did he have left?

Nothing.

Without Isabella, he didn't know what the point of all his efforts would be.

###chapter 453  Game Within a Game

Michael slammed his fist onto the steering wheel, his eyes blazing with anger as he gripped the wheel tightly.

"Nolan, you made me lose everything."

He would never let Nolan get away with this.

Meanwhile, back at Brown Enterprises, Aiden got word that Michael had left the company and was driving alone towards the Wilson estate.

He finally breathed a sigh of relief.

Yes, it was all a ruse he had orchestrated-changing the heir and transferring Michael's power.

To Aiden, Michael, the youngest grandson, was the rightful heir to Brown Enterprises. Everything in the Brown family would eventually be handed to Michael.

Aiden had done all this to force Nolan to reveal his true colors. He wanted to see just how far Nolan would go.

And Michael had more important things to deal with than the company right now.

Aiden had deliberately mentioned yesterday's events in front of the two brothers. He had kept quiet before because Isabella had asked him to, but now that Isabella and Michael had divorced, he had to speak up.

He didn't want to lose a good granddaughter-in-law like Isabella.

A knock on the office door interrupted his thoughts.

"Come in."

Nolan, in his wheelchair, appeared at the door, followed by his newly promoted assistant, Alex Green.

"Grandpa, I have some work to report."

Nolan took the files from Alex and waved him off, rolling his wheelchair forward alone.

Alex understood Nolan's signal, nodded, and left, closing the door behind him.

Aiden didn't say a word, but his eyes lingered on Alex. With his decades of experience, he could tell Alex was more of a bodyguard than an assistant.

Nolan couldn't read Aiden's thoughts and began his report.

"Grandpa, here are all the contract documents for the Auroria mine. Michael was in charge of these before. I need your guidance on what to do next."

Nolan was being overly deferential, leaving all decisions to Aiden.

But Aiden despised this pretense.

"Didn't we just appoint you as the company's president in the meeting? Why are you bringing everything to me now? Do you expect me to teach you how to do your job?"

Aiden snapped.

Since everyone supported Nolan, Aiden had gone along with it. But instead of solving problems, Nolan was pushing them back to Aiden.

"But these were Michael's responsibilities. I just don't want to..."

Aiden cut him off, "Don't want what? You've got the position now, so you should handle these issues. Or do you plan to use them against Michael?"

Nolan's eyes widened in shock.

"Grandpa, I wouldn't."

Aiden scoffed, "Wouldn't you? Nolan, I'm old, but I'm not senile. Don't think I can't see through your little schemes."

The biggest flaw in the Auroria project had been found, and Michael had been punished accordingly. Now he was gone. There was no need to bring these minor issues to Nolan.

Nolan was too eager, trying to block Michael's path completely before securing his own position.

He was too ruthless.

Nolan stared at Aiden in disbelief. How had Aiden seen through his seemingly foolproof plan? What did Aiden know?

He could only stay silent to protect himself, pondering where he had gone wrong.

After a moment, Aiden sighed deeply from the sofa.

"I know you've held a grudge against me for years, and I know how reluctant and resentful you were when you left the company. Now that you're back in this position, consider it my way of making it up to you."

"Michael's mistake means he can't return to the company. The board is extremely disappointed in him, and I'm getting old. I won't be around to manage things for much longer. So, I hope you can let go of your hatred and the past, and manage the company well. Can you do that?"

Aiden's heartfelt words gave Nolan a glimmer of hope.

Indeed, in Aiden's eyes, the family business was paramount. As for who was the heir, he didn't care.

Michael was finished. Soon, Brown Enterprises would be Nolan's alone.

Nolan wondered what Aiden's reaction would be if he knew Nolan had conspired with the Adri family to frame Michael. He couldn't wait to see Aiden's face when that day came.

"Don't worry, Grandpa. I'll manage the company well and live up to your expectations."

Nolan spoke earnestly.

Aiden nodded and left the company, not wanting to stay any longer.

He hadn't planned to hand the company to Nolan, but Michael and Isabella's divorce had pushed him over the edge.

Michael knew his own feelings but foolishly agreed to the divorce. He would regret it later.

Nolan had been restless lately, using various means to get into the company. If Aiden didn't find a way to resolve this, he feared Michael and Nolan would end up in a bitter conflict.

Better to defuse the situation now than wait for a crisis.

And he genuinely liked Isabella as a granddaughter-in-law. If this could make Michael realize Isabella's worth and win her back, Aiden's efforts wouldn't be in vain.

As for Nolan, Aiden felt guilty for forcing him out of the company years ago. Letting him manage the company for a while was a way to make amends.

Aiden would find a chance to explain the truth to Nolan later. Nolan would understand.

With his worries eased, Aiden felt a weight lift from his shoulders.

He had settled things at the company. Now he just needed good news from Michael.

At the same time, at the Wilson estate, Isabella received a call from Shadow. As soon as she answered, she heard shocking news.

"Isabella, latest update: Brown Enterprises held a board meeting today. Michael was unanimously voted out and removed as president. He's no longer with the company."

She was stunned.

All she could hear was that Michael had been kicked out of the company.

###chapter 454 Being Used

"How could this happen?"

Michael had been busting his butt for the company for years, never taking a break. Aiden always trusted him completely. So why the heck would Aiden suddenly kick him out?

What the heck went down?

If anyone else had told her, Isabella might've doubted it. But this came straight from Shadow. It had to be legit.

And if it wasn't 100% true, Shadow wouldn't have called her just to spill the beans.

"Shadow, do you know why this happened?"

Isabella knew Shadow probably wouldn't spill the whole story, but she had no other way to dig into it right now.

She was freaking out.

Michael was still recovering from injuries he got because of her, and now this huge mess at the company. Where could he be now?

Shadow sighed on the other end of the line but didn't say much more.

"Isabella, that's all I can tell you. For anything else, I'm really sorry."

Isabella felt crushed.

Michael had lost his CEO position and got booted from the company. Even though he still had the whole Brown Family backing him, losing his power was like losing his purpose.

For someone as proud as Michael, getting knocked off his high horse and stomped on by everyone was worse than death.

Isabella had lived with him for three years and knew better than anyone how proud he was.

Being the heir to the Brown Group wasn't just a power trip for him; it was the result of all his hard work over the years. And now it was gone, just like that.

How could he possibly accept this?

"By the way, Isabella, aren't you curious about who's taking over the company now that Michael's out?"

Isabella was caught off guard.

She had been so worried about Michael that she hadn't even thought about that.

Aiden was over eighty and couldn't possibly come back to run the company.

There was only one other person in the Brown Family who could take the reins.

"Nolan?"

"Exactly!"

Shadow snapped his fingers on the other end of the line and dropped another bombshell.

"Isabella, Nolan's no ordinary guy. And he's not just after the Brown Group; he's after you too."

"Me?"

Isabella frowned, not getting what Shadow was hinting at.

"Yep. Nolan's a master manipulator. Just as the Brown Group's scandal broke, news about you two popped up. Who knows if Michael will pass out from rage when he sees it."

"But for now, you should check the news online. The public's been going nuts from the start, and it's getting out of hand. Brace yourself for what you might see."

Isabella listened to Shadow's cryptic words, then hung up and immediately checked the latest news.

The top headline was about her and Nolan's forbidden romance, with nearly ten million shares. The comment section was a total mess.

[These rich families are so messed up. She was married to Michael from the Brown Family for three years, and right after the divorce, she's with his older brother Nolan. Disgraceful.]

[No wonder she suddenly wanted a divorce. She was tired of Michael and turned to seduce his brother Nolan.]

[She's shameless, and she comes from a prestigious family too.]

[Isabella must be after the Brown Group's fortune. She ruined Michael and now she's after his brother Nolan. Or maybe she just likes this kind of thing.]

Isabella couldn't read any more. Just these few comments made her so angry she almost threw her phone.

What was all this nonsense?

When had she ever had any relationship with Nolan? She didn't even know herself!

Scrolling back up, Isabella opened the photos. Recognizing the location and environment, she remembered it was from a few days ago when she was at a café with Nolan.

That was the day Nolan suddenly confessed to her and impulsively grabbed her hand.

She had been so shocked she couldn't think straight, and her expression was one of pure surprise.

But the photographer's angle and timing made her shock look like immense joy, and Nolan's deep gaze was clearly directed at her.

The person who took the photo had deliberately used it to drag her into a media storm.

Isabella scrutinized the angle. The photographer had been in the same area, secretly taking pictures from their right side.

If it had been a paparazzo, the café wouldn't have allowed it. And Nolan wouldn't have let such photos leak.

The only possibility was that Nolan had arranged it himself.

Only under his orders would someone dare to take such blatant photos in his presence.

Thinking back, she felt foolish.

She had been so concerned about his pride and face, afraid that rejecting him publicly would embarrass him.

It turned out it was all part of his plan.

Today, just as Michael was kicked out of the company, Nolan released these photos. He wasn't hiding his intentions at all.

His goal was to completely crush Michael.

Losing the company, his heir status, and his woman all in one night would devastate anyone, especially Michael.

Isabella's eyes reddened with anger. She had always treated Nolan like a brother, even if they weren't related by blood. She considered him her best male friend.

But he had used her as a tool to attack Michael.

Furious, Isabella found Nolan's number and called him directly.

She needed to ask him why he was using her like this!

When Nolan answered, he was both happy and surprised.

He had been waiting for her to reach out, but he hadn't expected her to see the news so quickly.

"Isabella."

"Nolan, what's with the headlines? What's with the photos? You better give me an explanation! Or I won't hesitate to get a lawyer involved."

Isabella's voice was full of anger and accusation.

If it had been anyone else, she might not have been so furious.

But it was Nolan.

She had always thought he understood her best, that they could talk about anything. Now he had manipulated her and used her to hurt Michael.

How could she tolerate that?

"Isabella, calm down. Just listen to me, okay?"

Compared to Isabella's rage, Nolan was surprisingly calm, as if everything was under his control.

###chapter 455  All for You

"Alright, go ahead. Let's hear what other excuses you got."

Isabella took a deep breath.

Nolan just smiled, his tone still as indulgent as ever. "Isabella, wait up. I haven't told you the good news yet. Today, I got back everything that belongs to me. I'm now the CEO of the Brown Group."

"Remember what I told you? I like you, so for you, I'm gonna be the best I can be. Whether it's my health or my status, I gotta be worthy of you."

Nolan was lost in his own emotions, eagerly anticipating Isabella's reaction to his words.

He had waited three long years for this day.

Every day abroad, he yearned to return to the Brown Group and reclaim everything that was his.

And, of course, his beloved Isabella.

Once, Isabella had chosen Michael over him.

That was a wound he could never erase.

Both grandsons of the Brown Family, they even looked about seventy to eighty percent alike. From a distance, it was hard to tell who was the older brother and who was the younger.

He had fallen for Isabella first. Back then, Michael didn't even like Isabella; he was into Bianca.

But why did Isabella choose Michael over him?

He didn't understand.

Why did Michael always outshine him? He hated Michael's very existence.

If it weren't for Michael, everything in the Brown Family would have been his.

So, no matter the cost or the means, he had to return to the Brown Family.

On the other end of the line, Isabella was stunned.

She opened her mouth, incredulous. "Nolan, do you even know what you're saying? Are you out of your mind?"

Was this still the Nolan she knew?

"Isabella, I'm not crazy. I'm very clear-headed. You have no idea how much I love you, how much I long to have you. I've worked so hard all these years just to stand by your side. Now, I've finally made it."

"Aren't you happy for me?"

Isabella didn't know what to say anymore.

Nolan had lost it, or rather, his mind had been twisted by hatred.

She blamed herself for not noticing his abnormal behavior sooner.

She closed her eyes and took a deep breath. "Nolan, if you were the one being framed and slandered in the news today, would you be happy?"

"And those photos, you had someone take them, didn't you?"

"Michael has already been forced out of the company by you, but that wasn't enough for you. So, you used me to push him further, hoping he'd lose all his fight and never compete with you for the Brown Group's inheritance again. Am I right?"

There was a long silence on Nolan's end.

Isabella was deeply disappointed.

There was no need for Nolan to explain. His earlier words had already revealed how determined he was about today's events.

The truth was right in front of her, and Isabella felt a heavy weight on her chest.

"Nolan, why have you become like this? Why?"

Isabella was on the verge of tears.

Thinking about the Nolan who used to comfort her over the phone and thoughtfully prepared birthday gifts for her every year, Isabella felt a pang of sadness and pain.

She didn't want Nolan to become like this. He was the person she trusted the most.

But why did he have to turn against her, use her, and hurt her in the name of love?

She couldn't accept it.

"Isabella, I love you. I've only ever loved you. Please believe me. I will bring you happiness."

Hearing Isabella's sobs, Nolan panicked.

But this time, Isabella wouldn't believe him anymore.

She didn't give Nolan a chance to explain further and said directly, "No, you don't love me. You love the version of yourself that you haven't achieved. You love yourself."

"Isabella, how can you misunderstand me like this? My love for you is real."

Being denied by the person he loved was devastating for someone like Nolan.

"All these years, I've never been with anyone else. Even when I was abroad, my heart was always with you. Do you know how I survived those three years alone in a foreign country?"

"If it weren't for your photos and calls, I wouldn't have made it this far."

"It was you who gave me the courage to live. How can you doubt my love for you?"

Isabella didn't want to hear any more declarations of love. She calmly rejected him.

"But I don't love you!"

Nolan was momentarily stunned.

He had underestimated the chaos a young woman could cause. She managed to miss the most crucial part of a contract review and even lost the pricing sheet.

It almost led to the other company terminating their contract. If he hadn't personally gone to apologize, it would have been a disaster.

He was clearly the biggest victim here, so how did it turn into him having something with his assistant?

He had no interest in that girl at all.

All he had left was a headache.

But he wasn't going to let Kian's words slide. If Kian thought he had no dirt on him, he was in for a surprise.

Thomas narrowed his eyes, turned to Kian, and smirked.

"Kian, you can't just accuse me without evidence. As the CEO, I have to set an example and properly guide my assistant. It's all work-related, so how did it become something else? But there's something I'm curious about. Can I ask for your opinion?"

"Go ahead!"

Kian showed no fear.

"Kian, what do you think about a man in his thirties who doesn't get married or date, but keeps visiting his neighbor's house to secretly meet and chat with their daughter? Isn't that a bit inappropriate?"

Kian secretly meeting the neighbor's daughter?

Isabella's interest was piqued.

No wonder Kian had never been linked to anyone romantically, despite being the first to settle abroad.

So he had someone in mind all along?
