"Unfortunately, Nolan is too cunning. Even if we know it's him, we can't use this video as evidence against him."

Aaron gritted his teeth. Nolan had planned everything meticulously, leaving no loopholes.

Michael remained silent for a long time after learning the truth.

If everything Aaron said was true, it meant Nolan had been planning this since he returned, no, since he left three years ago.

His ambition and purpose had never disappeared, only hidden behind a false facade.

No wonder Nolan had been so calm and dismissive when Michael visited him that morning.

He had anticipated all of this.

He would never let anyone else have the Brown Group.

Michael took a deep breath, struggling to calm his inner turmoil.

He never imagined Nolan would hold such a grudge over past events, to the point of making the Brown Group his obsession.

If he couldn't have it, he would destroy the person who did.

That was Nolan, a man who harbored a deep-seated hatred for Michael while pretending to be a good brother for years.

Michael let out a cold laugh, his eyes now clear of any doubt.

"I have the evidence."

Michael took a portable USB drive from his pocket and inserted it into Aaron's laptop.

The surveillance footage showed the inside of Michael's office.

Aaron was shocked, looking at Michael in disbelief. "Michael, what's going on? You installed surveillance in your own office?"

###chapter 480 I Have Evidence

Michael nodded, "I almost forgot about the cameras I set up earlier. Who knew they'd come in so handy?"

Luckily, he had hidden the cameras well.

Otherwise, with Nolan's cunning, they wouldn't have lasted this long.

Now, he was sure the guy in the surveillance footage was the one who took the documents, putting him in a tough spot. But whether this person was actually Nolan, Michael couldn't be 100% sure.

"Aaron, you're so sure the guy in the footage is Nolan. Got any proof?"

Nolan had kept a low profile for years, all to get back at the Brown family for kicking him out.

Without solid evidence, he would never admit to anything.

On the contrary, it might even tip him off.

"I do have proof."

Aaron enlarged the video on the computer screen. "Mr. Brown, check out the watch on this guy's wrist. Doesn't it look familiar?"

Michael took a closer look. The watch on the guy's wrist did look familiar.

It was the birthday gift Isabella had given Nolan.

But Michael quickly dismissed this thought.

The watch in the footage was worn and old, not the new one Isabella had given recently. It looked like it had been worn for years.

Nolan was sentimental. He wouldn't throw away something he liked, even if it was old.

Michael had never seen Nolan wear any other watch.

And he had seen this particular watch before.

It was the one Isabella had given Nolan a long time ago.

As for the new watch Isabella had given recently, Nolan had said he would keep it safe.

Both watches were from the same series.

Suddenly, a scene flashed in Michael's mind.

The lakeside villa, where Bianca had tried to drug him. There was a similar watch in the glass cabinet in the second-floor bedroom.

He had found it familiar but couldn't remember where he had seen it before.

Now everything seemed to make sense.

The watch in the villa was the same one Nolan was wearing.

So, the villa wasn't Bianca's; it was Nolan's.

At the time, he was focused on uncovering Bianca's hidden identity and the Adri family's intentions, so he agreed to go to the lakeside villa.

But no one expected his grandfather and Isabella to show up suddenly and see him with Bianca.

He didn't even have time to explain before Isabella deeply misunderstood him.

After that misunderstanding, his relationship with Isabella was never the same.

Michael connected all the dots, and the evidence became clear.

When Bianca returned to the country with Nolan under the alias Violet, Michael had found it strange.

Now, thinking back, they might have joined the Adri family long ago, but with different motives.

Bianca returned for revenge, while Nolan wanted control of the Brown Group.

They had teamed up to serve the Adri family.

Ultimately, the real beneficiary was the mastermind behind it all.

The Adri family had indeed played a long game.

They had targeted everyone close to him from the start.

One Bianca wasn't enough; there was also Nolan, who could replace Michael.

By teaming up with Nolan, the Adri family was hell-bent on taking down the Brown Group.

But Michael wasn't about to let that happen.

He wouldn't let the Adri family take over the Brown Group or the Wilson family.

"Mr. Brown?"

Aaron noticed Michael's face darken as he stared at the screen and called out softly.

"Now that we have the evidence, what's our next move?"

Aaron had his own ideas.

He thought they should take the surveillance footage straight to the company and confront Nolan, forcing him to step down as CEO.

If Nolan refused, they could hand the evidence over to the police.

With the police involved, Nolan's reputation would be ruined.

The board of the Brown Group wouldn't support someone with a tarnished reputation as CEO, and Nolan wouldn't be able to stay in the company.

But Michael had a different plan.

He was thinking beyond the immediate situation.

"We're not in a rush. We can deal with Nolan anytime, but the people behind him haven't surfaced yet."

If they used the surveillance footage to oust Nolan now, it would be the simplest and most effective method.

But it would also alert the Adri family.

As long as the Adri family was around, they posed a significant threat to the Brown Group and the Wilson family.

Michael couldn't rest easy until this ticking time bomb was defused.

He needed to see this mysterious family lose their ability to harm the Brown Group and the Wilson family before he could relax.

With this in mind, he took a deep breath, his eyes filled with determination.

"Aaron, this time we're playing for keeps. The one who holds out the longest wins."

Michael rolled his shoulders, his commanding presence returned-the one everyone knew and feared.

These people thought they could scheme against him? They clearly had a death wish.

Aaron couldn't help but grin at the transformation.

This was the Michael he knew-the one who never backed down from a fight and showed everyone what it meant to be truly formidable.

Thinking about the battles ahead, Aaron felt adrenaline coursing through his veins.

He couldn't wait to see those people get their comeuppance from Michael.

"Mr. Brown, why do you think Nolan, after all this careful planning, is now rushing to return to the company?"

They had the evidence of Nolan's sabotage.

Nolan should be the one worried now, not them.

After all, the evidence proved that the project contract was forged by Nolan, not signed by Michael.

If Nolan couldn't reach an agreement with the government in Auroria or prove the contract invalid, he'd have to deal with the mess himself. He'd have to fulfill the contract terms or face a billion-dollar penalty.

From what Michael had learned in Auroria, the local government officials were all greedy. They wouldn't let go of such a lucrative opportunity easily.

Now, it was Nolan's turn to be in a tough spot.

Michael sneered at Aaron's question.

"He's not rushing; he's seizing the moment. He endured three years abroad. Do you think he's the type to act hastily? The project in Auroria required billions in startup funds. He chose this timing on purpose."

###chapter 481 Put Yourself Out

Aaron still didn't quite get it. "If I were Nolan, I wouldn't pick this moment. After all that planning, if I got caught now, it'd be game over, right?"

Michael gave a resigned smile. "We found the evidence now, but what if we hadn't? Plus, the Adri Family backing Nolan has been waiting for him to ask for help."

Only then would Nolan willingly give up his interests.

Neither of them was a simple person.

Since being kicked out of the company, Nolan had been sending people to follow Michael's every move.

Michael had no choice but to pretend to spend every night in different clubs, wasting money on drinks and parties, then kicking everyone out halfway through to find a room to sleep in.

He was incredibly bored.

Now that someone who could help him was back, he no longer had to live that fake party life.

As Michael's executive assistant for nearly four years, Aaron didn't need to think much to know that Michael was bored out of his mind.

Even the doctors said it was a miracle he survived the shipwreck, and he needed to rest properly to ensure his wounds healed.

Renee had given him strict orders: as long as she was watching, he wasn't leaving the hospital.

He wouldn't be discharged anytime soon.

But just because he couldn't leave the hospital didn't mean Michael couldn't visit him.

Aaron suddenly had a brilliant idea.

"Mr. Brown, have you thought about a 'chance' encounter with Mrs. Brown?"

Since Michael didn't need to go to the company now, he could take this opportunity to reconnect with Isabella. Who knew? It might lead to something good.

"Are you saying Isabella might come here?"

Aaron was about to say yes, but remembering Isabella's specific instructions, he changed his approach.

"I'm not sure if Mrs. Brown will come again, but Renee is staying with Mrs. Brown. They often go out together."

Come again?

So, Isabella had already been here.

No wonder Aaron had found evidence against Nolan so quickly, including the watch Nolan wore.

After all, no one knew that watch better than Isabella.

"Mr. Brown, why don't you join me in seeking refuge under Mrs. Brown's wing?"

Aaron didn't mind.

He was staying in this private hospital's VIP room thanks to Renee.

So, he had no hesitation in seeking Isabella's help.

In his heart, Michael and Isabella would end up together no matter what.

Aaron's last sentence successfully tempted Michael.

If he could see Isabella every day without being exposed to others, it was a huge temptation.

"Do you think she would agree?"

Michael's eyes wavered.

Aaron held back a smile and nodded vigorously.

Isabella's fame and status were well-known, and she had no shortage of potential suitors.

And Michael, to put it bluntly, was currently unemployed. If he didn't take a chance, his wife would be taken right from under his nose.

By then, it would be too late for regrets.

Michael nodded, thinking quietly, as if he had taken Aaron's words to heart.

Finally, he made a decision. "I get it. I'll give it a shot."

Just as he finished speaking, a voice from outside suddenly objected, "Absolutely not!"

Renee, who had been waiting outside, couldn't hold back her anger any longer after hearing Aaron's bad idea. She burst in.

"Aaron, what nonsense are you spouting? Have you forgotten that we owe our lives to Ms. Taylor? Even this hospital room was arranged by her. How could you repay kindness with betrayal?"

Aaron was startled and quickly grabbed Renee's hand to explain.

"Renee, don't be mad. That's not what I meant."

Renee huffed and shook him off, full of anger. "Then what do you mean? Mr. Brown is the son of the Brown Family. Even without the CEO position, he has a huge family backing him. How could he have nowhere to go and need your help to seek refuge with Ms. Taylor? How could you come up with such a scheme?"

Her last words were practically spat out through gritted teeth.

She had clearly misjudged Aaron. She didn't expect him to have such bad intentions, being sincere to her but scheming against others.

Aaron lowered his head in embarrassment, his face turning red.

He hadn't expected Renee to be right outside, listening to their conversation.

And he had an agreement with Isabella, so he couldn't tell Michael or reveal it in front of Renee.

He had to play dumb in front of both of them.

As long as he achieved his goal, that was enough.

"Why don't we call Mrs. Brown and ask her opinion?"

After all, knowing what Michael had done to Isabella, Renee had no good impression of him.

They still wanted to use her name to get close to Isabella? Dream on!

"Don't even think about it. I won't agree to let Isabella see someone she doesn't want to see!"

That "someone" was, of course, Michael.

Renee, already having no good feelings towards Michael, now saw his true colors and her voice turned cold.

"Isabella saved my life. I won't let anyone she can't stand show up around her, especially not through me."

Renee had never been known for her patience. She only showed her true personality with Aaron and Isabella.

But once her hostility surfaced, the temperature in the room seemed to drop.

###chapter 482 Crisis Arises Again

One was his girlfriend, the other was his boss.

Aaron was breaking out in a cold sweat.

Renee couldn't stand Aaron's incessant chatter any longer. She shot him a cold glare, and he immediately clamped his mouth shut, not daring to make another sound.

Being this thoroughly under his girlfriend's thumb was impressive.

She didn't care that Michael was the heir to the Brown Family.

"Isabella, you heard it all. Michael is a schemer. He's the young master of the Brown Family. Even if he's kicked out of the company, he won't be homeless. Don't let your guard down and forgive him. And definitely don't bring him back to the Wilson Villa. Got it?"

If he managed to worm his way into the Wilson Family, he'd turn the place upside down.

Not to mention, the five Wilson brothers wouldn't let him off easily.
