She wasn't crazy. Who would bring an ex-husband home?

Especially someone like Michael, whom she wanted to avoid at all costs.

"But I really want to see Michael's face right now. It must be priceless!"

Renee's scolding was so satisfying, and Michael didn't dare say a word in return.

She couldn't do that.

They had parted ways amicably, and their families still had business dealings. It wouldn't be good to make things too ugly.

She was glad she stayed today; otherwise, she would have missed this entertaining scene.

Meanwhile, in Aaron's ward, a sudden exclamation broke the silence.

"Mr. Brown, something terrible has happened at the company!"

Michael was still thinking about how to convince Isabella to let him stay at the Wilson Villa to ease their awkward relationship.

Aaron's shout snapped him back to reality.

"What happened?"

Without wasting time, Aaron handed his phone to Michael, showing him the news.

The latest report was playing.

"Just now, Leanne Corporation released a statement online, using the company's reputation to publicly accuse the Brown Group's medical products of serious quality issues. They said they signed the contract and took a huge loss to warn others not to be deceived by the false advertising of big corporations and not to risk people's health and lives."

Hearing this, Michael couldn't take it anymore and paused the interview on the computer.

The timing of this news was too coincidental.

It was clearly premeditated.

Michael didn't need to think hard to guess who was behind it.

The Adri Family was clearly pushing their advantage, striking as soon as the Brown Group showed weakness.

Michael didn't have time to ponder. He immediately called Nolan.

As soon as the call connected, he started yelling.

"Nolan, how are you planning to handle the news from Leanne Corporation? Don't forget, Grandpa entrusted the company to you. If you ruin its reputation in a few days, how will you explain it to him?"

Michael did this on purpose.

He had signed the contract with Leanne Corporation, so he knew there were no issues. But since the Adri Family was causing trouble, he needed to solidify his image as the former president.

With the company in trouble, he had the right to question Nolan, the current president.

On the other end, Nolan's voice remained calm and composed. "How I explain it to Grandpa is none of your concern. My goal has been achieved. The company's fate doesn't matter to me."

His calm words left Michael almost speechless with shock.

"Nolan, do you know what you're saying? What do you mean the company's fate doesn't matter to you? Why did you fight so hard to take over the company then?"

Michael was incredulous.

But the next second, Nolan's voice turned cold and mocking.

"I fought for the heir's position to erase the shame of three years ago. Michael, to be honest, ever since Grandpa kicked me out of the Brown Group three years ago, I stopped caring about this family, including the Brown Group. So, even if the Brown Group collapses, I couldn't care less."

With that, Nolan hung up, not giving Michael a chance to respond.

Meanwhile, in his office, Nolan tossed his phone aside and turned his serious gaze to his assistant, Alex.

"What's going on with Leanne Corporation? How did such a big scandal suddenly come up?"

He had just taken over the company, and so many problems had already arisen.

Even his brother wanted to mock him at this time. Did they really think his years of hard work were for nothing?

Even if he didn't care much about the company, he wouldn't let anyone laugh at him.

Especially not Michael!

###chapter 483 Just a Pawn

Alex quickly explained, "Leanne Corporation signed a contract with us for a batch of medical equipment two months ago. They even lowered their requirements to secure a long-term deal. I didn't see this coming."

Nolan frowned, "Did you get in touch with them right away?"

Alex nodded. "Yeah, we reached out. They agreed to take back the equipment for repairs or replacements, but they're blaming us. They want to cancel the contract and are demanding triple the penalty fee, or they'll sue us."

Nolan zeroed in on the key point. "How much is the penalty fee?"

"Twenty million dollars. If they sue, triple that would be sixty million dollars."

Alex's face paled a bit. "Mr. Brown, we recently invested most of our cash flow into the Auroria mining project. If we have to pay Leanne Corporation sixty million dollars now, our financial chain will snap."

A big corporation facing financial trouble would attract a lot of unwanted attention.

Alex knew this was serious. Settling with Leanne Corporation privately would be better than losing their reputation.

But Nolan stayed calm. He knew this was a trap set by the Adri Family. Leanne Corporation might even be controlled by them. Their goal was to take over the Brown Group and enter the domestic market.

The timing was too perfect. Just as he was having issues with Auroria, the Brown Group faced a credibility crisis, clearly targeting him.

The Adri Family had discovered his ambitions and were now turning against him. They had agreed that he would help them approach the Brown Group, and they would help him take it over, splitting the benefits equally. But now, he didn't want to hand over the company he had worked so hard to acquire.

In just two days, the Adri Family had given him such a big "gift."

Nolan couldn't help but be angry. He motioned for Alex to leave and dialed a number from his wheelchair.

The person on the other end answered quickly, with a cold laugh, as if expecting Nolan's call. "Couldn't wait, could you?"

Nolan gripped the wheelchair armrest tightly. "Did you set up the Leanne Corporation issue?"

Even though he knew the truth, Nolan underestimated this person's strength.

"You broke your promise, so don't expect any mercy from me now. Remember, I'm the one who set the rules of this game. Nolan, you're just a pawn in my hands. Now that your task is complete, I'm taking back my victory."

Pawn? Nolan's eyes flashed with anger. "So, the fifty-fifty profit share you promised was all bullshit. You just used my Brown Family connections to achieve your goal!"

The person scoffed. "Like you weren't playing your own angle from the start? Come on, Nolan, I know exactly what you're after. You want to swallow up the entire Brown Group for yourself. That greed of yours? That's your weakness. Let's see who comes out on top when this is all over."

The call ended with the person's triumphant laugh.

Nolan angrily slammed his phone on the table. The Adri Family were nothing but thieves. He wouldn't give up everything he had worked so hard to gain.

Nolan watched the escalating news on his phone and called Alex back in.

"Get everyone together. We're having an emergency meeting tomorrow morning. All executives need to be at the office an hour early with at least two proposals on how to make Leanne Corporation back down."

Alex didn't waste a second and quickly left to carry out the orders.

Late at night, Nolan sat in his office, determined to fight the Adri Family. The Brown Group was his, and no one would take it from him.

The next day.

At the Brown Villa.

Aiden sat in his room, gazing at a gemstone pendant nestled in a velvet box. Sunlight streamed through the window, making the stone sparkle brilliantly.

As he looked at the gem, his eyes reddened. The pendant reminded him of Isabella's determined expression when she gave it to him. She was such a good granddaughter-in-law, and now she was gone.

His heart ached at the thought.

The gem had been his wife's treasure, a family heirloom she'd brought into their marriage. He carefully took it out and sighed. "My dear, it's my fault. We were so close to having a great-grandchild, but fate had other plans. And Isabella-such a lovely girl who treated me like her own grandfather-my grandson threw it all away. Michael drove her off with his behavior. I regret it so much. If I had known Michael was so irresponsible, I wouldn't have let Isabella marry him. He doesn't deserve her!"

Tears streamed down Aiden's face. He truly regretted it.

His friends had all passed away, and his two grandsons were at odds over the inheritance, tearing the family apart.

He even questioned his past decisions. If he hadn't agreed to that person's promise, would the Brown Family be different now?

But there were no "ifs" in life, and no room for regret. He had to bear it all.

When Stella came to call him for breakfast, she saw him holding the pendant and wiping his tears. She shook her head.

Crossing the room, she placed a hand on his shoulder. "Dad, why torture yourself like this? You're at an age where you shouldn't be getting tangled up in the younger generation's drama. Even if you tried to step in, they wouldn't listen anyway."

Stella had just learned that her son and Isabella had finalized their divorce. A mixture of regret and guilt washed over her whenever she thought about Isabella.

She had failed as a mother-in-law. How could she have been so blind to Isabella's true worth, instead falling for Bianca's manipulative charm?

###chapter 484 Aiden Faints

The reality was staring them in the face, and all they could do was look ahead.

Given the Wilson family's current stance towards the Browns, there was no way they were sending Isabella back.

No one would willingly watch their precious daughter suffer with a man who didn't appreciate her.

Part of it was her son's fault. He was clearly crazy about Isabella, but it was like his mouth was super-glued shut when it came to saying anything sweet or romantic.

Well, now he was paying the price. She had had enough and slapped him with divorce papers.

There was no way he could win her back now.

Aiden sighed at the thought, not wanting to dwell on it any longer.

He carefully placed the gemstone pendant back in its box and turned to Stella.

"I get it. Let's just drop it for now."

Stella nodded. "That's probably best. You need to take care of yourself at your age. Come on, breakfast is ready in the kitchen."

During breakfast, Aiden habitually turned on the TV, watching the news while sipping his porridge.

He had barely taken a few bites when he saw the familiar name "Brown Group" flash across the screen.

The news was about Leanne Corporation suing Brown Group over quality issues, and the internet was flooded with negative opinions.

Even Stella, who usually didn't care about such things, was drawn in.

After all, it concerned the Brown Group. She watched for a while to understand what was happening, and then she was furious.

"What is Nolan doing? He just got back and insisted on taking over the company. Now look, he's the president, and in just a few days, he's caused such a huge mess. He's plunged the company into both financial and reputational crises. Can he really handle this responsibility? Or is he just pretending to be capable and dragging the company into bankruptcy?"

Before Stella could finish her rant, there was a loud "bang" from the head of the table.

Aiden, who had been calmly drinking his porridge, had collapsed from his chair in a fit of rage.

Stella turned around, her face pale with fear.

"Dad, are you okay? Please don't scare me. Someone call an ambulance!"

At the hospital.

As soon as Aiden was wheeled into the emergency room, Michael came running in from outside.

Seeing the closed doors of the operating room, he frowned and asked Stella, "Mom, what happened? How did Grandpa suddenly collapse?"

Stella, seeing her son who hadn't been home in days, slapped him on the back of the head in anger.

"You heartless boy, are you planning to abandon your mother and grandfather? Do you even realize how long it's been since you came home? When you were in charge of the company, you said you were too busy to be disturbed. But now, the company is in someone else's hands, and you've disappeared completely, spending your nights in bars. Are you trying to drive me crazy?"

Stella scolded and cried at the same time.

She knew better than anyone how much her son was suffering after losing the company.

But that didn't mean he could give up on himself and stop coming home.

Michael didn't argue back. He just stood there, silently taking his mother's scolding.

It wasn't that he didn't want to come home.

He just couldn't stand hearing his grandfather talk about Isabella again.

To his grandfather, Isabella was the perfect granddaughter-in-law, the only one he approved of for the Brown family.

Michael felt the same way.

But he couldn't guarantee he could win Isabella back.

He couldn't bear to face his grandfather's disappointment and regret.

He felt that pain too.

So, he thought it was better to stay away, to avoid bringing that sadness home to his grandfather. At least this way, his grandfather wouldn't be hurt by his actions.

Seeing Michael silently endure her scolding, Stella wiped her tears. There were things she had to say, or she would regret it forever.

"Michael, I know you're reserved and have your own way of doing things, but you don't know how much your grandfather loves you. If he wasn't afraid of you losing Isabella, he wouldn't have handed the company over to Nolan so easily. And today, your grandfather collapsed because he saw the negative news about the company and got too worked up."

Stella's words hit Michael like a bomb.

He couldn't believe it.

His grandfather had handed the company to Nolan for his sake, to give him a chance to win Isabella back.

How could this be?

He had thought his grandfather was completely disappointed in him and didn't want to see him anymore, which was why he chose Nolan.

Seeing Michael's shocked expression, Stella was both angry and helpless.

"Aren't you supposed to be smart? How could you not see this? If you had cherished your wife even a little, you wouldn't be in this mess now. The wife you drove away isn't easy to win back. Nolan seemed capable, but as soon as he took over, he caused such a big mess. It's ridiculous!"

Stella continued to talk, while Michael was lost in his own thoughts.

Understanding his grandfather's intentions, he finally realized why his grandfather had suddenly changed his mind and handed the company to Nolan.

Years ago, his grandfather had promised someone that Nolan would never take over the company or become the heir to the Brown Group.

So, his grandfather had no choice but to hand the company to Michael at that time.

But Nolan's departure and three-year absence had left his grandfather feeling deeply guilty.

Now that Nolan was back, filled with resentment and ambition, and Michael's relationship with Isabella had hit rock bottom, his grandfather wanted to make amends with Nolan and give Michael a chance to reconcile with Isabella.

So, his grandfather had come up with this plan, playing the bad guy himself.

Michael almost misunderstood his grandfather.

He couldn't help but feel moved.

His grandfather had never blamed him for his mistakes. Instead, seeing his pain over the divorce, he had given him another chance to win Isabella back.

Michael took a deep breath and looked at the red light of the operating room.

The guilt he felt towards his grandfather was overwhelming.

He just hoped his grandfather would pull through. He wouldn't hide anything from him anymore.

###chapter 485 Isabella Came

Time dragged on as Michael sat on a nearby bench, anxiously waiting.

He couldn't stop worrying about his grandfather's condition.

"Mom, how much does Grandpa know about what happened at the company?"

If Grandpa found out that Nolan had been scheming with the Adri Family from the start, trying to split up the Brown Group's shares as revenge for old grudges, it might be too much for him to handle.

Stella, not knowing the details, could only respond honestly, "Your grandpa saw the news this morning, and that's when it happened. I don't know anything else. Son, you don't know, ever since Isabella returned that gemstone pendant to your grandpa, he's been sitting alone with it every day, sometimes even tearing up, saying he failed to keep such a good granddaughter-in-law. I wanted to comfort him, but then the company had this issue, and he couldn't take the blow and fainted."

Thinking about the chaos at home and the company, and her son being kicked out, Stella was at a loss and could only cry.

While Stella spoke, Michael's attention was caught by the mention of the returned gemstone pendant.

So, Isabella had already given back the gift he gave her to Grandpa.

That pendant was a birthday gift from him, the only thing he had given her with genuine feelings, yet she didn't even want to keep it.

Maybe in her heart, she had long wanted to cut ties with him completely.

He had been foolishly dreaming, thinking they still had a future.

It was all just his wishful thinking.

Stella cried for a while before realizing something important. She wiped her tears and asked, "Michael, why are you here alone? Where's Nolan? Doesn't he care at all about your grandpa's condition?"

Michael didn't want to hear anything about Nolan right now.

He frowned, "Mom, let's not worry about him. We need to focus on Grandpa."

Before he could finish, the doors of the operating room suddenly opened.

Stella and Michael quickly approached, ready to ask questions, but the doctor's words stopped them in their tracks.

"Are you the patient's family? The patient's condition is very serious. Given his age and the sudden brain hemorrhage, even if the surgery was successful, there's no guarantee it won't happen again. You should be prepared for the worst."

Stella, relieved to hear the surgery was successful, didn't think much of the warning, assuming it was standard doctor talk.

But Michael's heart sank.

The doctor's words were a clear indication that his grandfather's condition was critical. If he recovered well, he might have a few more years, but if not, his time was limited.

Michael thanked the doctor and followed the nurse to Aiden's room.

On the bed, Aiden lay with his eyes half-closed, pale and weak, struggling to breathe through an oxygen mask.

Stella entered, her eyes red, and called out, "Dad!"

Michael moved closer, holding Aiden's hand, his voice hoarse, "Grandpa."

Hearing his grandson's voice, Aiden slowly opened his eyes. Seeing Michael, he gripped his hand tightly, his whole body trembling slightly.

Though Aiden didn't speak, Michael could see the question in his eyes.

Michael nodded and reassured him, "Grandpa, don't worry. The company will be fine. Nolan will find a way to get through this. He has the ability."

Michael wasn't defending Nolan or trying to comfort his grandfather with false hope. He knew that even if Nolan fell out with the Adri Family, his pride and ambition wouldn't let the Brown Group fail under his watch.

This was what Grandpa was worried about.

Michael's words were meant to ease his grandfather's mind about the company.

Sure enough, after hearing Michael's explanation, Aiden's emotions calmed down.

But Aiden's hand still held onto his, and he struggled to utter a sound, "Isa..."

Even though his voice was faint, Michael understood.

His heart ached.

Grandpa was still worried about him and Isabella.

"Grandpa, you want to see Isabella, right?"

That was his wish too.

Aiden could only blink weakly in agreement.

"Okay, I'll bring her here. Don't worry."

Michael quickly agreed.

But as he left the room, he realized he didn't know where to find Isabella.

She had blocked his number, and the Wilson Family had blacklisted him. He couldn't even get close without their security warning him off.

But now, Grandpa wanted to see Isabella. No matter what, he had to find her.

Even if it meant swallowing his pride and begging.

Determined, Michael headed out the door, only to nearly collide with someone rushing toward him as he rounded the corner.

It was Isabella, her eyes red and puffy from crying.

For a moment, Michael's mind went blank.

He didn't know how she found out about Grandpa's condition, but the fact that she'd come was all that mattered.

"Isabella, how did you..."

Before he could finish, Isabella grabbed his arm, "Michael, how's Aiden? What did the doctor say? Did the surgery go well? Is Aiden okay?"

Isabella was genuinely worried. She couldn't care less about their divorce right now.

As soon as she heard about Aiden being hospitalized, she rushed over, her mind filled with memories of her grandfather's passing.

She was truly scared.

Scared that Aiden would leave her like her grandfather did.

She had already lost her grandfather and didn't want to lose another loved one so soon.

Seeing Isabella's distress, Michael knew she was thinking about her grandfather.

He gently pulled her into a hug, patting her back, "The surgery was successful. My mom is with him. Don't worry, the doctor said he just needs to rest."

###chapter 486 Too Scared for a Second Chance

Michael couldn't bring himself to tell Isabella the harsh truth; she needed comfort right now.

He didn't ask her how she knew about Grandpa's accident or how she got here so fast.

Isabella's reaction had already told him everything.

No matter how distant they had become, Isabella still saw Aiden as her grandfather. Their relationship wouldn't change just because of the divorce.

Seeing her tear-streaked face, Michael felt a pang of sorrow and wanted to wipe her tears away.

But halfway through, he stopped himself and pulled his hand back.

He pressed his lips together and softly asked, "Isabella, Grandpa wants to see you. Will you come with me to talk to him?"

Michael might not have realized it, but his voice carried a hint of pleading.

Just moments ago, when he found out Isabella had returned the gemstone pendant he had given her, his heart turned cold.

He understood that his past actions had disappointed Isabella to the point where she chose to let go.

She had discarded everything that belonged to him and severed all ties.

So now, facing her, he didn't dare to show any of his former dominance or arrogance.

He wouldn't force her to do anything she didn't want to do.

He feared that if he remained the same, Isabella would never forgive him.

Isabella was only worried about Aiden's health and didn't notice the cautious look in Michael's eyes.

She wiped her tears and kept a distance from Michael, nodding.

"Okay, where's Grandpa? I want to see him."

Aiden had always treated her like his own granddaughter. How could she refuse his wish?

Isabella followed Michael to Aiden's hospital room, where her former mother-in-law, Stella, was by his side.

Seeing Isabella arrive so quickly, Stella joyfully called out to Aiden.

"Dad, wake up! Isabella is here. Isabella came to see you."

Hearing Isabella's name, Aiden seemed to regain some energy. He took a deep breath, opened his eyes, and looked towards the door.

He saw Isabella and Michael standing together, as if they had never been apart.

Aiden slowly extended his hand and weakly waved, "Isabella."

Isabella's eyes welled up with tears, and she hurried over to hold Aiden's hand, her voice choked with emotion.

"Grandpa, it's Isabella. What happened to you?"

Seeing Aiden, who seemed to have aged significantly since she last saw him, Isabella felt a heavy weight on her chest, making it hard to breathe.

Aiden gripped Isabella's hand, a faint smile appearing on his pale face.

He then pointed to his jacket pocket, indicating to Stella, "The pendant... bring it here..."

Though it was just a few simple words, Aiden seemed to use all his strength. Fortunately, Stella understood and quickly fetched Aiden's coat.

She found a dark red velvet box inside.

It contained the gemstone pendant Isabella had returned.

Just one look at the box, and Isabella knew what was inside and understood why Aiden had called her.

Aiden signaled Stella to open the box, and he personally handed the pendant to Isabella.

"Grandpa."

Isabella's eyes were red, but she knew what the pendant represented. Her hands instinctively pulled back.

But Aiden shook his head and explained each word clearly.

"Isabella, this was left by your grandmother. It was meant to be a gift for my granddaughter-in-law. If you don't accept it, are you blaming me?"

Isabella quickly denied, "No, Grandpa, I don't mean to blame you. But Michael and I are no longer..."

Such a meaningful gift, how could she accept it?

At that moment, Stella stepped forward and placed the pendant in Isabella's hand, speaking earnestly.

"Isabella, this is your grandfather's wish. For his sake, just accept it as a gift."

Stella then glanced at Michael, who stood silently by, and sighed.

"As for you and Michael... your grandfather and I can see what's happening. Michael was blind before-he couldn't see how special you are. Now, it's obvious he's fallen for you. And honestly, you're right not to forgive him too quickly. He hurt you badly, and that's not something a few words can fix."

Stella couldn't help but wipe her tears as she spoke.

She recounted the times she had hurt Isabella, her words filled with guilt and regret.

Isabella remained silent.

Whether it was Michael's belated affection or Stella's late remorse, she felt nothing.

To her, the past was something she had left behind the day she walked out of the Brown Villa.

As for Michael's feelings for her, Isabella wasn't completely unmoved. After all, she had secretly loved him for years. Knowing he liked her too made her happy.

But she was no longer the same Isabella.

She couldn't ignore her own feelings to accommodate him just because of a few words or small changes.

He could have explained everything to her face-to-face, cleared up the misunderstandings.

But he chose to keep it all to himself, even when she caught him in an intimate moment with Bianca. He never thought to explain.

She couldn't accept that.

Whether as a girlfriend or a wife, she had just one non-negotiable: complete honesty. If he couldn't be straightforward with her, she wouldn't even consider him.

Even now, she hadn't felt any respect or importance from him as a wife, nor had she received his understanding and love.

So, she could face him rationally and help him out of their past relationship.

But when it came to feelings, she couldn't accept it now.

After waiting for him for three years, without a single moment of softness from him, she had completely given up.

She didn't dare to hope that Michael's feelings for her would last.

If it was just a fleeting interest, she would be the one hurt in the end.

Knowing what kind of person he was, she didn't want to go through that again.

With that in mind, Isabella looked up at Stella, her tone calm and composed.

"Mrs. Brown, with all due respect, no one understands what's between Michael and me better than we do. I appreciate your concern, but I've made up my mind. And about this pendant, I really..."

Before she could finish, Stella quickly interrupted.

###chapter 487 What About Me

"Isabella, I get what you're saying, but you really need to take this pendant today. Look, no one knows what the future holds. If you and Michael stay together, then this pendant is yours. If not, just think of it as a keepsake from Aiden."

Stella didn't give Isabella a chance to refuse and quickly fastened the pendant around her neck.

Isabella frowned and was about to take it off when Stella's next words stopped her.

"Isabella, you can say no to me, but can you really ignore your grandpa's last wish?"

Isabella couldn't bring herself to meet Aiden's hopeful gaze.

The refusal she was about to voice got swallowed back down.

Seeing Aiden like this, how could she bear to let him down?

She bit her lip and finally agreed to keep the pendant.

"Thanks, Aiden."

As she spoke, Isabella lifted the modest pendant around her neck to show Aiden.

She thought, once her grandpa's health improved, she could return it. For now, she couldn't let him be sad in the hospital.

Seeing Isabella finally accept the pendant that symbolized the future daughter-in-law of the Brown Family, Aiden's eyes lit up.

He squeezed her hand and softly called her name, then looked at Michael, who was standing nearby, hesitant to approach, and called his name too.

"Come here."

Michael didn't dare disobey and stepped forward to the bedside.

Stella, sensing the moment, quickly stepped aside.

Michael knelt beside Isabella, both of them by Aiden's side. "Grandpa, Isabella and I are both here. What do you want to say? We're listening."

Aiden didn't speak, just pulled Michael's hand to cover Isabella's, patting them gently.

With a weak voice, Aiden managed to say, "You two... must... be... happy..."

Isabella's eyes welled up again.

How could she not understand her grandpa's wish?

From the moment she married into the Brown Family, Aiden had hoped she and Michael could live harmoniously like a normal couple. Every time she and Michael had a disagreement, her grandpa would always support her.

But she and Michael had already reached the point of divorce; going back to the way things were was impossible.

Yet, at this moment, she couldn't say anything that would break Aiden's heart.

Isabella's soft hand was in his, and Michael couldn't help but look up at her, feeling a mix of emotions.

He knew his grandpa always wanted them to reconcile and return to how they were at the beginning.

But after everything that had happened, he seemed to understand what Isabella truly wanted.

If she didn't want to, he wouldn't force her like before.

Perhaps only at this moment could he hold her hand openly without her rejecting or resenting him.

"Grandpa, no matter what happens between Isabella and me, she will always be your granddaughter and a part of the Brown Family. As long as I'm here, I won't let anyone hurt her."

Michael had truly come to terms with it.

Loving someone meant respecting their choices. If Isabella was willing to give him another chance, he would show her his true feelings without hesitation.

He would make up for all the pain and grievances she had endured over the years.

But if she wanted him to stay away and never see him again, he would respect that too.

Isabella was stunned.

She couldn't believe these words were coming from Michael.

Was this really the same arrogant Michael she knew?

Just then, the sound of a wheelchair rolling down the hallway echoed. Nolan, having rushed over from the company upon hearing about Aiden's hospitalization, arrived.

But when he reached the door, the scene inside the room pierced his heart.

By Aiden's bedside, Michael and Isabella were holding hands, making promises to Aiden, looking every bit like a loving couple.

What hurt Nolan even more was the pendant around Isabella's neck.

That pendant symbolized the future matriarch of the Brown Family, something even Michael's mother never received, and now it hung around Isabella's neck.

So, Isabella had forgiven Michael and accepted her role as "Mrs. Brown" again!

Realizing this, Nolan trembled with anger.

He stared at the scene with furious eyes.

Why?

Why could she so easily forgive Michael but not accept his love and pursuit?

If she reconciled with Michael, what about him?

What did he mean to her?

He had been by her side for so many years, loved her for so many years, and in the end, his confession and affection meant nothing to her?

Nolan's hands gripped the wheelchair tightly, his anger and overwhelming hatred nearly consuming his rationality.

He almost forgot why he had come here because of the "warm" scene before him.

Alex, standing nearby, coughed lightly to remind Nolan of his current status as the CEO of the Brown Group.

With Aiden gravely ill, Nolan's priority should be to show the concern and worry of a grandson, not to let a woman make him forget everything he had worked so hard to achieve.

"Mr. Aiden Brown, Mrs. Brown, Mr. Nolan Brown is here."

Alex's announcement brought Nolan back to reality.

Nolan suppressed his inappropriate emotions, waved Alex away, and wheeled himself into the room, approaching Aiden.

"Grandpa, I'm here. I'm sorry I didn't manage the company well and caused you such distress."

As he spoke, Nolan lowered his head slowly.

His voice was full of guilt and concern, making it hard for anyone to blame him further.

His concern might have been feigned, but his guilt was real.

On the way to the hospital, Nolan had learned from Alex that his grandfather had fainted after seeing negative news about the company that morning.

As the person in charge, he couldn't escape responsibility.

This was his fault.

Isabella glanced at Nolan briefly before quickly looking away.

With her grandfather still in bed, she didn't want to think about anything related to Nolan, nor did she want to speak to him.

She had seen Aiden, and given her current status, it was no longer appropriate for her to stay.

Isabella pulled her hand away from Michael's grasp, made an excuse, and left the room.

###chapter 488 Provoking Nolan

Michael wanted to chase after her, but he knew Isabella was the last person who wanted to see him right now.

Even though it hurt, he had to keep his feelings in check.

Otherwise, how would he be any different from before?

After Isabella accepted the gemstone pendant, Aiden's mood visibly lifted, and he seemed much more energetic.

With Michael's help, he sat up and reached out to Nolan.

He wanted Nolan to come over; he had something to ask.

"Nolan, is everything sorted out?"

Nolan nodded, "Yeah, Grandpa. Everything's taken care of. But this time, the mess was huge and it hurt the company's reputation. It's on me, and I deserve any blame you throw my way."

This whole mess started because of him, and the company's losses were definitely tied to his actions.

He had underestimated the Adri Family's ambition and methods, leading to the Brown Group suffering this impact and loss.

Nolan couldn't deny that.

If he hadn't been blinded by his desire for revenge and made deals with the Adri Family, he wouldn't have brought this trouble upon them, nor would he have put the Brown Group at such risk.

His thirst for revenge had turned him into a pawn in someone else's game.

He had harmed the Brown Group and the business he had once built with his own hands.

There were some things he couldn't bring himself to say in front of his grandfather.

He knew too well the Adri Family's ambition and greed.

Now that they had their sights set on the Brown Group, they wouldn't let go easily. This negative impact was just a small warning.

If he continued to resist them, the Brown Group's financial chain would break, or they would be cornered by the Adri Family, ultimately leading to bankruptcy.

The Adri Family would be the biggest beneficiaries of this scheme.

Hearing that the situation was resolved, Aiden finally breathed a sigh of relief. "As long as it's resolved, I don't blame you."

Saying this, Aiden reached out and held Nolan's hand, giving it a reassuring pat.

It was as if he was telling Nolan not to be afraid, that no matter what happened, his grandfather would always be there to support him.

This warm sentiment was something Nolan had never experienced before.

Or rather, he had always thought these gestures were reserved for Michael.

Nolan was momentarily stunned.

All his life, he had been seen as dispensable by everyone. All the affection was given to Michael, while he was met with disdain.

Now, after causing such a big mess, he had expected Aiden to scold him or strip him of his CEO position.

But Aiden didn't blame him at all.

Could it be that Aiden, knowing he didn't have much time left, had developed a sense of pity for Nolan?

Nolan couldn't figure it out, but he couldn't bring himself to believe that he had finally received his grandfather's affection.

After a few more words, Aiden was forced to rest by the doctor.

Having just undergone surgery and given his age, the best way for him to recover was to rest well and avoid stress.

Following Aiden's instructions, Michael took the wheelchair from behind Nolan and pushed him out of the room.

They reached the end of the hallway.

Away from the room, Michael no longer needed to maintain the facade of brotherly love with Nolan.

He stood by the window, opened it, lit a cigarette, and gazed out with an unreadable expression.

But his question was directed at Nolan, "Is the issue with Leanne Corporation really resolved?"

Nolan might have fooled their grandfather, but he couldn't fool Michael.

With such a big stir online, if someone hadn't been backing Leanne Corporation, that small company wouldn't have dared to challenge the Brown Group so openly.

Whatever Nolan meant by "resolved," it must have involved some deal with the Adri Family.

"The company's matters are under my management now. If I say it's resolved, then it's resolved. Don't forget your current status; you no longer have the right to question me."

Michael was so tall that Nolan had to look up from his wheelchair to speak to him.

This made him uncomfortable.

But what bothered him more was that Isabella had accepted the gemstone pendant.

He couldn't help but sneer, "Michael, are you questioning me because you think you've won?"

Michael was puzzled.

He frowned and looked at Nolan, his voice cold, "What do you mean by that? Are you trying to provoke me?"

Everyone knew the company was in Nolan's hands now. Even with their grandfather seriously ill, there was no intention of changing the successor.

Wasn't this what Nolan had always dreamed of?

Clearly, Nolan had gained the most, yet he was asking if Michael thought he had won. Was Nolan out of his mind?

Provoke?

Nolan's lips curled into a mocking smile. 'Cut the act-it's just us here. You used Grandpa's illness to manipulate Isabella into accepting that pendant and getting back with you. After all these years, she still picked you in the end. You won, didn't you? What, am I supposed to pop champagne for you two?"

Nolan said this with a smile, but his heart was bleeding.

He couldn't understand.

He loved Isabella more, cared for her just as much as Michael did.

But why did Isabella always choose Michael over him?

Even when he confessed, she rejected him without hesitation.

She even said she never had feelings for him.

Michael was momentarily stunned by Nolan's words.

He quickly realized that Nolan had misunderstood the scene in the hospital room.

But so what?

He had no obligation to explain to Nolan.

Not long ago, Nolan had told him that Isabella truly loved Nolan, not Michael.

He even said that Isabella had married Michael because she saw him as a stand-in for Nolan.

This misunderstanding had deepened the rift between him and Isabella, causing them to miss out on each other.

Now, he could finally let Nolan feel what it was like to be on the receiving end of such a misconception.

He had to admit, it felt pretty good.

Seeing the resentment in Nolan's eyes, Michael raised an eyebrow in satisfaction and nodded deliberately.

"Feel free to congratulate us! Honestly, Isabella and I might not have gotten back together without your help. We're planning a big wedding for our second time around - you've gotta be there as our witness! And hey, no pressure, but we're totally looking forward to your gift!"

###chapter 489 I Might Propose to Her

Hearing Michael talk about the wedding, Nolan's face twisted with anger.

Seeing Michael like this, he couldn't help but think back to the day he confessed to Isabella.

At first, he thought she was just too shocked, but when she called him later, he realized she never intended to consider a future with him.

She had always loved Michael, from the beginning to the end.

She only befriended him out of pity, but he didn't need that!

The last thing he needed was anyone's sympathy!

The angrier Nolan got, the more satisfied Michael felt.

He had a sense of sweet revenge.

After all, he had learned this trick from Nolan, and now he was using it against him. Who wouldn't say he deserved it?

The next second, he heard Nolan's cold voice.

"Michael, you won't get your way! Do you really think Isabella will marry you again? I've known her for over ten years. Do you think I don't understand her? The only reason she accepted that gemstone pendant in front of you today was to avoid upsetting Grandpa. Isabella has already divorced you. She doesn't love you anymore. Even if she gets married, it will be to me, not you. Do you understand?"

Nolan clenched his fists and shouted at Michael in anger.

But Michael didn't care about any of this. His attention was on Nolan's legs, covered by a blanket.

Aaron had said that Nolan's legs were fine and that he could walk like a normal person.

He was only pretending to be wheelchair-bound.

But now, Nolan's legs were covered tightly by the blanket, and Michael couldn't see any problem except for the black shoes.

That didn't mean he couldn't uncover Nolan's secrets.

"Nolan, who Isabella marries is her choice, not something you or I can decide!"

Michael didn't take his words seriously.

He had said those things just to provoke Nolan.

Not to mention, Isabella had no intention of reconciling with him.

He just wanted to use these words to throw Nolan off balance, making it easier for him to ask his next question.

"Nolan, if your legs could walk normally, what would you want to do the most?"

Michael spoke calmly and casually.

But his sharp eyes were fixed on Nolan's expression, trying to confirm some answers.

For example, the man in the surveillance video from his office, dressed in sportswear, wearing a black mask and hat, who freely took documents from his safe and forged his handwriting to frame him.

What was Nolan thinking at that moment when he succeeded?

He must have been excited and happy.

Nolan had worked for the Adri Family abroad for so long, only to get their help in returning to the Brown Group. Now he was just one step away from achieving his goal.

How could he not be happy?

But Nolan forgot one thing: he wanted to use the Adri Family to get the Brown Group, while they only saw him as a stepping stone to take over the Brown Group.

People like that never agreed to share benefits. Their ambition had long been exposed.

Nolan was too smart not to see the Adri Family's intentions.

But his obsession with the Brown Group clouded his judgment. Desire, once it took root, became both a weakness and a vulnerability.

Rather than saying the Adri Family sought Nolan for "mutual benefit," it was more accurate to say Nolan was dragged down by his own desires.

To satisfy his hatred for being kicked out of the Brown Group, he was willing to ally with outsiders to bring it down.

Nolan, did you really not regret this?

At this moment, Nolan was still lost in the previous question.

If he could stand on his own two feet in front of everyone, what he wanted most would be to...

"I think I would propose to Isabella in front of a crowd."

Even knowing she wouldn't agree, he wanted to make his dream come true once.

He had loved her for over ten years and deserved one more chance to fight for his happiness.

Michael let out a dry chuckle.

He couldn't help it; someone out there was even more delusional than him.

"What are you laughing at?"

Nolan's face darkened, and his tone became cold.

Wasn't it Michael who asked the question? Nolan told the truth and was mercilessly mocked. How could Nolan stand it?

Michael spread his hands helplessly. "You're planning to propose to my wife in public. If I don't laugh, should I beat you up in front of Grandpa?"

Of course, he didn't mind, but he was worried Grandpa couldn't handle the shock.

As he spoke, his gaze fell back on Nolan's legs, and his smile became meaningful.

"But don't worry, that wish will only remain a dream. It will never become reality."

And he wouldn't let Nolan achieve that wish.

Nolan had fallen for his wife. If it became reality, not only would Grandpa disapprove, but the Wilson Family wouldn't let Nolan have his way either.

She had just divorced him and got together with Nolan. Didn't Isabella care about her reputation?

Nolan really didn't consider any practical factors.

Hearing this, Nolan thought Michael was just jealous and sneered.

"Michael, don't forget Isabella doesn't belong to you anymore. If she agrees to my pursuit, we'll be a couple. Do you think you have the right to stop us?"

If this had happened before, Nolan's words might have gotten to him. But now, knowing Isabella had kept him in her heart all along, Michael didn't even flinch.

On the contrary, he could now see the guilt in Nolan's eyes when he said those words.

It was always easy to spot a liar once you knew what to look for.

Realizing this, Michael wanted to kick himself. How had he missed all the red flags in Nolan's behavior? If he'd just pushed a little harder, asked one more question, couldn't he have seen through Nolan's act?

But at this point, it didn't matter anymore. What stood between him and Isabella now went far beyond anything to do with Nolan.

So, he wouldn't argue with Nolan over these things anymore.

Michael sighed deeply, not wanting to waste more time on this, and changed the subject.

"Whether I have the right is not for you to decide. But I don't want to discuss this with you anymore. I just want to ask you one question: how do you plan to deal with the Leanne Corporation?"

###chapter 490 Figured It Out

At first, Michael thought the situation with Leanne Corporation was just a small warning from the Adri Family to Nolan.

But just now, seeing Nolan apologize to Grandpa in the hospital room, Michael realized it wasn't that simple. Nolan's tone and expression were too genuine to be faked.

Michael had dealt with the Adri Family before and knew how ambitious they were. If they wanted Nolan to comply, they wouldn't back off so easily. The fact that Nolan felt so guilty about apologizing to Grandpa suggested that the Adri Family was finally showing their true colors.

However, Nolan was now on high alert. Michael's repeated questioning made Nolan suspicious, even thinking this was Michael's best chance to compete for the heir position.

But Nolan had worked hard to get what he wanted; there was no way he would let it go so easily.

"Michael, you better recognize your current status. Grandpa has entrusted the company to me. This is your last warning: stay out of things that don't concern you!"

Michael was speechless. He smirked coldly, "You weren't this nervous when you took over the Brown Group. Relax, as long as you manage the company well, no one will fight you for the president's position."

Michael glanced at Aiden's hospital room, his tone dropping a few notches. "Haven't you noticed that Grandpa hasn't considered giving the company back to me? Maybe he already acknowledges your abilities. So, focus on being the president of the Brown Group and stop thinking everyone is out to get you."

If this was the outcome Grandpa wanted, Michael was willing to let go. Before his mother told him the truth, he had indeed thought about fighting Nolan, even if it meant mutual destruction, to reclaim what was his. Back then, it was all about a man's pride.

But now, he understood Grandpa's intentions to help him win back Isabella, and the doctor's words after Grandpa's surgery. When he held Isabella's hands tightly just now, he realized something.

If he couldn't even keep the person he loved most, what was the point of holding onto the Brown Group?

"Michael, what do you mean by that?" Nolan wasn't stupid. His brother had been investigating him, so how could he suddenly give up on the Brown Group?

Michael didn't bother explaining further. He just threw out one last warning and turned to leave. "Nolan, the Brown Group is something you worked hard for too. Take good care of it, don't make me look down on you."

After settling things with Aiden, Michael went to the private hospital where Aaron was staying. In the room, only Renee was by Aaron's side.

"Aaron, you've put a lot of effort into finding evidence against Nolan, but now I want to tell you, I don't want to pursue this anymore. Let's stop."

Michael didn't avoid Renee when he told Aaron his decision, so they were both shocked. Aaron took a while to process what Michael meant.

"But why, Mr. Brown? Did something happen?" Aaron asked, bewildered. They were just one step away from bringing Nolan down and reclaiming the Brown Group. Why was Michael giving up now?

Even Renee thought Michael was joking and couldn't help but ask, "Mr. Brown, do you know what you're saying? If we stop now, all our previous efforts will be wasted."

Michael nodded seriously but remained firm. "I know."

"But..." Aaron started, but Renee stopped him with a slight shake of her head and a glance at the room across the hall. Aaron quickly understood her meaning and swallowed his questions.

He knew Michael's character better than anyone. Once Michael made a decision, no one could change his mind. But he wasn't the only one confused; someone else was too.

Isabella, who had come to visit Aaron at the same time as Michael, had hidden in the next room when she saw Michael. She couldn't believe what she overheard in just a few minutes.

What was Michael thinking? Isabella wanted to rush over and confront him. She had stayed up all night finding evidence to clear his name. Now, just one step away from exposing Nolan, he wanted to stop?

That was the Brown Group, the company he had managed for three years. How could he just give it up? Didn't he realize that not fighting now meant handing the entire Brown Group to Nolan, leaving no place for himself in the future?

Just as Isabella was about to storm out, she heard Michael's voice again from the next room. "It's not that big a deal. I just figured if Nolan wants the Brown Group so badly, he can have it. Fighting over it isn't worth it."

Isabella was almost suffocated by Michael's nonchalant attitude. Aaron couldn't stand it either. "Mr. Brown, have you forgotten you're the rightful heir to the Brown Group, not Nolan? And have you forgotten what he did to you to take it? How can you forgive him so easily? And what about the company? Are you just going to give it up?" Aaron was baffled.

What had happened overnight to make Michael change so drastically?

"The company is in Nolan's hands. Let him manage it," Michael said with casual finality, like he'd made peace with the decision.

"Honestly, there are other things I'd rather do than run the company. Besides, we both know what Nolan's capable of. He already led the Brown Group to success before. The company will be fine with him in charge. Even Grandpa trusts him. Why should I get in the way?"

What a way to put it. Isabella bit her lip in frustration. They were all part of the Brown Family, sharing the same blood. So Michael could let go of these grudges easily.

But what about her? All her efforts to help him would be wasted. Michael didn't even know what she had done for him.

It made her realize she needed to stop getting involved in matters that didn't concern her, to avoid bringing unnecessary trouble on herself.

###chapter 491 No More Chance

Isabella took a deep breath, ready to leave, when she suddenly heard footsteps outside the door.

Her heart tightened instantly.

The next second, the door right next to her was knocked on.

Michael's deep, familiar voice came through the thin door. "Isabella, I know you're in there. Can we talk?"

Isabella froze.

She had no idea how Michael knew she was here. Renee would never have given away her location.

But now he was right outside, and all he had to do was push the door open to come in. There was nowhere for her to hide.

Isabella's heart was racing.

What could Michael want to talk about so suddenly? Had he discovered she was helping him behind the scenes, or did he want to fulfill Aiden's wish and reconcile with her?

Whatever it was, she had to face it.

Looking at the gemstone pendant hanging around her neck, Isabella steadied herself, turned the handle, and opened the door.

Michael stood there, his eyes fixed on her, as if he had no doubt she would be here.

Isabella didn't want to get entangled with him any further. She decisively took off the gemstone pendant that Aiden had personally given her and handed it to Michael.

"I couldn't refuse in front of Aiden, but now, this gemstone belongs to its rightful owner."

She understood Aiden's wish to use this pendant to bring them back together. Aiden wanted to see his grandson have a happy family in his final moments, and there was nothing wrong with that.

But her relationship with Michael had gone beyond the point where others' persuasion could mend it.

So, while she could accept the pendant for Aiden's sake, it didn't mean she would forgive Michael for everything he had done to her.

The gemstone, the size of a pigeon egg, glistened warmly in the sunlight, but Michael had no intention of taking it.

He hadn't come here to reclaim the pendant.

If he could, he would want Isabella to wear it for the rest of her life.

This gemstone represented the status of the Brown Family's matriarch. He was thrilled she had accepted it.

"Isabella, this was a gift from Grandpa. I won't take it back. Besides, I didn't come here to talk about this."

Michael said, gripping Isabella's small hand along with the gemstone tightly in his palm.

"Isabella, I was wrong. Can we start over?"

All his words boiled down to this plea, and as he spoke, his voice trembled slightly.

He was nervous and afraid.

He knew there was a high chance Isabella would reject him, but he had to fight for their future.

But Isabella didn't think Michael's apology held much weight.

Just moments ago, he had let Nolan off the hook, even though he knew what Nolan had done to try to take over the Brown Group. She had almost been dragged into the brothers' war.

Thinking of this, Isabella decisively pulled her hand out of Michael's grasp and took a step back.

"Michael, do you really think that just saying you're sorry will make me forgive you and reconcile our marriage?"

Did he even understand what had gone wrong between them?

Did he know what she cared about?

He hadn't figured out anything and thought he could just brush it off?

Sure enough, he was still the same high-and-mighty Michael, thinking a simple apology could fix everything.

He hadn't changed at all.

Seeing Isabella's anger, Michael quickly tried to explain, "That's not what I meant. Don't overthink it. I just want to say let's leave the past behind and focus on our future."

Grandpa's intentions had made him see his own heart clearly.

They both had feelings for each other, so why couldn't they clear up the misunderstandings and get back together?

When Isabella met Michael's deeply affectionate gaze, she understood his purpose for coming here.

But the nameless fire in her heart also flared up.

"Look, Michael," she said through clenched teeth, "we need to be real here. We're divorced. It's over. You're my ex now, and we both need to accept that. So please, stop calling me, stop with all these comments, and just... give me some space, okay?"

Isabella was about to explode with anger.

Was Michael an idiot?

Now he wanted to reconcile, but what was he thinking when they divorced? Where was he then?

When she had mustered the courage to confess her feelings and ask if he liked her, he didn't even have the courage to respond.

Yes, she knew he did everything for her own good, including the divorce, to keep her from getting entangled with the Brown Group and targeted by the Adri Family.

But she didn't care about that. She cared about his attitude.

She had waited for him for years, just wanting to understand how he truly felt.

But he never changed - controlling, demanding, and set in his ways, both in their relationship and everything else.

He never once stopped to consider her feelings.

So how could she easily return to his side just because of an apology?

Unless Michael showed her his true self.

"Isabella, it's not like that. I know I messed up, and I can't bear to lose you again. Please, just give me one more chance."

Michael grabbed Isabella as she turned to leave, his tone sincere as he confessed his feelings.

"I get why you're angry with me-you have every right to be. I was distant, I shut you out, and I never explained myself. That's on me. But I've changed. I understand now what you need in this relationship, what kind of partnership you've always wanted. Just trust me one last time. Don't walk away for good. Let me show you it can be different."

Michael poured out his heart in one breath.

He had overestimated his own possessiveness. As soon as he got the divorce papers, he regretted it.

He feared Isabella would move on before he could resolve the Adri Family's issues. He feared that when he turned around, Isabella would be long gone.

And he would be left with nothing but memories.

This wasn't about pride anymore. If it meant winning Isabella back, he would get down on his knees without hesitation.

"Michael, how many chances do you expect me to give you?" Isabella asked, her voice steady.

The past came flooding back.

She had once loved him with everything she had, even when it meant sacrificing her dignity, only to be met with his cold indifference.

Now he couldn't handle even a fraction of the pain he had once put her through?

###chapter 492 Switch Roles

This was the perfect chance for her to finally say what she needed to say.

"Michael, remember when you couldn't stand to be around me for even a second? Even when I begged, you never softened. Before the divorce, I asked if you ever had any feelings for me, even a little bit. And what did you say?"

"You said no. You even went to Thomas to speed up the divorce. Now that you've lost everything, you suddenly remember me? Michael, what do you take me for?"

Isabella clenched her hands at her sides and bit her lip.

"Do you think saying a few nice words and admitting you were wrong will make me foolishly come back to you and be your wife again? Do you think I'm an idiot?"

This time, Isabella was truly angry.

Before and after the divorce, Michael never respected her opinions or thoughts.

He couldn't even manage the basic trust and respect that a marriage required. Why did he think that after everything, she would forgive him because of a few sweet words?

Or maybe he had another reason for wanting to reconcile so urgently.

Michael was no longer the president of the Brown Group, but she was still the heir to the Wilson Family. Nolan had tried every trick in the book to use her resources and background. Did Michael think of that too?

So, he was only saying these things for his own future, wasn't he?

When she looked at Michael again, the warmth and hesitation in her eyes were gone, replaced by a cold stare.

"I should have known. Someone as high and mighty as you would never lower yourself to me unless you wanted to use my status to get the Wilson Family's resources and help. But you can forget about it."

"I won't help you again. Years ago, I was blind to marry you, but now I see your true colors. The person I want to love and be loved by will never be you!"

Isabella's words were firm, but Michael wasn't about to give up because of her suspicions.

"Isabella, why can't you believe me? You clearly love me. Can you honestly say you never loved me, not even a little?"

He closed the door behind him and stepped forward, gripping Isabella's shoulders and forcing her to look at him.

He didn't believe she never had any feelings for him.

But Isabella refused to give him the satisfaction.

She lifted her chin and said deliberately, "That's right. I don't like you. I don't love you. Is that clear enough?"

Isabella stared at him without blinking.

Only she knew the truth-she had always loved deeply, and from the beginning, Michael had been the only one who held her heart.

But she'd rather die than admit it now.

After being rejected by Michael so many times, she needed to win this round.

Michael smirked, as if her answer was exactly what he expected. He knew her temper too well.

"Isabella, do you really believe yourself when you say you don't love me?"

If she didn't love him deeply, why would she have insisted on marrying him, even at the risk of falling out with her beloved grandfather?

In their three years of marriage, he had seen all her kindness and tenderness.

If that wasn't love, what was it?

Michael felt a warmth in his heart. He backed her into a corner, placing his hand over her heart.

"Isabella, be honest with yourself. If you didn't have feelings for me, why is your heart racing right now? Just admit it. You're into me. I can feel it."

A flash of anger sparked in Isabella's eyes.

She shoved his hand away. "God, Michael, get over yourself. My heart is racing because I'm pissed off. I already told you I'm not interested. How many ways do I need to say it?"

Isabella immediately retorted, but the next second, Michael had her pinned in the corner again.

He held her hand tightly.

This time, Michael placed her hand over his own heart, his voice low and husky.

"But my heart is full of you. I only love you, Isabella. Can't you feel it?"

"You."

Isabella never expected Michael to pull such a move, and she instinctively tried to pull her hand back. But Michael held her firmly in place.

She couldn't match his strength, so she gave up struggling and faced him directly.

"Yes, I admit I used to love you. But so what? In our three years of marriage, all you brought me was pain and endless grievances. Why would you think I would still love you unconditionally like before?"

Isabella gave him a big, unfiltered eye roll.

If it weren't for Aiden, she wouldn't have agreed to meet him today.

How could he have such a misunderstanding?

Seeing this, Michael just smiled and lowered his head, seemingly unaffected by her words.

"I don't care. I just know that you loved me before, and that's enough. As for now, we'll switch roles."

"What?"

Isabella didn't understand what Michael meant and looked at him questioningly.

The next second, Michael leaned in and whispered in her ear, "This time, I'll be the one chasing you. I'll make you fall in love with me again. I'm confident."

Isabella was speechless.

Where did Michael get this confidence? Why did he think she would fall for him again?

"Michael, do you think being persistent makes you look cool? I said I don't love you anymore. Not now, not ever. So please, stop bothering me."

Isabella yanked her hand back and glared at him.

She finally saw Michael's true colors. He was an arrogant, shameless jerk!

Michael didn't argue with her. Instead, he pulled out some evidence.

"If you don't care about me, then why did you help me behind my back? The evidence Aaron found-that was actually from your investigation, wasn't it?"

Michael's voice was unnervingly calm, his certainty making Isabella's heart race.

"Help you? I didn't do anything," she said, avoiding his gaze.

The last thing she needed was for Michael to discover she'd been secretly working on his behalf. His ego was already big enough.

"Really?"

Michael smiled helplessly. "I don't think Aaron alone could have found the suspicious person in those surveillance videos. And he couldn't have identified Nolan just by the watch he was wearing."

###chapter 493 The Wilson Family Will Help You

Neither Aaron nor Renee knew much about Nolan, let alone recognizing a watch that appeared on surveillance for just a second.

In this world, the only person who could identify that watch besides Nolan himself was Isabella.

After all, she was the one who gave it to him.

As the person involved, how could Isabella not recognize it?

When Aaron laid out all the evidence in front of him last night, Michael had already concluded that Isabella was part of this investigation.

And the only reason she would do this, besides helping him, was because she still had feelings for him.

She couldn't bear to see him in trouble, so she decided to lend him a hand.

Seeing the look on Michael's face, as if he had figured it all out, Isabella couldn't help but blush.

She had only wanted to help him secretly, without him knowing, but she didn't expect him to see through it all at this moment.

And he even said it out loud.

No matter what, she wouldn't admit it.

If she nodded, it would completely negate everything she had just said and indirectly admit that she still liked Michael.

No way.

She couldn't let Michael see that she still had feelings for him.

Michael had hurt her so much in the past. If she just went along with his wishes because of a few words, what would that make her?

"I didn't do any of this. If you don't believe me, you can ask Aaron!"

Isabella was determined not to give in.

Michael, however, found her current demeanor incredibly adorable. She clearly cared about him deeply but wouldn't admit it because of her pride.

In a way, it was all his fault.

If he had realized her worth and his own feelings earlier, there wouldn't have been so many misunderstandings between them.

He gently held her shoulders, pulling her into his arms, and sighed deeply.

"It's my fault for hurting you so deeply before. It's normal for you not to forgive me. I just want to tell you that my feelings for you are genuine, without any ulterior motives. So, admitting you like me isn't that hard, right?"

Maybe it was Michael's gentle voice, or perhaps his embrace that felt so warm and comforting.

Feeling the long-lost warmth, Isabella had a moment of longing.

"Yes, I did like you, very much."

Isabella's husky voice came from Michael's embrace, and that short sentence made him tremble all over. He could no longer control his emotions and held her tightly.

He never wanted to let go again.

But the next second, Isabella's voice rang out again, bringing Michael back to reality.

"But Michael, it's been three years, and in these three years, I haven't gotten through to you. I'm exhausted, and whatever love we had... you wore it down to nothing."

"About what you mentioned earlier-yes, I wanted to help you, but only because of our history together. Nothing more."

"Now Aiden's trusted me with this gem. I helped you this time, but only out of obligation and common sense. Do you get that?"

This was the most reasonable and least suspicious explanation Isabella could think of.

Whether it was Michael's confession or his genuine feelings, she couldn't fully trust it.

She feared it was just a fleeting novelty for him.

When that novelty wore off, what would be left for her?

So, she used Aiden as a shield. Even if she got entangled with Michael again, she would wake up at the last moment.

"Can we trust each other just this once, Bella?"

It was the first time Michael called her by that nickname.

Even though he'd used it countless times in his thoughts, he'd never said it aloud to Isabella before.

Isabella froze, caught off guard.

The sudden intimacy of a nickname from Michael-who had always addressed her formally as Isabella, even around family-left her momentarily speechless. His voice had softened to a tone she'd never heard before.

"What did you just call me?"

This time, it was Michael's turn to look embarrassed. He lowered his head, burying his face in her shoulder, and his deep voice came out softly.

"Bella, I just don't want to call you the same as everyone else. I want a name that's just for us. Can I call you that from now on? Only I can call you that, no one else. Bella."

Michael's husky voice called her name over and over, filled with deep affection.

Isabella stood there, her mind blank.

Did she hear that right?

Michael was speaking to her so gently, using a nickname no one else had ever called her.

If it weren't for the warmth of his breath on her neck, Isabella would have thought she was dreaming.

It felt too unreal.

After a while, Isabella came back to her senses and gently pushed Michael away.

"Michael, you..."

Michael responded softly but still didn't want to let go.

He had finally held her for a few minutes and didn't want to let go at all.

Isabella gathered her thoughts and asked.

"You're here because of Aiden's illness, right? Or maybe you want to use my status and the Wilson Family's background to help you take back the Brown Group from Nolan!"

In Evergreen City, the most influential families were the Browns and the Wilsons. Now that Michael had been framed and lost his power, the quickest way was through her.

With just a little help from the Wilson Family, Michael could easily regain his position as the head of the Brown Group.

Of course, that depended on whether she was willing to help!

Isabella deeply desired Michael's affection, but she also understood that the past couldn't be ignored. He hadn't loved her before.

If he claimed to like her now, it was just a fleeting feeling, not something she could rely on.

If she gave in, she would fall into his trap again, and the outcome would be no different from now.

So, she needed to make everything clear.

Hearing this, Michael stood up straight and faced Isabella.

His eyes were full of disbelief.

Did she really think he was someone who would manipulate others' feelings to get what he wanted?

Was that how low she thought of him?

"Bella, listen to me, I never..."

"No need!"

Isabella raised her hand to stop him. His expression had already told her everything.

And she knew what to do.

"Nolan didn't just frame you, so the Wilson Family will help you. I'll talk to my uncles. They may have personal opinions about you, but in such important matters, they will consider the bigger picture."

###chapter 494 She Still Doesn't Believe Him

"I'll help you put on a show for your Grandpa, just like you helped me before."

Aiden was family, and she couldn't just let him leave with regrets.

She wasn't that heartless.

When her grandfather was gravely ill, Michael had pretended to be a loving husband to comfort him. Now, she would repay that favor.

She didn't want to experience the pain and suffering of the past once more.

Why? He had made it very clear that he liked her, only her.

He could feel that Isabella still had feelings for him, and he loved her deeply. Why did she have to pretend?

Aaron.

Renee's protective stance made Michael both envious and jealous.

Michael's tone was exasperated, with a hint of self-pity.

Even though Aaron didn't want to part with his girlfriend, Michael was his boss. He couldn't just leave him hanging.

Aaron's words were clearly meant to send her away.

Was he choosing his boss over his girlfriend?

Aaron hesitated.

Michael was a distinguished member of the Brown family, even if he was no longer the CEO of the Brown Group. His status was still significant.

How could Michael stay in the hospital for a subordinate?

"I can stay and take care of Aaron. You can go home for now. If you're worried, you can come back first thing in the morning."

Michael's sincere and serious tone showed his determination.

He wasn't leaving.

This surprised not only Renee but also Aaron lying in the hospital bed.

They exchanged a look, both seeing disbelief in each other's eyes.

Renee couldn't help but smirk and whispered to Aaron, "Did I hear that right? Your boss wants to stay in the hospital with you all night?"

Who would believe that?

Aaron looked down, feeling guilty.

What could he do? Michael was facing a problem he couldn't solve.

But he couldn't tell Renee directly. She'd run straight to Isabella the minute he opened his mouth.

Why did he, of all people-just an assistant-always end up making these impossible calls?

Seeing this, Michael stepped in to help.

"Renee, Aaron and I have been like brothers for years. I just want to discuss some things with him, so I'm taking up some of your time together. If it affects your relationship, I apologize."

It was rare for Michael to explain so much.

Renee wasn't stupid. Isabella had just left, and now Michael was here, wanting to stay and take care of Aaron.

It was clear he wanted to get information about Isabella from Aaron.

She wasn't worried about Michael's schemes but about Aaron's post-surgery condition.

"I'll go. Are you sure you'll be okay alone in the hospital?"

Renee looked at Aaron with concern.

Seeing Renee finally relent, Aaron quickly nodded.

"Of course. Besides, I can't move much, so nothing will happen. If something does, I'll call the doctor and nurses. You haven't rested well on the boat and stayed up all night. Go home and get some sleep."

Since Aaron insisted, Renee didn't want to dampen his spirits.

She nodded, squeezed Aaron's hand, and said, "Alright, I'll stay at Ms. Taylor's tonight. Call me if you need anything. And..."

Renee lowered her voice, issuing a warning.

"I don't care what you two talk about, but if I find out you're conspiring with Michael against Isabella, I'll do whatever it takes!"

###chapter 495 Seeking Advice on Love Experience

Aaron's face went white as a sheet at those words.

When Renee got physical, she held nothing back. She'd even take on the Adri Family without a second thought.

Given his small frame, he probably wouldn't even survive a flick from her finger.

Only then did Renee leave, looking satisfied.

Michael and Isabella had feelings for each other.

And Michael genuinely liked Isabella. There was no way he would ever think of hurting her.

Renee just had too many misunderstandings about Michael because of past events.

If Isabella showed him even a fraction of that care, he'd do anything in return.

Michael was here seeking advice from someone he viewed as "successful with women."

As men who had both experienced heartbreak, Aaron could relate to Michael's situation.

He recalled how Renee had been dead set on leaving Aaron, and they'd gone through a period where they barely spoke.

But in just a few months, Aaron had won her back?

It completely mystified him.

Michael fell silent.

He was indeed curious about that.

"It's simple! Mr. Brown, since you and Isabella have feelings for each other, just be straightforward and confess your feelings. That's all you need to do!"

"That won't work!"

Michael frowned. He had thought of that, but Isabella had still rejected him.

And she had rejected him thoroughly.

Isabella hadn't even given him a chance to explain.

"How could it not work?" Aaron was puzzled. "That doesn't make sense. Isabella has always had feelings for you. If you confess, she should feel something."

Michael also felt something was off but couldn't pinpoint it.

"I thought I made myself clear, but Isabella doesn't believe me. She thinks my feelings are just a way to use her. No matter how I explain, she won't listen."

Aaron was even more puzzled. "Mr. Brown, can you tell me how you confessed to her?"

He wasn't trying to be nosy, but without understanding what had happened, he couldn't help Michael.

Seeing Aaron's sincere expression, Michael put aside his embarrassment and roughly recounted what had happened next door.

After hearing what Michael had said, Aaron thought for a moment and came to a conclusion.

"Mr. Brown, I think your confession was too sudden and scared Isabella. That's why she doesn't believe your sincerity."

"Sudden?" Michael didn't understand. They had been married for three years and were now on the brink of divorce. How could his confession be sudden?

"Yes, think about how you've treated her over the years. It's understandable that Isabella doesn't believe you."

Aaron analyzed seriously, "Moreover, Mr. Brown, you've just been ousted from the company, lost your position as heir and CEO, and you two have only been divorced for a few days. Yet, you suddenly confess and want to reconcile. Anyone would think you have ulterior motives."

Hearing Aaron's analysis, Michael realized he had been impulsive.

No wonder the more serious he was, the worse Isabella's expression became. She really thought he was using her.

He should have realized this earlier.

Seeing Michael deep in thought, Aaron continued.

"Mr. Brown, a confession isn't just about words. You didn't give her the romance and sense of ceremony before. If you still don't now, it's no wonder she thinks you haven't changed."

Having been by Michael's side for years, Aaron knew what kind of life Isabella had endured.

Forget small gifts; Michael had barely spared her a kind glance.

If he didn't seize this opportunity, Isabella might actually be swept away by someone else.

Change.

Michael muttered the word to himself, then looked up with determination. "What do I need to do to prove to her I've changed?"

Aaron's eyes lit up as he eagerly offered his advice.

"Look, before you tell her how you feel, you need to show Isabella you're serious. Make up for your past mistakes. Every woman appreciates thoughtful gestures-whether it's flowers, a meaningful gift, or even just something that shows you've been paying attention. You say you care about her, but words alone won't cut it. She needs to see it through your actions."

"The timing was all wrong, Mr. Brown. The company was in crisis mode, your grandfather just landed in the hospital, and you rushed straight to Isabella hoping to patch things up. No wonder she misunderstood your intentions!"

###chapter 496 Give It a Shot

"What am I supposed to do now?"

Michael got what Aaron was saying, but actually doing it was a whole different ballgame.

When he turned twenty, his grandpa handed him the company. For the past few years, he'd been all about work and had zero experience with romance.

Over the years, he'd gotten used to his relationship with Isabella.

Aaron was guiding Michael step by step on how to turn the situation around.

A guy who hesitated with a woman he was interested in rarely won her over. Aaron knew this all too well.

He didn't have any other options.

Might as well give it a shot.

For someone like Michael, who had no experience in love, a few words of advice wouldn't be enough to win her back.

Since he didn't know how to woo a woman, he might as well start from scratch. Otherwise, he might scare Isabella away for good.

Fine.

Renee, sitting on the couch, shivered for no reason and instinctively pulled her coat tighter.

Olivia, sitting across from her, thought she might be sick.

She didn't trust anyone else to take care of Aaron.

Isabella had wanted Renee to come home and rest. They could have sent someone from the Wilson Family or hired a reliable nurse to take care of Aaron.

They couldn't change her mind, so they had to let her be.

Renee hadn't seen Isabella since she got back, even though Isabella had left the hospital before her.

"Isabella? She went..."

###chapter 497 Running From Love

Renee was probably jealous.

Michael.

###chapter 498 Single and Free

Olivia and Renee were already in action.

###chapter 499 Taking a New Step

Before they got started, Olivia turned to Renee and asked, "Hey, we're drinking, which is cool, but don't you have to take care of your boyfriend tomorrow? It's not too late to bail if you need to."

Renee's eyes widened at the thought of missing out.

Olivia and Renee quickly started a drinking contest, while Isabella focused on grilling the meat, not bothering to join in their antics. It was a spontaneous gathering, so she let them enjoy themselves.
