The moment she left, Renee noticed Olivia's mischievous grin as she watched Isabella walk away.

Renee squinted at Olivia, puzzled. "What's with that look? Planning another prank?"

Olivia raised an eyebrow and smiled mysteriously. "Take a guess."

Renee took a sip of her beer, exasperated. "No need to guess. It's written all over your face. What are you up to this time?"

Olivia's eyes widened in mock surprise. "How did you know? I haven't even said anything yet!"

Atticus had once told her she couldn't hide her thoughts and should be more discreet around others. Turns out, he was right.

Renee chuckled. "It's practically written on your face. If you don't spill, I'll tell Isabella that the call she just took was..."

"Don't, don't!" Olivia quickly reached out to stop her. "Fine, I'll tell you. It's no big deal. I just arranged a little surprise for Isabella. If all goes well, the person should be here soon."

Olivia blinked and revealed, "It's the guy her uncles set her up with, the VP of the Wilson Group, Emilio!"

She had heard of Emilio but didn't know much about him.

Olivia nodded. "Yep. Isabella's single now. She has the right to meet new people. Michael's been so wishy-washy about their relationship. Who knows what he really wants? Isabella is young and beautiful. Why shouldn't she find someone who truly loves and cares for her?"

Olivia kept talking, while Renee listened, stunned.

"Olivia, weren't you just telling Isabella to give Michael another chance? Now you're setting her up with someone else?"

Renee had thought Olivia was on Michael's side, urging Isabella to accept his love and give their relationship another shot. But now, she was pushing for Emilio? Whose side was Olivia really on?

Renee was thoroughly confused.

Olivia looked at Renee in disbelief. "Renee, how could you think that? I'm always on Isabella's side. I want her to move on from Michael. But you know how she can't seem to forget him. If I don't push her, do you think she'll ever move on? Isabella's been hurt so badly by Michael that she's almost given up on love. I just want her to take a step forward."

Olivia wanted Isabella to face reality, to move on even if she still had feelings for Michael. But that didn't mean she supported Isabella staying with him. Michael had hurt Isabella deeply. How could he have the nerve to ask for reconciliation after their divorce?

"You have a point," Renee admitted after a moment. "But something still feels off."

"Of course, I'm right," Olivia said proudly, pointing outside. "Just wait and see. Emilio is a great guy-handsome, kind, and he likes Isabella. He's even willing to stay at the Wilson Group for her. How can we let such a good man slip away?"

As Olivia praised Emilio, Renee's mind wandered, recalling what she knew about him. Emilio, the current VP of the Wilson Group, had a mysterious background. Even the Adri Family, known for their information-gathering skills, had little on him. Was he genuinely interested in Isabella, or did he have ulterior motives? Renee couldn't help but worry.

"Olivia, do you really know Emilio well? What kind of person is he?"

"Of course! Emilio and Isabella were childhood friends. He moved abroad when he was young, though. He..."

Talking about Emilio and Isabella's connection, Olivia couldn't stop. But they didn't know that the call Isabella took wasn't from Emilio. It was from Nolan.

Standing in the living room, Isabella's grip on her phone tightened, her body radiating cold anger.

"Nolan, enough is enough. I told you I don't like you and I don't want to see you again!"

She had only answered to avoid worrying Olivia and Renee. She hadn't expected Nolan to be so shameless. After all the rumors and scandals, he still had the nerve to ask her out for dinner!

###chapter 500 Paths Better Left Separate

Nolan's intentions for inviting her were obvious.

He still wasn't over her and wanted to use their past relationship to get her to compromise and become his girlfriend.

But she never liked him in the first place.

She had made her rejection clear long ago, yet Nolan still pulled this stunt. She truly couldn't understand what he was thinking.

They couldn't even be friends anymore.

Did he really want to erode the last bit of their friendship?

What Isabella didn't expect was that even after she said all that, Nolan still wouldn't let her go.

Nolan's voice was gentle, with a hint of tenderness. His last sentence even sounded like he was accusing Isabella of going back on her word.

Isabella had seen through his tactics long ago.

The next second, her cold voice broke through his fantasy over the phone.

Back then, she said she would consider it just to avoid hurting his pride.

But what did her kindness bring?

She never imagined that the Nolan she once thought understood her, cared for her, and treated her like a brother was all a facade.

From the beginning, Nolan had seen her as a tool to help him climb the ladder.

Remembering the things Nolan had said to her last time only strengthened Isabella's resolve.

She never intended to be with Nolan.

She only saw him as a brother, with no romantic feelings whatsoever.

So this time, she wouldn't believe a word he said.

"Isabella, do you really have to talk to me like this? I've never lied to you. My feelings for you have always been real. I've been waiting for you all these years. Why can't you believe me? I truly want to be with you. No matter what obstacles we face, I'm not afraid. I've always wanted you."

Nolan's words seemed to express his sincerity.

But Isabella had already seen his true colors. How could she believe his lies again?

"Nolan, the moment you used our photos to manipulate public opinion, our relationship was over. No matter how many times you say it, it won't change. I don't have romantic feelings for you, and I never will."

Isabella never wasted time on people or things she didn't like.

Even if it was Nolan, whom she once trusted the most, she would rather let go if the feelings had changed.

Nolan fell silent.

After a moment, his voice came through, filled with both pleading and frustration.

"Isabella, why won't you give me a chance? What does Michael have that I don't? Tell me. Michael doesn't love you. Being with him will only bring you pain. But I'm different. I'm sincere about you. If you like his looks, aren't I the best choice for you?"

Nolan couldn't understand why, despite being from the same Brown family and having such similar faces, Isabella only loved Michael.

Didn't he deserve to be loved?

Isabella was speechless.

She never expected Nolan to think she liked Michael just because of his good looks.

As a socialite of the Wilson Group, she had seen all kinds of men. How could she like someone for over a decade just because of their appearance?

In the past, Nolan had restrained himself because she was still Michael's wife. Now that she and Michael were divorced, Nolan didn't even bother to hide his intentions.

Clearly, if she didn't make things clear, Nolan wouldn't give up.

"Nolan, it's true that I'm divorced from Michael. But don't forget, you're still his brother. How do you expect people to talk about me if I marry Michael and then get together with you?"

"Will they call me shameless, or say I seduced his brother right after the divorce? You might be able to handle that, but I can't. So, I will never agree to your pursuit. Give up."

In Isabella's eyes, moral and ethical boundaries were insurmountable.

Not to mention, she saw Aiden as her own grandfather.

If he knew that Nolan not only took Michael's place as the heir but also wanted to take Michael's wife, would he be so angry that he'd fall ill?

Isabella thought she had given the most likely reason for Nolan to agree, but she didn't expect that Nolan never saw this as a problem.

Or rather, he never cared about morality.

"Isabella, you know me. I never care about these things. As long as you agree, I can remove all obstacles for you. Didn't you say you liked me the most? You clearly have feelings for me. Why not be brave and admit it?"

Nolan firmly believed that he and Isabella were the most compatible.

They had shared everything over the years, from hobbies to values. If he lost her, he would never find someone who understood him so well again.

So he was determined to have a happy ending with her.

No matter who tried to stop him.

From Nolan's somewhat agitated voice, Isabella could tell he wasn't absorbing anything she said.

He was completely lost in his own emotions.

Anything she might say now would fall on deaf ears.

Isabella didn't want to continue this conversation. "If you insist on being so stubborn, then we have nothing more to say."

She was about to hang up when Nolan suddenly pleaded over the phone.

"Isabella, please don't be so cold to me. I don't ask for much, just a meal with you today. No other demands, okay?"

Isabella decisively refused.

"No, I think it's better if we don't see each other anymore, considering how things are between us now."

She couldn't bear to destroy her memory of the kind-hearted Nolan who had been there for her so many times when she felt alone and vulnerable.

###chapter 501 Threatening Her with Michael

Hearing Isabella's words, Nolan felt his heart break into pieces.

Was he really going to lose her?

"Isabella, I know you hate me right now, so I'm not here to win you over. Can you still see me as your brother? Can't we go back to how things were?"

No matter how gentle Nolan's voice was, it couldn't bring back Isabella's past feelings.

She knew very well that Nolan was no longer the brother he once was.

They couldn't go back to the way things were.

"Isabella, what if I told you this is the last time I'll see you?"

"Nolan, what do you mean by that?"

What did he mean by the last time? What was he planning to do?

But he couldn't just let go.

If Isabella truly couldn't accept his love, then he wanted to see her one last time, even if it was just a glance.

He had originally planned to take Isabella with him, but her rejection made it impossible to force her.

So now, he was just begging to see her one last time.

Leave?

Isabella was shocked, but then she thought it was impossible.

Nolan had just wrested control of the Brown Group from Michael, and with Aiden in the hospital, Nolan was the sole decision-maker for the company.

Why would he choose to leave at such a crucial moment?

Isabella thought he was just making an excuse to get her to come out and didn't believe him at all.

"Nolan, if you keep lying, eventually no one will believe you. Even if you really were leaving today, I still wouldn't meet up with you."

She had nothing to do with the Brown Family anymore and didn't want any ties with Nolan either.

So whether he left Evergreen City or the Brown Group had nothing to do with her.

"Isabella, where are you? Emilio is here to see you."

Emilio was here?

"Who I choose to be with is my own business. Emilio is my friend, and I won't let you talk about him like that."

Even if you don't have romantic feelings for me, I thought you at least cared about me. But now, I'm not even worth as much as a stranger to you? What does all our time together mean? Just because you don't accept my love, you want to torture me like this?"

Every word Nolan said accused Isabella of being heartless and cold.

He sounded like someone who had been abandoned after years of love.

Isabella felt like she was going crazy.

But now, he was trying to control her?

She was divorced from Michael and free to be with whoever she wanted. How could anyone try to control that?

"Isabella, I regret it! I've been too gentle with you, so you think I'm easy to bully, right?"

"Nolan, what nonsense are you talking about?" Isabella was truly angry. "You know why I hate you. I don't want to hear you anymore. That's it."

Thinking about how Nolan had changed so much made Isabella feel suffocated.

The best way to deal with him was to never see him again.

Otherwise, she would erase even the memory of the old Nolan.

But what Isabella didn't expect was that her moment of softness would lead to his endless demands and threats.

"Isabella, come out and see me, or I can't guarantee I won't do something to Michael. You know he's no longer the president of the Brown Group. It's easy for me to get to him."

Nolan's voice was cold and violent, no longer the gentle, caring brother he once was.

Isabella realized what Nolan intended to do and broke out in a cold sweat.

She hadn't forgotten that Nolan had the Adri Family behind him.

Especially since that family had a mysterious assassin organization.

Renee and Aaron had almost died at their hands.

If Nolan wanted to harm Michael, he wouldn't even need to do it himself to push Michael to the brink.

The old Nolan was truly gone.

The current Nolan was a madman.

Just to get her to come out, he dared to threaten his brother's life?

At that moment, she saw his true colors.

"Nolan, Michael is your brother. You would harm your own brother?"

"Isabella, I thought you understood me. I hate everyone in the Brown Family, including Michael. You know that better than anyone, don't you?"

So Nolan was really willing to act.

She could be sure Nolan wouldn't harm her for now, but if she didn't go, she couldn't guarantee Michael's safety.

After all, Nolan's hatred for the Brown Family had never disappeared.

Finally hearing the answer he wanted, Nolan's tone softened a bit.

"Of course. As long as you come, I won't do anything, including to Michael. Isabella, I'll show you how much I love you."

Isabella didn't want to hear any more of his disgusting confessions and asked directly.

"Send me the location and address. I'll be there on time tonight."

With that, she hung up the phone.

She didn't want to hear Nolan's voice any longer.

###chapter 502 Just Drop By

"Isabella, why are you still inside?"

Emilio was here because of Olivia's idea.

Atticus and Holden were eager to set her up with Emilio.

###chapter 503 Lifelong Friends

Hearing this, Emilio's face turned a bit red. "They said they had a bit too much to drink, so they went back to their rooms to rest."

Isabella immediately got the hint.

Olivia and Renee were giving her and Emilio some alone time.

###chapter 504 Keeping the Appointment

It was getting late, and she couldn't delay any longer.

Putting her phone away, she turned to the embarrassed Olivia and Renee. "I have an urgent matter to attend to. I don't know when I'll be back, so I'm leaving my good friend in your care. Don't neglect my guest, got it?"

Olivia and Renee were taken aback and responded without thinking.

"Good friend?"

"Guest?"

Isabella knew they would react this way, but she just smiled and walked away without explaining further, leaving the three of them in confusion.

Olivia was the most unwilling to accept this reality.

"Renee, did I hear wrong? Isabella said 'good friend.' What does that mean?"

She had seen Isabella hug Emilio. Didn't that confirm their relationship? Now Isabella was saying they were just friends?

Renee felt a bit sorry for Olivia and didn't want to burst her bubble.

But Emilio, knowing the truth, spoke up openly.

"Thank you for your support, Ms. Smith. Isabella and I are really just friends."

There would be no other possibilities.

As he spoke, a hint of regret flashed in Emilio's eyes.

How could he not be sad?

He had genuinely liked her, but in the end, he couldn't even confess his feelings. Only he could understand that pain.

A white Bentley drove out of the garage, quickly leaving through the gate.

As the night grew darker, Isabella rested her hand on the car window, feeling the cold wind on her face, which only strengthened her resolve.

A few minutes earlier, Nolan had sent her the location for their meeting.

He had told her he was already there, waiting.

If she didn't show up, he would make her witness how he would deal with Michael and strip him of his status as the Brown Family heir, turning him into a nobody.

This was the first time Isabella truly understood how ruthless Nolan could be.

To achieve his goals, he didn't care about anyone's life.

Even if that person was his own brother, he wouldn't hesitate.

Someone as selfish as Nolan would never put her first.

Going alone now, there was no telling what Nolan might do in a fit of anger.

The more Isabella thought about it, the more scared she became.

She had been through too many similar situations and had to consider her own safety.

With that in mind, she decisively pulled over and sent a text message.

###chapter 505 Are You Really Willing to Give Up?

The dimly lit restaurant was silent.

Nolan sat at the best spot by the floor-to-ceiling window, gazing out at the night with a calm expression.

A line of waitstaff stood nearby, waiting for Nolan's orders, not daring to make a sound.

He was no longer the illegitimate son of the Brown Family that people looked down on. Now, he was the head of the Brown Group, and wherever he went, he looked down on others from above.

Those who once mocked and doubted him had long been dealt with.

He accepted all the privileges that came with his position, a slight smile playing on his lips as he looked out the window.

He knew one thing for sure.

Tonight, Isabella would definitely come.

Twenty minutes later, the sound of a bell at the restaurant door announced the arrival of the evening's main guest.

When Isabella followed the waiter to Nolan's table, she noticed he had dressed up for the occasion.

A custom-tailored black suit, a watch worth millions, and a pair of silver glasses that matched his current status.

From a distance, Nolan looked every bit the aristocrat, his noble and sharp aura almost palpable.

It made people hesitant to look directly at him.

But Isabella couldn't find a trace of the gentle and considerate Nolan she once knew.

It made sense. Nolan had achieved everything he wanted.

Why would he still show a gentle side?

This calculating and ruthless Nolan was his true self.

As Isabella approached the table and began to sit down, she was surprised to see that Nolan was in a wheelchair.

The dim lighting had almost hidden the fact that he was sitting in a wheelchair.

But hadn't he recovered? Why was he still pretending to be disabled?

Was it to avoid suspicion that he was the mastermind behind the Brown Group's troubles?

But he had told her himself. She already knew. Why continue the charade?

Isabella found it odd but didn't want to dwell on it. She had other priorities tonight.

Before she could speak, Nolan beat her to it.

"Isabella, I knew you would come."

His voice was full of gratitude and emotion.

As if her presence tonight gave him immense courage.

Isabella didn't want to engage in pleasantries. She decided to get straight to the point.

"You know why I'm here. So, say what you need to say and let's not waste each other's time."

She was here to clear things up.

Their relationship no longer needed to be maintained.

Nolan seemed to have anticipated Isabella's attitude. Instead of getting angry, he just smiled as he used to.

He looked at her with a mix of indulgence and helplessness.

"I know your time is precious, but since you agreed to have dinner with me, you can't go back on your word, right?"

He handed her the menu. "Order whatever you like. Don't worry about the cost."

Nolan acted as if nothing had happened between them, treating Isabella with his usual gentleness.

She had never imagined that the mild-mannered, unassuming Nolan was actually so cunning and ruthless.

What did all those years of treating him like a brother mean to him?

Isabella smirked coldly, not responding, and took the menu.

She turned to the waiter and ordered her meal.

But her mind wandered back to what Nolan had told her before.

He said tonight would be their last meeting, and after tonight, he would leave Evergreen City?

Given his current relationship with the Adri Family, was he planning to return to Auroria?

Unable to hold back, Isabella asked, "What did you mean when you said you were leaving? You've been planning and waiting for so long to become the CEO of the Brown Group and take control. Why would you let it go now?"

Logically, Nolan should be using this opportunity to make the Brown Group his own.

Why would he let go of the Brown Group so easily?

Isabella couldn't understand.

Nolan chuckled softly, as if he had been waiting for her to ask this.

"Isabella, I thought you knew me. Have you forgotten the resentment and hatred in my heart? Now that I've achieved what I wanted, there's no point in staying."

Nolan's eyes were indifferent, as if this decision held no sentiment for him.

Isabella was even more confused. "Didn't you want the entire Brown Family?"

She didn't get it.

If this was such a hurdle for Nolan, why give it up so easily after achieving it?

If he could let go so easily, what was the point of all his years of planning and patience abroad?

This didn't match Nolan's usual approach.

And she couldn't believe that the bullying and grievances Nolan had endured could be erased just by taking over the Brown Group.

It couldn't be that simple.

Nolan nodded lightly. "You're right. I did want control of the Brown Group. But now that I have it, it doesn't mean much to me."

Seeing Isabella's disbelief, he took a sip of water and continued.

"When I wanted to prove my worth to the Brown Group, it was Grandpa who pulled me down from the heights and discarded me like a useless pawn, without any explanation."

"From that day, I vowed to myself that I would use any means necessary to get revenge and take back the Brown Group. Now that I've achieved my goal, I have no regrets."

"But..."

Isabella frowned, about to argue, but Nolan interrupted.

"I know what you're thinking. You can't believe I did all this just for a moment of satisfaction, right? But that's the truth. I never had any feelings for the Brown Family. Taking the Brown Group from Michael was just to show everyone that I'm no different from him."

###chapter 506 Won't You Have a Drink with Me?

Nolan lifted his gaze, staring deeply into Isabella's eyes.

"I can't believe the company I busted my butt for all these years can just be tossed aside because of a name or status. Meanwhile, Michael just stands there and gets everything I've ever wanted, including you."

His voice was thick with resentment as he spoke the last few words.

"We share the same blood, we even look alike to some extent. Why does Michael get everything, and I get nothing? Why does he get your love, while I don't even have the right to tell you how I feel? Isabella, how am I supposed to deal with this? I can't accept it."

Isabella pondered over his reasons for a long time.

It wasn't about whether she wanted to believe him or not; it was just that his reasons seemed too far-fetched.

She took a deep breath. "So, have you come to terms with it now, or have you let it go?"

Nolan let out a bitter laugh. "How could I just let it go?"

"I spent three years planning to take over the Brown Group, but I can't bring myself to use those tactics on you, Isabella. Believe it or not, my feelings for you are real."

"I called you here not just to see you, but also to tell you that if you ever find someone you love, make sure to let me know on your wedding day. No matter who it is, I will give you my blessings."

As he said this, tears glistened in Nolan's eyes.

Even though he didn't want to let her go, he still prioritized her happiness.

This was the Nolan Isabella knew.

He always thought of others first, even if he had to suppress his own emotions.

Isabella couldn't help but feel a pang of softness in her heart.

She had known Nolan for many years and understood the pain he carried deep inside. His current obsessive nature was a result of the lack of attention he received as a child.

Now, as he was about to leave Evergreen City and had given her his blessings, maybe it was time for her to let go of her prejudices and properly say goodbye.

Perhaps this farewell would be forever.

"I will."

Isabella pressed her lips together.

She didn't know if it was just her imagination, but no matter how much Nolan resembled the brother she once knew, the rift between them still existed.

She suppressed the emotions welling up inside her and maintained her composure.

"So, are you going back to the Adri Family?" she asked.

For some reason, Isabella didn't want Nolan to have any more ties with the Adri Family.

That mysterious family and the assassin organization didn't seem like a good place for him.

Someone who longed for a stable family shouldn't get involved with such a powerful family.

A peaceful, stable life was what suited him best.

At least, he would be free.

Nolan's eyes darkened at the mention of the Adri Family, but he quickly regained his gentle demeanor.

"Yeah, I have a contract with them. There are some things I need to completely resolve before I can be free. Let's not get into all that heavy stuff right now. I'll figure things out on my own, Isabella. You don't need to worry about me."

He raised his glass of red wine and gestured to her.

"One last dinner, won't you have a drink with me?"

Nolan's eyes were as deep as ever, his voice gentle and expectant. Isabella had no reason or opportunity to refuse.

Because after this meal, their relationship would be over.

With that thought, Isabella didn't hesitate any longer. She raised her glass and clinked it lightly with his.

The glasses made a crisp sound as they touched.

"Safe travels," Isabella said, her voice following the sound.

She downed the wine in her glass.

Setting the glass down, she stood up to leave. "Goodbye, I have to go..."

Before she could finish her sentence, Isabella felt a sudden dizziness as she stood up, her head spinning.

She gripped the table tightly, her eyes catching sight of the empty wine glass. A realization hit her, one that she couldn't believe but was undeniably true.

Nolan had drugged her.

As her body went limp, Isabella didn't even have time to utter a word.

Alex, Nolan's assistant, approached and respectfully asked, "Mr. Brown, what should we do next? Should I put Ms. Taylor in the car?"

Nolan raised his hand. "No need, Isabella is with me. Wait outside."

With that, he stood up from his wheelchair, walked over to Isabella, and lifted her from the chair, carrying her out of the restaurant.

The car's back door was opened, and Nolan got in with Isabella in his arms.

But he didn't put her down. Instead, he held her close and instructed Alex to drive.

Alex didn't dare hesitate or look back, quickly starting the car and driving away.

As the car moved, a partition rose, completely separating the back seat.

Under the dim light, Nolan gazed at the delicate Isabella in his arms, his hand unable to resist caressing her face, from her brows to her lips.

He savored every moment with her.

Nolan couldn't possibly let go of someone he had set his sights on so easily.

Isabella could only be his.

He had lost her once; he wouldn't let her slip into another man's arms again.

Just the thought of her with someone else drove him mad with jealousy.

The Wilson House.

It had been two hours since Isabella left, and Olivia and Renee watched the time pass, but Isabella hadn't returned.

Olivia couldn't help but call her, but there was no answer.

Remembering the dangers Isabella had faced before, Olivia's first thought was that something had happened to her.

Without hesitation, she called Atticus and told him that Isabella was missing.

Atticus told Olivia not to worry and to stay home.

The moment he hung up, Atticus contacted the bodyguards protecting Isabella, but the news he received made his heart sink.

All the bodyguards had been taken out an hour ago.

Isabella was really in trouble.

And it was clear that this person had come prepared.

Atticus rushed back to the Wilson house and asked if there had been anything unusual before Isabella left.

After all, the enemy was in the shadows, and they were in the light. They didn't even know who the person was.

They had no clues to follow.

"How could this happen? Who kidnapped Isabella?"

Olivia clutched her phone, not knowing what to do, pacing anxiously.

###chapter 507 What's He Up To

Renee was filled with regret after realizing the gravity of the situation.

If only she had stopped Isabella from leaving the house.

Or if she had just asked Isabella one more question about where she was going, it would be better than having no clue at all now.

But what's done is done, and there's no use dwelling on it.

The most important thing now was to find out who had taken Isabella and where they had taken her.

No matter what demands the person made, the Wilson Family would not refuse, as long as Isabella could be brought back safely.

Atticus had already deployed all the Wilson Family's resources to search the entire city for Isabella. Additionally, he announced a reward of one million dollars for anyone who could provide accurate information on Isabella's whereabouts.

At that moment, Olivia's eyes widened as something clicked.

She grabbed her phone and exclaimed, "Oh my God, that's it!"

She rushed over to Atticus, her words tumbling out. "Isabella got a text right before she left the house. If we pull her phone records, we might be able to see who contacted her!"

"But that doesn't necessarily mean that person is the one who kidnapped Isabella." Atticus frowned.

He had considered this possibility, but it was Isabella's personal privacy. He couldn't just check her call logs based on a mere suspicion, could he?

"What if there's a clue about where Isabella went? Right now, her life is the most important thing, Mr. Wilson. Don't hesitate." Renee said anxiously.

At this point, finding Isabella was the top priority.

They could apologize to her later once she was back.

Olivia was already frantic. Seeing Atticus still hesitating, she lost her temper.

"Atticus, for God's sake, man up! If you're still her uncle, just authorize the check on her call logs and texts to see who she's been talking to. If Isabella gets mad, tell her I pushed you into it. Got it?"

"Olivia, you..."

Atticus was both angry and helpless with his girlfriend. It wasn't that he didn't want to check; she just couldn't wait even a minute.

She even shouted his name in public to give him orders. He had really spoiled her.

Isabella was his beloved niece. With something like this happening, how could he remain indifferent? He was more anxious than anyone.

But there was no better option now.

Atticus picked up his phone and gave the order. Within two minutes, Isabella's call records and all her text messages from the past few hours were displayed in front of him.

Among the unfamiliar numbers, the first thing he noticed was a message sent to Isabella's phone two hours ago.

It contained the location of a restaurant and a threat about the consequences if she didn't show up.

Seeing the name "Michael" in the message, Atticus frowned deeply.

He noted down the number that sent the message and had someone investigate it.

He had a hunch that this person was close to Isabella.

It didn't take long for Atticus to get a response.

"We found it. The owner of this number is Nolan!"

It was him!

Nolan had just taken control of the Brown Group from Michael, and now he had kidnapped Isabella. What was he planning?

Atticus clenched his fists tightly.

Whatever Nolan wanted, he had better return Isabella unharmed, or the Wilson Family would make him pay.

"Find out Nolan's location immediately, by any means necessary!"

Atticus ordered furiously.

In an instant, all the Wilson Family's resources were mobilized to track down Nolan's whereabouts.

Meanwhile, Michael was at the hospital discussing relationship advice with Aaron when he received a call from an unknown number.

Whatever was said on the other end made Michael's face darken.

By the time the caller finished, Michael abruptly hung up and jumped to his feet.

Aaron was startled.

He didn't know what had happened, only that Michael's face had turned pale after taking the call, and his eyes were red.

"Mr. Brown, what happened?"

Before Aaron could finish his question, Michael, with a pale face, revealed the reason.

"Isabella is missing! I just got word that the Wilson Family has deployed all their resources to search the entire city for Isabella and has posted a high-reward notice on the black market."

Michael was almost panicking.

"Who could have kidnapped Isabella? Could it be Bianca?"

But Bianca had already returned to Auroria with the heir of the Adri Family. It was unlikely she could reach this far.

Could she be orchestrating this from afar, taking advantage of the Wilson Family and Michael's moment of inattention to strike a fatal blow at Isabella?

Bianca was crazy enough to do something like this!

Michael quickly considered all possibilities.

Hearing Michael's muttering, Aaron's mind worked fast.

"But Mr. Brown, the Adri Family's influence in the country is almost entirely controlled by Nolan. Even if Bianca wanted to harm Isabella, she would have to go through Nolan. But doesn't he like Isabella? How could he agree to Bianca harming Isabella? It doesn't make sense."

Michael had thought of that too.

Nolan wouldn't just stand by and let Bianca hurt Isabella.

If Nolan could be indifferent, he wouldn't have fought Michael for Isabella in front of Aiden.

But aside from Nolan, who else in Evergreen City would dare to go against the Wilson Family's socialite and kidnap her?

As Michael struggled to make sense of it, Aaron suddenly slapped his thigh.

"I get it! Nolan must be thinking that the company is now entirely under his control, and with your grandfather hospitalized, the entire Brown Group is in his hands. If he..."

Aaron stopped mid-sentence, realizing something and clamping his lips shut.

He didn't dare continue, not wanting to provoke Michael further.

Being a man, even with Aaron's half-finished sentence, Michael could guess the rest.

Instantly, his face turned completely dark.

Especially knowing Nolan's hidden ambition to possess Isabella.

That deceitful Nolan had always coveted Isabella.

And now that Nolan's legs had healed, if he had indeed kidnapped Isabella, his intentions were clear. It was obvious what he wanted to do!

Michael was instantly furious.

"Damn Nolan, he better not lay a finger on Isabella!"

Otherwise, Michael couldn't guarantee what he might do.

With that, Michael grabbed his coat and headed out.

###chapter 508 Life-Saving Comes First

"Mr. Brown, hold up a second."

Aaron, despite his serious injuries, almost tumbled off the hospital bed. He had to warn Michael about the situation.

"Did you forget Nolan's running the Brown Family now? He's got all the manpower. If we rush in, we'll just tip him off and won't be able to do anything."

As he spoke, Aaron seemed to remember something and grabbed his phone to call his girlfriend, Renee.

"Don't worry, I'll get in touch with Renee for more information."

Renee lived in the Wilson house. If something happened to Isabella, the Wilson Family would definitely react.

Hearing this, Michael paused. He knew Aaron was thinking more clearly than he was right now. They needed to know Isabella's situation to act effectively. Otherwise, he'd be running around like a headless chicken, wasting precious time.

Aaron quickly dialed the number, but for some reason, Renee, who usually answered right away, wasn't picking up. Just as Aaron was getting anxious, Michael's phone rang. It was an unknown number, but Michael recognized it. It was the same number that had texted him Isabella's location when she was kidnapped by Bianca.

Michael's eyes widened. He was about to answer when the call abruptly ended. A text message popped up on his phone.

[Isabella's been taken by Nolan. What are you waiting for?]

This message confirmed Michael's suspicions. It was Nolan who had targeted Isabella! If it wasn't Bianca, Isabella might still be safe, but Nolan had other plans for her. If he didn't get to her in time, who knew what that maniac might do?

He had to find Isabella fast. Without caring who the sender was, Michael immediately called the number back. This person had helped him rescue Isabella twice now and couldn't be from the Adri Family. He had a gut feeling this person knew Isabella.

Despite just sending a message, no one answered when Michael called. He had no choice but to text back.

[Who are you? Where is Isabella? I need to save her now!]

This time, the reply came quickly.

[Meet me at the hospital entrance in five minutes.]

Michael was stunned. This person knew his location. Who could it be? But he had no choice but to take the risk. It was the only way to find Isabella quickly.

Since taking over the Brown Group, Michael never imagined he'd be ousted from the company. Besides the necessary security for his home and office, he hadn't built a personal team. But he had treated his people well over the years. He believed some would still follow him.

Aaron thought for a moment and looked at Michael. "About a hundred."

"Get them all on standby."

Michael left the rest to Aaron and strode out of the hospital room. Late at night, Michael waited at the hospital entrance for less than two minutes before a heavy motorcycle roared up. The rider braked in front of Michael, clearly the person who had called.

The man, dressed in black, dismounted and walked up to Michael, removing his helmet to reveal his face.

"You."

Michael recognized him immediately. He had seen this man before, during an incident at a lakeside villa with Bianca. This man had been with his grandfather and Isabella.

"So, it's you!"

The man casually adjusted his hair, holding his helmet in one hand and extending the other to Michael.

"Yeah, it's me. Mr. Brown, long time no see. I'm Felix Myles."

The Myles Family? Michael's eyes narrowed. No wonder Aiden had found him so easily that day; he had enlisted the Myles Family's help. But now wasn't the time for grudges. Michael shook Felix's hand, knowing he needed his help to rescue Isabella.

"Do you know where Isabella is?"

Felix pointed to his motorcycle. "To save Isabella, this bike won't cut it. Where's your car, Mr. Brown? We can talk on the way."

Michael's car was nearby. They got in and quickly drove off. Felix didn't wait for Michael to ask and explained his connection to Isabella.

"Mr. Brown, you're curious about my relationship with Isabella, right? Don't worry, we're just friends. She didn't trust Nolan and informed me before meeting him."

"You mean she told you before going to meet Nolan?"

Michael felt a mix of emotions. He knew Isabella's safety was paramount, but the thought of her trusting another man more than him bothered him deeply.

Felix, watching the road, directed Michael to take a shortcut. "Yeah, thanks to Isabella's timely message, my informants saw Nolan taking her away. It's been almost two hours since she disappeared. We need to hurry."

Michael frowned. "You said you had people. It's just the two of us?"

Felix didn't see a problem. "What's wrong with two people? You scared?"

His casual remark made Michael's face harden. He floored the gas pedal. When it came to Isabella, fear was never an option.

###chapter 509 Found Her

Felix let out a cold snort from the side.

'Don't even start with needing two people. I could get Isabella away from that psycho Nolan all by myself.'

If he didn't know that Isabella's heart was set on that jerk Michael, he wouldn't have let Michael have this chance.

The car sped down the road like a flash.

Michael couldn't think about anything else; he just wanted to see Isabella safe as soon as possible.

He had already investigated everything about Nolan when Nolan first targeted him.

If Isabella was really inside, he would face Nolan head-on to get her out.

Felix pulled out a small, intricate device from his pocket. With a few deft folds, it transformed into a sophisticated gadget ready for deployment.

He realized Felix was using cutting-edge foreign technology.

The Flying Shadow Bee.

Rumor had it that a mysterious mechanical genius invented it.

The device weighed no more than an egg but had impressive capabilities.

Originally designed to explore dangerous, uninhabited areas, this genius had refined it to rival the smallest military drones.

It was sold for millions of dollars as soon as it hit the market.

And now, it was in Felix's hands?

Did Felix buy it at a high price, or did he invent it himself?

Felix wasn't just Isabella's good friend; he had also been hired by Aiden to investigate him. Now, he had a piece of high-tech equipment worth millions.

Michael couldn't help but question Felix's true identity.

Felix, focused on the controller, heard Michael's question but didn't take it seriously. He smirked and answered slowly.

"Who am I? Mr. Brown, haven't you figured it out yet? I already told you my name. If you remember, your grandfather and my grandfather were close. If you don't know that, just remember I'm the grandson of your grandfather's old friend. In short, I'm just an ordinary person. There's no need for you to be suspicious or afraid of me."

As he spoke, Felix continued to skillfully operate the remote, guiding the "bee" into the villa, searching for Isabella from the top down.

"You can't be an ordinary person."

Michael concluded but knew now wasn't the time to investigate.

"Whatever, I don't care."

Felix raised an eyebrow, indifferent.

He didn't think he had much to discuss with Michael, but if Michael insisted, he wouldn't mind giving him a piece of his mind for Isabella.

The next second, Felix spotted Isabella on the controller's screen.

"Found her. Isabella is here."

Michael immediately looked down, seeing Isabella on the small screen.

It was really her.

Seeing Isabella's condition, Michael's hands clenched tightly.

Damn it, how dare Nolan lock Isabella up here?

On the third floor of the villa.

Isabella was thrown onto a large bed, her hands and feet bound tightly with ropes, unable to move.

She slowly opened her eyes, taking in the unfamiliar surroundings, her mind gradually recalling the moments before she lost consciousness.

She remembered being moved by Nolan and having a drink with him, then feeling dizzy.

Before she passed out, she was sure she saw Nolan's determined face.

He did this!

All that talk about seeing her one last time and leaving Evergreen City tomorrow was just a setup to kidnap her.

He was despicable.

Isabella gritted her teeth in anger.

Nolan, that lunatic, drugged her drink and brought her here?

How could he do this to her?

She had felt guilty and softened by his words. If it weren't for what he said, she wouldn't have drunk that glass of wine.

If she hadn't touched the wine, she wouldn't have fallen into his trap!

Isabella now saw Nolan's true face beneath the mask.

He was a complete liar, a despicable scoundrel with no bottom line.

"Nolan, if you have the guts, come out and tell me what you want!"

He might be the head of the Brown Group, but did he forget she had the entire Wilson Family backing her?

She was her grandfather's chosen heir to the Wilson Group. If anything happened to her, her uncles wouldn't let him off.

###chapter 510 Don't Touch Me

In the room next door, Nolan stared at the flashing number on his phone, a smug smile playing on his lips.

The call was from Atticus.

Nolan had no intention of answering it; he simply watched as the call went to voicemail.

He couldn't help but wonder what the reaction would be the next time he met with the Wilson family if he showed up as Isabella's fiancé.

Regardless of their approval, tonight he would have Isabella.

Ideally, he would get her pregnant.

That way, Isabella would never be able to leave him and would have to agree to marry him. From then on, he would not only have the woman he loved and their child but also the full support of the Wilson family.

This was his best strategy to break the current deadlock.

By securing Isabella, he would secure the entire Wilson family.

Even if the Brown Group was slowly being devoured by the Adri family, with the resources from the Wilson family, he would never fall.

He had worked too hard to gain his power to give it up so easily.

So, he had to set his sights on Isabella, who also had a claim to her family's legacy.

Besides, he had secretly loved Isabella for years. Back then, he had no power or influence and could only watch as she married Michael. But now he was back, sitting at the helm of the Brown Group.

Isabella had divorced Michael at this time. Wasn't this fate giving him a chance?

They were meant to be together.

Only he could give Isabella the love she wanted, and the Wilson family's strength and resources were exactly what he needed. Their union would be perfect.

So, how could he let this opportunity slip away?

He had to have Isabella.

The thought of finally having the woman he loved made Nolan's heart race with excitement.

This time, he didn't bother pretending to be disabled. He stood up from his wheelchair and strode confidently to the room where Isabella was.

Seeing Nolan walk towards her like a normal person, Isabella's eyes flashed with resentment.

Of course.

Nolan no longer needed to hide his true self, so there was no need to pretend to be disabled.

From the moment he lured her out and drugged her, their friendship was over.

Thinking of this, Isabella's expression grew colder.

"Nolan, what exactly do you want? Do you think tying me up will get you everything you want? I'm telling you, you're dreaming!"

Nolan didn't care about Isabella's hostility and disgust. Soon, she would be his, and no matter how unwilling she was, she would have to become his.

Why should he care about a few harsh words now?

Nolan sat on the edge of the bed, gently caressing Isabella's face, his eyes filled with a deep affection that could drown a person.

"Isabella, why are you still so disobedient? You know how much I like you. If you would just accept me, I wouldn't have to do things that make you unhappy. You have no idea how much I loved that innocent, adorable you. Why did you have to change? I've only taken what was rightfully mine. Shouldn't you be happy for me?"

His fingers slid down to her chin, forcing her to look at him. He still looked like the Nolan she used to know, but Isabella felt a wave of nausea.

She used to find warmth in his face, which resembled Michael's by about seventy or eighty percent.

She thought she had a caring, protective brother.

But when Nolan finally revealed his true self, Isabella realized he had never changed. She had been too blinded by his act to see the darkness that had always lived inside him.

His gentleness and care were just masks to deceive others.

In reality, his scheming and cunning were deeper than Michael's. She had no idea what he was thinking now or what his next move would be.

He might pull a knife on her next, and everything he did was just to achieve his goals.

So, she had to stay calm.

Nolan was no longer the Nolan she once knew. Provoking him now would do her no good.

"Nolan, you've already got what you wanted. The Brown family's everything is in your hands. What more do you want?"

Isabella couldn't understand why Nolan, having achieved his dream of controlling the Brown Group, would kidnap her at this critical moment. Wasn't he afraid of making an enemy of the Wilson family?

Looking around the unfamiliar room, Isabella couldn't guess where Nolan had taken her.

It didn't look like a hotel. It seemed more like a private place.

It made sense. Nolan wouldn't go through all this trouble to kidnap her and then hide her in a crowded place.

This might be his secret base for conducting shady business.

Escaping under his watchful eye would be difficult.

Nolan saw through her thoughts and chuckled, his large hand caressing her face, gently rubbing it.

"Isabella, I've confessed to you twice. What do you think I want?"

Of course, he wanted to make her his possession.

Ideally, he would get her pregnant this time.

That way, Isabella would never leave him.

"Don't think about escaping. This is my place. No one dares to come in here, and I think it's time our relationship took a step forward."

"Get your hands off me!"

Isabella jerked away in disgust, her eyes narrowing as she caught the unmistakable hunger in his gaze.

How had she not seen before that Nolan harbored such repulsive thoughts?

Nolan grabbed her chin, forcing her into his arms.

"Flinch all you want. Where do you think you can hide from me? This is my territory. Soon enough, you'll be mine too."

Nolan's arrogant words made Isabella feel sick.

But her hands and feet were tied.

Even so, she wouldn't let Nolan have his way easily.

"Let go of me, Nolan! To think you studied abroad for years, and now you'll stop at nothing to get what you want, even drugging and kidnapping a woman?"

If she had known Nolan was this despicable, she would never have supported him, never spoken well of him to Aiden.

No wonder Aiden always fell silent and sighed when she mentioned Nolan.

He had seen through Nolan's deep-seated scheming long ago.

###chapter 511 In the Name of Love

"But Isabella, have you ever thought about it? If I didn't do this, how could I ever get you to stay with me? Everything I've done is because I love you too much."

Nolan wasn't angry at all by what Isabella said. On the contrary, he felt that if Isabella hadn't rejected him time and again, he wouldn't have been driven to this point. Nolan had always been someone who didn't care about the process, as long as the end result was what he wanted.

"Isabella, do you know how long I've waited for this moment?" He gazed at the woman in his arms with an almost obsessive look. "Do you remember the first time we met? Out of all those people, you were the only one who walked up to me and spoke. From that moment, I knew I had to have you."

"I've been by your side all these years, but you never saw me. Your eyes were always on Michael, even though he didn't love you. You were still determined to marry him. Why?"

Pain flickered in Nolan's eyes as he gripped Isabella's shoulders, searching her face for answers. "Why does everyone love Michael unconditionally, including you? We're brothers, we look the same, share the same blood, but you only have eyes for him. You never even gave me a second glance. Do you think that's fair, Isabella?"

Nolan's emotions grew more intense, but Isabella no longer felt any sympathy for him. She had once been deceived by his pitiful act, feeling both sympathy and heartache for his past because she had also lost her mother's love. She had thought they shared a similar fate.

But now, she realized that her kindness and understanding had only fueled his greed and relentless pursuit. Isabella couldn't help but retort, "There's no such thing as absolute fairness in this world. Who I like is my own business. Just because I married Michael, do you think you can marry me too?"

She had seen through Nolan's so-called love. He didn't understand what true love was. He wanted her simply because she had chosen Michael, and he couldn't stand it. It was all about his twisted sense of victory.

"Nolan, before things get worse, I advise you to let me go. If the Wilson family finds out I'm missing, you won't be able to escape."

If Atticus and Holden knew that Nolan had drugged and kidnapped her, they would probably want to kill him on the spot. She just wanted to cut ties with Nolan and never have anything to do with him again.

Seeing that Isabella still wouldn't yield, Nolan sighed helplessly. "Isabella, why are you still so naive? Do you think after all I've done, I'd let you go just because of a few words? You should be the one begging, not me. Understand?"

"But don't worry, I'll be gentle tonight. I won't let you feel any pain. After all, I do love you." Nolan's lips curled into a faint smile as he tucked a strand of hair behind her ear. His low voice sent chills down her spine.

Isabella's body tensed up, but she had sent a distress signal to Shadow before coming here. If anything went wrong, he would come to rescue her immediately. By now, Shadow should have already found her location. With his skills, he could easily break in and save her.

She wasn't worried about her safety, but she was concerned about what other tricks Nolan might have up his sleeve. "Nolan, have you thought about the consequences of using such methods to get me?"

Isabella coldly raised her eyes, using the Wilson family name to warn him. "I'm the designated heir of the Wilson Group and the only heiress of the Wilson family. Aren't you afraid my uncles will come after you?"

"Don't forget who my grandfather was. The Wilson family's power runs deeper than you can imagine. You should think carefully about what you're doing to avoid bringing disaster upon yourself."

Nolan knew that well. Daniel was once a feared gambling legend, and his influence was still strong. He had founded the Wilson Group to leave behind a safer legacy for his family. Despite stepping away from his dangerous past, Daniel's reputation and power remained. His followers would still be loyal to the Wilson family.

Nolan understood all this, but he had made up his mind to kidnap Isabella and wasn't afraid of the Wilson family's retaliation. He gently stroked her hand, speaking slowly. "Isabella, do you really think I haven't touched you all this time because I'm afraid of the Wilson family's power?"

Isabella frowned. "If not for that, then what?"

He shook his head, his deep eyes fixed on her. "Because I love you. Only love would make me unwilling to let you suffer any pain. I know you still have feelings for someone else, so I gave you time to accept me. But that doesn't mean I can tolerate you using my love as a reason to despise me."

"Isabella, I've been waiting for you to see my love. But now, I won't wait any longer. I want to have you, truly and completely."

Hearing Nolan's "heartfelt" explanation, Isabella's eyes flashed with mockery. "You think I have to accept your love?"

"Nolan, why can't you admit that you're just a selfish man? The only person you love is yourself. Stop blaming your selfishness on me."

"You say you wouldn't hurt me, but look at what you've done. You drugged me and brought me here. Is this your idea of love?"

Isabella exposed Nolan's lies. Everything was his doing, yet he had the nerve to call it love. He was truly terrifying.

Nolan's expression changed, his voice lowering. "Isabella, you may not believe me, but you shouldn't doubt the bond we've shared for over a decade, nor my love for you!"

###chapter 512 Playing for Time

"Really?"

Isabella let out a cold laugh, gesturing to the ropes tightly binding her. Her voice dripped with sarcasm. "You tie me up like some kind of toy for your amusement. Is this what you call love?"

"Or are you gonna tell me this kidnapping wasn't your idea, and I came here on my own?"

Every word Isabella spoke was laced with mockery.

She truly couldn't fathom what was going on in Nolan's mind.

He clearly wanted to use her to gain the Wilson Family's power and support, yet he couldn't admit it. Instead, he cloaked his actions under the guise of love.

This suffocating love was something she couldn't bear.

Moreover, she knew Nolan's so-called love stemmed from jealousy and resentment because she chose Michael over him. He was desperate to prove he was no less than Michael.

Having never experienced love, Nolan had no idea what it truly was.

He was both pitiful and detestable, and Isabella had no desire to speak with him any further.

"Nolan, I'll give you one chance. Let me go now, and I'll pretend none of this ever happened."

"You said you'd leave Evergreen City tomorrow and never return. It's not worth pissing off the entire Wilson Family over this kidnapping. Besides, if Atticus and the others find out, they won't rest until they hunt you down."

"Let me go, and I won't mention today to anyone."

Isabella seized the moment to present her terms, offering him a chance to escape.

As long as he let her go and left the country, she could pretend she never knew him.

Time would eventually help her forget him and everything about him.

This wouldn't affect Nolan much.

But Isabella didn't expect him to be so stubborn.

"Leave?"

Nolan let out a cold laugh. "I've spent three years getting control of the Brown Group here. You really think I'd just walk away now?"

Isabella was stunned, realizing that everything had been a lie.

"You."

"Isabella, you're still the same as before. You believe whatever I say, especially when it comes from a man. You're still too naive."

A smug expression appeared on his face.

Clearly, all those years of companionship weren't entirely in vain. At least Isabella still had a tendency to believe his words.

"Nolan, you're shameless. You'd even lie about something like this to deceive me?"

Isabella's face turned pale with anger.

"So what? If I didn't say that, would you have obediently drunk that glass of wine?"

Nolan finally dropped his gentle facade, removing his glasses to reveal the sinister gleam in his eyes.

"Isn't it normal for a guy to use some tactics and tricks to win over the person he loves? I've put so much effort into you. Shouldn't you feel proud and flattered? A person only does these things when they care and love someone."

"This just proves how sincere my feelings for you are, Isabella. You should be happy."

He stroked her head, his tone a mix of coaxing and brainwashing.

Isabella was left speechless, not wanting to engage with him.

But Nolan thought she was listening, using her relationship with Michael as an example to validate his words.

"Didn't you notice? Michael never put any effort into you. He didn't even bother to comfort you. If he truly liked you, how could he stand by and watch you suffer without doing anything?"

"A woman who loves someone who doesn't love her is doomed to a bad ending. Look at you and Michael. You were married for three years, and yet you still ended up divorced."

"But we're different. I love you. I'm willing to give up everything for you. I don't expect you to do anything for me. As long as you stay by my side, I'll be content."

The more Isabella listened to his manipulative words, the more her head ached.

But she couldn't find a way to refute him at the moment.

Fortunately, she was clear-headed.

She wouldn't be swayed by Nolan's words.

Michael didn't love her, but he would never hurt the person he liked in the name of love, nor would he force her to do anything against her will.

Right now, she needed to buy time. She had to go along with Nolan's thoughts to lower his guard, giving her a chance to escape.

"I admit there's some truth to what you're saying."

Isabella put on a pitiful expression. "I chased after Michael for so long, but what did I get in return? I finally got pregnant, only to lose the baby. My grandfather passed away, and my mindset changed because of him."

"He made me realize that being with someone who doesn't love me only brings me pain. I've become someone I don't recognize."

"Now that I hear you, maybe being with someone who loves me is the right choice. Nolan, it's not too late for me to realize this, is it?"

Isabella admired her own ability to lie without batting an eye.

In front of someone she didn't want to deal with, she could still lie with a straight face.

Indeed, in the face of survival, she could overcome any difficulty.

Seeing Isabella willing to listen to him, Nolan smiled in satisfaction, gripping her hand. "Isabella, I'm really glad you understand this."

Nolan knew how strong-willed Isabella was. If she wasn't willing, things would be difficult for him.

But if she willingly came to him, the sense of accomplishment was unparalleled.

"Isabella, I forgot to tell you, this is my private residence. I just want us to spend some time together without interruptions. We need a quiet place to nurture our relationship, don't we?"

From the moment he made that call in the afternoon, Nolan had decided to hide Isabella here.

He wouldn't let her out until she was pregnant with his child.

But things were progressing even better than he had hoped.

"Nolan, don't you think we know each other well enough after all these years? Do we really need to nurture our relationship?"

Isabella said lightly.

But she feared Nolan might suspect her sudden change in attitude.

So she added, "I was angry because I thought you were using me as a tool to access the Wilson Family's resources. Now I understand you truly love me. So why not give it a try? Why do you still have me tied up like this? Aren't you afraid I'll get really mad and never speak to you again?"
